QA Test Automation Engineer / CDI / Environ 55k€ / 3 - 6 ans / Boulogne-Billancourt

Le poste
Sidetrade est un éditeur français de logiciels en SaaS (230 Sidetraders dans 4 pays en Europe) en pleine croissance. L’IA fait partie intégrante de nos produits! Contribuer à tous les moyens de rendre tout cela concret pour nos utilisateurs dans le monde entier passe entre-autre par du C#, du JS, du Python, des apps web, des APIs, du front, du back, des micro services et des données en flux continu tous les jours. Bon il faut le dire aussi… ça passe par des soirées gaming, des tournois de baby-foot, une équipe soudée et agile, des hackathons, des petits déjeuners… Notre équipe Engineering compte au total une soixantaine de personnes à Paris, Boulogne et Birmingham. Nous recherchons actuellement un Senior QA Automation qui apportera son expertise à l'équipe R&D de Boulogne!
Les responsabilités
Rechercher et identifier les solutions d'automatisation qui apportent de la valeur au système logiciel existant
Prendre la responsabilité de la mise en place de environnement d'automatisation ainsi que l’implémentation des scénarios de test
Aider à l’intégration des pratiques d'automatisation dans le cycle de développement logiciel
Former et accompagner les testeurs et développeurs dans l’utilisation de environnement de tests automatiques
Vous participerez également au processus de recrutement des futurs collaborateurs QA Automation Engineer , et assurerez un accompagnement de qualité à nos nouvelles recrues
Pourquoi venir chez nous?
Un éditeur de logiciel certifié Microsoft Gold Partner dont l'innovation fait partie de l'ADN Une entreprise à taille humaine et financièrement solide Travailler sur des projets IA, Machine Learning et Big Data dans un environnement technique varié L'équipe t'adoptera dans un environnement multiculturel, agile et convivial Si en plus tu es sportif, notre Sidetrade Sport Organisation sera ravie de compter un nouveau membre Tickets restaurant, assurance prévoyance et frais de santé.

description:
Job Description

Dailymotion’s Security and Privacy team is in charge of the security of both Dailymotion’s production platform, and its corporate IT environment. The team is looking for an experienced security engineer to contribute to its mission critical projects and security operations.
Within a growing security team and with large-scale production platform to defend, you’ll have opportunities for delivering exciting and impactful projects, requiring a broad range of InfoSec skills.
Responsibilities will include (non-exhaustive list):
Develop the detection capabilities by taking the responsibility of the SIEM and SoC
Deliver security technical projects to implement the security strategy (zero trust, least privilege, defense in depth)
Internal security assessments, operation of a public bug bounty program.
Management of the vulnerability mitigation pipeline, from impact scoring and design of the mitigation strategy to retests
Contribute to security investigations related to incident response and fraud investigation
Work with developers and process owners to evengelise the security culture inside the company

Qualifications

Broad skillset and strong technical expertise and experience in InfoSec (experience in consulting is a plus)
Risk based approach, ability to understand the business stakes beyond the technical impacts
Knowledge or experience in a least one of the following is a must have: Web Security, large scale, production platforms, AdTech ecosystem, Microsoft Active Directory and Azure Active Directory (environment), data privacy regulations
Some knowledge and understanding of security norms and standards (ISO2700x, EBIOS, ITIL or else) will be seen as a plus
Great rigor: very structured approach to problems and strong attention to details
Fluent English (written and oral)
Technical environment:
o PHP, Go, Python, JQuery, GraphQL, OAuth, Kubernetes, Docker, GCP, Ubuntu for production platform
o Okta, Mac OS X, MS Windows, Active Directory, Azure Active Directory/O365, JamF, LastPass, OpenVPN for the office IT environment
o Splunk, BigQuery, Pandas, Nessus, Suricata, OpenVPN for the Security tools

Additional Information

Permanent Contract
Location: Paris 17eme

description:
L’Energie et le Digital vous passionnent ? Envie d’être acteur dans cette transition énergétique et de trouver un sens à ce que vous faites ?

Alors welcome chez ENGIE Digital !

# WeareENGIEDigital

ENGIE est un acteur mondial de l’énergie, résolument engagé dans la transition énergétique et expert dans 3 métiers : l’électricité, le gaz naturel et les services à l’énergie. ENGIE compte 155 000 collaborateurs dans plus de 70 pays pour un chiffre d’affaires en 2017 de 65 milliards d’euros.

En pleine transformation digitale ENGIE a décidé de créer en 2016, ENGIE Digital en plein cœur de Paris dans le quartier Saint-Lazare.

Notre mission ? ENGIE Digital conçoit et fournit des produits et services digitaux pour réinventer le monde de l’énergie et accompagner la transformation digitale des entités, dans le monde entier, d’ENGIE et du Groupe.

Notre ambition, devenir le Leader de la transformation digitale de l’Energie.

Pour ce faire, nous recherchons un nouveau talent, pour grandir et nous faire grandir !


Engie Digital- Data Scientist (H/F) au sein de l'équipe Data
Poste basé à Paris (Saint-Lazare)

L’équipe Data accompagne les plateformes digitales et les Business Units d’Engie dans leur création de valeur autour de la donnée en fournissant une expertise technique en Data Science et Data Engineering. Sa vocation est de réaliser les études data science de bout en bout, c’est-à-dire de la phase exploratoire jusqu’à leur industrialisation.

Vos missions au quotidien
Votre mission principale consiste à participer au développement des briques data science de produits digitaux orientés Data. Pour cela vous aurez notamment besoin de :
Réaliser des études exploratoires sur les données mises à disposition, vous serez notamment amené à évaluer la qualité des données et produire des data visualisations
Identifier les problématiques métiers et les traduire en problématiques Data
Utiliser des techniques de machine learning afin de répondre aux problématiques identifiées,
Présenter les résultats et animer les ateliers métiers pour orienter les développements,
Industrialiser les modèles retenus,
Assurer le monitoring des modèles afin de gérer leur cycle de vie et les ré entrainer ou les faire évoluer lorsque la qualité baisse,
Réaliser une amélioration continue des modèles,
Animer des communautés autour de ces sujets
Faire de la veille technologique.
Qualifications
Votre profil
Vous êtes diplômé(e) d’un Bac+5, vous êtes passionné(e) par l’univers de la data science en général et vous justifiez à minima d’une première expérience dans le domaine. Vous avez idéalement déjà travaillé au sein d’une équipe de développement. Votre niveau d’anglais est courant.
Compétences techniques attendues
Langages de programmation : très bonne maitrise de python. R est un plus.
Maitrise des librairies classiques de data science : scikit-learn, numpy, pandas. keras est un plus.
Maitrise des techniques de régressions, classification, clustering, deep learning, …
Connaissance en bases de données : SQL et noSQL
Pratique de la méthode Agile Scrum,
Sensibilité à la culture devops et au software craftmanship
Compétences comportementales recherchées

Vous appréciez le travail dans une équipe pluridisciplinaire orientée produit (product owner, data engineers, software engineers, …)
Vous recherchez le partage de connaissances avec vos homologues sur votre domaine d’expertise.
Vous êtes pédagogue et êtes capable d’expliquer simplement des méthodes complexes tout en les justifiants vis-à-vis de leur contexte.
Vous êtes rigoureux et vous appréciez avoir un impact direct sur le business : le code produit a vocation à être déployé en production et être utilisé au quotidien par plusieurs milliers d’utilisateurs.

Emploi
: Digital et IT
Lieu principal
: Europe-France-Île-de-France-Paris
Organisation
: ENGIE Digital
Horaire
: Temps plein
Nature de responsabilité
: Opérationnel confirmé

DATA SCIENTIST F/H
Banque de France134 avis - Paris 9e (75)

description:
La mission a une forte dimension d'innovation. Elle implique des contacts nombreux avec les spécialistes de l'analyse de données (data scientists, data engineers, responsables du data lake, informaticiens) ou de l'innovation à la Banque de France mais également chez les différents acteurs du secteur financier. Les modes d'action peuvent revêtir un aspect expérimental.

Dans ce cadre, vous serez amené(e) à :
Contribuer à construire, une compétence « data » à l'ACPR ; aider à identifier les besoins et les ressources pour ce faire ;
Contribuer à définir les attentes de l'Autorité en matière de gouvernance, d'auditabilité et d'explicabilité des algorithmes d'IA utilisés par les organismes financiers ;
Participer, au développement d'outils améliorant l'efficacité des contrôleurs ou renouvelant les méthodes de contrôle ;
Assister ou intervenir dans des événements relatifs au sujet (colloques scientifiques, événements de place, groupes de travail européens ou internationaux etc.)
Profil recherché De formation supérieure (bac +5) dans un champ quantitatif (mathématiques, statistiques, ingénieur...) vous avez une expérience en qualité de data analyst/ data scientist. Vous avez mené des projets de machine learning, connaissez les principales techniques de modélisation en intelligence artificielle et maîtrisez les principaux langage de programmation (R/Python/Java). Vous avez suffisamment de recul sur ces techniques pour challenger d'éventuels développements dans ce domaine.

Doté d’un bon relationnel, vous savez être à l'écoute des besoins métiers et votre sens du travail en équipe vous permet d’échanger avec un grand nombre d'acteurs aux profils et aux technicités variés. Créatif, ouvert aux expérimentation , vous possédez un bon sens de la communication, orale comme écrite.

Un bon niveau d'anglais professionnel est requis.

La Banque de France est une institution socialement responsable, attachée à la diversité de ses personnels. Des aménagements de poste peuvent être organisés pour tenir compte des handicaps des personnes recrutées.
Entreprise La Banque de France recrute

2 Data scientists (h/f)

pour renforcer ses équipes.

L'Autorité de contrôle prudentiel et de résolution (ACPR) a pour missions de contribuer au maintien de la stabilité financière, de veiller à la protection de la clientèle des secteurs de la banque et de l'assurance et de mettre en oeuvre les mesures de prévention et de résolution des crises bancaires ou assurantielles. Adossée à la Banque de France, qui est l'employeur de son personnel, l'ACPR compte plus de mille collaborateurs répartis en une douzaine de directions.

Présentation du Service

Le pôle Fintech-Innovation, directement rattaché à la Direction générale du SGACPR, est le point d'entrée de l'ACPR pour les porteurs de projets innovants et l'observatoire des changements du secteur financier induits par l'innovation. Il a pour mission de favoriser l'innovation en interne.

Il est composé d'une équipe réduite transversale et souple en lien avec de nombreux services de l'ACPR, de la Banque de France et des différentes instances promouvant l'innovation financière en France. Il est également en contact, à l'international, avec les structures des superviseurs et des banques centrales dédiées à l'innovation.

Depuis 2019, il a comme ambition de mener une série de projets destinés à accroître la maîtrise de l'ACPR des méthodes et des outils d'intelligence artificielle pour (i) préparer les conditions de contrôle futur des algorithmes d'intelligence artificielle développés dans le secteur et (ii) développer des outils d'IA pour accroître l'efficacité des contrôleurs de l'ACPR.

meta1:
Data Engineering Intern H/F
Square Sense - Paris (75)
date_publication:
il y a 16 heures
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Technology domains: Kafka, Spark, Python, Java, Scala, Docker, Kubernetes, AWS, GCP, Azure
Location: Paris, France
Duration: 6 months
Square Sense
Square Sense is a fast-growing platform that provides advanced data solutions to global real estate developers, investors and managers. The company builds AI-powered “brains” that improve the operational and financial performance of real estate assets by providing real-time pattern detection and autonomous optimization. They also greatly enhance the overall experience for the tenants.
Square Sense was founded in 2017 in Paris by a multi-cultural team of talented engineers and data scientists.
Software Engineering at Square Sense
In Square Sense's Software Engineering Team we are building a multitude of products in the domains of data collection, analysis, visualization and IoT manipulation. Our systems collect data from IoT devices or third-party data sources, process ingested data in streaming and batch modes, organize processed data, provide the APIs to access it (thus creating a data analytics platform), or use third-party APIs to manipulate the physical world (thus making an automated decision making solution).
Our main programming languages are Python and Scala. From software engineering standpoint, our current technology stack includes Docker and Kubernetes, Kafka, Spark, Beam, Airflow, as well as various related Google Cloud Platform services (GKE, Dataproc, Dataflow, Pub/Sub, BigQuery) and Azure services (e.g.: AKS, HDInsight, etc.).
All team members are responsible for the overall design and architecture, development, quality, production delivery, and monitoring.
Objectives
As a member of the Software Engineering Team you will be guided by Lead Engineer. The primary goal of this internship is to evolve and improve a data collection and data processing pipeline, and deliver your modifications regularly to production for end users. This includes work on componenets for data collection (connectors for various IoT devices and third-party services, web hooks, or MQ clients) and data processing (for example, streaming and batch data pipelines with Apache Kafka Streams and Apache Spark).
Your tasks will include:
Work within a Scrum framework with your teammates and in collaboration with other teams: research & data science, project management.
Design and develop source code for a multitude of Square Sense products in order to deliver new functionalities or modify existing behavior of our data processing pipeline.
Write automated tests (unit tests, integration tests) for new features developed by yourself, or previously existing ones.
Deliver updated systems to production for use by end-users.
Work on improvements of everyday team productivity (automation of existing processes, Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivery).
Participate in the architecture design of Square Sense products.
Profile
We are looking for a student interested in data engineering that is studying for a postgraduate degree in engineering, a master (M2), or an equivalent university course and is looking for a final 6-month internship. Candidates for this position are expected to have knowledge of:
Java, or Scala, or Python. We expect a candidate to be fully autonomous in the coding process.
SQL
Relational and/or non-relational databases
Knowledge in following areas is a plus:
Kafka
Spark
Usage of Amazon Web Services and/or Google Cloud Platform
Agile methodology and Scrum in particular
Being passionate about IT ourselves, we are looking for a likewise passionate person with a good team spirit.
Working at Square Sense
Every member of our enthusiastic multi-cultural team is passionate about the technology; team leaders have 10+ years of professional experience in Software Engineering and Data Science. We offer a motivating work environment and competitive salary. We work in a nice comfortable office in the center of Paris (Métro Strasbourg – Saint-Denis).
Apply
To apply for this position, please send us your CV via indeed.com, or visit https://jobs.square-sense.com/data-engineer/
Job Type: Internship
Location:
Paris (75) (Required)

description:
About us:
Chaque seconde, près de 80 000 recherches sont réalisées sur les différents moteurs de recherche alors que plus de 50% des pages des sites web n’apparaissent pas dans les pages de résultats.
Autant d'opportunités manquées pour les annonceurs.
Rejoignez Botify.
Nous définissons les nouveaux standards du Search Marketing à grande échelle.
Unifiée, Data-driven et facile d'utilisation, notre plateforme permet aux entreprises de déceler des optimisations afin d'impacter chaque étape du Search Process: des exigences techniques à l'optimisation de contenu en passant par les rankings et les mots-clés réels.
Botify est déjà utilisé par plus de 500 multinationales à travers différents marchés tels que les sites de voyages (Expedia, Luxury Retreats, Odigeo), e-commerce (Jet.com, Macy’s, Farfetch, Zalando), media (Axel Springer, Condé Nast, Refinery29), marketplace (eBay, RetailMeNot, Monster), et des agences digitales (Merkle, iProspect, GroupM).
Nous sommes une plateforme SaaS en fort développement, soutenue par des VC, avec un financement de 27 millions de dollars et des bureaux à New York, Seattle, Paris et Londres
Missions principales :
Le poste de QA Automation Engineer chez Botify est complètement intégré à l'équipe technique: il suit les sprints, les cérémonies, et les processes de l'équipe de développement du produit.
Le QA Engineer à la responsabilité de s'assurer de la qualité de la plateforme, à la fois pour des nouveaux développements et pour la régression de la production actuelle.
Le rôle a, entres autres, les responsabilités suivantes:
Analyse des développements à venir, préparations de plans de tests et de critères d'acceptation
Analyse des surfaces de risques, des surfaces de régressions
Proposition de coverage de test automatisés
Implémentation de tests automatisés
Reporting de bugs et de défauts dans notre outil de gestion de tâches (JIRA)
Suivi des développements dans notre outil de gestion de code (Github)
Validation des spécifications techniques, et préparation des plans de tests pour valider les Réalisations
Etre force de proposition sur l'amélioration continue du processus qualité
S'assurer que les développements en cours sont conformes et sécurisés
Reporter sur la qualité globale du produit
Dans le cadre du testing automatisé, la QA interagit étroitement avec les développeurs en amont et en aval de leurs réalisations.
En termes d'outils, aujourd'hui les efforts de la QA Automatisée sont répartis sur deux surfaces:
Une stack d'automatisation de navigateur, construit avec Puppetteer et Chrome en JavaScript avec la framework de testing Jest
Une stack d'automatisation de curl, construite directement dans Postman et intégrée à nos repos de développement
Vous travaillerez au sein d'une équipe de 3 ingénieurs QA assurant quotidiennement la qualité de la plate-forme. L’équipe contient aussi des efforts de testing manuels.
Le développement s'effectue par cycles courts avec des déploiements en production réguliers au fur et à mesure de l'évolution du produit. Nous travaillons en mode Agile avec des sprints de 2 semaines au cours desquels l'équipe partage les sujets en cours et passe en revue le code produit.
Visitez notre blog technique pour avoir un aperçu de nos méthodes de travail: https://medium.com/botify-labs

Profil :
Connaissance profonde du Web et du Cloud
Bonne connaissance de Git, des environnements Linux et de l’intégration continue
Une première expérience de testing automatisé sur un produit Web ou un webservice est obligatoire
Expérience préalable dans le test d'applications Web complexes, notamment la préparation, la documentation, l'exécution de critères de test, de scénarios de test, de scripts de test et de plans de test
Expérience de test de grands ensembles de données / transformations de données / systèmes ETL
Maîtrise complète du français et maîtrise professionnelle de l'anglais
Excellentes aptitudes à la communication, sens aigu de l'organisation


Pourquoi Botify?
Vous rejoindrez une équipe internationale, talentueuse, composée de salariés passionnés travaillant dans une ambiance stimulante.
Vous aurez l’opportunité d’être créatif et d’apporter votre pierre à l’édifice en rejoignant une startup prometteuse, en bénéficiant de nombreux avantages (salaire compétitif, possibilités d’évolution en France et à l’étranger, environnement de travail attractif dans de superbes bureaux, tickets restaurant, etc.)
Vous pensez être fait(-e) pour ce poste ? Vous avez des questions ? Contactez-nous!

Why work for VMware PSO?
The global VMware Professional Services Organization (PSO) drives the adoption of VMware technology and solutions. The Global Account Management (GAM) team owns the business across top enterprise accounts with global operations. We are responsible for driving a significant part of VMWare’s revenue by co-innovating with our customers and partners. Our vision is to lead the digital transformation journey by driving the simplification and acceleration of IT solutions using VMware leading-edge technology and deliver the business outcomes our customers demand.
We are passionate about our Customers: our focus is on professional excellence and quality. We have a rich portfolio of consulting services aimed at bringing to bear the experience, expertise and methodology of our delivery teams around software defined Data Centre (SDDC), cloud automation, multi-cloud, IoT and workspace management.
We are committed to offering a collaborative and supportive working environment with an opportunity to develop in services sales. We promote an inclusive atmosphere where your voice will be heard, and where you will join a fun, dynamic team working in partnership with each other.
The Role:
As a Associate Client Solutions Executive (Associate CSE), South EMEA (SEMEA) Global Accounts (GAM) you will be responsible for supporting services sales across Global Accounts in France, Spain and Italy. You will be part of an exciting team working to drive complex solutions that create disruption, help our customers to innovate their business models and enable them to achieve competitive advantage and differentiation through using VMware’s technologies and services.
Your team is formed by a group of top talent sales individuals across EMEA and with a strong background and experience in selling professional and consulting services for cloud infrastructure, software, workspace mobility, end user computing and IT operational transformation. We are looking for services sellers with vertical industry experience in Telco, Finance and Manufacturing to share their knowledge and approach in a diverse sales team.
You will be working with the extended GAM team to build the commercial proposition to your customers and achieve your business objectives
This is a role which requires passion, dedication and creativity. The GAM team is driving innovation at VMware.

You will be responsible for:
Supporting the professional services business across France, Italy and Spain Global Accounts
Supporting services sales activity working closely with the extended GAM CSE team
Working with the GAM CSEs to driving the services sales cycle end-to-end:
Building the statement of work (legal and finance terms)
Obtaining internal deal approvals (Finance, Delivery, Revenue, Operations)

Driving customer-specific sales campaign to utilise PSO services credits

Orchestrate the VMware PSO presales resources required to develop proposals, respond to RFQs/RFPs and Statements of Work (SoWs)

Strong sales orientation

Able to organise and manage multiple tasks and activities supporting multiple team members Self-motivated, passionate, dedicated, driven, tenacious, achiever and well presented
Able to communicate effectively at all levels.
Excellent communication, and social skills
Fluent in French and English
Bachelors degree

Good understanding of our portfolio

Lead Security Solution Engineer - Public Sector
Paris, France
We’re looking for Security & Compliance Solution Engineers that sell to agencies across the Public Sector.
This sector, as a lot of other industries, have a diverse set of issues around security, compliance, risk as well as emerging technology and trends. This is a highly technical and customer-facing role with most of its impact focused on the success of our customers. There must be a strong desire to leverage both technical and sales skills, including the ability to solicit business requirements, develop a technical sales strategy, and effectively demonstrate the solutions that address these requirements and provide business value, often using configuration or light coding to tailor the demonstration to the audience.
We look for technical professionals who can “own” the conversation on Salesforce's platform security and service delivery, Data confidentiality and Privacy and Security and Compliance posture various cloud offerings flow together.
The role of a Security & Compliance Solution Engineer is to work with our sales teams and customers to:
Understand a customer's risk, security or compliance concerns and communicate how Salesforce's infrastructure, architecture and application features can address these concerns
Apply knowledge of Federal, State, and local cyber and information security regulation and legislation (specifically National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) - Cyber Essentials Plus, Defence Cyber Protection Partnership (DCPP), Cyber Security Model (CSM), French National Cybersecurity Agency (ANSSI) - SecNumCloud, ANSSI - politique de sécurité des systèmes d'information (PSSI), ANSSI - politique de sécurité des systèmes d’information de l’État (PSSIE)) to address customer concerns around risk, data privacy or Salesforce's compliance posture
Work with a variety of technical organizations within Salesforce - including Technology Compliance, Technology & Product and Engineering teams
Have strong understanding of network security, general engineering principles, cryptography, data in transit, and other technical aspects to assist in in-depth conversations with IT/CIO conversations
Partner with sales teams to remove security as a blocker by speaking to CISOs, CIOs and other key decision makers
Understand current and emerging cyber security risks, and innovative risk management methods and eloquently communicate to customers
Scale the role through external and internal education and enablement efforts
Lead hands-on technical workshops and education sessions
Your Impact :
Having fun and getting out of your comfort zone on a daily basis
Present Salesforce's cloud infrastructure, including demonstrating deep familiarity with Salesforce's hardware, software, networking and security stack
Opportunity to speak at industry conferences
Build and present customized demos
Feedback customer requirements and use cases to Product Managers and Product Marketers to influence product strategy and optimize product-market fit
Build deep relationships and provide thought leadership in our customer base to become a Trusted Advisor
Constantly learning, absorbing new information daily, and having a keen focus on how to best discuss complex, technical problems with customers
Assist customers understand how the cloud and Salesforce can meet their security needs
Part of a highly motivated sales team who are fanatical about our customers’ success
Comfortable working with clients at all levels - it is just as important to work with the front line as the CIO and CTO
Willing to learn how to configure our technology to build demonstrations that will show off the power of Salesforce’s platform
Adding to our broader team's point of view and base of knowledge and understanding
Minimum Qualifications:
B.S. Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Software Engineering or equivalent work experience
A deep passion for working with the latest, cutting-edge technologies
Experience with cloud, SaaS, PaaS, aPaaS and IaaS concepts and technologies
Familiarity with integration, security, and architecture patterns
Knowledge of related applications, relational database, and web technology
Deep understanding with information security and auditing, including experience with internal and external audits, and security and risk frameworks (e.g. ISO 27001, PCI DSS, HIPAA, GDPR or similar standards)
Strong background in security controls, auditing, network and system security
Some domestic travel is required
Fluent French and good English language skills
Preferred Qualifications:
Basic programming experience in Java/.Net/JavaScript and other web based technologies, Salesforce platform development (e.g. Apex code)
Information Security certifications (CISSP, GSEC, SANS etc.)
*LI-Y
Posting Statement
Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this Web site or directly to managers. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org.

description:
Lead Agile Coach: Product Coach
Based: Paris
Excellent salary, c 80K basic and bens
INTERVIEWING NOW TO START JANUARY
An exceptional opportunity has arisen to join this rapidly expanding Trail Blazer in France for Innovation for Data, AI, Financial Digital Transformation and much more.
The Lead Agile Coach (focused on Product) is responsible for the education, adoption and scaling of agile and product with all Product Teams (includes PO, Development, Dev Ops and Data Engineers etc.) and Leaders at a Product level in order to establish a common understanding across the product needs.
The Product Coach will evaluate the stability of the portfolio and respective products in order to identify opportunity for improvements around scaling agile and product management, and help the leaders and teams mature their product vision, planning and delivery. This role will be accountable for partnering with leaders (poss. Customer’s VP of products and Directors across the portfolio) to develop a strategy to set and achieve the Agile or Lean processes and product goals for their respective products. The position is new to the Practice so you will know what needs to be done and lead this.
Responsibilities may include:
Formally create, in conjunction with the product leaders, and execute against a product level coaching plan and communicate the plan to the Product Teams and the team’s leader chain (up to VP).
Educate Director+ leaders on agile and product principles.
Ensure Product Teams and leaders can demonstrate their learning based on the coaching plan.
Formally review the progress, outcomes, and observations (positive and negative) of the product level coaching plan with the product leaders and the portfolio VP.
Ensure all coaching engagements have a positive learning experience. The Product Coach will be the resident expert of the product principles and product management techniques. As such, you will need to be involved with internal and external agile and product networks in order to stay current on best practices and strategies related to this way of working. Partnership and learning are cornerstones of the agile and product mindset thus the Product Coach will need to actively participate in the thought leadership within these Agile and Product communities and seek out opportunities to continuously improve their own skills in order to better support the products and companies.
Participate and promote internal Community of Practices to drive a learning culture.
Participate in external professional organizations relevant to product development and coaching for best practice and SAFe etc.
Willingness to attend and present at conferences, trade shows, or industry events, as appropriate.
Training and Certification: The Product Coach will be responsible for understanding and developing shared internal training and learning materials that apply the principles of Agile and product. They will develop strategies to leverage these materials with leaders, and thus be accountable for ensuring all leaders and Product Teams understand these concepts and how they apply to the working processes of their product. The Product Coach will be responsible for the active coaching of Product Teams and leaders, facilitation and coaching of quarterly planning events, and development of product specific coaching plans to mature the Product Teams and leader’s skills and mindset.
Contribute to and/or create instructional content (including training programs, written procedures, or any other instructional material).
Recommend and coordinate training or certification programs for product teams and leaders.
Deliver formal instruction to others (for example, lead classroom training or certification sessions).
Coach leaders and teams in driving a learning culture rooted in product, agile, lean and technology.
Consulting and Process Improvement the Product Coach will be responsible for coordinating with Product Teams and leaders in order to align on outcome-based deliverables and drive dependency awareness outside of the teams. The Product Coach will work closely with partners, particularly Scrum Masters, Product Managers and Engineer Managers, to evaluate a Product Teams agile and product maturity and strategies to address gaps. The Product Coach will also work closely with Directors to establish agile and product maturity strategies for the products, coach and educate one-on-one with leaders, provide direct feedback based on observations, and be a catalyst for promoting a learning culture.
Communicate with stakeholders to ensure that newly implemented product coaching strategies are working as planned.
Demonstrate product level adoption by the Product Teams and leaders of the best practices and repeatable processes.
Facilitate the definition of a product
Enable Product Teams and leaders to identify their customers and enable them to conduct qualitative research to better understand those customers
Support cross-team planning activities as part of quarterly planning
Provide subject matter expertise to others outside of own work group (e.g., internal customers, merchants, vendors).
Proactively provide feedback to leaders and individuals based on direct observations. Mentor and develop other Coaches and Scrum Masters and Product Owners etc.
Ideal Profile:
3+ years in Agile coaching experience.
8+ years Product Management experience across a variety of Agile teams and Agile methodologies and frameworks. Also LEAN.
Leading large organizations/enterprise through Agile and Product transformations.
Leading coaching and learning programs for product teams.
Leading coaching of leaders in technology, product and business organizations.
Agile certifications (SAFe/Scaling, Product Owner, Coaching, etc.) RTE
Lean, Kanban, Continuous Improvement, Process experience/certifications.
DevOps experience (build automation, test automation, test driven development (TDD), Continuous Integration (CI), Continuous Development (CD), Infrastructure as code, etc.)
Working with the Technical/development teams (Java/OOP. coding, scripting. SaaS infrastructure development, application development in multi-channel needs).
Design, UX experience to full life cycle and Automation Testing.
Presentation level English & French.
An excellent challenge and real opportunity to make a difference in the Agile and timely Product delivery etc.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: 80,000.00€ /year
Experience:
Agile Coach: 1 year (Preferred)

Big Data Engineer H/F
Square Sense - Paris (75)
date_publication:
il y a 19 heures
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Technology domains: Kafka, Spark, Python, Java, Scala, Docker, Kubernetes, AWS, GCP, Azure
Location: Paris, France
Duration: CDI
Square Sense
Square Sense is a fast-growing platform that provides advanced data solutions to global real estate developers, investors and managers. The company builds AI-powered “brains” that improve the operational and financial performance of real estate assets by providing real-time pattern detection and autonomous optimization. They also greatly enhance the overall experience for the tenants.
Square Sense was founded in 2017 in Paris by a multi-cultural team of talented engineers and data scientists.
Software Engineering at Square Sense
In Square Sense's Software Engineering Team we are building a multitude of products in the domains of data collection, analysis, visualization and IoT manipulation. Our systems collect data from IoT devices or third-party data sources, process ingested data in streaming and batch modes, organize processed data, provide the APIs to access it (thus creating a data analytics platform), or use third-party APIs to manipulate the physical world (thus making an automated decision making solution).
Our main programming languages are Python and Scala. From software engineering standpoint, our current technology stack includes Docker and Kubernetes, Kafka, Spark, Beam, Airflow, as well as various related Google Cloud Platform services (GKE, Dataproc, Dataflow, Pub/Sub, BigQuery) and Azure services (e.g.: AKS, HDInsight, etc.).
All team members are responsible for the overall design and architecture, development, quality, production delivery, and monitoring.
Objectives
As a Data Engineer you will be a member of the Software Engineering Team. This position implies close collaboration with members of our Data Science Team, who design and implement various data processing algorithms.
Primary objectives of a Data Engineer are:
Develop various components for data collection (connectors for various IoT devices and third-party services, web hooks, or MQ clients) and ingestion of collected data (using Kafka, for example).
Develop data processing applications (for example, streaming and batch data pipelines with Apache Kafka Streams and Apache Spark).
Automate data processing tasks and their monitoring in production (for example, orchestration of batch processing jobs using Airflow).
Design efficient data models using various storage technologies (cloud file storages, relational DBs and non-relational DBs such as Cassandra for instance).
Implement APIs (GraphQL and REST) to access processed data.
Profile
We are looking for a software engineer with 3+ years of industry experience in back-end software development or data engineering. Candidates for this position are expected to have:
Industry experience and strong programming skills with at least one of the following programming languages: Python, Java, or Scala. We expect a candidate to be fully autonomous in the coding process.
Willingness to learn new programming languages and new technologies.
Industry experience in back-end software development and/or data engineering.
Good knowledge of SQL and relational databases.
A taste for high quality software (clean code, high test coverage, willingness to do thorough PR reviews).
Knowledge in following areas is a plus:
Kafka, Kafka Connect, Kafka Streams, KSQL
Spark
Docker, Kubernetes, Helm
NoSQL databases
Amazon Web Services / Google Cloud Platform / Microsoft Azure
Agile methodology and Scrum in particular
Being passionate about IT ourselves, we are looking for a likewise passionate person with a good team spirit.
Working at Square Sense
Every member of our enthusiastic multi-cultural team is passionate about the technology; team leaders have 10+ years of professional experience in Software Engineering and Data Science. Currently with 8 full-time members we are looking to double the team size in next 12 months. We offer a motivating work environment, competitive salary and participation in the stock option plan. We work in a nice comfortable office in the center of Paris (Métro Strasbourg – Saint-Denis).
Apply
To apply for this position, please send us your CV via indeed.com, or visit https://jobs.square-sense.com/data-engineer/
Job Type: Permanent
Salary: 50,000.00€ to 60,000.00€ /year
Experience:
professional software development: 3 years (Required)

Overall Job Description

The R&D Program Manager supports its tribe or more tribes by ensuring that all business and technical aspects of the delivery of functionalities are executed smoothly and that software delivery over our environments is a continuous and aligned process. Each tribe consists of several Squads that deliver software changes for a specific . Program Manager works closely together with the IT Tribe Leads, the Business Tribe leads (/Product Owner) and the delivery teams within the Squads.

Fast removal of impediments, timely preparation of SAFe and SCRUM ceremonies, fruitful collaboration with concerned business and IT departments to manage any dependencies are the key tasks and responsibilities of the R&D Program Manager. He/she also assists the Tribe and Product Owner with idea funneling, as well as with timely prioritization and identification of requirements.

The R&D Program Manager proposes and continuously improves implementation-related processes that drives the technical delivery of his/her tribe and assures proper maintenance by the IT Operations team after delivery. When relevant, the R&D Program Manager assures that delivered functionalities are properly marketed by the concerned stakeholders.

Using his/her technical expertise and superb interpersonal skills, the R&D Program Manager works together with the IT Tribe Lead and the Product Owner to ensure that business and technical initiatives owned by the tribe are prioritized, planned and delivered to Production within time, scope and budget. He/she also provides clear monthly reporting to all stakeholders about the tribe’s delivery roadmap.

KEY RESPONSABIITIES:
Governance: Enables product vision understanding within squads and secure audit-proof requirements
Accountability: Is the accountable person for end to end delivery of the Program building a consolidated plan with all actors of the projects (Development, QA, Architects, Product Owners, Integration, DevOps)
Financial Management: Forecasts annual budget in terms of iterations and service increments of all EPICS within his/her scope on time for V0 and V1 portfolio budget exercises
Planning / Forecasting including non R&D deliveries: Setup and runs the Service/Program Increment planning ceremonies (cross Tribes) to define and plan the scope of the next service increments (10 to 12 weeks cycle
Risk Management Multi-squad level: Identifies and track risk, dependencies and issues and work with Development, Product Owners, Architects, OPS and Customer Program Manager to maximize alignment and value delivery and remove impediments
Infrastructure delivery: Setup release management ceremonies in order to follow up and obtain proper release management visibility and delivery
Service increment demo: Setup service increment demo ceremonies in order to show value delivery and obtain feedback for potential release decision
Best practices: Promotes continuous improvement practices and accounts for sprints retrospectives outcomes; Lead by example with respect to change management; Foster craftsmanship practices, frequent deliveries of value and shorter time to market cycles. Champion I-AM (Agile Methodology) values and guiding principle and provide continuous feedback for its improvement.
Build and Share Reporting: Measures progress of Epics deliveries within his/her scope with respect to delivered value and forecasted budget through his / her updated EPICS roadmap and EPICS burndown / burnup charts; Is accountable for providing transparency on delivery through monthly reporting and stimulate teamwork and team commitment

SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:
4-6 years of hands on experience in taking a key role in an agile SDLC, for instance as Scrum Master, Senior Developer, Product Manager or IT Project Manager
4-6 years in an international working environment
Demonstrated experience in large organizations in roles which include structuring of activities, estimation of time and costs, execution to plan, delivery of results
Experience in managing technical aspects of software delivery in at least three of the following areas: front end development, back end development, infrastructure, middleware, data warehousing
Ideally Certified from Scrum.org ( Professional Scrum Master’ or Scaled Professional Scrum’) or SAFe
Knowledge of CI/CD concepts
Experience in Financial or Payment industry in senior delivery roles
Experience working with geographically dispersed teams, onshore, offshore and nearshore
Experience in implementation of continuous improvement methodology (Lean, Six Sigma)
Experience with a professional, structured Project Management Methodology is a nice to have (i.e. Prince2, CMMI, PMI)
Ability to work across functional and business unit lines and develop and maintain a culture of partnership with the Group project and product delivery managers and between all parts of the organization

INTERPERSONAL SKILLS:
Demonstrated relationship building, networking and collaboration, decisiveness in negotiation, very strong influencing and persuasion skills
Excellent planning skills, ability to split large deliveries into small epics, features and user stories prioritized by value delivered, in collaboration with the Product Owner
Ability to build consensus in an environment of conflicting interests and ensure execution of agreed initiatives - always focused towards result
Strong ability to analyze complex situations and present solutions in a structured way at Director and C-Level
Assertive and a driver of change and delivery
Strong operational orientation
Strong communication skills
Ability to work cross-culturally and across regions and to travel internationally on occasion
Lean / Agile attitude and mindset

QUAALIFICATIONS
The 3rd party company has to propose candidates with the following skillset / qualifications:
Engineer or University degree, with a least 7 years of experiences
Proficient in Microsoft Excel and Powerpoint, Atlassian JIRA and Confluence
Technical (Development/DBA) background is a plus
Basic knowledge in Monetic
Experience in Linux environment and SAAS development

description:
MP DATA est une société de Conseil spécialisée dans la transformation digitale des entreprises. Dans le cadre de son développement, MP DATA recrute un(e) data engineer débutant(e) directement rattaché à la direction technique amené àtravailler sur différents projets pour une multinationale engagée dans l'Aéronautique.
Au titre d'un projet de grande ampleur, vous contribuerez à la mise en place d’une infrastructure Big Data, au développement et à la mise en production d’outils de machine Learning et optimisation en collaboration étroite avec les data scientist. Votre rôle sera dans un premier temps de participer à la mise en place et à l’amélioration continue d’une infrastructure Big Data basée sur un DataWarehouse collectant et mettant a disposition des métiers et Data Scientists un historique de données de vol et d’opérations consolidé, en utilisant uniquement des outils open source (Hortonworks, Spark, Hadoop, MongoDB par exemple). Dans un second temps ,vous serez le référent des data scientists sur les questions liées à leurs environnements de travail, ainsi qu'à l'industrialisation des moteurs de machine learning que vous pourrez contribuer à développer. Sur cette phase d'industrialisation, vous serez amené à accompagner l'équipe dans les choix d'architectures et les échanges avec les autres équipes du groupe. L’infrastructure ayant actuellement une vocation de pilote, vous serez fréquemment amené à proposer et mettre en place des évolutions et/ou migrations liées aux services qui la structurent, et a la déployer dans les différentes antennes du groupe. Vous serez accompagné tout au long du projet par un de nos Lead Data Engineers.
Ingénieur Grande Ecole (Centrale, Mines, Supaero, Supelec, …), ou avec une forte expérience, vous avez des connaissances en Java, Scala acquises lors de votre scolarité ou de vos expériences passées. Vous connaissez Spark et Hadoop. Vous êtes familier avec les langages de manipulation des bases de données et les technologies associées (MongoDB, Blob Storage, SQL, NoSQL). Votre autonomie et votre capacité à être force de proposition ont été reconnues durant vos précédentes expériences ainsi que votre esprit de synthèse. Job details

Internship GPCOPE01 - Junior engineer : automation of offshore schedule setup
Vacancy ref
64375
Based in
Paris (Suresnes)
Business area
Surf and Conventional
Contract type
Intern Temp
Closing date
31/12/2019
Languages in which you may apply
English, Français
Vacancy information
During tender and project phases, the Operations team develop an offshore schedule, describing all activities that need to be done by the vessels offshore on field to install all the different piece of equipment (pipelines, Manifold, flexible line, umbilical, …), pre-commission them and made them fully ready for hand-over to our Client.
Today, the process to setup this offshore schedule is mainly “hand driven” and required lot of People (Project Operations Manager) effort to analyse past experience and develop new schedule for new tender and project.
All analysis of variation in duration of offshore works between as-sold, as-planned and as-built are mainly done manualy with no automated tools, and no reliable and standard way of doing.
The offshore schedule is done with Microsoft Project.
The intention of this internship is to develop a tool and processes that maximize the automation process of creating offshore schedule, including understanding the Scope of Work, evaluation tasks to be performed, understanding links inter tasks and evaluate based on previous experience/evaluated time estimates, the required time to perform the tasks.
Candidate, will have access to the softwares and tools that are required to be used. He/she will also have access to previous projects schedules to understand the the work Subsea 7 is performing, how schedules are built as of today, and what type of activities and links need to be considered.
Candidate will need to prepare a standard process, develop an input interface file to summarize scope of work and potential individual activities, develop a tool to maximise offshore schedule automation for initial setup/creation, update throught out life cycle (as a minimum during tender) and variation analysis.
Depending on progress and time available, the candidate will also be required to do analysis of past projects schedule and will be required to create statistics from past projects on individual tasks, that can be used for future offshore schedule.
Profile :
We are looking for an applicant in his third year of Engineering School.
The applicant mut be curious, proactive and have good communication skills.
The applicant must be practical in order to understand quickly the reality of our marine activities, but also have good skills on data analysis / processes analysis / automation of process.
An advanced level in English is required

At TechnipFMC, we deliver critical projects of a scale, scope and difficulty that you simply won’t find anywhere else. We are looking for a Piping Specialist Engineer (M/F) who can join our multicultural team in Paris
Job description
Reporting line:

Operationally reports to Estimating Piping Lead Engineer and Hierarchically to head of Estimating Department
Key interactions:

Internally: Proposals Department, Engineering Department, Procurement department Construction Department, Cost Control department, Project management team.

Externally: Subcontractors / Suppliers, clients.

Produces overall piping material estimates/budgets/forecasts for selected proposals and/or project within the piping estimating pool team inside the Estimation Department and in relation with Lead Estimating Engineers.

Have experience in the engineering project in Oil and Gas.

Have agile to produce or follow several piping Cost Estimate. (Offshore, Onshore, with different cost estimate level).

meta1:
Internship GPCENG09 - Junior engineer : Torpedo piles, design challenges
Subsea 7118 avis - Paris (75)
titre_poste: Internship GPCENG09 - Junior engineer : Torpedo piles, design challenges
date_publication:
il y a 3 jours
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Job details
Position
Internship GPCENG09 - Junior engineer : Torpedo piles, design challenges
Vacancy ref
64372
Based in
Paris (Suresnes)
Business area
Surf and Conventional
Contract type
Intern Temp
Closing date
31/12/2019
Languages in which you may apply
English, Français
Vacancy information
Geotechnical Team forms part of the Design and Analyses group, servicing the geotechnical needs of Subsea 7 within the Global Project Centre. Our team has been involved and has extensive experience in the design and installation of foundations for a large collection of offshore developments (Oil & Gas industry and renewable industry) around the globe.
Dynamically penetrating anchors provide an extremely simple and cost-effective method of installation, by free fall from a significant distance above the seabed. In its simplest form, the so-called Torpedo piles are steel, torpedo-shaped objects that are installed as projectiles penetrating the sea floor under velocity. Used widely (more than 2000 units) by Petrobras Offshore Brazil, they are a potentially viable alternative for anchoring both mobile drilling units as well as permanent facilities.
They are designed to reach velocities of 25 to 35 m/s at the seabed, allowing tip penetrations of ~3 times the anchor length, and holding capacities after consolidation that are anticipated in the range 5 to 10 times the weight of the anchor. While such efficiencies are lower than would be obtained with other sorts of anchor, the low cost fabrication and installation compensates.
However, they have not yet been used outside of Brazilian water. There is a lack of documented installation and design methods with verification agencies.
The proposed work consists of:
Review of the design challenges for Torpedo piles on deep-water sediments.
Specific items are:
Penetration behaviour of anchors
Axial pull out capacity over the time
Lateral capacity
Establishment of design procedure
Prediction of pile embedment after free fall
Modelling of the piles with 3D finite element analyses
Validation of the numerical results by mean of published centrifuge data, model tests and field tests
Identify the further work (in terms of additional model tests in the laboratory, full-scale tests in the field and numerical modelling).
Case study: typical offshore development: Torpedo pile vs suction pile. Focus on both technical aspect and cost evaluation
Reporting
The candidate will be integrated to the offshore geotechnical team. He will work under the direct supervision of the team manager. Candidate will collaborate closely with structure department, installation group and supply chain team for other aspects of Torpedo pile viability.

Profile :
Engineer's degree in civil or geotechnical engineering.
Broad interest in engineering software, notably PLAXIS/ABAQUS and Mathcad.
An advanced level in English is required

Pivot & Co also invests in and advises Marketing Technology start-ups that will change the rules of media and marketing performance tomorrow.
Our team comprises strategy consultancy profiles, data scientists, and digital entrepreneurs. Our leaders have all worked in top executive roles in large organizations (FMCG and Luxury), as well as in strategic consultancies and agencies.
PIVOT & CO SEEK TO INTEGRATE A SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST
Today, main marketing mix model approaches rely on disparate data sources, not consistent in the collection, non-consistent over time. Most of the investment decisions are made through the lens of marketing expertise and don’t provide enough rationale facts.
Pivot is recruiting a senior data scientist, working in the data science team (4 persons to oversees the activities of the junior data scientists and provides advanced expertise on statistical and mathematical concepts for the broader Data science team, to solve Pivot & Co clients problems.
The Senior Data Scientist applies and inspires the adoption of advanced data science and analytics across Pivot clients with the focus on excellence and delivery.
Main challenges are
- Sales uplift modelling in Marketing
- ROI modelling
- Rationale investments decision for A&P allocation and brand planning process
- Modelling cumulative effect and activities impact on sales/Brand equity
ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES
1. Data collection and data cleaning
2. Create composite KPIs to reflect the Marketing Return of Investment
3. Model channel contribution by application of advanced statistical methods: (Linear regression, Neural network, stochastic gradient boosting)
4. Present key findings with structured memos or PPT to Pivot Team or Pivot clients
PROFILE
· BAC +4/5 (Maths/Stats/Operational Research/Engineer, Econometry)
· Advanced knowledge in one statistical toolbox: R, Python – Good command in Python is a plus
· Interest for Marketing analytics: Marketing effectiveness, Digital media, Brand planning
· Autonomy and ability to work in project mode and manage multi-task
· Ability to develop a real closeness to clients, based on a sense of commitment and a culture focused on result
· A "positive” attitude
GENERAL INFORMATION
· Work Office: 24 avenue Georges V, Paris 8 (Métro Alma Marceau, Charles de Gaule Etoile, Georges V)
· Salary: Good package
WHY PIVOT?
· The Pivot team is small and tight-knit. The consulting missions are led by senior associates, all from operational departments in the largest groups.
· A high level of responsibility and interactions. We’ll give you responsibility for deliverables from day one; your work will be important!
· Diversity of assignments to strengthen training and performance.
· Cooperative work atmosphere, fast decision-making mode, short hierarchy line.
Avantages :
Participation au transport
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: 60,000.00€ /year

Integrated into the Supply Chain Management department, the trainee will have the opportunity to become familiar with the oil & gas services environment and will discover our organization through interfaces with other services.
The Supply Chain Management of the GPC department (Global Project Centre) of Subsea7 aims to purchase materials and to sub-contract the services needed to carry out its engineering, manufacturing and installation projects for offshore and subsea infrastructures. The department also provides budget recommendations in the tendering phase, based on market consultations or its databases and internal estimation tools.
The GPC is the department of excellence of Subsea 7 for the execution of its EPCI contracts (Engineering, Procurement, Construction, and Installation) around the world.
The GPC Supply Chain Management department wants to recruit a Data Scientist trainee whose main role will be to develop benchmarking and internal estimation tools by Machine Learning. These tools should help to quickly identify the cost of strategic products to support negotiations with our suppliers or to provide a reliable budget in the bidding phase.
The internship will require many contacts with commodity managers, buyers, engineers and cost controllers to collect, understand and explain the data collected from the company.
Its main tasks will be:
Collection and processing of historical data
Identification of representative variables
Search the best model with Air Studio
Development of an estimation tool quickly usable by buyers
From a data scientist training/study, the curiosity and dynamism of the candidate will be essential to question the employees to understand the specificities of the different commodities and the parameters impacting the cost of them.

Student oriented data scientist
Familiarity with “R Studio” and “R Shiny” is a plus
A good physical sense to quickly understand the products and services of Subsea7
Autonomous, Curious, Proactive, interest for investigation and research of pragmatic solutions

description:
About the team
Smart’s software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that empower our customers to reach their digital business goals. They grow in a demanding environment that values performance and high-availability: our platform manages over 1 million bid requests per second and our dataset is about 3 petabytes in Hadoop (more than 2TB additional data per day).
Our innovation team based in Paris and Nantes is composed by 70 straightforward and energetic individuals working in an Agile environment and ready to tackle the most complex technical challenges.
Your mission
Site Reliability Engineers make our platforms highly available and robust both at infrastructure and application level.
Reporting directly to our Lead SRE, you will join a team where millisecond matters and will have the opportunity to significantly contribute to the evolution of our production platform and technologies (5 DataCenters, 1 000+ servers).
Write specifications, implement and maintain back office tools (web API, site administration) in order to monitor evolution in terms of quality of services, software, and systems.
Optimize and monitor software and network infrastructure across the globe.
Solve complex problem (monitoring, sharding) regarding the implementation of previous generation architecture, allowing the deployment of advanced business functionalities, essentially based on Linux (Hadoop, Redis, Prometheus, Aerospike, Grafana…)
Provide technical expertise in order to improve the quality and performance of the architecture (Ansible, Docker, Kubernetes, Cloud), highlighting the outcomes with Key Performance Indicators.
About you
Master degree in Computer Science or similar technical field of study
5+ years of System or Software Engineering experience in a Linux and/or Windows environment ideally in the web industry
Experience in the administration and smooth scaling of messaging (RabbitMQ) or NoSQL (Hadoop, Redis, Elasticsearch) technologies that support high loads and offer a top quality of service in terms of performance and high-availability
Interest in new technologies and large-scale technical stakes
Entrepreneurial spirit and know-how to identify opportunities of improvement with ability to thrive under autonomy in a fast-paced environment
Working proficiency and communication skills in verbal and written English
Side technical projects
Why you should apply...
We are one! At Smart, we care for our people. We are certified Great Place To Work and are constantly improving our working environment. Meet the team: https://youtu.be/BxvmLDyXct0
Grow with us! You will work in a challenging and fast-paced profitable context with varied projects and get awesome opportunities to develop your skills and grow internally.
Leave your mark! Smart is a human-size company. Our employees thrive under autonomy and can easily have a strong impact on our business, customers and organization.
✈️ Live global! You will work across countries & cultures through career path or Backpackers Program, our interoffice exchange program to boost employees’ collaboration.
We are transparent! We speak with fact and data and have a true culture of feedback. We believe in an open world and show a strong sense of integrity both internally & externally.

description:
Overview:
Looking for candidates that may support clients in Paris, France
FM Global is a leading property insurer of the world's largest businesses, providing more than one-third of FORTUNE 1000-size companies with engineering-based risk management and property insurance solutions. FM Global helps clients maintain continuity in their business operations by drawing upon state-of-the-art loss-prevention engineering and research; risk management skills and support services; tailored risk transfer capabilities; and superior financial strength. To do so, we rely on a dynamic, culturally diverse group of employees, working in more than 100 countries, in a variety of challenging roles.
Do you know how a power plant operates or why a transformer has a malfunction? Can you explain high cycle fatigue, flow associated corrosion? Have you ever seen a turbo generator break down, a lube oil fire or witness a steam turbine fail? Would you like to?
FM Global is currently expanding its Boiler & Machinery Consultant Engineering team around the world. If you’re interested in taking your career to the next level check out our newest Boiler & Machinery Consultant Engineer openings!
At FM Global, you have the power to influence outcomes and make a difference in the future – yours and your clients. When you join our team as a Boiler & Machinery Consultant Engineer, you can leverage your engineering background to help clients neutralize potential disasters—saving property and businesses.
With the company’s nearly two centuries of knowledge and experience behind you, you’ll work hands on with some of the world’s most influential organizations, helping them understand risk and protect their assets.

Responsibilities:
Boiler & Machinery Consultant Engineers will interact with high hazard FM Global clients within the PowerGen, Forest Products-Pulp & Paper, Semiconductor, Mining, Chemical and similar industries. Experienced engineers will use their expertise to consult with clients to protect their facilities against mechanical and electrical breakdowns, fire and many other hazards. As a Boiler and Machinery Consultant Engineer, you will develop strong client relationships to advise on risks associated with client businesses as well as develop and implement risk improvement strategies.
Additional responsibilities include:
Evaluate the integrity and reliability of equipment, identify hazards and deficiencies to deliver focused risk improvement solutions and reduce equipment risk
Utilize Operating standards, data sheets and guides to provide risk guidance and implement best practices
Prepare engineering reports, loss expectancies to support risk improvement
Collaborate with Operations Engineering, Client Services, Account Management and Underwriting on Boiler & Machinery recommendations
Engineers will work from a home office, must be able to manage their time and work independently with minimal supervision
This is a field-based role and will require travel to large, complex industrial client sites to evaluate the operations and systems of the site and identify risks and hazards. Expected overnight travel is 10%-30%
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or equivalent work experience with a concentration in either electrical, mechanical or chemical engineering
Minimum of 5 years’ experience in a high hazard industry such as power generation, chemical, nuclear, mining, pulp & paper, manufacturing or maritime combined with a Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, a minimum of 10 years relatable experience without a Bachelor’s Degree required
Must possess knowledge of electrical and/ or mechanical power generation and associated equipment and systems such as rotating equipment, boilers, generators, system interrelationships and knowledge of safety devices. Industrial Control Systems experience highly desired.
Demonstrated experience to understand basic machinery and equipment along with hands on exposure
Candidates will possess strong verbal and written communication skills, proficiency in MS Office products is required
Candidates must be analytical, organized and have good problem solving and interpersonal skills
A valid driver’s license is required, a company car is provided
Physical Requirements:
Able to lift up to 25 pounds or 11.34 Kilograms
Able to climb ladders

L'équipe Tech œuvre pour la mise en place d’outils utilisés en interne (et bientôt en externe pour certains) par les équipes contenu afin de déterminer les sujets qui buzzent, les aider dans la création de contenu, suivre les performances des vidéos internes etc... en injectant dans chacun de ces produits une dose conséquente d’algorithmie, de statistiques et de machine / deep learning.
Principales missions

de la construction, de l’optimisation et du monitoring au quotidien de pipelines data complexes,
de l’enrichissement du Data Model existant,
de l’accompagnement de l’équipe Data dans une démarche d’amélioration continue (aide à l’application de best practices de développement, méthodologies de travail, documentation, refactoring de codes...),
de la participation, en collaboration avec l’équipe Infra & Devops, à l’optimisation de nos processus Data et de nos outils (mise en place dans notre stack technique de Dask – ou autre framework - pour du calcul distribué par exemple).

Jellysmack est une entreprise américaine, spécialisée dans la création de contenus vidéos originaux sur les réseaux sociaux.
Du football (Oh My Goal) au gaming (Gamology), en passant par la beauté (Beauty Studio), les énigmes (Riddle Me This), sans oublier les arts créatifs DIY (Genius Craft) ou encore le monde des animaux (Naturee), nous créons des communautés et connectons des personnes qui partagent les mêmes passions.

date_publication:

description:
Engineer in Machine Learning for Medical Image Analysis
Data Scientist position:
Deep Learning Techniques for Medical Images Analysis
This position is proposed by Guerbet , a global leader in Radiology, offering a full range of contrast media and associated medical devices and solutions for Diagnostic Imaging (CT/Cath Lab, MRI) and Interventional Imaging. The company is headquartered in the Paris area and operates globally, with over 80% of sales generated outside of France. They can be combined within a CIFRE-PhD contract in collaboration with a public research institute.
Subject: Detection and Classification of Prostate Tumors in Multiparametric MRI
Prostate cancer (PCa) is among the most common cancers and a leading cause of cancer-related death. One of the most important problems in urological practice is how to differentiate clinically significant and non-significant PCa i.e. how to avoid over treatment of tumors with low malignant potential in one hand, and inappropriate less aggressive treatment of significant tumors, on the other hand. At the first place, one should estimate precise local clinical stage and the grade of the disease. Transrectal ultrasound-guided prostate biopsy id the golden standard to estimate the aggressiveness. The Gleason score GS from biopsy and prostate specific antigen (PSA) level are clinically used to determine PCa aggressiveness. GS is a well-validated factor and known to be a powerful predictor of disease progression, mortality, and outcomes. In general, patients diagnosed with a Gleason score (GS) ( 6) have better 5- and 10-y survival rates, lower biochemical recurrence rates, and lower prostate cancer-specific mortality than do patients with GS 7 (2). But there are few dilemmas concerning prostate biopsy: the number of biopsy cores, inter and intra-observer variations in the grading and the GS determined through biopsies is known to differ from those determined following radical prostatectomy as well as between immediate repeat biopsies.
Therefore, the ability to automatically detect the GS with high accuracy from the diagnostic MRIs would have a significant impact on clinical decision making, treatment selection, and prediction of outcomes for patients and spare them from painful biopsies and their accompanying risk of complications. Noninvasive and accurate techniques that determine the aggressiveness of PCa are needed to enhance the quality of patient care. We propose in this subject is to develop AI and machine learning methods for the automatic detection and classification (gleason score grading) of prostate cancer from multiparametric Magnetic Resonance Imaging. It will be based on a large dataset (1000+ MRI cases) currently acquired from multiple clinical centers worldwide.
Searched profile
Biomedical engineering, computer science, applied mathematics (MSc or PhD level)
Good scripting and programming skills
Good knowledge of machine learning
Experience with common data science toolkits preferable (tensorflow, scikit-learn…)
Innovative and results oriented
Excellent English, French preferred
Passion to use computer science to improve healthcare and benefit patient’s life
Investigators
Marc-Michel Rohé, PhD, Augmented Intelligence Technical Leader at Guerbet
Jean-Sébastien Raynaud, PhD, MR Lead Scientist at Guerbet
Francois Nicolas, PhD, Chief Digital Officer at Guerbet

description:
The Company
We are engineers. We provide an open-source content management platform for architects and developers, using the latest technologies and working with agile methodologies.
We are focused on creating an extensible platform for our customers, allowing them to build applications to organise, search and transform their data according to their business needs.
That is why we are leaders and visionaries in our sector.
People are our secret weapon, and that is why Nuxeo is an award-winning place to work.
The Team
Our Engineering team of 30 developers is committed to designing, building and delivering features, and continuously improving the performance and reliability of our products as we rapidly scale our organisation.
The team is divided into sub-teams that work with agile methodologies.
We are mainly based in Paris, France but also in Lisbon, Portugal as well as in the US.
Technical Stack
Frontend: JavaScript (ES6), Polymer 3, CSS3, npm, webpack.
CI/CD: Jenkins X, Kubernetes, Docker, AWS, GCP.
The Role
As a Frontend Software Engineer for the Engineering team, you will create visually engaging interfaces for complex applications. You will implement designs for Nuxeo's products and services, taking technical possibilities and limitations into account: we are looking for a developer with a strong sense of design and UX.
We are not looking for freelance workers: this is a permanent position (CDI).
A Typical Week
You will brainstorm with Software Architects, Product Managers and Designers to deliver quality applications with experience focused on user needs.
You will implement interactive client-side web applications on both desktop and mobile browsers, using HTML, CSS and JavaScript to accommodate the ever-growing list of viewports and browsers in play.
You will help our support team fix bugs and make customers happy. This is important as we sell support and maintenance.
You will mentor other engineers and review code.
Requirements
You love coding!
You have 3+ years of relevant experience in the Frontend development: expert skills in JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3, RWD techniques and methods, cross-browser compatibility including mobile and tablet experience and accessibility.
You are familiar with frontend development frameworks.
You write understandable and testable code keeping in mind maintainability.
You bring an in-depth understanding of fundamental visual and interactive user-centred design principles.
You're a quick learner, team player and are adaptable to new technologies.
You speak English and French fluently.
Bonus Points
You've mastered developing with Polymer.
You have experience developing PWA and web components.
You are comfortable with visual tools such as Photoshop, Sketch and wireframing software.
You are familiar with other programming languages e.g. Typescript, Dart, Java or other frameworks like React, React Native, Vue.js...
You have a passion for building beautiful user interfaces.
