Tinyclues is an AI solution that enables B2C marketers to drive revenue and engagement from their existing customers. By contrast with traditional data-science approaches that rely on capturing explicit customer intent, Tinyclues' Deep AI approach leverages the full complexity of our clients' anonymized first-party datasets and picks up implicit signals (“tiny clues”), making it possible to reach unparalleled relevance & campaign performance.
Job Description
Tinyclues’ AI-first marketing platform is built with the latest technology including Akka, Spark, Mesos, elasticsearch, Docker, scikit-learn, Python ML frameworks, React.js, etc. Our software stack is a mix between Scala and Python, natively designed for cloud and deployed on AWS and other cloud providers. We focus on using those ecosystems for what they do best.
The solution processes and analyzes hundreds of terabytes of data every day from our 100+ enterprise clients across 13 countries. It runs dozens of powerful and carefully designed machine & deep learning algorithms to find the “tiny clues” in our clients’ first-party dabases. The technology currently relies on proven NoSQL datastores and distributed backends to process data. Our data pipelines are implemented over Spark and Mesos and orchestrated with an intelligent event-driven architecture using Akka and RabbitMQ.
What we do
We build a bleeding-edge predictive marketing platform on top of open-source technologies such as React, Play/Scala, Spark, elasticsearch, Docker, python, numpy, scikit-learn... Our software stack is natively designed for cloud and deployed on AWS and other cloud providers. We focus on using all those ecosystems for what they do best.
We ingest petabytes of data, and run dozens of powerful and carefully designed Machine Learning algorithms to bring value to our customers. It relies on an industrialized, automated and highly configurable platform, using advanced visualizations to help its operation.
As we believe methodology excellence helps to build a better product for our clients in a sustainable way, we currently work using agile methods, kanban boards, and recurrent internal tech events to share knowledge.
What you will do
Embedded in the Data Science Tools team:
You will help us build the platform that runs and operates all the ML algorithms in production
You will work hand in hand with data-scientists, ML engineers, data-ops to improve our platform and deliver rich insights from the data we manipulate
You will play with some of the sexiest piece of technologies available (react, d3, play/scala, machine learning...), and help going even one step further
You will participate in our initiatives of knowledge sharing and continuous quality improvement
You will be at the heart of a fast-paced, forward-thinking company building word-class technology
Preferred Experience
You are currently a full-stack & dataviz software engineer or wish to become one.
These assertions should not frighten you :
You have practical knowledge, experience or strong interest in building a solid, beautiful, useful and easily refactorable front end applications. Since our product and tools use browser side technologies, you should have knowledge in the corresponding idioms.
You like manipulating data, and find a way to visualize it in a meaningful way for the users, even when you have to deal with abstract matrices and mathematical metrics.
You have practical knowledge, experience or strong interest in manipulating data structures, algorithms, and backends to build data-centric applications while being easily refactorable, easily deployable, monitorable and resilient
You work easily with agile concepts (user stories, sprints) and best practices (peer review, pair programming…)
You have a passion for shipping quality/tested/performant code : all around testing, TDD, continuous integration, continuous deployment, devops…
You have great communication skills and fit well within a team
You have no fear to challenge benevolently others' work or to be challenged on your own
Additional Information
Contract Type: Full-Time
Location: Paris, France (75001)
Education Level: Master's Degree
Experience: > 1 year

By joining our experimented and talented tech team, you’ll contribute to the design and development of new services for bus professional, making sure they are robust and scalable. Thanks to your technical expertise and your communications skills you’ll work closely with our product and business experts as well as tech teams our partners.

meta1:
Next-Generation IoT Protocols (Engineer)
Inria46 avis - Palaiseau (91)
date_publication:
il y a 4 jours
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Le descriptif de l’offre ci-dessous est en Anglais
Type de contrat : CDD de la fonction publique
Niveau de diplôme exigé : Bac + 5 ou équivalent
Fonction : Ingénieur scientifique contractuel
A propos du centre ou de la direction fonctionnelle
Located at the heart of the main national research and higher education cluster, member of the Université Paris Saclay, a major actor in the French Investments for the Future Programme (Idex, LabEx, IRT, Equipex) and partner of the main establishments present on the plateau, the centre is particularly active in three major areas: data and knowledge; safety, security and reliability; modelling, simulation and optimisation (with priority given to energy).
The 450 researchers and engineers from Inria and its partners who work in the research centre's 28 teams, the 60 research support staff members, the high-level equipment at their disposal (image walls, high-performance computing clusters, sensor networks), and the privileged relationships with prestigious industrial partners, all make Inria Saclay Île-de-France a key research centre in the local landscape and one that is oriented towards Europe and the world.
Contexte et atouts du poste
This offer is within the framework of an Inria "DeepTech/Innovation" funding on the subject of next generation IoT networks. A large part of the research currently conducted at the Inria Saclay–Île-de-France centre aims to meet the technological needs of companies, and we maintain a constant dialogue with the socioeconomic stakeholders of the Saclay plateau.
The position is in the team TRiBE of Inria Saclay. The team TRiBE is focusing its research activities on the Internet of Things (IoT). In this area, recently, Low-Power Wide Area Networks (LPWAN) have recently gained considerable attention. The key objective of these wireless technologies is to connect low-power devices over very large areas, with low data rates. LPWANs are promising for various emerging IoT applications, complementing the traditional cellular and short-range technologies.
TRiBE team members have 20+ years of experience in research and development in IoT, wireless, sensor networks, etc. We are also active participants and contributors to Internet standardization at IETF/IRTF. TRiBE is a major contributor to the open-source project RIOT, an operating system for the Internet of Things (in action: http://riot-demo.inria.fr). We also maintain one of the sites of the open access testbed FIT IoT-LAB (saclay cam. here).
The position is for two years (one year + one year renewal).
Mission confiée
Assignments:
With the help of Cedric Adjih and Alexandre Abadie, the recruited person will be taken to develop next-generation protocols for LPWANs. The main objectives are to:
Advance the state of open, standard, protocols stacks for LPWAN by providing open-source implementations; and when useful, to provide the tools to experiment them on a real testbed, the FIT IoT-LAB testbed.
Incorporate open research results on next-generation protocols developed at Inria, in the TRiBE team, promote them by providing them as extensions of existing open-source implementations and contribute to the various standardization committees.
For experimentation of protocols, update with new tools and new devices the FIT platform in Saclay in cooperation with other FIT sites.
In addition, with Inria Department of Industrial Relations and the Application of Technology, the engineer will:
contribute to the technology transfer activity in Inria and/or with different industrial partners from Inria.
Considered IoT protocols:
The work will proceed in several steps: intially, developing/contributing and finalizing an open-source implementation of an IoT protocol; then extending it with research results from Inria Team TRiBE; and finally, experimenting on a real testbed.
The considered IoT protocols include: SCHC [1] the IPv6 compression for IoT network with short packets [2]; the transport of firmware updates by multicast such as for LoRa [3]; or coded random access [4].
The research-based enhancements include coding, such as network coding [5], machine learning techniques [6], and other protocol-specific enhancements.
For SCHC, the team TRiBE has already contributed to an open source implementation (in-progress), OpenSCHC [7], and to several IETF Hackathons. For (network) coding, we also have contributed to the IRTF research group NWCRG with draft specifications and to implementations [8].

[1] Static Context Header Compression (SCHC) and fragmentation for LPWAN, application to UDP/IPv6, draft version 21
[2] IPv6 over Low Power Wide-Area Networks (lpwan), Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF)
[3] LoRa Alliance, Firmware Updates Over the Air
[4] work in progress, Experimenting Coded Slotted Aloha
[5] IRTF research from NWCRG - Coding for efficient NetWork Communications Research Group (nwcrg)
[6] Yu, Y., Wang, T. and Liew, S.C., "Deep-reinforcement learning multiple access for heterogeneous wireless networks", ICC 2018.
[7] Open source implementation of SCHC: openschc
[8] SWiF Codec https://github.com/irtf-nwcrg/swif-codec , and Liblc https://github.com/GardiNet/liblc
Principales activités

Compétences
We are looking for highly skilled developers:
Excellent programming skills and experience in languages: C and Python
Good knowledge of project management tools (make, git, github)
Knowledge of development for IoT, wireless networks and/or embedded systems

Avantages
Subsidized meals
Partial reimbursement of public transport costs
Leave: 7 weeks of annual leave + 10 extra days off due to RTT (statutory reduction in working hours) + possibility of exceptional leave (sick children, moving home, etc.)
Possibility of teleworking (after 6 months of employment) and flexible organization of working hours
Professional equipment available (videoconferencing, loan of computer equipment, etc.)
Social, cultural and sports events and activities
Access to vocational training
Social security coverage
Rémunération
Salary in regards to professional experiences

You will work with VMware sales, partners and customer network architects to develop the detailed network design, and successfully carry out the deployment and cutover. You will solve potentially complex network problems which span beyond just SD-WAN and take it all the way to resolution. You will also take the practical, real world learning and help us further improve our products and usability.Area of Focus:Create the High Level Design (HLD) and Low Level Design (LLD)
Define the cutover plan and participate in the cutover calls (after hours possible)

Track the deployment progress (number of sites, software releases). Recommend and plan software upgrade as necessary.
Review changes in customers requirements, feature needs, and communicate with account team and product management
Tackle challenging network issues which may span multiple network devices and not just SD-WAN
Enjoy traveling and interacting with various functions in VMware clients and partners such as project manager, network engineers, director of network architecture, and CIO

Practical experiences of routing design and implementation using OSPF and BGP
7+ years of experience supporting or deploying WAN technologies, data centers networking, and network security in the enterprise production network

Virtualization experience with VMware and KVM.

Ability to pick up and learn new things, be autonomous, and be creative in solving complex problems.
1+ years of experiences in customer facing roles, such as Customer Support, Deployment Engineer, or Network Engineers
Exceptional communication and listening skills, ability to quickly build rapport, establish trust and credibility with VMware clients and partners

description:
Passionné(e) par les nouvelles technologies ? Intéressé(e) par le secteur de l’énergie ? Rejoignez Kayrros, la start-up qui révolutionne le monde de l’énergie.
Kayrros est une start-up créée en 2016 et spécialisée dans l’énergie et l’intelligence artificielle. Rejoindre Kayrros, c’est rejoindre une équipe dynamique de 140 personnes basée à Paris (HQ) et dans nos bureaux de New-York, Houston, Singapour et Londres. Notre équipe internationale est principalement composée de Data Scientists, Data Engineers et Energy Analysts, dont le but est d’apporter de la transparence au secteur de l’énergie.
Kayrros utilise des technologies innovantes, telles que le traitement d'images par satellite et l'intelligence artificielle, pour capturer et analyser des données dans le secteur de l'énergie. Ces données combinées à notre expertise nous permettent de fournir à nos clients (traders, fond d’investissement et grandes entreprises), des informations sur les mouvements du marché mondial, afin de les aider à prendre de meilleures décisions d’investissement.
En septembre 2018, Kayrros a réalisé une deuxième levée de fonds de 21 millions d’euros, nous permettant de continuer notre croissance.

Nous recherchons actuellement pour notre bureau de Paris
un Junior Legal Counsel H/F (CDI)
Vous intégrerez l’Équipe Juridique composée de notre Responsable Juridique ainsi que d’une paralegal et épaulée par un réseau de cabinets d’avocats indépendants.
Sous la direction de notre Responsable Juridique et en collaboration avec les équipes administratives et opérationnelles, vos principales responsabilités seront les suivantes :
Droit commercial : revue contractuelle contrats clients et fournisseurs
Droit social : assistance pour toute question liée au droit du travail
Propriété intellectuelle et Données personnelles : suivi de la compliance interne en matière de propriété intellectuelle et RGPD
Droit des sociétés ; Secrétariat juridique en matière de corporate
Plus généralement, mise en place et suivi de process, assistance juridique au quotidien



Le profil idéal
Vous êtes intéressé(e) par travailler au sein d’une start-up dynamique et en pleine croissance et vous êtes à la recherche d’une opportunité en CDI débutant immédiatement.
Vous avez deux ans d’expérience au sein d’un cabinet ou d’un département juridique d’entreprise
Vous avez une formation généraliste BAC+4/5 idéalement en Droit des Affaires ou DJCE
La maitrise de l’anglais à un niveau courant (écrit et oral) est indispensable compte tenu du périmètre international de ce poste. Des résultats récents de tests types TOEFL seront appréciés.
Votre polyvalence, votre esprit d’analyse et votre esprit d’équipe sont autant d’atouts qui vous permettront au mieux de réussir à ce poste
Pourquoi Kayrros ?
Nous sommes une jeune entreprise en croissance et nous sommes extrêmement passionnés par ce que nous faisons
Nous sommes situés dans le bâtiment WeWork, rue la Fayette, 75009 (boissons gratuites, événements et atmosphère animée)
Vous travaillerez avec une équipe internationale et pratiquerez votre anglais (ou chinois, allemand, suédois, portugais ...) au jour le jour.
Notre processus de recrutement
Envoyez votre CV en vous présentant rapidement (5 lignes) et en précisant vos dates de disponibilités
Un premier entretien téléphonique (RH)
Un premier entretien physique (RH + Responsable Juridique)
Un test juridique pratique de 30 min est à prévoir
Un dernier entretien physique (Différents membres des équipes administratives)
Le processus s’étend sur un mois maximum.

Present in 108 countries, the Groupe employs more than 78,000 professionals.
Altaïr :
The deployment of an ERP (Enterprise Resources Planning), a very high-performance tool, aims to create consistent and efficient applications across our agencies on a global level, to facilitate real-time information sharing and analysis regardless of the size of the agency or its location. This project, named Altaïr (which signifies "Flying Eagle" in ancient Arabic and is also the name of the brightest star in the same constellation) is rolling out.
The Altaïr solution has been developed and piloted since Q2 2013. Parallel roll-out is running as of 2013. The solution is now deployed to Publicis entities supporting 35.000 end-users (of which 8.000 heavy users). The Altaïr solution will provide a common process and application platform for the following CORE processes:
Client set-up, Vendor set-up
Manage projects, Estimating
Manage time, Manage expenses
Purchasing & procurement
Production billing
Cash collection & credit receivables
Account payable
Inter-company
Treasury
GL
Month-end
Fixed assets
Budget forecasting
All these CORE processes are supported by extensive reporting capabilities.
The processes are run on SAP ECC6.0 (SD billing, MM purchasing, FI, CO, PS) and SAP Netweaver (Portal, PI, BI). The following project tools are in use: Solution manager, Quality center, RWD, Loadrunner.
The SAP platform is fully integrated into the Publicis application landscape: HFM for corporate reporting, TMS for treasury management and dedicated applications for Media planning and buying.
Delivery Center
In order to deliver the next versions of CORE Solution design & build and the world-wide roll-out, Publicis Groupe manages its own Altair internal Delivery Center and with a number of proven SAP experts eager to contribute to the challenges of Altaïr. We are pioneering and leading the industry in many area's and will be to first major advertising & communication group to launch a global ERP. In this challenging environment we offer a number of challenging positions in a truly global environment in the fascinating world of advertising.

meta1:
Stage - Data Engineer - Visualisation des données d'essais moteurs H/F
Safran2,751 avis - Moissy-Cramayel (77)
titre_poste: Stage - Data Engineer - Visualisation des données d'essais moteurs H/F
date_publication:
il y a 5 jours
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Safran est un groupe international de haute technologie opérant dans les domaines de la propulsion et des équipements aéronautiques, de l'espace et de la défense. Implanté sur tous les continents, le Groupe emploie plus de 92 000 collaborateurs pour un chiffre d'affaires de 21 milliards d'euros en 2018. Safran occupe, seul ou en partenariat, des positions de premier plan mondial ou européen sur ses marchés. Pour répondre à l'évolution des marchés, le Groupe s'engage dans des programmes de recherche et développement qui ont représenté en 2018 des dépenses d'environ 1,5 milliard d'euros.

Safran est classé dans le Top 100 Global Innovators de Thomson Reuters ainsi que dans le palmarès « Happy at work » des sociétés où il fait bon vivre. Le Groupe est en 4ème position du classement Universum des entreprises préférées des jeunes ingénieurs en France.

Safran Aircraft Engines conçoit, produit et commercialise, seul ou en coopération, des moteurs aéronautiques civils et militaires aux meilleurs niveaux de performance, fiabilité et respect de l'environnement. La société est notamment, à travers CFM International (société commune 50/50 entre Safran Aicraft Engines et GE), le leader mondial de la propulsion d'avions commerciaux courts et moyen-courriers.

Au sein de la Division Support en service et Réparations, et dans le cadre du projet de maintenance prédictive des moteurs, les Bureaux d'Etudes s'appuient sur des données de natures variées pour aider aux diagnostics de panne, à la recherche de solutions de réparation ou à la mise en place de plans d'inspection. Ces données sont également à la base d'algorithmes qui permettent la détection ou l'anticipation de panne, ou bien le suivi du vieillissement de certaines pièces.

En particulier, les données d'essais moteurs (essais de développement et essais de réception avant livraison aux clients) sont souvent exploitées par les Bureaux d'Etudes dans le cadre de la conception, de l'étude de comportements observés lors des essais de réception ou de l'analyse de constats en service.
La disponibilité et l'accessibilité de ces informations représentent donc un enjeu majeur pour les Bureaux d'Etudes.
A l'heure actuelle, l'accessibilité de ces données et leur exploration visuelle restent un exercice pour un public de spécialiste.

L'objet du stage consistera donc à proposer et développer une solution pérenne destiné à un public non spécialiste en informatique.

Il s'agira notamment :
De recueillir les besoins du Bureau d'Etudes Support en service et Réparations dans l'exploitation de ces données,
De dresser un état des lieux des solutions (ou des briques de solutions) existantes,
De proposer une solution de visualisation cohérente de ces besoins, à partir d'une base de données,
De développer cette solution,
De déployer et soutenir cette solution.
Parmi les moyens de visualisation, les outils Plotly Dash et Power BI pourront être étudiés.
La performance des solutions de traitement et de visualisation, leur convivialité, la disponibilité et la qualité des données sont des contraintes clés du projet.

Pour réaliser ses travaux, le/la stagiaire s'appuiera au maximum sur les solutions existantes et réalisera les développements en cohérence avec les règles et bonnes pratiques informatiques en vigueur.

Les principales composantes du stage sont :
recueil et analyse des besoins métiers spécifiques de la Division Support en service et Réparations,
Prototypage, développement et validation de codes de traitement et de visualisation en python,
Mise en place de chaînes de traitement et de visualisation de données, y compris dans un cluster HADOOP en python et en spark,
Soutien à l'utilisation des outils logiciels développés.
Dans le cadre d'une formation à forte composante informatique, nous recherchons un(e) candidat(e) Bac+5 ayant :

Une maîtrise du langage de programmation python et du paradigme orienté objet pour le traitement de données massives et leur visualisation (idéalement librairies pandas + quelques librairies de visualisation),
Une première expérience avec des solutions de visualisation de la donnée, (par exemple : Kibana, PowerBI, Plotly Dash).
Pour mener à bien ses activités, le/la candidat(e) devra avoir un esprit de synthèse, faire preuve de créativité et avoir un bon relationnel pour échanger avec les différents interlocuteurs.

De plus, le contenu de stage fait appel à des capacités de prototypage rapide et de travail dans un environnement dynamique et transverse.

meta1:
Site Reliability Engineering Internship/Data Processing and Governance
Criteo46 avis - Paris (75)
titre_poste: Site Reliability Engineering Internship/Data Processing and Governance
date_publication:
il y a 5 jours
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Who we are
At Criteo, we connect 1.5 billion active shoppers with the things they need and love. Our technology takes an algorithmic approach to predict what user we show an ad to, when, and for what products. Our dataset is about 50 petabytes in Hadoop (more than 120 TB extra per day) and we take less than 10ms to respond to an ad request. This is truly big data and machine learning without the buzzwords. If scale and complexity excite you, join us.

What is it like to work in our R&D

Most of all, we are creators. From designing ground-breaking products to finding unique ways to tackle technical challenges at an extraordinary scale, our tech teams work with state of the art methodologies to shape the future of advertising.
The Site Reliability teams keep one of the largest computing platforms in the AdTech world functioning like clockwork. They are processing, storing and monitoring through large scale data compute & storage services (Hadoop, SQL & NoSQL), streaming (Kafka), platform as a service (Chef, Mesos), identity management (Kerberos) and analytics (Hive, Druid, Vertica).
What You’ll Do
You will be part of the team working on data governance and processing and you will get the full picture of data transformation: who owns it, data growth, etc. That comes together with a full exposition to our tech stack, as the data goes through many different systems: Kafka, jobs based on Hive, Spark and Presto, many different SQL and NoSQL databases for online and offline purposes.
With the guidance and support of your mentor, you will learn how to drive your project, design and ensure best practices are applied.
You will participate in all knowledge sharing sessions/ workshops.
You will gain a better understanding of how to work on real world data and mission-critical constraints.
You are encouraged to actively voice your ideas whilst learning how to build and ship quality code into production.
You will participate in architecture discussions, influence the roadmap, and take ownership.
You will work with and learn from talented engineers, with a diverse set of backgrounds.

During your internships (6 months – end of studies) and according to your choice, skills and interest, you can tackle one of the following subjects:
Streaming data catalog: You will help to deal with more than millions of messages per second, flowing from several Kafka clusters, all around the world, into one of the biggest Hadoop clusters in Europe.
Understand the data and their dependencies in Criteo based on actual usage and develop some use cases with: Scala/React/Typescript/SQL/Hadoop.
Develop tools and analyses to understand and monitor the quality of our data with Scala/React/Typescript/SQL/Hadoop.
Who You Are
You are in your final year of study in Systems/Software Engineering or related field.
You have already built projects in Python, C# or Java, and you have some practical experience writing Map/Reduce, Spark or Hive.
You are curious about new technologies.
You have a strong sense of ownership and a dislike for passing the buck.
You are a problem solver, a fixer, and a creative technologist. We believe coding is a talent and a passion, not just a skill.
You are a strong communicator and a team player who can work efficiently with others.
You are fluent in English.
Want to Know More?

What does it feel like to be part of something big? Get a snapshot Get the story directly from our R&D engineers, check our Medium R&D blog Interested in discovering your Criteo community first? Let’s meet

At Criteo, we dare to be different. We believe that diversity fuels innovation and creates an energy that can be seen and felt all over Criteo. We champion different perspectives and are committed to creating a workplace where all Criteos are heard, feel a sense of belonging, and are treated with respect and dignity.

Criteo collects your personal data for the purposes of managing Criteo's recruitment related activities. Consequently, Criteo may use your personal data in relation to the evaluation and selection of applicants. Your information will be accessible to the different Criteo entities across the world. By clicking the "Apply" button you expressly give your consent.

Criteo46 avis - Paris (75)
date_publication:

description:
Who we are
At Criteo, we connect 1.5 billion active shoppers with the things they need and love. Our technology takes an algorithmic approach to predict what user we show an ad to, when, and for what products. Our dataset is about 50 petabytes in Hadoop (more than 120 TB extra per day) and we take less than 10ms to respond to an ad request. This is truly big data and machine learning without the buzzwords. If scale and complexity excite you, join us.

What is it like to work in our R&D

Most of all, we are creators. From designing ground-breaking products to finding unique ways to solve technical challenges at an exceptional scale, our tech teams work with state-of-the-art methodologies to shape the future of advertising.
The Product Engineering team builds the products that make Criteo tick: from developing industry leading machine learning techniques, to building high scale/low latency real-time applications (over 5M QPS, handling over 300 Bn HTTP requests daily), to delivering first class client interfaces, both API and UI, with forward-thinking UX at their core, all using state of the art technology.
What You’ll Do
During your internship (6 months) and according to your choice, skills and interest, you can tackle one of the following subjects:

Back-end: participate to build large-scale pipelines and systems that make the best decision in a very short time, half a million times per second.
Full stack: MasterTag request production and parsing - Technical stack: a bit of TypeScript/JavaScript, C# (.Net Frmwk, .Net Core) and Mesos.
Front end: Design and implement a component in a web application that will be used to manipulate big JSON markup easily. The goal is to provide a tool to create or change layout banners in a simple and efficient way.
Data quality in the RichTimeline (Remove fraudulent users and identify low-value data) .

In a team of 5-7, you will be working closely with your mentor to drive your project, design and ensure best practices are applied. You can ask questions and participate in all knowledge sharing sessions/workshops, etc. You are encouraged to actively voice your ideas whilst learning how to build and ship quality code into production which will likely affect millions of users instantly.
Who You Are
You are in your final year of study in Software Engineering or related field and available for 6 months.
You have experience in developing web-based applications. You occasionally participate in coding competitions.
You are experienced in Object Oriented Programming.
You have a strong sense of ownership and a dislike for passing the buck.
You are a problem solver, a fixer, and a creative technologist. We believe coding is a talent and a passion, not just a skill.
You are a strong communicator and a team player who can work efficiently with others.
You are fluent in English.

We champion different perspectives and are committed to creating a workplace where all Criteos are heard, feel a sense of belonging, and are treated with respect and dignity.

Entreprise Agil-It est une Entreprise de Services du Numérique (ESN) fondée en 2015. Agil-It opère dans le conseil et le service et est spécialiste des technologies Big Data, Business Intelligence et des architectures JAVA/JS dans un environnement agile.

Nous accompagnons nos clients en conseil et en expertise dans la mise en place de projets structurants et novateurs. Nous accompagnons la transformation digitale des systèmes d’information.

Notre enjeu consiste à apporter de la valeur en accompagnant les décideurs d’entreprises dans tout type de projet technologique.

Notre objectif est d’aller plus loin que les attentes initiales de nos clients en proposant les meilleures solutions et services.

Ability to learn new concepts and technologies, and apply them to provide the best business outcomes for customers
Ability to formulate and communicate ideas clearly in a business environment, including presenting in front of varied internal and external audiences
Business fluent French is required for customer interactions, alongside business English for internal communication and collaboration with the worldwide teams

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for Data Warehousing and Analytics Solutions Architects for our French customers. If you have experience in designing architecture of data ingestion, storage, processing and visualization, leveraging tools such as Teradata, Pentaho, Qlik, Tableau or Elasticsearch and are interested in helping customers embrace cloud technologies, come and talk to us. Specialist Solutions Architects work with AWS' partners and customers to accelerate their cloud transformation. They engage in a wide range of activities around their domain of expertise, providing technical advice to customers, helping the internal and external communities, presenting AWS publicly on their domain, and providing a preferred path between AWS service teams and customers.

This is an opportunity to join Amazon’s technical teams, working with our engineers on the new services that power the cloud ecosystem, while developing your skills and furthering your career within what we believe to be one of the most innovative and progressive technology companies. These engagements will focus on Data warehousing, Business Intelligence, and Machine Learning. This role will specifically focus on AWS Services for Analytics, and on helping our customers and partners build innovative Solutions and Businesses that focus on leveraging the value of data.

As a Data Warehousing and Analytics Specialist Solutions Architect (SA), you will help customers select the technologies that will support their business requirements. Part of the Specialist Solutions Architecture team, you will work closely with the other Specialist SAs on Big Data, Databases, Analytics, Artificial Intelligence, or Security, as well as the Business Development teams, to enable large-scale customer use cases and drive the adoption of AWS for their data processing platforms. You will interact with other SAs, providing guidance on their customer engagements by developing white papers, blogs, reference implementations, and presentations to enable customers and 3rd parties to fully leverage the AWS platform. You will also create field enablement materials for the broader SA population, to help them understand how to integrate AWS solutions into customer architectures.

Candidates have a mix of communication and technical skills, and will have the ability to engage with customers at different levels in the organization, from executive to developer. Previous experience with AWS is desired but not required, provided you have experience building large scale solutions. You will get the opportunity to work directly with senior engineers at customers, partners and AWS service teams, influencing their roadmaps and driving innovation.

If you are someone who enjoys innovating, likes solving hard problems and working on the cutting edge of technology, we would love to have you on the team.
Amazon's Culture Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We have 14 leadership principles that help guide us in our every-day decision making process. We believe they are a clearer articulation of those things that have always been a part of what makes Amazon great – things that we must consciously hold on to in fulfilling our mission to be Earth’s Most Customer Centric Company. We are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy and happy lives. Learn more about life at Amazon. It is always Day One.

How You’ll Grow At Amazon, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn and develop your career. We offer opportunities to help sharpen your skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.

Roles and responsibilities
Customers' trusted advisor: collaborate with AWS account, training and support teams to help partners and customers learn and use AWS services such as Amazon Redshift, Kinesis, SageMaker, Glue, S3, DynamoDB, and the Relational Database Service (RDS)
Business partner: serve as a key member of the business development and account management team in helping to ensure customer success in building and migrating applications, software and services on the AWS platform.
Public engagement: provide thought leadership on Analytics solutions that benefit customers through the use of AWS Services. This takes the form of contribution to external publications such as the AWS Blogs, Whitepapers and Reference architectures, or public presentations at AWS Summits, AWS re:Invent, AWS User Groups or industry events
Community player: capture and share best-practices, participate, and contribute as a member of the worldwide AWS technical community of Solution Architects, Professional Services Consultants, Technical Account Managers, and AWS Trainers
Service team point of contact: act as a conduit between the AWS Service teams and the customers, providing detailed guidance for the broader field organization and the customers, and acting as an advocate for the customers towards the central teams

Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Women / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation.

description:
Imaginez demain…
Au sein du Département Corporate Research & Science, vous intégrerez l’équipe Data Science, s’intéressant aux problématiques liées aux environnements de dimension massive mixant le réel et le virtuel et générant des quantités de données complexes nécessitant l’automatisation de leur traitement et de leur analyse afin d’en extraire une connaissance et des modèles à forte valeur ajoutée.

La grande complexité et variété des données, leur dimension souvent explosive a conduit à l’essor des techniques d’apprentissage statistique (Machine Learning), visant à produire des algorithmes permettant d’apprendre automatiquement des données les représentations ou les modèles les plus performants.
Les approches à base d’apprentissage statistique comme le Deep Learning ont fait leur preuve sur les données texte (traduction, génération, similarité, …) ou image (classification, détection, segmentation, …). En revanche, appliquer le Deep Learning sur les données de type 3D et plus particulièrement les modèles 3D industriels (CAD) reste un domaine de recherche ouvert et très actif qui soulève un certain nombre de challenge.

Votre contribution :
Cartographier l’écosystème 3D Machine Learning du point de vu laboratoire de recherche et de la concurrence. Réaliser des référentiels sur les technologies clés.
Développer des prototypes et des composants technologiques.
Démontrer l’applicabilité et l’usage des composants dans des scénarii adaptés aux besoins de la R&D.
Au travers des études et prototypes réalisés, il/elle élaborera des recommandations technologiques et il/elle accompagnera leur transfert vers les équipes de développement produit.
Participation à l’écriture de brevets dans le cadre de ses travaux.
Vos atouts pour réussir :

Doctorat (PhD) en Machine Learning / mathématique appliquée ou formation d’ingénieur ou universitaire (de type Bac+5) avec une majeure en Machine Learning / Data Science et un minimum de 3 ans d’expérience professionnelle dans le développement d'algorithme de Machine Learning (apprentissage statistique)

A ce titre, vous disposez de solides connaissances en Modélisation 3D (maitrise), Mathématiques Appliquées (Expertise), Algorithmique (maîtrise),
Vous disposez de compétences en programmation en python et C++ (Expertise), Framework Deep Learning (Tensorflow, Caffe, …) (maîtrise), rédaction de document et de présentation

Outre les compétences techniques, vous êtes doté(e) d’un esprit d’analyse et de synthèse, d’une bonne aptitude à la restitution d’information et à la communication.

Dassault Systèmes reconnait et intègre tous les talents. La diversité est notre meilleur atout.

description:
Who we are
At Criteo, we connect 1.5 billion active shoppers with the things they need and love. Our technology takes an algorithmic approach to predict what user we show an ad to, when, and for what products. Our dataset is about 50 petabytes in Hadoop (more than 120 TB extra per day) and we take less than 10ms to respond to an ad request. This is truly big data and machine learning without the buzzwords. If scale and complexity excite you, join us.

What is it like to work in our R&D
Most of all, we are creators. From designing ground-breaking products to finding unique ways to tackle technical challenges at an extraordinary scale, our tech teams work with state of the art methodologies to shape the future of advertising.
The Site Reliability teams keep one of the largest computing platforms in the AdTech world functioning like clockwork. They are processing, storing and monitoring through large scale data compute & storage services (Hadoop, SQL & NoSQL), streaming (Kafka), platform as a service (Chef, Mesos), identity management (Kerberos) and analytics (Hive, Druid, Vertica).
What You’ll Do
You will be part of a team providing services available, scalable and for most use cases, low latency. In other words, manage the service from bare metal OS install to the driver.
More in depth, you will provide Distributed Caching, Columnar Database services and Full index search service. We're using Memcached, Couchbase, Cassandra and ElasticSearch running on Kubernetes.
With the guidance and support of your mentor, you will learn how to drive your project, design and ensure best practices are applied.
You will participate in all knowledge sharing sessions/ workshops.
You will gain a better understanding of how to work on real world data and mission-critical constraints.
You are encouraged to actively voice your ideas whilst learning how to build and ship quality code into production. You will participate in architecture discussions, influence the roadmap, and take ownership.
You will work with and learn from talented engineers, with a diverse set of backgrounds.

During your internships (6 months – end of studies) and according to your choice, skills and interest, you can tackle one of the following subjects:
Bin packing app on Mesos: your contribution will be to make our scheduler take optimal decisions to start new containers on the right servers to minimize resource waste.
Isolate disk IOps between applications: your contribution will be focusing on allowing several application sharing disk access in a reliable manner and provide guarantees to disk intensive application like databases.
Who You Are
You are in your final year of study in Systems/Software Engineering or related field.
You have experience in developing web-based applications. You occasionally participate in coding competitions.

titre_poste: Site Reliability Engineering Internship/ Core Services
date_publication:
il y a 5 jours

Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Who we are
At Criteo, we connect 1.5 billion active shoppers with the things they need and love. Our technology takes an algorithmic approach to predict what user we show an ad to, when, and for what products. Our dataset is about 50 petabytes in Hadoop (more than 120 TB extra per day) and we take less than 10ms to respond to an ad request. This is truly big data and machine learning without the buzzwords. If scale and complexity excite you, join us.

What is it like to work in our R&D
Most of all, we are creators. From designing ground-breaking products to finding unique ways to tackle technical challenges at an extraordinary scale, our tech teams work with state of the art methodologies to shape the future of advertising.
The Site Reliability teams keep one of the largest computing platforms in the AdTech world functioning like clockwork. They are processing, storing and monitoring through large scale data compute & storage services (Hadoop, SQL & NoSQL), streaming (Kafka), platform as a service (Chef, Mesos), identity management (Kerberos) and analytics (Hive, Druid, Vertica).
You will be part of a team providing services available, scalable and for most use cases, low latency. In other words, manage the service from bare metal OS install to the driver.
More in depth, you will provide Distributed Caching, Columnar Database services and Full index search service. We're using Memcached, Couchbase, Cassandra and ElasticSearch running on Kubernetes.
With the guidance and support of your mentor, you will learn how to drive your project, design and ensure best practices are applied.
You will participate in all knowledge sharing sessions/ workshops.
You will gain a better understanding of how to work on real world data and mission-critical constraints.
You are encouraged to actively voice your ideas whilst learning how to build and ship quality code into production. You will participate in architecture discussions, influence the roadmap, and take ownership.
You will work with and learn from talented engineers, with a diverse set of backgrounds.

During your internships (6 months – end of studies) and according to your choice, skills and interest, you can tackle one of the following subjects:
Bin packing app on Mesos: your contribution will be to make our scheduler take optimal decisions to start new containers on the right servers to minimize resource waste.
Isolate disk IOps between applications: your contribution will be focusing on allowing several application sharing disk access in a reliable manner and provide guarantees to disk intensive application like databases.
Who You Are
You are in your final year of study in Systems/Software Engineering or related field.
You have experience in developing web-based applications. You occasionally participate in coding competitions.
You have already built projects in Python, Ruby or Go, and have rock solid fundamentals in Linux. You are curious about new technologies.
You have a strong sense of ownership and a dislike for passing the buck.
You are a problem solver, a fixer, and a creative technologist. We believe coding is a talent and a passion, not just a skill.
You are a strong communicator and a team player who can work efficiently with others.
You are fluent in English.
Want to Know More?

Get the story directly from our R&D engineers, check our Medium R&D blog

We champion different perspectives and are committed to creating a workplace where all Criteos are heard, feel a sense of belonging, and are treated with respect and dignity.

description:
Dubbed an "open-source unicorn" by Forbes, Confluent is the fastest-growing enterprise subscription company our investors have ever seen. And how are we growing so fast? By pioneering a new technology category with an event streaming platform, which enables companies to leverage their data as a continually updating stream of events, not as static snapshots. This innovation has led Sequoia Capital, Benchmark, and Index Ventures to recently invest a combined $125 million in our Series D financing. Our product has been adopted by Fortune 100 customers across all industries, and we’re being led by the best in the space—our founders were the original creators of Apache Kafka®. We’re looking for talented and amazing team players who want to accelerate our growth, while doing some of the best work of their careers. Join us as we build the next transformative technology platform!

Confluent sales engineers drive the technical evaluation stage of the overall sales process, making them critical drivers of customer success as realtime data streams become more and more important in the modern enterprise. In this role you will be the key technical advisor to the sales team, work very closely with the product management and engineering teams, and serve as a vital product advocate in front of prospects, customers, and the wider Kafka and Big Data communities.

You will be a key technical advisor to Confluent customers as they undertake technical design and development of their end-to-end solution, be conversant with the current state and future roadmap of Kafka in open source, and be able to identify known issues and inform them of upcoming fixes or workarounds. You’ll also be responsible for clear articulation of Confluent’s technical and product positioning to a wide variety of business and technical stakeholders, and for forging strong relationships with them throughout the sales cycle and beyond.
What we're looking for:
Experience with technical sales of distributed systems, infrastructure software like databases, message queues, SaaS, or Big Data products
Exceptional presentation and communications capabilities. Confidence presenting to a highly skilled and experienced audience, including enterprise architects and C-level executives
Clear, consistent demonstration of self-starter behavior and a desire to tackle hard technical problems
Bachelor’s level degree in Computer Science or relevant experience
Proficiency in Java or Python with experience developing ETL applications
What gives you an edge:
Previous experience building solutions with Apache Kafka
Understanding of systems operations concepts (disk, network, operating systems, etc)
Experience building and operating large-scale systems
Culture is a huge part of Confluent, we’re searching for the best people who not only excel at their role, but also contribute to the health, happiness and growth of the company. Inclusivity and openness are important traits, with regular company wide and team events. Here are some of the personal qualities we’re looking for:

Smart, humble and empathetic
Hard working, you get things done
Hungry to learn in a field which is ever evolving
Adaptable to the myriad of challenges each day can present
Inquisitive and not afraid to ask all the questions, no matter how basic
Ready to roll up your sleeves and help others, getting involved in projects where you feel you can add value
Strive for excellence in your work, your team and the company

Come and build with us. We are one of the fastest growing software companies in the market. A company built on the tenets of transparency, direct communication and inclusivity. Come meet the streams dream team and have a direct impact on how we shape Confluent.

Vous utilisez plus souvent les mots class, if, instance que les mots maison, ville, porte (mots les plus utilisés en français)?
01000011 01100001 01110000 01100001 01100010 01101100 01100101 00100000 01100100 01100101 00100000 01110100 01110010 01100001 01100100 01110101 01101001 01110010 01100101 00111111
Si oui, c’est que vous êtes soit trilingue, soit débrouillard. Que ce soit l’un ou l’autre, vous avez déjà coché une première case et démarrez très bien cette aventure!
Dans notre équipe tech, pas de place pour la lassitude ou la répétition, ici on multiplie les projets et surtout on laisse toute liberté à votre imagination débordante. Ce qui compte c’est que vous laissiez exprimer votre personnalité et éclater votre virtuosité.
L'équipe œuvre pour la mise en place d’outils utilisés en interne par les équipes contenu afin de déterminer les sujets qui buzzent, les aider dans la création de contenu, suivre les performances des vidéos internes etc... en injectant dans chacun de ces produits une dose conséquente d’algorithmie, de statistiques et de machine / deep learning.
Amateurs de Techno et PS4, passionnés de développement et amoureux de la Corse (oui, on y a un bureau!), postulez!
Principales missions
Après plus de 2 ans de développement technique, Jellysmack propose une technologie unique articulée autour de 3 produits qui visent à optimiser la création et la distribution sociale de vidéos.
Le Cloud Engineer H/F occupera un rôle central au sein de l’équipe Infra où il :
participera à l’amélioration globale de l’architecture par la recherche et la mise en place de nouveaux process & outils,
sera responsable de la supervision et de la maintenance de la plateforme,
sera un référent technique système, architecture & sécurité pour les équipes Dev et Data Science,
garantira le respect de toutes bonnes pratiques dans l’ensemble des process et des équipes.
Il agira sous la supervision directe du Responsable Infra et en collaboration avec un DevOps Engineer.
Il sera attendu du Cloud Engineer H/F une excellente compréhension de notre environnement technique et de nos processus d’intégration et de déploiement, ainsi qu’une maîtrise de l’ensemble des workflows produits tech tout en s’imprégnant des concepts régissant le business de Jellysmack. Il sera également amené à participer aux discussions cross-teams autour de l’évolution de notre infrastructure et de nos processus DevOps.
Une grande autonomie, une capacité à réfléchir, concevoir et proposer des solutions, à découvrir de nouveaux outils ainsi qu’à fournir un travail de grande qualité seront de fait attendus du Cloud Engineer H/F. Aussi, notre environnement technique évoluant rapidement et régulièrement, le Cloud Engineer H/F devra être capable de réaliser de la veille technologique et de monter en compétences sur de nouvelles technos en vue de les intégrer dans l’architecture existante.
Profil recherché
Les compétences requises sont les suivantes :
AWS,
SysAdmin : Linux (CentOS, RedHat), Systemd, Bash,
Docker,
Connaissance des principes DevOps et expérience en environnement industrialisé (GitLab ou flow de CI/CD),
Au moins 2 ans d’expérience à un poste de Cloud Engineer ou de SysOp évoluant dans un environnement Cloud AWS,
Une forte sensibilité aux problématiques de sécurité (gestion des creds, sécurisation des flow et des data).
Les compétences appréciées sont les suivantes :
AWS (IAM, EC2, Redshift Spectrum, Aurora, Firehose, SNS, ECR/ECS, CloudFront, CloudWatch, etc....),
Orchestration docker (K8s / swarm),
Ansible, Puppet, Chef,
Une expérience de développeur backend sera appréciée,
Airflow / DataOps.
Description de Jellysmack
Jellysmack est une entreprise américaine, spécialisée dans la création de contenus vidéos originaux sur les réseaux sociaux.
Du football (Oh My Goal) au gaming (Gamology), en passant par la beauté (Beauty Studio), les énigmes (Riddle Me This), sans oublier les arts créatifs DIY (Genius Craft) ou encore le monde des animaux (Naturee), nous créons des communautés et connectons des personnes qui partagent les mêmes passions.
Avec plus de 3 milliards de vues par mois, Jellysmack a connu une ascension fulgurante, ne cesse de grandir et ambitionne de devenir le leader mondial dans son domaine.
Partagez, grandissez et évoluez à nos côtés. Bienvenue chez Jellysmack !
Type d'emploi : Temps plein, CDI

meta1:
Senior Data Scientist
Pivot & Co - Paris 8e (75)
date_publication:
il y a 3 jours
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Areas: Data Science, Media Effectiveness, ROI, Marketing Mix Modelling, Marketing Science
ABOUT PIVOT & CO
Pivot and Co is strategic advisory, with acceleration teams, focused on data-driven growth & transformation in large organizations. We work with global leaders in consumer goods and luxury goods to build the bridge between data and business growth. Pivot & Co also invests in and advises Marketing Technology start-ups that will change the rules of media and marketing performance tomorrow.
Our team comprises strategy consultancy profiles, data scientists, and digital entrepreneurs. Our leaders have all worked in top executive roles in large organizations (FMCG and Luxury), as well as in strategic consultancies and agencies.
PIVOT & CO SEEK TO INTEGRATE A SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST
Today, main marketing mix model approaches rely on disparate data sources, not consistent in the collection, non-consistent over time. Most of the investment decisions are made through the lens of marketing expertise and don’t provide enough rationale facts.
Pivot is recruiting a senior data scientist, working in the data science team (4 persons to oversees the activities of the junior data scientists and provides advanced expertise on statistical and mathematical concepts for the broader Data science team, to solve Pivot & Co clients problems.
The Senior Data Scientist applies and inspires the adoption of advanced data science and analytics across Pivot clients with the focus on excellence and delivery.
Main challenges are
- Sales uplift modelling in Marketing
- ROI modelling
- Rationale investments decision for A&P allocation and brand planning process
- Modelling cumulative effect and activities impact on sales/Brand equity
ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES
1. Data collection and data cleaning
2. Create composite KPIs to reflect the Marketing Return of Investment
3. Model channel contribution by application of advanced statistical methods: (Linear regression, Neural network, stochastic gradient boosting)
4. Present key findings with structured memos or PPT to Pivot Team or Pivot clients
PROFILE
· BAC +4/5 (Maths/Stats/Operational Research/Engineer, Econometry)
· Advanced knowledge in one statistical toolbox: R, Python – Good command in Python is a plus
· Interest for Marketing analytics: Marketing effectiveness, Digital media, Brand planning
· Autonomy and ability to work in project mode and manage multi-task
· Ability to develop a real closeness to clients, based on a sense of commitment and a culture focused on result
· A "positive” attitude
GENERAL INFORMATION
· Work Office: 24 avenue Georges V, Paris 8 (Métro Alma Marceau, Charles de Gaule Etoile, Georges V)
· Salary: Good package
WHY PIVOT?
· The Pivot team is small and tight-knit. The consulting missions are led by senior associates, all from operational departments in the largest groups.
· A high level of responsibility and interactions. We’ll give you responsibility for deliverables from day one; your work will be important!
· Diversity of assignments to strengthen training and performance.
· Cooperative work atmosphere, fast decision-making mode, short hierarchy line.
Avantages :
Participation au transport
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: 60,000.00€ /year

description:
Relocation to London required.

Imagine writing the code at the core of your company’s success
G-Research is a leading quantitative research and technology company. By using the latest scientific techniques, we produce world-beating predictive research and build advanced technology to analyse the world’s data.
Software Engineering is core to our business. By designing and implementing real-time systems, our engineers are solving some of the world’s most complex financial problems.
The Role
We are looking for the world’s foremost engineers and take recruitment of the best talent very seriously. Most of our systems are written in C# but we also have specialist teams using C++, Java and F#. We also utilise modern web, distributed and big data technologies, so we have a broad range of software engineering challenges for the right person.
This is an opportunity to be part of our journey to build a world-leading software engineering practice. We are working hard to embed a Continuous Improvement culture & philosophy across the organisation and are striving to learn from the best practitioners in the industry.
Who are we looking for?
The ideal candidate will at minimum have experience in the following areas:
You will be an intelligent, capable and hands-on engineer who has an excellent academic background
Have a genuine interest in both software technology & the underlying hardware.
You will demonstrate a proven ability to engineer high-quality software in an OO language
Have an appreciation of good software architecture, CompSci fundamentals & data structures
Working knowledge of Agile, Continuous Delivery and TDD principles.
Why should you apply?
Highly competitive compensation plus annual discretionary bonus
Informal dress code and excellent work/life balance
Comprehensive healthcare and life assurance
25 days holiday
Contributory pension scheme
Cycle-to-work scheme
Subsidised gym membership
Monthly company events
Central London office close to 5 stations and 6 tube lines

meta1:
Software Engineer - Distributed Systems (Paris)
Datadog - Paris (75)
date_publication:
Jobbio.com - il y a 7 jours
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
At Datadog, we’re on a mission to bring sanity to cloud development and operations. We need to make the heterogeneous, complex data we collect easy for users to comprehend and act upon.
As a engineer working on our distributed systems, you will build the high-throughput, low-latency systems that power our product. Your data pipelines will ingest, store, analyze, and query tens of millions of events per second from companies all over the globe.
Our engineering culture values pragmatism, honesty, and simplicity to solve hard problems the right way. Join us to own significant chunks of our architecture, design and build resilient systems, and ship to production every day for customers who care deeply about what you build.
In this role, you will:
Build distributed, high-throughput, real-time data pipelines
Do it in Go and Python, with bits of C or other languages
Use Kafka, Redis, Cassandra, Elasticsearch and other open-source components
Own meaningful parts of our service, have an impact, grow with the company
Requirements
You have a BS/MS/PhD in a scientific field or equivalent experience
You have significant backend programming experience in one or more languages
You can get down to the low-level when needed
You care about code simplicity and performance
You want to work in a fast, high-growth startup environment that respects its engineers and customers
Bonus points
You wrote your own data pipelines once or twice before (and know what you'd like to change)
You've built high scale systems with Cassandra, Redis, Kafka or Numpy
You have significant experience with Go, C, or Python
You have a strong background in stats

description:
Summary
Job Family Group Description - Information Technology:
Gathers jobs providing support to the business through IT services and expertise. Includes fields such as IT business solutions, data and infrastructure management and systems infrastructure.

Job Family Description -IT Architecture and Security:
Designs and implements all the IT general architecture solutions for our company. Designs and implements procedures and controls necessary to ensure and protect information systems assets. Ensures prevention of intentional or inadvertent access, modification, disclosure or destruction.
Job Description
KERING COMPANY
KERING (previously known as group PPR) is a family-controlled, listed company and world leader in apparel and accessories, which develops an ensemble of powerful brands. Focused on a single business, the group designs and manufactures market desirable products across two fast growing segments:
Luxury: Gucci, Bottega Veneta, Saint Laurent, Alexander McQueen, Balenciaga, Brioni, Christopher Kane, McQ, Boucheron, Dodo, Girard-Perregaux, JEANRICHARD, Pomellato, Qeelin and Ulysse Nardin.
Sport & Lifestyle: Volcom, Cobra
These brands are complementary and all enjoy strong potential for organic growth. They have global recognition, are deep rooted and true to their distinctive values. By 'empowering imagination' in the fullest sense, Kering encourages its brands to reach their potential, in the most sustainable manner.
Present in more than 120 countries, the Group generated revenues of €12,4 billion in 2016 and had more than 40 000 employees.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
The team of architecture was created one year ago and groups varied profiles (functional, application, technical). The enterprise architect will be both technical and functional. He will be responsible for:
Identifying the organization’s needs
Identifies implementation risks and analyses potential impact on the enterprise and on the achievement of scheduled objectives
Working out which IT products to use based on cost benefit analysis and research
Participates in the design and implementation of IT service management standards, tools and methodologies
Explaining to designers and developers what's required and overseeing the progress
Producing documents that monitor progress and ensure the quality of the project
Advise the business on managing future IT needs
Required skills
5/7 years of experience with a technical background
Engineer master degree or equivalent
Good communication with business/operational managers
Strong problem solving skills
Up to date knowledge of technical applications
Good knowledge of quality standards, legislation and best practice
Ability to be adapt and prioritise
Ability to think ahead and anticipate problems, issues and solutions
Ability to project
Ability to convince
An experience in development is a plus
Job Type
Regular
Start Date
2019-07-09
Schedule
Full time
Organization
KERING S.A.

Virtu - Paris (75)

description:
Virtu is a leading financial firm that leverages cutting edge technology to deliver liquidity to the global markets and innovative, transparent trading solutions to our clients. As a market maker, Virtu provides deep liquidity that helps to create more efficient markets around the world. Our market structure expertise, broad diversification, and execution technology enables us to provide competitive bids and offers in over 19,000 securities, at over 235 venues, in 36 countries worldwide.

Primary Responsibilities

Ondesk Support:
Setup, configure, and maintain the Windows Desktop Environment and end-user support, including but not limited to hardware and software management, security patches and health check monitoring in line with Global desktop standards, policies and procedures.
Build rapport with help desk customers and provide first line local and second line regional desktop/office technical support including incident/problem identification, resolution and escalation.
Configure and support mobile and general office facilities issues.
Install and maintain desktops, user account administration; responsible for introducing adapting and improving IT systems in own area of responsibility.
Administer and support all aspects of Windows 20xx Server environment.
Good knowledge of designing, implementation and support of VMware ESX/vSphere 6.x
Good understanding of Microsoft Technology: Active Directory, DNS, MS Exchange and Cisco Jabber.
General programming skills such as PowerShell, which can help with automation scripting is highly desired.
Local Data Center:
Responsible for both the local office & EMEA Data Centre Management including, organizing deliveries, patching cables, installing servers and inventory management in line with global standards, policies and procedures.
IT Infrastructure:
Work with the other Infrastructure & application engineers locally and globally on issues, projects where needed as their person in region
Undertake regular system testing/adaptation/installations.
Maintain inventory of all hardware and software.
Liaise with supplier for issues, upgrade and procurement of hardware/software.
Knowledge and Skills

Required:
3-5 years relevant experience.
Customer focused attitude and dedicated to problem resolution.
Must be able to handle multiple projects/issues simultaneously.
Working experience with Windows 7 and 10, Microsoft Office, Windows Server 2008+, Active Directory, SCCM.
Must be able to work under pressure with long working hours under critical situations.
Clear and detail-oriented communicator and team player.
Outgoing, comfortable with speaking and writing English is a must.
Data Center Experience.
VMware and datacenter operation experience.
Preferred:
Microsoft Exchange.
Prior experience in the financial industry, especially trading desk support is preferred.
Bachelor's degree holder in Information System, Information Technology, Computer Science or a related discipline.
Scripting in PowerShell & Python
Why Virtu?

Be part of a highly skilled & focused team.
A great place for picking up practical experience new tech and geographic mobility.
Direct exposure to the decision makers and senior leaders on the business side.
Teams that are passionate about continually learning, improving and raising the bar.

meta1:
Engineering & Product HR Business Partner
BLABLACAR - Paris (75)
date_publication:
ISAI Group - il y a 5 jours
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
BlaBlaCar is the global leader in long-distance carpooling. We are an innovative and fast-growing company building a unique community of members to transform the way people travel!
For more information about us, please visit
www.BlaBlaCar.com/DreamJobs
Job Description
Why join us?
As part of the Talent & Organization team, the HR Business Partner will be key in the high growth of our Engineering & Product teams by providing full-cycle human resources partnering on a daily basis to our managers and team members. Your main responsibility will be to implement BlaBlaCar HR policies (e.g., salary review, equity programs, internal and external training and development, hiring planning and strategy, succession planning, remote policy), and you will also lead specific programs that will increase BlaBlaCar’s ability to attract, retain and engage team members in your scope.
You’ll be instrumental in scaling the engineering organization by doubling the number of engineers in a year and by keeping our retention rate at its current level. The role is both a strategic and hands-on role including supporting the 130 staff members, by contributing into organization effectiveness & design, providing management coaching and driving HR functional excellence on your scope. You will assist Managers in building efficient HR processes. You will contribute to fostering engineers' engagement and adherence to the company’s culture. You will be a part of a fun, passionate and dynamic global People team, with whom you’ll work very closely to deliver ambitious People-related projects, policies and value.
We are seeking an experienced HR business partner who can effectively interact with business leaders and managers at all levels, possesses excellent self-organization and communication skills, demonstrates a solid experience in talent development and loves embracing a tech and fast-paced environment.
What you will directly contribute to:
1 - Support 130 team members and managers on a high-growth scope :
Provide guidance to managers on their own team management and organizational and HR-related topics (ex : ensure efficient organization implementation, change management, daily support in our various HR policies’ application). You lead scope-specific initiatives by collaborating closely with managers in order to better attract, develop and retain talents.
Support our team members : you are the main HR point of contact of our Engineering & Product team members to better inform and advise them. You are an essential relay of internal communication to better involve and bring together our teams. Because you’re close to our teams, you have an accurate feeling of our internal climate on your scope and to be proactive in suggesting plans. You make sure there is a good coordination of HR-related subjects between managers and team members and other People team members : Operations, Talent Acquisition, Talent Development, Compensation & Benefits, Engagement team.
2 - Talent management & development of our Engineering & Product teams
For every HR-policy you act as an ambassador of our policies, processes and tools to boost our talent development :
In collaboration with our Talent Development Manager, build and deliver a promising internal academy for Engineering team members to help them develop their technical hard but also soft skills.
Coach managers in their daily team management : feedback culture development, situation-handling, OKR definition and performance assessment, individual talent development guidance and advisory.
Provide guidance to our managers and team members in understanding, and taking up our policy philosophy, strategy and tools (ex : hiring, levels, performance, compensation & benefits, remote).
Drive Performance review campaigns and talent / people review cycles on your scope.
3 - HR Performance management
Build a dedicated Engineering & Product HR dashboard, analyze trends and use metrics to develop solutions, programs and best practices.
You’ll participate into Tech Management team meetings.
This position will initiate and lead projects in areas including: benefits, training, HR processes and systems.
You actively participate into new People programs, boosting our Engineering & Product Talent acquisition and engagement.
Ensuring consistency, communication and collaboration in a matrixed and global environment.
Preferred Experience
*What you will need to be successful *
Several years of experience in an HR leadership role with broad knowledge and experience in human resource management.
HR Experience dealing with large teams of engineers, you are familiar with basic concepts, semantic and issues specific to this population ; a minimum of 3 years of HR experience in a high tech environment.
Broad experience and specific knowledge of human resource theory, in Talent management and development such as HR compensation plan, management, assessing management and executive talent, employee relations and performance appraisal systems.
Ability to relate to, influence and coach employees at all levels in the organization.
A strong ability to diagnose problems both in a qualitative but also data-driven approach, using strategic thinking skills as well as identify and drive appropriate solutions.
Be humble, structured, organized, motivated by innovation and a relentless doer.
Enjoy working as a team-player and learning from others.
Recruitment Process
A few practical details about the role:
Start: As soon as you are ready!
Location: Paris
Contract: Permanent contract (CDI)
What we offer all of our employees
The opportunity to have a meaningful impact, building a CO2-saving global travel network enabling strong human connections too.
A strong “Fun & Serious” company culture
An international environment with a team counting 35 nationalities, serving a global member-base from 8 offices around the world (Berlin, Kiev, Madrid, Milan, Moscow, Paris (HQ), São Paulo, Warsaw)
State-of-the-art office spaces, in a great location
A start-up spirit grounded in agility & teamwork
Challenging career opportunities in a high-growth and fast-paced environment
Bi-Weekly team-all BlaBlaTalks to learn from each other
Weekly Tech Demos, so that we’re all up to date with where our product stands
And some other great perks!
Free carpooling to live our value “Be The Member”.
Annual BlaBlaBreak which takes us all for an unforgettable weekend
Possibility to work from another BlaBlaOffice abroad for a week once a year (BlaBlaSwap)
What is next?
If you are ready to join our exciting journey, please apply below: upload your resume in English (PDF format).
Kindly note that only complete applications will be reviewed by our hiring team and that all your information will be kept confidential.
You can expect us to review your application within the following 3 weeks. If your application and profile fit our requirements, we will invite you for a set of interviews with our Head of Talent & Organization, one of our Engineering Directors, 2 other members of the People team, and 2 ExCo members : Secretary General and VP Engineering.
BlaBlaCar is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
Additional Information
Contract Type: Full-Time
Start Date: 04 November 2019
Location: Paris, France ()
Education Level: Master's Degree
Experience: > 5 years

FIND: help customer discover what they need (North Star Metric: add2cart rate)
BUY: offer the most seamless and reassuring buying (inc. delivery experience) (NSM: abandon rate)
CARE: provide the best customer experience (advice before sale and customer service after sale) (NSM: Net Promoter Score)
GROW: attract the most qualified traffic with the best ROI (NSM: Cost per Order)
Currently we are looking for a PM in the Buy Tribe- Pay in Feature
Product Management role at ManoMano
We’re currently hunting the best Product Managers out there to join one of our tribes (B2C, Sellers, Insiders, etc.) within ManoMano’s fast growing product team.
With the mentoring of your Lead Product Manager, you’ll work on your own product. You will handle all the regular PM activities (understanding of business and technical needs, roadmap creation, delivery management, etc.). If you believe you are a structured and smart product professional with great communication skills, you will thrive in ManoMano’s environment.
1- Product discovery
Understand your users painpoints and needs through qualitative research (assisted by our user research department) or quantitative data (NPS results, Customer Effort Score verbatims)
Analyse your product usage through our analytical tools stack to understand what drives usage and conversion
2- Product strategy
Build and nurture your product vision with your Lead Product Manager, based on the data you gathered (from users, your team, data analysis, competitors, user research…)
Turn that into a strategy and a well-thought roadmap: you will make sure that we’re building the right features
Make sure your team / stakeholders understand and embrace it through your engaging communication
3- Product delivery
Work closely with Product Designers and engineers to come up with the best solution to address your users' pain points: you will also make sure that we’re building the feature right
Turn your roadmap into a backlog of user stories. Organize and prioritize everything with your Lead PM, and explain the rationale behind it to all partners, stakeholders and your team
Ensure that all products shipped by your team are bug-free (with the QA team’s help).
Test hypothesis and ideas on the field with ingenious MVPs
Analyse features performance through A/B testing, behavior data, etc. and generate insights about your product (with user researchers’ help)
Communicate in a timely manner with your Lead Product Manager about important informations, alerts, etc. Ask for help everytime you need it, and be a fast learner
Preferred Experience
You have an engineering mindset and an Engineering or Business School degree. You thrive in a startup environment growing (fast).
You handle ambiguity, complexity and interdependencies in an organized, prioritized and structured way. You have excellent judgment and thoughtfulness about the dynamics of a product ecosystem. You are passionate about it.
You have great communication skills and intuition for communication strategy at every level.
We often say about you that you’re an analytical and “customer centric” person. You believe that data should help drive your product strategy.
You are kind, thoughtful and have a natural ability to get things done. You qualify as an “achiever”.
Your English (and French) is perfect.
Bonus points:
You have been a Product Manager for 1 or 2 years
You have already worked in an ecommerce company, started your own company or know at least the marketplace model
You love DIY and want to profoundly play a role in the reinvention of this market
Recruitment Process
1/ Phone interview with a Talent Recruiter
2/ In-Person interview with a Talent Recruiter and a Senior Product Manager
3/ In-Person interview with a Lead Product Manager
4/ In-Person interview with the CPO
Additional Information
Contract Type: Full-Time
Start Date: 03 November 2019
Location: Paris, France (75017)
Education Level: Master's Degree
Experience: > 3 years
Telecommuting Possible
