We're on a mission to build the best platform in the world for engineers to understand and scale their systems, applications, and teams. We operate at high scale—trillions of data points per day—providing always-on alerting, metrics visualization, logs, and application tracing for tens of thousands of companies. Our engineering culture values pragmatism, honesty, and simplicity to solve hard problems the right way.
The opportunity:
We’re looking for an Engineering Manager to lead and grow the teams building our log management platform. Working very closely with product management, they build the log application but also the log collection agent and integration endpoints. They own all the services from ingestion to processing as well as near-real time systems like live-tail or alerting.
The platform runs in the cloud, it's always on, low latency and high throughput. It's built on top of high-scale open source frameworks and languages: Kafka, Go, Java, MongoDB, Akka, Kubernetes.
You’ll join at an ideal time to make a big impact, the product is seeing very high growth, with many new features to build as well as a need for scaling up dramatically. You’ll be involved in every step of the process—defining product, designing architecture, managing the team, recruiting excellent engineers.
You will:
Manage and grow teams of talented engineers, ensuring they deliver high quality, timely work and that they’re happy, motivated, and growing
Work with the product team to flesh out the future of the product
Work with other managers in Europe and in the US to deliver cross-cutting projects (e.g. running in multiple regions and clouds)
Scale the systems to accommodate hyper growth
Contribute to shaping the future of the engineering organisation
Requirements:
You have been building applications for 6+ years and know the systems you’ve worked on from top to bottom
You have significant backend programming experience
You have managed a team of software engineers
You have architected, built, and operated distributed systems to solve problems at high scale
You have a BS/MS/PhD in a scientific field or equivalent experience
You want to work in a fast-paced, high-growth startup environment to build a brand new product
Bonus points:
You’ve built a non-trivial application from scratch that sees significant user traffic
You’ve recruited a team of engineers before
You have deep experience with observability products
You have frontend experience

We are launching our sales office for France, and are looking to hire our first Solutions Engineer for the Large Enterprise market in France.
Slack is more than just a tech company, we are on a mission to make your working life simpler, more pleasant and more productive. We believe that culture is the compass to success and so our Slack Values are woven into the fabric of all we do. We seek exceptional talent that is eager to do the best work of their life while supporting others in doing the same.
We are looking for an experienced Solutions Engineer to join our fast-growing team. In this role, you will collaborate with Account Executives and Customers Success Managers to convey Slack's value to prospective customers during the pre-sales phase. You will do this while taking a consultative approach to working with customers and being passionate about the value we provide, not simply selling Slack’s features. As the product expert, you will have a deep understanding of the Slack Platform, handle tough objections, and lead successful evaluation cycles to gain product fit consensus.
Do you love closing large, complex deals and making a huge impact? Do you excel at building trust with both technical and non-technical executives? Last but not least, are you passionate about conveying value to your customers? If you’re an established sales professional with a consistent track record in helping customers achieve visionary goals, we should chat.
Slack has a positive, diverse, and supportive culture—we look for people who are curious, inventive, and work to be a little better every single day. In our work together we aim to be smart, humble, hardworking and, above all, collaborative. If this sounds like a good fit for you, why not say hello?
What you will be doing
Partner with Account Executives to navigate complex, multi-stakeholder deal cycles with C-level executives
Drive the discovery process, helping to uncover your customer’s business objectives and current pains
You will ensure that your customers understand Slack's security posture, tackling objections along the way and occasionally responding to security questionnaires
Prepare and deliver value-based demonstrations highlighting our powerful platform ecosystem
You will conduct Proof Of Concepts where necessary to help your customers validate technical requirements (Data Loss Prevention, Single Sign-On, E-Discovery, Platform Integrations)
Contribute to the success of a rapidly growing and evolving organization
Act as a liaison between Product and Sales, sharing customer feedback to help craft the product roadmap
What you should have
6+ years of sales engineering or solution consulting experience in a SaaS organization
Excellent written and verbal communication skills; a knack for delivering compelling presentations
Track record of successfully overcoming technical and security objections; problem-solving is in your DNA
Familiarity with API development and service integrations is a plus
Bachelor's degree required

description:
Qui sommes-nous ? Forts de trois levées de fonds d'un montant total de 68 millions d'euros et figurant dans la liste du Next40 comme acteur de la French Tech avec le plus de potentiel, nous sommes aujourd'hui le leader européen de l'orientation et du recrutement des jeunes talents.

Notre mission ? Primo, accompagner les jeunes talents vers la carrière où ils s'épanouiront et grâce à laquelle ils feront avancer la société, en leur donnant tous les outils nécessaires à cette réussite. Deuxio, accompagner les entreprises afin qu'elles puissent continuer à attirer les jeunes pousses pétries de potentiel en leur sein, tout en s'adaptant aux changements de paradigme qui animent nos sociétés.

Pour cela, nous avons créé un écosystème unique, réunissant ainsi 70 000 entreprises, 600 établissements d'enseignements supérieurs et 2,5 millions d'étudiants à travers le continent. On ne compte bien sûr pas s'arrêter là, et viser la lune ne nous fait pas peur (nb : chanter du Amel Bent n'est pas un pré-requis pour postuler).

Avec qui travaille-t-on ? D'un côté, la grande majorité des écoles et universités françaises (HEC, ESSEC, Dauphine, Ponts, X...) et de plus en plus d'établissements européens (ESADE, Nova, Stockholm School of Economics, London School of Business...). De l'autre, de grandes entreprises comme Orange, Décathlon ou encore Coca-Cola, mais aussi de belles PME et de supers startups. Et nous au milieu, pour construire les ponts entre les deux.

Nous rejoindre ? Pour bosser chez nous il faut : de l'envie, du souffle, des idées, et de la suite dans les idées. Mais aussi et surtout, adhérer à nos valeurs, le fameux HEAT : Humilité, Engagement, Agilité, enThousiasme.

Esprit (et structure) start-up, labellisé Great Place to Work depuis 4 ans... tu connais la musique, mais promis : nous, on ne joue pas de flûte. 95% de nos équipes recommandent JobTeaser à leur réseau !

Job Description

Intégré(e) au sein de l'équipe RH et en étroite collaboration avec la Team Tech, tu accompagneras le Tech Recruiter opérant sur les métiers de développeurs, data engineer, product manager, UX/UI designer, etc., au travers des missions suivantes :
Accompagner les opérationnels dans la définition du plan de recrutement (prise du besoin, mise en place de la fiche de poste, rédaction de l'offre puis publication)
Etre en charge des phases de sourcing: la chasse des profils sur les différentes plateformes, l'échange avec les partenaires comme par exemple les cabinets spécialisés
Sélectionner, rencontrer les candidats pour être en mesure de présenter une short list aux opérationnels

L'idée est que tu puisses monter en compétences sur les différentes technos et être en full autonomie sur le process de recrutement.

Les plus ?
JobTeaser propose une stack technique très large et la possibilité de travailler sur des profils très différents.
Il y a un bon nombre d'events tech du type meetup qui sont organisés, si tu le souhaites tu pourrais gérer l'organisation des prochains.
Une multitude de projets vont être lancés donc on compte sur ta participation pour amener tes idées !


Qualifications

De niveau bac+⅘, tu recherches une alternance pour la rentrée prochaine
Idéalement, tu as déjà une expérience en recrutement
La connaissance des métiers IT est un plus mais tu as assurément une appétence pour ce domaine et l'envie d'en savoir plus
Tu es une personne curieuse et dynamique qui souhaite vite monter en autonomie
L'interaction avec tous types de profils ne te fait pas peur car tu as un sens de l'écoute
"Un pour tous et tous pour un" est ta devise en tant que team player
Tu as une bonne aisance en anglais, à l'oral et à l'écrit


Additional Information

Conditions:
Début: Dès que possible
Contrat d'apprentissage ou de professionnalisation ou Stage conventionné
Durée d'alternance : 1 an


Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?
Pour participer à la construction de la Licorne Career Tech de demain
Pour avoir un impact dans la société, celui d'aider les jeunes à trouver le job de leurs rêves, dans l'entreprise de leurs rêves
Pour rejoindre une équipe internationale de 250 personnes
Pour vivre une aventure unique auprès d'une équipe soudée et aux valeurs fortes en plein centre de Paris

description:
Who we are
At Criteo, we connect 1.5 billion active shoppers with the things they need and love. Our technology takes an algorithmic approach to predict what user we show an ad to, when, and for what products. Our dataset is about 50 petabytes in Hadoop (more than 120 TB extra per day) and we take less than 10ms to respond to an ad request. This is truly big data and machine learning without the buzzwords. If scale and complexity excite you, join us.

Most of all, we are creators. From designing ground-breaking products to finding unique ways to solve technical challenges at an exceptional scale, our tech teams work with state of the art methodologies to shape the future of advertising.

The Site Reliability teams keep one of the largest computing platforms in the AdTech world functioning like clockwork. They are processing, storing and monitoring through large scale data compute & storage services (Hadoop, SQL & NoSQL), streaming (Kafka), platform as a service (Chef, Mesos), identity management (Kerberos) and analytics (Hive, Druid, Vertica).

The Data Engineer will be part of our Data Group. This group is in charge of hosting and producing the data for operations, reporting and machine learning purposes. We deliver can't-fail systems and services distributed across 9 data centers, spanning 3 continents and serving billions of Internet users. This includes the systems that host the data, the pipelines responsible of producing the core data and the tools to monitor and understand the data life cycle.
Challenges of this role
Build optimal data pipelines that meet business owners needs and requirements
Maintain the most critical data sets with high quality monitoring
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery
Participate in building the long term vision on data governance problematic
What we're looking for
You are comfortable with Java or Scala or a similar language
Practical experience on data modelling and ETL
Analytical mind - You like to question the information you have and understand the big picture and the real problems that should be solved
Scalability - You like working with problems involving huge amounts of data, provide data insights, with good reliability practices
Accountable - you have a real sense of ownership and feel responsible for the service your team provides to multiple clients
Passionate - You are a problem solver, a fixer, and a creative technologist. We believe coding is a talent and a passion, not just a skill.
Team Oriented - You need to be a great team worker and a good communicator.
Bonus skills
Practical experience in writting Map/Reduce, Spark or Hive/Presto jobs
Practical experience in writting SQL queries
Experience performing root cause analysis to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement
Experience on Data Governance questions
Competitive compensation package
35+ annual holidays days
Health insurance
Discounted transport and sports activities
Personalized relocation package if moving from abroad
Catered lunch and breakfast
Private nursery
Maternity and paternity leave
Annual cross teams hackathon
2 conferences per year of your choice
Internal mobility programs
Tailored educational resources

Want to know more?
What does it feel like to be part of something big? Get a snapshot
Get the story directly from our R&D engineers, check our Medium R&D blog
Interested in discovering your Criteo community first? Let’s meet

At Criteo, we dare to be different. We believe that diversity fuels innovation and creates an energy that can be seen and felt all over Criteo. We champion different perspectives and are committed to creating a workplace where all Criteos are heard, feel a sense of belonging, and are treated with respect and dignity.

Consequently, Criteo may use your personal data in relation to the evaluation and selection of applicants. Your information will be accessible to the different Criteo entities across the world. Amazon Data Services France SA38,548 avis - Paris (75)

description:
Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent work experience
5+ years of experience with leading MEP designs and/or complex root cause analyses in industrial or commercial in Mission Critical facilities combined with 1+ years of performing due diligence, design gap analysis, and/or operational performance audits of Mission Critical facilities
Strong command and fluency in English both spoken and written.
Comfortable with regular regional and global travel up to 50% of the time.

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is seeking a Colocation Field Engineer with a Mechanical Engineering background in mission critical facilities design, field, or operational engineering experience to become part of a global team that is responsible for performing availability and performance audits of our Colocation data centers. As engineers at Amazon, we are responsible for achieving a world class uptime for our customers so we need to ensure that our Colocation data centers have resilient designs, cost effective systems, and an industry leading operational management program.
As one of our Colocation Field Engineers, you will work directly with the engineering and/or operations teams for the Colocation data centers within your assigned region to drive continuous advancements and improvements within their designs and operations. We will look to you for identifying availability risks then to provide suggestions for improving the availability/costs/performance/simplicity of the equipment/system designs and operational readiness programs.
This will include reviewing existing designs and contributing your field experience to collaborate with the other peer engineering teams to develop approved remediation plans for any issues found in the field.

Amazon has a global presence, therefore, domestic and international travel will be necessary. Team work is absolutely necessary for us to accomplish our goals. You must be able to work within a team and depend on others to accomplish the required tasks. This includes working with internal groups as well as external suppliers and consultants, including utilities, manufacturers, vendors, and contractors.

If you have an understanding of the critical equipment needs for large infrastructure mission critical sites and equipment; especially data centers, and understand the constructability and maintainability of varying designs, you may be a good fit.

Responsibilities
The Colocation Field Engineer will be responsible for the following:
Understanding the design and functionality of the data centers within your assigned region(s)
Traveling to different data center regions to conduct engineering evaluations of critical infrastructure designs, equipment performance, equipment settings, and commissioning results
Interpreting/evaluating Single Line Drawings (SLD), as-built drawings, equipment submittals, equipment specifications documentation, and performance data
Creating detailed audit reports along with identifying solutions to remediate any immediate threats to our operations
Leading internal teams to conduct Root Cause Analysis (RCA), developing Corrective Action (CA) solutions/plans for design gaps and performance related problems, and reporting status of implementations
Collaborating with Design and Commissioning Engineers to properly test and validate installation, operation, and performance of electrical/mechanical systems per the design intent; then using this data to calibrate our performance models
Reporting results of audits to Operations and Engineering teams
Working on concurrent projects in multiple geographical regions

Master’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering
5+ years of continuous operating redundant electrical systems, cooling systems, water and air distribution systems, air flow containment systems, and building management systems. This includes but is not limited to: uninterruptable power sources, diesel generators, MV and LV electrical switchgear, power distribution units, variable frequency drives, automatic/static transfer switches, chillers [air-cooled and water-cooled], pumps, cooling towers, heat exchangers, air handlers, air economizers, etc.
10+ years of direct experience with the design, construction, operation, or maintenance of mission critical data centers
Experience with developing solutions and executing plans on fast track design/build projects and/or multiple significant upgrade projects
Experience with commissioning and/or performance testing of critical infrastructure and the associated controls systems for mission critical environments
System Matter Expert level of understanding of both mechanical and electrical equipment/design related to data centers
Good working knowledge of electrical system protection and co-ordination schemes
Knowledge of building codes and regulations including Life Safety, IBC, NFPA, NEC, ASHRAE, and OSHA
Possess excellent attention to detail and communication skills in order to maintain high quality standards for being organized, setting priorities, meeting deadlines, and staying within budgets
Possess leadership and problem solving skills
LEAN Engineering experience or certifications
ISO9001 or similar certifications

meta1:
Data Engineer Manager
BLABLACAR - Paris (75)
date_publication:
ISAI Group - il y a 19 jours
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
BlaBlaCar’s vision is to bring fairness, freedom and fraternity to the world of travel.
BlaBlaCar was created in 2006 with one dream in mind: fill the millions of empty seats on the road to create an efficient, affordable and friendly way to travel. Today, our global, trusted community counts 75 million members in 22 countries, enabling a smarter, large scale and truly sustainable transport network.
Born from a simple idea of people sharing their rides, BlaBlaCar’s ambition is to become the go-to marketplace for shared road mobility. We offer long distance carpooling service, a commuting carpooling service, and since 2018 a marketplace bus service too. A filled bus emits one third of the emissions per passenger kilometer as an average car. So we want to fill those seats too!
In 2018, 84 million travellers used BlaBlaCar globally saving 1.6 million tons of CO2. Meanwhile we enabled human connections, bringing people closer together in more ways than one with 87% of members say that carpooling is an enriching experience.
BlaBlaCar offers a truly and unique international environment with a team counting 35 nationalities, serving a global member-base from 8 offices in Berlin, Kiev, Madrid, Milan, Moscow, Paris (HQ), São Paulo, Warsaw. English is the official spoken language across BlaBlaCar. We are privately-held and founder-led. Our team of 500 employees is entrepreneurial, passionate, and fundamentally mission-driven.
Job Description
Why join us ?
The warehouse team sits within the data team, in the engineering organization. The data team mission is to supply dependable data and algorithms to BlaBla employees and products. The warehouse team mission is to supply dependable data to the company. Dependable means trustworthy and reliable: stakeholders need to be 100% confident their data is accurate, and this data is delivered in a timely and predictable fashion, to whoever needs it.
BlaBlaCar is a data-driven company: from top-management to junior contributors, everyone understands and believes in the value data brings. Supplying data to the company puts the warehouse team at the center of critical decision-making processes, ranging from strategic planning to product analytics, through financial reporting and marketing performance monitoring. The scope covered by the team is wide; accordingly, the warehouse manager role has tremendous impact on the activity.
The warehouse manager mission is to make supplying dependable data possible. The challenge can be broken down into the following goals:
Manage the team and setting it up for success;
Communication and stakeholder management;
Building a vision to provide data as a service.
What you will contribute to :
Managing the team and setting it up for success
Hiring and onboarding newcomers. The team is expected to scale up as operations are ramping up;
Building new expertise within the team, around real-time data processing. This will go through training existing members and hiring experienced data engineers;
Taking responsibility for implementing best practices and ensure the team has best in class processes. This is critical to maximize the productivity of the team and mitigate operational risks;
Structuring the team to scale further in 2020. This includes clarifying roles and responsibilities within the team.
Communication and stakeholder management
Handling communication for the team vis-a-vis the rest of the company. The focus is on structuring the vision for the team to the outside world;
Communicating sideways and upwards about roadmap progress, organizational changes & dependencies. Communicating downstream to update the team on company’s context, strategy and articulate their impact for the team;
Creating close ties with stakeholders in Marketing, Finance, Product and Engineering organizations. This is critical to ensure information flows enable the team to prioritize its work.
Building a vision to provide data as a service
Defining a vision and objectives for the team to come up with its roadmap. Communicating with stakeholders to align on strategic priorities. In particular, this means balancing multi-year plans with short-term deliverables (e.g. stream processing for ML);
Steering the team towards delivering data-as-a service. This includes anticipating use-cases with high business impact, and pave the way to deliver solution enabling them;
Deploying accountability frameworks to measure efficiency and improve it. This is crucial to legitimate the significant amount of resources invested in data engineering projects;
Managing third-party resources to strike the right balance between in-house and external expertise. This includes all steps of the budgeting process.
Preferred Experience
What you will need to be successful:
+5 years of leadership experience with demonstrated growth of high-functioning data engineering teams
Strong project management, organizational and communication skills
Strong data standards
Experience working in a fast paced, highly collaborative environment
Excellent English communication skills
Ensure a good mindset and keep a good culture in your team
Be high-energy, humble, structured, organized, motivated by innovation and a relentless doer and leader
A few practical details about the role :
Start: As soon as you are ready!
Location: Paris HQ (remote friendly)
Contract: Full-time permanent contract (CDI)
Compensation: Competitive package based on experience
What we offer all of our employees:
A start-up spirit that fosters agility, teamwork and impact
Challenging career opportunities in a high-growth and fast-paced environment
An inspiring working environment including state-of-the-art office spaces
Free carpooling to live our value “Be The Member”
Annual BlaBlaBreak which takes us all for an unforgettable weekend
Bi-Weekly BlaBlaTalks when we learn from each other
Weekly Tech Demos
Recruitment Process
What is next:
If you are ready to join our exciting journey, please apply below: upload your resume in English (PDF format) and your cover letter. Applications without cover letter will not be considered. Kindly note that only complete applications will be reviewed by our hiring team and that all your information will be kept confidential.
You can expect us to review your application within the following 2 weeks. If your application fits our requirements, we will invite you to a first call followed by several face-to-face interviews and a case study.
BlaBlaCar is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
Additional Information
Contract Type: Full-Time
Start Date: 24 November 2019
Location: Paris, France ()
Experience: > 7 years

description:
Who we are
At Criteo, we connect 1.5 billion active shoppers with the things they need and love. Our technology takes an algorithmic approach to predict what user we show an ad to, when, and for what products. Our dataset is about 50 petabytes in Hadoop (more than 120 TB extra per day) and we take less than 10ms to respond to an ad request. This is truly big data and machine learning without the buzzwords. If scale and complexity excite you, join us.

Most of all, we are creators. From designing ground-breaking products to finding unique ways to solve technical challenges at an exceptional scale, our tech teams work with state of the art methodologies to shape the future of advertising.

The Site Reliability teams keep one of the largest computing platforms in the AdTech world functioning like clockwork. They are processing, storing and monitoring through large scale data compute & storage services (Hadoop, SQL & NoSQL), streaming (Kafka), platform as a service (Chef, Mesos), identity management (Kerberos) and analytics (Hive, Druid, Vertica).

The Data Engineer will be part of our Data Group. This group is in charge of hosting and producing the data for operations, reporting and machine learning purposes. We deliver can't-fail systems and services distributed across 9 data centers, spanning 3 continents and serving billions of Internet users. This includes the systems that host the data, the pipelines responsible of producing the core data and the tools to monitor and understand the data life cycle.
Challenges of this role
Build optimal data pipelines that meet business owners needs and requirements
Maintain the most critical data sets with high quality monitoring
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery
Participate in building the long term vision on data governance problematic
What we're looking for
You are comfortable with Java or Scala or a similar language
Practical experience on data modelling and ETL
Analytical mind - You like to question the information you have and understand the big picture and the real problems that should be solved
Scalability - You like working with problems involving huge amounts of data, provide data insights, with good reliability practices
Accountable - you have a real sense of ownership and feel responsible for the service your team provides to multiple clients
Passionate - You are a problem solver, a fixer, and a creative technologist. We believe coding is a talent and a passion, not just a skill.

description:
DataDome is a global company that offers the most advanced technology designed to block OWASP automated threats: credential stuffing, layer 7 DDoS attacks, SQL injection & intensive scraping. DataDome's Artificial Intelligence protects all vulnerability points (web, mobile apps & APIs) with a cutting-edge technology providing real-time automated blocking decisions.

Thanks to our state-of-the-art dashboard, users get real-time intuitive notifications about blocked attacks, feedback loops, insights, business KPIs and attack details.

Our technical stack is mainly composed of realtime detection layer in Java, a low latency Stream Engine running on Flink in Scala, ElasticSearch for the storage, Kafka for communication between layers, HAProxy for load balancing, Symfony 4 & Angular 7 for our dashboards.

Our infrastructure is deployed on AWS and Azure, using Docker, Ansible and Terraform, and monitored with Grafana and Prometheus.

This stack is currently handling 100k requests per second and manages more than 100 TB of data.

We are looking for an experienced Support Engineer who will have to meet the technical challenge and product expertise on our current solutions.

You will be part of the Onbaording and Support team, and help ourr cusTomers to get the most of our solution. You will be an expert in DataDome Soltuion and understand in depth :

how the product works
its implementation lifecycle
the bot detection process
the dashboards functionalities
Day to day tasks :
As a Support Engineer, you'll receive requests from customers and from internal teams such as Customer Success Managers. The main types of requests are questions on the products, product setup and ultimately about the bot traffic.

Your goal is to answer them precisely so that we limit the number of back-and-forth discussions and get customers satisfied as soon as possible. You will therefore have to :

Answer customers' technical questions, solve technical customer-specific issues and inform our customers or the internal team about your investigations
Proactively monitor the customer application traffic and raise any potential issue to the tech team
Escalate bugs to Engineering and keep customers informed of resolution
Monitor and handle any unusual situations
Requirements

We are looking for a customer driven person, who is excited to work and solve technical challenges in an ambitious environment.

You have a technical background, you like being immersed in a technical environment , you're not a full-day developer but you have some query language knowledge
You are a fast-learner, curious and autonomous
You have a good understanding of website hosting, mobile application and how internet works
You have full professional proficiency in spoken and written English and French and like to explain technical topics over the phone when needed
You are a team player and like to interact with other teams in the company
You have an experience in managing webservers like Apache, Nginx, Varnish, IIS
You have a previous experience in B2B/SAAS solutions
What we offer if you join our dream team :
A stimulating work environment with passionate individuals and a first class R&D team creating a top-quality and innovative solution, making DataDome one of the strongest performers in the bot protection industry
A multicultural and diverse team with people from diverse backgrounds
A joyful workplace with many events throughout the year : annual offsite, summer and Christmas parties; one thematic aperitivo per month, breakfast every Friday morning
Offices being at the heart of Paris and the tech ecosystem
An attractive remuneration scheme and rewards policy
***REMOTE CANDIDATES ARE WELCOME***

LiveRamp's 2nd Party (2P) Data business, is building an EU based technical services team to provide support within the EU region for a SaaS based platform. This team will be aligned to the European business but will join a global technical services team.

The position will cover a combination of DevOps and Product Ops functions. This is a fast paced product development environment operating as an agile start-up. The roles will be based within our Paris offices but with frequent travel to the London office. There is also likely to be occasional travel to the US and China where the engineering teams are primarily based.

Key responsibility in the short term will be to support the expansion of our 2P platform for our first enterprise client (based in Paris) and bringing new clients onto the platform. This platform connects a number of LiveRamp's products with the client's systems and their ad-tech partners.

The technical services team are responsible for the EU regional instance of the platform. This will involve deploying updates to the application code and infrastructure as the platform is further developed and scales with client demand. The team will also be the application experts with administration access to onboard new clients and data integrations. They will need to work closely with the product engineering and central DevOps and ProdOps functions based in the US & China to ensure a smooth transition of the platform into the EU region.

--------------------

--------------------

Develop a detailed understanding of our big data SaaS platform to provide technical expertise to educate and advise diverse teams across multiple external organisations

Competent using both Unix and Windows operating systems

Ambitious and driven to find creative ways to contribute to the success of the business.

Mission
Au sein de l'AI Foundry, le Data Scientist exploite des données pour détecter de nouveaux leviers de création de valeur et aider à la prise de décision, et ce dans le respect de la réglementation en vigueur sur les données. Pour ce faire, Il s’appuie sur une compréhension fine des enjeux métiers et son expertise des algorithmes d'intelligence artificiel (machine learning, NLP, modèles Bayésiens, …)

De l'identification des besoins à l'appropriation des outils développés, il collabore étroitement avec les utilisateurs cibles et les spécialistes des divers domaines de la banque : fraude, marketing (appétence produits, moments de vie, attrition, parcours client…), gestion des risques (octroi de crédit, tarification, probabilité de défaut…). La création de valeur est l’objectif cardinal de son travail.

Il élabore, en lien avec les Data Engineer, les outils nécessaires à la collecte des données dans l’exhaustivité, dans l’historique, dans la fréquence et dans la qualité suffisantes, en amont de la modélisation.

Le Data Scientist met en œuvre les meilleures pratiques de développement logiciel et porte une attention particulière à la réplicabilité de ses travaux afin que les outils créés puissent facilement être déployer à l'échelle.

Il synthétise et communique les résultats de ses analyses pour en extraire une connaissance décisionnelle facilement interprétable et manipulable par les utilisateurs, en s’appuyant sur des techniques et des expertises de visualisation.
Tous nos postes sont ouverts aux personnes en situation de handicap.

Bac +5 en école d’ingénieur, master Data Science
Bilingue anglais

Forte curiosité intellectuelle : intérêt pour le secteur bancaire, vision sur les enjeux stratégiques
Sens du résultat, pragmatisme
Goût pour le travail en cycles courts inspiré des méthodes agiles

Autonomie / esprit d’initiative
Esprit d’équipe / capacité d’écoute / sens des responsabilités

Les données étant reconnues comme un actif stratégique de la banque, elles constituent aujourd’hui un enjeu majeur pour le groupe Société Générale.

De nombreuses initiatives sont déjà présentes dans le Groupe pour développer/créer de la valeur autour de cet actif sur quatre réalités distinctes : sa qualité, sa protection, son utilisation et le développement des usages, sa gouvernance.

La communauté DATA du groupe Société Générale, riche de plus de 500 membres, couvre à la fois les enjeux business (Marketing, Risques, Finance, Opérations, Juridique etc) et technologiques liés à la donnée.

Membre de cette communauté, l’AI Foundry est le centre d’expertise sur les données et l’intelligence artificielle de la direction de l'innovation du groupe (DGLE/INO). Sa mission est d'accompagner les Business Units (BU) et Service Units (SU) du groupe dans la mise en œuvre de certains cas d’usage de valorisation de données. Rejoignez-nous !

Job Description

Why join us?
You want to do practical security work in a fast-growing company with real security challenges this job is for you. If you thought that security at a Carpooling / Bus company was a dull topic we are going to prove you wrong.
What you will directly contribute to :
As a generalist Security Engineer:
You will be working hand in hand with BlaBlaCar Information Security Manager which is responsible for overseeing the security at BlaBlaCar. You have the opportunity to work on all the security topics at BlaBlaCar which range from very technical topics to organizational ones. To give you a better understanding, those are some of the topics you will be working on:
Ensuring that BlaBlaCar operates in a safe way and that our members’ personal information and our company’s data is secure in our facilities and in the cloud
Maintaining a company-wide risk analysis to design and enforce the security strategy aligned with BlaBlaCar’s business objectives and culture
Collaborating with the Engineering and IT teams to implement the security strategy in the most efficient and frictionless way possible
Encouraging a good security culture and organize appropriate training for all employees
Participating in building tools to secure our systems, networks, applications, and products
Implementing BlaBlaCar’s security policy evolution and compliance efforts together with the legal team. (GDPR, PCI/DSS, DSP2, ISO 2700x ...)

Qualifications

What you will need to be successful :
A minimum of 2+ years of prior experience as an Information Security Engineer
Demonstrate a global and broad knowledge in security on physical, technical, social, legal aspects
Excellent communication skills and able to explain complex security subjects to non-technical people
Minimum of knowledge on security regulations and standards (GDPR, PCI…)
Willing to discover and learn about a wide range of security topics
French-speaking and fluent in English
It would be nice (not required) if you have:
Worked in an agile and continuous improvement culture
Experience in a fairly large web company
Experience in cloud environments

A start-up spirit that fosters agility, teamwork and impact
Challenging career opportunities in a high-growth and fast-paced environment
An inspiring working environment including state-of-the-art office spaces

Bi-Weekly BlaBlaTalks when we learn from each other
Weekly Tech Demos

Gestion des calculs exécutés sur des clusters de machines pouvant accumuler plusieurs térabytes de RAM.

Manipulation de volumes de données mettant en difficulté les méthodes traditionnelles de calcul.

Projet dans une équipe internationale de migration d’une architecture entière de données et d’applications backend vers les technologies big data. L’application est écrite principalement en Java 8 et manipule les technologies les plus récentes sur l’écosystème Hadoop d’Hortonworks et Spark.

Intervention sur le développement d’un calculateur de risque de crédit dans le cadre des réglementations européennes Bâle III en environnement international. La stack technique est principalement : Java, Mongo DB.

VOTRE RÔLE

Analyser le besoin utilisateur

Rédiger les spécifications techniques

Concevoir et développer

Réaliser les tests unitaires

Assister les utilisateurs afin d’assurer une continuité de service

À vous de choisir. Chez NOVENCIA, chaque consultant a le choix de sa mission et décide de la façon dont il souhaite évoluer.
Profil recherché AVANCER EN ÉQUIPE

NOVENCIA, c’est avant tout un projet collectif.

Validation par un pair.

Après les formules d’usage du premier entretien, vous rencontrez un de nos consultants lors d’un second échange pour qu’il puisse appréhender votre niveau technique et vous en dire plus sur l’écosystème de NOVENCIA. (C’est souvent là que tout bascule…).

Partage d’expérience.

NOVENCIA compte 7 communautés : Partners – Finance/ Prodigi – Agile / Craft / ActiveViam / UX@Scale / Data / GDPR, dont le fonctionnement est indépendant. Dotées de leur propre budget, elles sont libres de récolter et diffuser des informations. L’objectif : encourager la veille technique et l’évolution professionnelle.

Expertise.

Meet-up, webinar, articles, vidéos…Au-delà d’un objectif purement professionnel, technique ou fonctionnel, NOVENCIA vous donne la possibilité de vous exprimer. Environ 80 événements annuels sont organisés. Autant d’occasions pour un collaborateur de se dépasser. Crédibilité et notoriété du parcours sont donc au rendez-vous !

Formation sur mesure.

NOVENCIA possède son propre centre de formation. Technique ou fonctionnelle, les formations proposées sont, pour la plupart, certifiantes.

Suivi personnalisé.

Qu’elle soit personnelle ou professionnelle, votre évolution, est notre priorité. C’est pourquoi un Manager opérationnel vous accompagne au quotidien dans vos missions. Nous avons également créé les Instants RH et Objectifs Carrière. Vous l’avez compris, chez NOVENCIA on ne lâche rien !

Notre objectif commun : co-construire votre carrière en fonction de vos aspirations et de vos compétences.

DE LA TECHNIQUE ET DE LA PERSONNALITÉ

Un touche à tout : possédant des compétences en langage Java, de bonnes capacités de modélisation, une forte appétence pour le Big Data

Fin connaisseur : data engineer convaincu, très peu de secrets pour les clusters et pour les calculs parallèles

Ambidextre : beaucoup d’algorithmie à droite, un peu de Finance à gauche

Explorateur : à l’affût des nouvelles technos et scrute GitHub à la recherche de trésors perdus

Débrouillard(e) : toujours partant pour relever un nouveau défi !

COMPETENCES :
Java / Python / C#

Hadoop

Spark

Cassandra

ElasticSearch

HDFS

Kibana

MongoDB

Anglais

S’engager en faveur du handicap c’est garantir l’égalité des chances dès le recrutement.

À compétences égales, nos postes sont ouverts aux personnes en situation de handicap.
Entreprise Dans le monde actuel où vitesse et efficacité sont les maîtres mots, pouvoir gérer, traiter et analyser en temps réel une masse incroyable de données représente un avantage concurrentiel fort.

Les objectifs de ces données sont variés puisqu’il s’agit de pouvoir analyser le parcours et le comportement client sur les marchés boursier, de mesurer le rebond commercial ou encore de pouvoir détecter la fraude financière par exemple.

C’est dans ce contexte que nous recherchons un développeur pour intégrer le centre de compétences Big Data.

Développeur Big Data depuis au moins 1 an, vous avez une appétence pour la finance et êtes à la recherche de nouveaux défis. Bouclez votre ceinture, la suite est pour vous !

description:
C3.ai répond à une demande urgente et à croissance rapide d'applications Big Data, IA et IoT à l'échelle de l'entreprise pour permettre la Transformation Digitale. La plateforme C3.ai utilise le monitoring de performances en temps réel et l'analyse prédictive pour optimiser les processus métier, différencier les produits et services et créer de nouvelles sources de revenus. Grâce à l'innovant système du C3.ai Type System et à sa plateforme ouverte et extensible, C3.ai est devenu le leader mondial des initiatives de Transformation Digitale.

Notre plateforme et les applications développées sur celle-ci sont majoritairement écrites en Java, JavaScript et Python. Nous développons et utilisons des technologies modernes (Spark, Cassandra, PostGres, Kafka, GraphX, Torch, etc.). Au cœur de cette architecture réside notre type system : une couche d'abstraction objet d'une grande expressivité qui permet aux développeurs et data scientists de décrire leurs données, d'utiliser des fonctionnalités existantes ou d'en définir de nouvelles sans se soucier de l'infrastructure ou des services sous-jacents. Cette technologie permet à nos utilisateurs de développer et de déployer en production des applications à grande échelle en à peine quelques semaines.

Le rôle

En tant que Software Engineer - Professional Services, vous travaillez directement avec les clients pour concevoir, développer et déployer des applications d'entreprise basées sur l'intelligence artificielle sur la plateforme C3.ai ; en particulier :

Vous êtes est en charge du développement des modèles de données, des APIs (utilisant le C3.ai Type System), et de la logique applicative, notamment des algorithmes d'analyse de données en JavaScript et Python.
Vous travaillez à l'intégration d'algorithmes d'apprentissage et de prédiction en collaboration avec les équipes Machine Learning et Data Science.
Vous effectuez les améliorations, les revues de code, les tests et le débogage des applications avec et pour le compte des clients.
Vous rédigez les spécifications, la documentation, et les guides utilisateur.
Vous identifiez les risques et les lacunes techniques; vous élaborez des stratégies d'atténuation en prévision des besoins des clients
Un candidat idéal possède une véritable capacité d'analyse, une bonne compréhension des enjeux stratégiques, une expertise forte en développement logiciel, et d'excellentes compétences interpersonnelles.

Votre profil

Le(a) candidat(e) sélectionné(e) sera un membre clé de l'équipe, contribuera à notre croissance rapide et sera à l'origine de solutions innovantes pour des problématiques uniques.

Expérience avec JavaScript et Java (ou autre langage de programmation orientée objet).
Connaissance et compréhension solide de :
Programmation orientée objets
Algorithmes et Structure de données
Fonctionnement des types de base de données (RDBMS, NoSQL, etc.)
Systèmes distribués et paradigmes associés (MapReduce, Event Processing, etc.)
Expérience avec git (ou autre VCS), la rédaction de tests efficaces, et la méthodologie agile
Une bonne connaissance des services AWS est un plus
Capacité démontrable d'adaptation (nouveaux domaines, nouvelles technologies) et volonté de partager son expérience en interne ou avec nos clients
Excellent niveau de communication orale et écrite en français et en anglais
Désir de résoudre des problèmes difficiles en équipe et de contribuer à développer un environnement inclusif, intellectuellement stimulant et fun (Glassdoor Best place to Work 2017)
Les +

C3.ai représente l'intersection rare d'une bonne idée, développée par une équipe exceptionnelle, pour un marché émergeant gigantesque.

Startup innovante et en pleine expansion travaillant sur des sujets bien ancrés dans le réel
Collègues brillants et motivés parmi les meilleurs dans leur domaine
Possibilités d'autonomie et de croissance importantes

SentinHealth is a MedTech startup established in 2017, focused on the development of integrated
monitoring solutions to prevent heart failures and manage other chronic diseases in ageing patients.

to detect symptoms as early as 30 days before heart failure, which allows doctors to administer a light
and effective treatment and thus prevent hospitalization and potential adverse effects.

Our patented technology determines a composite index from multi-sensor physio-pathological signals
and uses state-of-the-art algorithms to predict the evolution of the patient’s condition.

SentinHealth currently conducts pre-clinical trial and will bring its first product to the market in 2023.

The client is looking for senior / lead installation engineer to join the company working initially in Paris.

They are looking for an experienced Project Installation Engineer to join Installation Department Engineering Management.

You will be in charge of the installation of launched jacket and deck/topside floatover.

SPECIFIC KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Perform installation procedures for offshore/subsea assets such as subsea structures, launched jacket and deck/topside floatover and others, as required,
Perform lifting and rigging analysis,
Write technical project documents,
Bring technical expertise during the procurement process, and confirm the project's progress at interim meetings with the Lead Engineer,
Check of installation analysis work and reports,
Liaise with project teams to obtain input data, agreeing installation feasibility and providing technical support in Client reviews,
Liaise with project teams and Clients to clarify installation procedures concerns,
Collaborate to develop and constantly improve tools and internal processes for installation methods activities,
Participate to vessel/CB mobilization as well as installation phases on vessel in order to validate technical solutions by respecting the rules of the Group HSEQ,
Provide support to on-going offshore installation activities,
Actively participate in internal study projects as assigned.
AUTHORITY/DIMENSIONS:
Operate within the Business Code of Conduct,
Operate according to Management Principles,
Support standards and procedures for the Engineering Function.
PROFILE:
Graduated with a Master of Engineering, you have 5 years of experience as a minimum in engineering on Oil & Gas related installation projects.
You have knowledge and proven experience of launched jacket installation and deck/topsides floatover installation.
Your autonomy, your capacity to coordinate and communicate at all levels within the organization are key assets to succeed at this position.
Ability to prioritize and organize work.
Ability to manage interfaces within a project structure, including other disciplines, drawing office, document control, project management, Client and suppliers.
Missions on constructions sites onshore and offshore during execution phases according to requirements.
A fluent level in English (spoken, written and read) is essential.

Established in 1978, NES Global Talent provides a complete range of contract and permanent talent solutions to the Oil and Gas, Power, Construction and Infrastructure, Life Sciences, Manufacturing and IT sectors worldwide. R&D Program Manager / Freelance
Uniware - Paris
date_publication:
Freelance-info - il y a 17 jours
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
1. PROJECT PRESENTATION

1.1 CONTEXT
The Retail/ Payment Platforms division is a cross country organization gathering both card present (CP) and card non present (CNP) high-volume and high-availability platforms within . Our common target is to move from a platform to a service organization, leveraging on our global pool of IT resources to enhance our offer and capabilities. You will be joining Group, a company in full transition to a new era of payments, covering both hardware, software and services as tooling for merchants to grow their business. A company, that over the past 7 years has shown, a remarkable and constant appetite for market share.
In this strong transformation context, we are looking for a R&D Program Manager working for the R&D service based in Paris, France. The Research & Development (R&D) department is structured in Tribes made of Squads ( ), each Tribe is responsible for a specific part of our Product Portfolio or Technology Stack. The objective of our department is to develop and manage the software products portfolio. R&D adds value by creating marketable products that help our customers to become more successful and by supporting s internal business processes.

1.2 OVERALL JOB DESCRIPTION
The R&D Program Manager supports its tribe or more tribes by ensuring that all business and technical aspects of the delivery of functionalities are executed smoothly and that software delivery over our environments is a continuous and aligned process. Each tribe consists of several Squads that deliver software changes for a specific product line. To achieve this the R&D Program Manager works closely together with the IT Tribe Leads, the Business Tribe leads (/Product Owner) and the delivery teams within the Squads.

Fast removal of impediments, timely preparation of SAFe and SCRUM ceremonies, fruitful collaboration with concerned business and IT departments to manage any dependencies are the key tasks and responsibilities of the R&D Program Manager. He/she also assists the Tribe and Product Owner with idea funneling, as well as with timely prioritization and identification of requirements.

The R&D Program Manager proposes and continuously improves implementation-related processes that drives the technical delivery of his/her tribe and assures proper maintenance by the IT Operations team after delivery. When relevant, the R&D Program Manager assures that delivered functionalities are properly marketed by the concerned stakeholders.

Using his/her technical expertise and superb interpersonal skills, the R&D Program Manager works together with the IT Tribe Lead and the Product Owner to ensure that business and technical initiatives owned by the tribe are prioritized, planned and delivered to Production within time, scope and budget. He/she also provides clear monthly reporting to all stakeholders about the tribe’s delivery roadmap.

2. REQUIEREMENTS

2.1 KEY RESPONSABIITIES:
Governance: Enables product vision understanding within squads and secure audit-proof requirements
Accountability: Is the accountable person for end to end delivery of the Program building a consolidated plan with all actors of the projects (Development, QA, Architects, Product Owners, Integration, DevOps)
Financial Management: Forecasts annual budget in terms of iterations and service increments of all EPICS within his/her scope on time for V0 and V1 portfolio budget exercises
Planning / Forecasting including non R&D deliveries: Setup and runs the Service/Program Increment planning ceremonies (cross Tribes) to define and plan the scope of the next service increments (10 to 12 weeks cycle)
Risk Management Multi-squad level: Identifies and track risk, dependencies and issues and work with Development, Product Owners, Architects, OPS and Customer Program Manager to maximize alignment and value delivery and remove impediments
Infrastructure delivery: Setup release management ceremonies in order to follow up and obtain proper release management visibility and delivery
Service increment demo: Setup service increment demo ceremonies in order to show value delivery and obtain feedback for potential release decision
Best practices: Promotes continuous improvement practices and accounts for sprints retrospectives outcomes; Lead by example with respect to change management; Foster craftsmanship practices, frequent deliveries of value and shorter time to market cycles. Champion I-AM ( Agile Methodology) values and guiding principle and provide continuous feedback for its improvement.
Build and Share Reporting: Measures progress of Epics deliveries within his/her scope with respect to delivered value and forecasted budget through his / her updated EPICS roadmap and EPICS burndown / burnup charts; Is accountable for providing transparency on delivery through monthly reporting and stimulate teamwork and team commitment

2.2 SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:
4-6 years of hands on experience in taking a key role in an agile SDLC, for instance as Scrum Master, Senior Developer, Product Manager or IT Project Manager
4-6 years in an international working environment
Demonstrated experience in large organizations in roles which include structuring of activities, estimation of time and costs, execution to plan, delivery of results
Experience in managing technical aspects of software delivery in at least three of the following areas: front end development, back end development, infrastructure, middleware, data warehousing
Ideally Certified from Scrum.org ( Professional Scrum Master’ or Scaled Professional Scrum’) or SAFe
Knowledge of CI/CD concepts
Experience in Financial or Payment industry in senior delivery roles
Experience working with geographically dispersed teams, onshore, offshore and nearshore
Experience in implementation of continuous improvement methodology (Lean, Six Sigma)
Experience with a professional, structured Project Management Methodology is a nice to have (i.e. Prince2, CMMI, PMI)
Ability to work across functional and business unit lines and develop and maintain a culture of partnership with the Group project and product delivery managers and between all parts of the organization

2.3 INTERPERSONAL SKILLS:
Demonstrated relationship building, networking and collaboration, decisiveness in negotiation, very strong influencing and persuasion skills
Excellent planning skills, ability to split large deliveries into small epics, features and user stories prioritized by value delivered, in collaboration with the Product Owner
Ability to build consensus in an environment of conflicting interests and ensure execution of agreed initiatives - always focused towards result
Strong ability to analyze complex situations and present solutions in a structured way at Director and C-Level
Assertive and a driver of change and delivery
Strong operational orientation
Strong communication skills
Ability to work cross-culturally and across regions and to travel internationally on occasion
Lean / Agile attitude and mindset

French working language 1
English working language 2 - excellent communication skills (both oral and written)

Experience in Linux environment and SAAS development

Dubbed an "open-source unicorn" by Forbes, Confluent is the fastest-growing enterprise subscription company our investors have ever seen. And how are we growing so fast? By pioneering a new technology category with an event streaming platform, which enables companies to leverage their data as a continually updating stream of events, not as static snapshots. This innovation has led Sequoia Capital, Benchmark, and Index Ventures to recently invest a combined $125 million in our Series D financing. Our product has been adopted by Fortune 100 customers across all industries, and we’re being led by the best in the space—our founders were the original creators of Apache Kafka®. We’re looking for talented and amazing team players who want to accelerate our growth, while doing some of the best work of their careers. Join us as we build the next transformative technology platform!

Would you like a role where you drive customer success by helping them realise business value from the burgeoning flow of real-time data streams in their organisations?

Do you love the possibilities that Apache Kafka can bring to businesses and would love the challenge of developing a deep knowledge of best practices in the use of Apache Kafka, the broader Confluent Platform, and complementary systems like Hadoop, Spark, Storm, relational databases, and various NoSQL databases?

If so, being a Consulting Engineer for Confluent could be your perfect fit.

In this role you will build strong relationships with customers, ensure exemplary delivery standards, and have a lot of fun building state-of-the-art streaming data infrastructure alongside colleagues who are widely recognised as leaders in this space.

Promoting Confluent and our amazing team to the community and wider public audience is something we invite all our employees to take part in. This can be in the form of writing blog posts, speaking at meetups and well known industry events about use cases and best practices, or as simple as releasing code.

We are currently looking for someone to join our team in Paris since most of our engagements are in Paris, but you will be part of the wider EMEA team so there will be travel to customers. Given the focus on French customers, written and spoken French is essential for the role.
A typical week at Confluent in this role may involve:
Preparing for an upcoming engagement, discussing the goals and expectations with the customer and preparing an agenda
Researching best practices or components required for the engagement
Delivering an engagement on-site, working with the customer’s architects and developers in a workshop environment

Building tooling for another team and the wider company
Testing performance and functionality of new components developed by Engineering

Honing your skills, building applications, or trying out new product features

Deep experience building and operating in-production Big Data, stream processing, and/or enterprise data integration solutions using Apache Kafka

Experience with Java Virtual Machine (JVM) tuning and troubleshooting

Excellent communication skills, with an ability to clearly and concisely explain tricky issues and complex solutions
Ability and willingness to travel up to 50% of the time to meet with customers
Bachelor-level degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics, or another quantitative field
Nice to have:

Experience helping customers build Apache Kafka solutions alongside Hadoop technologies, relational and NoSQL databases, message queues, and related products
Experience with Python, Scala, or Go

description:
We believe in a world where all cars are shared. Carsharing empowers people to get going in a smarter, easier way, while also having a positive impact on the environment and making cities more liveable. It’s this vision that propels us forward and inspires us to think even bigger.

Getaround is the world's leading carsharing platform with a community of more than 5 million users sharing thousands of car in more than 300 cities in the U.S and Europe.

Our team is collaborative, positive, curious, and engaged. We think fast, work smart, laugh often, and are looking for like-minded people to join us in our mission to disrupt car ownership and make cities better.

Your mission:
The product & engineering team is getting close to 50 people in Europe, but we have a lot of positions open and we will grow a lot more this year. To scale effectively, we organize ourselves in squads with people coming from various departments like engineering, data, design, and product.

Getaround is a marketplace collecting Millions of euros per month on behalf of our owners, drivers and insurance partners. The finance squad has 2 main missions:

Fulfill Getaround's financial obligations and build a scalable and easy-to-use accounting system.
Empower other squads with easy to use abstractions to grow our business.

What you’ll work on:
In practical terms, your work will be very diverse and will span all over the codebase:

Define and implement long term changes to support growth and product iterations, like going from only supporting one time payments to subscriptions, supporting different payment methods or adding pre-authorization for risky behaviors.
Shape our codebase to gracefully handle regulatory challenges, like the PCI-DSS compliance or the recently released PSD2 aiming at securing online payments with two-factor authentication.
Produce automated reporting for the finance department to use. Seems boring, isn't it? Actually the needs of a finance department are driving a lot of fun constraints to play with; continually increasing volumes, consistency, reliability, and precision (to the last penny!).
Supporting other squads; Most squads need at some point something from the finance squad. It could be some assistance for a given task, or it could be a feature that isn't yet supported and that we'll need to add to the components we own.
Develop the vision of the squad using continuous refactoring to build a more decoupled architecture and simple-to-use abstractions to be used by other developers.

Who you’ll work with:
You'll be working with David and Nicolas, Backend Engineers, and Marine, product owner of the squad, but will be in contact with all the other squads when needed. You will report to Michael.

What you'll bring to the table:
You've shipped and maintained code in production
Good knowledge of at least one backend language
Experience with a relational database such as PostgreSQL or MySQL
You're a rigorous engineer that relish creating highly reliable backend services
You have a good understanding of system design, data structures, and architecture
You care about quality and you know what it means to ship high-quality code
Good communication and teamwork skills
Able to communicate in English

Our Tech Stack:
Ruby on Rails 5.2 with Ruby 2.5
TypeScript, React/Preact with Webpack
Continuous integration with Docker and CircleCI to push to production multiple times a day
MySQL, Redis, Snowflake
A strong internal design system
Monitoring dashboards built with Telegraf + Influxdb + Grafana

What we offer:
A solid engineering team with a lot of experience
The peace of mind of a large test suite and pull requests to stay sane and ship often
Getting to learn from your peers and to share your knowledge on the blog and in our internal presentations every two weeks
A ticket to one technical conference of your choice each year
Open source projects are being extracted from the codebase when appropriate
We'll buy any non fiction books you want to read, and you'll get access to our growing library
An international startup environment with 20+ different nationalities, HQ in San Francisco and European offices in Paris, Berlin, Barcelona, London, Amsterdam, Oslo and Nantes
A remote friendly culture, with some remote allowed for this position
We often organise meetups in our office
Tickets restaurants, a good health insurance
"Hack days" to experiment with new technologies and ideas as well as other team events

No need for a resume, but Linkedin, Twitter and Github usernames are appreciated! Don't hesitate to give our backend challenge a try.

QUI SOMMES-NOUS ?
L’activité Systèmes terrestres et aériens conçoit des systèmes, des équipements, des capteurs et des services pour le contrôle du trafic aérien civil et militaire, la défense aérienne ainsi que le combat naval et terrestre.
Le site de Rungis est idéalement situé à proximité de l’aéroport d’Orly. Site à l’architecture moderne, il compte aujourd’hui plus de 1000 collaborateurs travaillant pour nos trois domaines d’activité : les radars, le contrôle du trafic aérien et les systèmes d’armes avancés.
Leader mondial de la gestion du Trafic Aérien,Thales ATM équipe plus de 170 pays de solutions Radar et logicielles permettant chaque jour à des millions de passagers d’arriver à leur destination en toute sécurité et sans retard.
La densification sans précédent du trafic aérien, l’occupation des espaces de basse altitude par des engins sans pilote (drones) et l’optimisation de la consommation d’énergie requierent des solutions digitales plus écologiques et plus efficaces. Pour relever ces défis nos équipes conçoivent des systèmes et développent des algorithmes d’IA visant à aider à la prise de décision en temps réel tout en respectant les contraintes de sécurité liées au monde de l’aéronautique.
Rôle
En rejoignant l’une des Squad Agiles dans un rôle de Lead Software Engineer- Airspace, vous participerez au développement de notre plateforme de données d’aviation ayant pour but d’aider les entités responsables du trafic aérien à la prise de décision grâce à l'agrégation, l’intégration et le traitement de différent types de données (trafic aérien,trafic drone, météo, surveillance, cartographiques, design de l’espace…). Le rôle de Lead Software Engineer - Airspacepilote le développement logiciel sur les données de structuration de l’espace aérien : volume, sectorisation, capacité, données de description (aéroports, pistes, couloirs aériens, volumes spéciauxdrones…).
Responsabilités
Construire, porter la vision technique du produit plateforme « Aviation Data » et piloter les choix technologiques et d’évolution de l’architecture
Piloter le design, le développement des composants de vos micro-services, APIs, business-logic et Data Storage
Piloter l’implémentation des algorithmes de machine learning sur les données d’aviation
Accompagner l'équipe dans les bonnes pratiques de développement logiciel, en collaboration avec l'équipe QA (TDD, revues de code, pair-programming etc.)
Fluidifier la communication tant avec les développeurs de la squad qu’avec les autres Tech lead et collaborer avec notre Lab IA et nos Data Scientists sur le domaine Aviation
Faire de la veille et se former aux technologies les plus pertinentes pour notre plateforme d’aviation afin de continuer à innover
Piloter la mise en place, le suivi et l’amélioration continue des pratiques de développement de l’équipe

Formation Bac +4/5 Ingénieur ou Universitaire, et/ou simplement une expérience significative dans le développement logiciel
Solides connaissances et maitrise de langage Back-end (Java, SpringBoot)
Une expérience significative sur un projet Kafka et sur des infrastructures distribuées temps réel à forte volumétrie de données
Habitué à Linux, Git et l’environnement DevOps (CI/CD, Kubernetes, Ansible etc.)
Connaissances BDD (SQL/noSQL)
Connaissances architecture API (REST)
Connaissances et pratique du développement en mode Agile (Scrum, TDD)
Anglais correct à l’écrit et à l’oral

Bonus
Expérience sur des projets avec des contraintes de performance fortes
Travaux personnels ou contribution(s) à des projets open source
Participation à des projets d’envergure dans le contexte de l’industrie aéronautique ou connaissances dans le domaine
Connaissances en sécurité/sûreté logicielle
Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?
Travailler et évoluer dans des industries de pointes : aéronautique, espace, défense, sécurité & transport
Possibilité d’évolution à l’étranger dans le groupe (Europe, Asie, USA, Australie...)

CE (Comité d’entreprise) très actif

meta1:
PhD in Augmented Machine Interaction
NOKIA4,364 avis - Nozay (91)
date_publication:
il y a 17 jours
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Nokia is a global leader in the technologies that connect people and things. With state-of-the-art software, hardware and services for any type of network, Nokia is uniquely positioned to help communication service providers, governments, and large enterprises deliver on the promise of 5G, the Cloud and the Internet of Things.
Serving customers in over 100 countries, our research scientists and engineers continue to invent and accelerate new technologies that will increasingly transform the way people and things communicate and connect.
Nokia is an equal opportunity employer that is commited to diversity and inclusion.
At Nokia, employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Nokia Bell Labs’ AAAID research domain focuses on the blending of intelligence into all aspects of everyday life and processes. As devices and sensors become increasingly connected and several autonomous agents with a physical presence make an appearance in smart homes and factories, the need for intelligent algorithms to support machines within complex physical spaces shared with humans becomes a primary driver of our research. The Future X network will be the platform that dynamically provides the knowledge and the computing power to support machine interactions at scale. Our ambitious objective is to develop systems that collect and blend information from multiple sources, extract and make sense of the things that matter, and act upon and propagate the resulting knowledge. Our research targets the fields of industrial automation and smart cities.

Scope of the Ph.D. Thesis

Future industrial automation scenarios will be defined by the coexistence of heterogenous devices that include sensors, mixed-reality displays, robots, drones, and smart objects. The development of new functionalities involving these mobile devices will face fundamental limitations, imposed by the resource constraints inherent to the devices’ form factor and by the technical possibilities of wireless connectivity. While accelerators for compute-intensive tasks will help empower the devices with local “intelligence” for solving specific tasks, the evolution of ever-smaller goal-driven machine designs will still limit the complexity of generalized problem-solving capabilities and require distributed coordination of sensing and processing among devices and infrastructure. Other constraints - such as battery life, thermal dissipation, interactivity, expected quality and timeliness of the decisions - provide a large spectrum of trade-offs in the design of algorithms that manage real-time, computational-intensive functions that underpin sensor coordination and machine learning in augmented reality and robotics.

Research Topic

The Ph.D. thesis will focus on developing techniques aimed at augmenting autonomous machines capabilities through accelerated processing, by overcoming their inherent computing limitations while still meeting different requirements including scalability, latency, and energy efficiency.

The student will explore challenging use cases that highlight how industrial automation scenarios might benefit from an infrastructure tailored towards integrating sharing of knowledge across different types of machines. In particular, he/she will focus on the mobile devices that will populate the factory ecosystem (e.g. drones, robots). These machines will be required to take over tasks that require dynamic cooperative interaction with the environment. Towards this goal, these machines will need to gather contextual information and act in real time. The end goal of the Ph.D. will be designing and developing algorithms and systems that integrate into the envisioned industrial automation environment.

Two key research questions will be tackled in the context of the Ph.D. program:
The architecture of the computing environment is expected to play a key role in supporting information exchange among machines, as the presence of distributed resources drives down the complexity of these devices and supports their interactions by offloading computing tasks that would have to be otherwise executed on every device. The thesis will explore how systems could use the infrastructure to gather and merge information into exploitable knowledge.
Supporting the generation of contextual awareness through information exchange will require collecting and processing data from a large number of sensors at low latency, without impacting their inherent power restrictions. The advancements in wireless access technologies plays an important role in supporting industrial IoT scenarios, but also requires a fundamental re-thinking of how data will be delivered, processed, and aggregated on the way. More powerful delivery paradigms could be explored exploiting context-based communication and control schemes.

Job Grade/Level: 6

We are looking for a highly-motivated candidate who is enthusiastic about developing breakthrough innovations and participate in cutting-edge research in NOKIA Bell Labs.

A BAC+5 diploma or master's degree in communications, computer science or electrical engineering with focus on embedded systems, as well as a good knowledge in communication networks and programming languages for systems development (e.g. C++, C, python). Most importantly, the applicant should be willing and able to get engaged in novel and disruptive research areas across multiple disciplines, which will require the applicant to readily learn new skills and expand their toolbox.

The applicant should be highly proficient in spoken and written English, and he/she should have the ability to conduct independent research while also collaborating in a multi-cultural team environment.

Documentation

Applications shall include: a cover letter, curriculum vitae, bachelor and master (or diploma) degrees, academic transcript of courses and grades, any other related documents such as certificates and reference letters.

The application process started on July 1st, 2019 and shall conclude as soon as a qualified applicant has been selected.

As a Data Engineering Group Manager at Avanade, you will use comprehensive modern data engineer techniques and methods with Advanced Analytics to support business decisions for Avanade clients. You can collect, aggregate, and analyse structured/unstructured data from multiple internal and external sources and patterns, insights, and trends to decision-makers. Your goal is to support the use of data-driven insights to help our Clients achieve business outcomes and objectives.

In this role, you will collect, aggregate, store, and reconcile data in support of Client business decisions. You will help design and build data pipelines, data streams, reporting tools, information dashboards, data service APIs, data generators and other end-user information portals and insight tools. You will be a critical part of the data supply chain, ensuring that stakeholders can access and manipulate data for routine and ad hoc analysis to drive business outcomes using Advanced Analytics

Key Role Responsibilities:
Day-to-day, you will:
Translate business requirements to technical solutions leveraging strong business acumen.
Analyze current business practices, processes and procedures as well as identifying future business opportunities for leveraging Microsoft Azure Data & Analytics PaaS Services.
Support the planning and implementation of data design services, providing sizing and configuration assistance and performing needs assessments.
Deliver of architectures for transformations and modernizations of enterprise data solutions using Azure cloud data technologies.
Design and Build Modern Data Pipelines and Data Streams.
Design and Build Data Service APIs.
Develop and maintain data warehouse schematics, layouts, architectures and relational/non-relational databases for data access and Advanced Analytics.
Expose data to end users using PowerBI, Azure API Apps or any other modern visualization platform or experience.
Implement effective metrics and monitoring processes.
Travel as needed
