Your technical and non-technical skills include:
Demonstrated experience of turning business use cases and requirements to technical solutions.
Experience in business processing mapping of data and analytics solutions.
Ability to conduct data profiling, cataloguing, and mapping for technical design and construction of technical data flows.
The ability to apply such methods to solve business problems using one or more Azure Data and Analytics services in combination with building data pipelines, data streams, and system integration.
Mastery of .NET C# and T-SQL with the familiarity of U-SQL is required
Knowledge of Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake, Azure SQL DW, and Azure SQL, Azure App Service is required.
Azure IoT, Azure HDInsight + Spark, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Databricks, Azure Stream Analytics is a plus.
Knowledge of Python is a plus.
Experience preparing data for Data Science and Machine Learning.
Experience preparing data for use in Azure Machine Learning and/or Azure Databricks is a plus.
Demonstrated experience preparing data and building data pipelines for AI Use Cases (text, voice, image, etc.…).
Designing and building Data Pipelines using streams of IOT data.
Knowledge of Lambda and Kappa architecture patterns.
Knowledge of Master Data Management (MDM) and Data Quality tools and processes
Strong team collaboration and experience working with remote teams.
Knowledge of Dev-Ops processes (including CI/CD) and Infrastructure as code fundamentals.
Working experience with Visual Studio, PowerShell Scripting, and ARM templates.
Experience with Git/TFS/VSTS is a must.

MCAD .NET, MCSD .NET, MCDBA

Preferred Education Background:
You likely possess MS/ Ph.D. in a quantitative field such as computer science, applied mathematics, statistics, or machine learning. An equivalent combination of education and experience will also suffice.

Preferred Years of Work Experience:
You likely have about 5-7 years of relevant professional experience.

Creates and implements work plans for assigned projects, programs, and clients against established operational objectives; supports translation of group strategy into objectives and work plans.
Scope of Work: Provides operational leadership for large-scale, strategically critical work efforts requiring significant coordination.

description:
Job Category

Job Details
Role: Marketing Specialist, Field Sales - Salesforce.org (Southern Europe)
Location: Paris
Everyone who wants to change the world should have the tools and technology to do so. Technology is the most powerful equalizer of our time, providing access to data, knowledge, and-above all-connections. Salesforce.org gets our technology in the hands of nonprofits and educators so they can connect with others and do more good. As a social enterprise, the more missions our technology supports, the more we invest back into technology and communities, creating an endless circle of good.

About the position:
The Salesforce.org Field Sales Account Executive Marketing Cloud serves as a process and technology subject matter expert representing the entire suite of Salesforce marketing and engagement solutions. Additionally, the Field Sales Account Executive Marketing Cloud works in a team selling environment with Account Executives, Solution Engineers, Product Managers and others to ensure that our engagement solutions fit within our customers requirements to deliver personalized customer journeys powered by the intelligent marketing platform for email, mobile, social, digital advertising, and DMP.

We are seeking an experienced quota-carrying sales executive who enjoys working within a dynamic, fast paced, and evolving sales environment functioning as part of the broader Account Team and/or as an Individual Contributor driving and creating pipeline and sales opportunities focused on the entire suite of Salesforce Marketing Cloud solutions. If you have a demonstrable history of thriving in this type of environment, we want to speak with you. If you wake up in the morning with genuine passion around creating customer Trailblazers that will change the status-quo on how nonprofits and education institutions engage with their constituents, then you belong here.

Core Responsibilities:
- Create and drive revenue within a specified region and/or list of named accounts
- Generate new and run-rate business opportunities through networking, cold-calling, and prospecting in to current Salesforce.org customers
- Be prepared to own the sales cycle for your product suites - from lead generation to closure
- Ensure tight collaboration with your assigned Account Team and the broader teams to ensure timely and accurate updates of the opportunities and forecasting, discovery notes, pricing, and anything deal related to ensure collaboration and team success.
- Ensure that your personal knowledge set is always fresh with the latest announcements on product feature releases, industry trends and analysis, customer best practices and success stories, and that you have proactively covered any personal knowledge gaps through self enablement or a mutual plan. In plain English, you either have the knowledge it takes to be successful or you have a plan in place to get there - whatever it takes to be successful within your territory.
- Ensure that your Account Team has been enabled with the right level of knowledge, tools and process to exceed impact and revenue goals, and that enablement continues through the year or as needed to ensure that Account Team has the latest relevant information on product feature releaes, industry trends and analysis, and new customer best practices and success stories to best position the customer for ongoing success.
- Work with your Account Team to help drive successful outcomes in the Account Planning process through the sharing and comprehension of the individual account business value drivers.
- Drive brand and campaign awareness along with supporting the lead generation process via networking, participation in organizations and associations, and both marketing and territory driven events.
- Ensure adherence to all policies around compensation, discounting, and any other management guidelines that may be put in place as the business grows.
- Meet and exceed all quarterly and annual sales quotas. and targets.

Requirements:
- As a general rule of thumb, give back more than you receive from your team and the broader teams you either partner with or support, and be a strong part of our Ohana.
- A proven team player who has worked in both an overlay/co-prime (or similar) model along with experience in a direct outside territory based hunter and closer sales executive role for 5+ years at minimum.
- Experience with and knowledge of current digital marketing and engagement platforms beyond the cursory overview level.
- Working experience with Salesforce Marketing Cloud in a marketing or marketing support environment is ideal. Additional experience with Salesforce Pardot, Social Studio, Ad Studio is ideal, experience with Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Salesforce CPQ, Communities, Commerce Cloud and/or other Salesforce products is an extra added bonus.
- Strong preference for experience working on the front lines of a complex marketing organization with with ideal experience in omni-channel campaign strategy, planning, tools, and execution; social media strategy, planning, tools and execution, marketing analytics, journey creation, email and mobile campaign planning and strategy, email deliverability and advertising.
- You know what it takes to be successful either as an individual contributor and/or as a part of a large or small dynamic team with competing priorities, personalities, and ideas on how to best help the customer be wildly successful, and you can point to examples of what has and has not worked in the past to help build team consensus.
- Your can easily pivot and adapt your work style from Individual Contributor to Team Player to Team Leader at a moments notice and show success in this approach.
- You exude professionalism everywhere, and especially when it comes to Business Acumen, Attention to Detail, Professional and Presentation Presence & Style.
- You have experience and a comfort level with all interactions and selling motions involving the "C" level – Chief Marketing Officer, Chief Digital Officer, Chief Development Officer, Chief Advancement Officer.
- Ability to give high-level overview product demonstrations and instill confidence in the customer with every interaction.
- Work collaboratively with the solution engineering team to create compelling demonstration scenarios, assets, and any other items that may be required to close the deal.
- You are extremely organized effective via in person and online meetings, hangouts, and conference calls
- You have a genuine passion for working with Nonprofit and/or Higher Education institutions
- You are able to travel as needed to support your territory and other business activities.
Posting Statement
Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

The Account Executive’s primary responsibilities include prospecting, qualifying, selling and closing new business to existing and net new customers. The Account Executive brings a Point of View to the Customer engagement; uses all resources to solve customer problems with appropriate SAP products.

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. meta1:
Post-Doctoral Research Visit F/M Distributed memory parallelization of the anisotropic mesh adaptation platform
Inria46 avis - Palaiseau (91)
titre_poste: Post-Doctoral Research Visit F/M Distributed memory parallelization of the anisotropic mesh adaptation platform
date_publication:
il y a 19 jours
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Le descriptif de l’offre ci-dessous est en Anglais
Type de contrat : CDD de la fonction publique
Contrat renouvelable : Oui
Niveau de diplôme exigé : Thèse ou équivalent
Fonction : Post-Doctorant
A propos du centre ou de la direction fonctionnelle
Located at the heart of the main national research and higher education cluster, member of the Université Paris Saclay, a major actor in the French Investments for the Future Programme (Idex, LabEx, IRT, Equipex) and partner of the main establishments present on the plateau, the centre is particularly active in three major areas: data and knowledge; safety, security and reliability; modelling, simulation and optimisation (with priority given to energy).
The 450 researchers and engineers from Inria and its partners who work in the research centre's 28 teams, the 60 research support staff members, the high-level equipment at their disposal (image walls, high-performance computing clusters, sensor networks), and the privileged relationships with prestigious industrial partners, all make Inria Saclay Île-de-France a key research centre in the local landscape and one that is oriented towards Europe and the world.
Contexte et atouts du poste
The postdoc will be held at Inria Saclay - Ile-de-France in the Gamma team-project under the supervision of Frederic Alauzet.

The work will be done in collaboration with Boeing and Safran Tech that are users of the mesh adaptation technology.
Mission confiée
The aim of mesh adaptation is to generate the best mesh to perform a specific numerical simulation. It results in a powerful methodology that reduces significantly the size of the mesh required to reach the desired accuracy. Thus, it impacts favorably the simulation CPU time and memory requirement. Moreover, as the generated adapted mesh is in agreement with the physics of the flow, for some applications, this is the only way to obtain an accurate prediction of the flow.
Nowadays, mesh adaptation is a mature tool which is well-posed mathematically. And, as it is fully automatic, it has started to be used in industrial R&D departments. Indeed, it has already proved, throughout many publications and applications, its superiority with respect to fixed mesh. However, simulating complex physical phenomena on complex 3D geometries (such as high-lift applications or turbomachinery applications), which is more and more required by industry, still remains a challenge. Indeed, high-fidelity prediction for such numerical simulations requires large size meshes (hundreds of million elements) even if anisotropic mesh adaptation is considered.
A quicker response of the adaptative process requires a parallelization of the full platform, i.e., the parallelization of the flow solver, the error estimate, the local remesher and the interpolation stage. This also requires a proper mesh partitioning which is optimal for each stage of the mesh adaptation loop.
A first step in this direction has been done with the shared-memory parallelization of the whole solution-adaptive simulation platform using a shared-memory parallelization library developed in the team: the LPlib. An overall (real time) strong speed-up between 10 and 15 on twenty cores is usually achieved on industrial applications.
A second step has been achieved with the distributed-memory parallelization of the local remesher and the development of an efficient mesh partitioning which takes into account the remesher work load. With this strategy, we were able to generate, for a model problem, a billion elements in 15 minutes on 100 processors. But, this has been done outside of the solution-adaptive platform.
The goal of this Post Doctoral position is to finalize the distributed-memory parallelization of each stage of the mesh adaptation loop and to design optimal transition between each stage as mesh repartitioning will be required to obtain balance work load at each step.

The postdoc will first learn all the concepts related to mesh adaptation. He/she will perform several 3D adaptive simulations of inviscid and viscous flows to become familiar with the Inria solution-adaptive simulation platform involving a flow solver, an adaptive mesh generator, an error estimate code and an interpolation code.
Once familiar with the mesh adaptation platform, the postdoc will work on the parallelization with MPI of the flow solver, the error estimate and the solution interpolation software. For each tool, we will analyze in detail the obtained strong speed-up and will set-up the optimal hybrid parallelization using shared-memory and distributed memory techniques. We will also enhance the mesh partitioning code to obtain an optimal load balancing and to output appropriate partitions (ghost cells, ...) for each tool.
The next step will be to link all the tools involved in the solution-adaptive simulation platform and to analyse deeply the obtained strong speed-up. This may lead to work on the development of parallel IO's in the LibMesh library.

The developed methodology will be validated on several industrial problems in aeronautics and turbomachinery and will be
run on Inria Saclay Ile-de-France cluster composed of 1000 processors. In aeronautics, in collaboration with Boeing, we will focus of drag and high-lift prediction applications. In turbomachinery, in collaboration with Safran, we will focus on compressor and stator simulations.
As one can see, in this work, the postdoc will be confronted to advanced scientific computing issues (numerical schemes, fast and efficient implementation of the numerical methods, parallel computing,...).
Principales activités
Main activities (5 maximum) :

Develop distributed memory parallelization in the flow solver, the error estimate and the interpolation tools
Pursue the development of the mesh partitioning tool
Set-up the full distributed memory solution-adaptive simulation platform
Anaylze the strong scalability of the full distributed memory solution-adaptive simulation platform
Participate to the collaboration with Boeing and Safran
Further information below :
https://zimbra.inria.fr/service/home/~/?auth=co&loc=fr&id=403116&part=2
Compétences
A PhD in scientific computing is required to apply for this position.
Good knowledge in C and shell programming is required.
Knowledge on MPI and finite volume methods is also mandatory.
Avantages
Subsidized meals
Partial reimbursement of public transport costs
Leave: 7 weeks of annual leave + 10 extra days off due to RTT (statutory reduction in working hours) + possibility of exceptional leave (sick children, moving home, etc.)
Possibility of teleworking (after 6 months of employment) and flexible organization of working hours
Professional equipment available (videoconferencing, loan of computer equipment, etc.)
Social, cultural and sports events and activities
Access to vocational training
Social security coverage
Rémunération
Monthly gross salary : 2.653 euros

Le poste
Chez Margo, nous vous proposons d'intervenir sur des missions challengeantes en développement sur des langages OO. Codeurs passionnés, adeptes des bonnes pratiques de code, rejoignez-nous et travaillons main dans la main pour construire votre carrière ! Chez Margo, vous pourrez par exemple développer un portail web dédié aux clients d'une banque d’investissement, mettre en place des outils web permettant aux traders de faire des simulations de pricing et assurer la refonte globale d’une application leur permettant de suivre les opérations financières. Vous participez à des projets from scratch et à la migration d’une application en Front et développez des microservices en Back. Environnement agile et dynamique où la technique, les bonnes pratiques de code et l'optimisation de la performance sont au centre de l'activité. Stack techno : Back end : Java 8 Front end : Angular 7 Base de données : MongoDB Nous avons également des opportunités dans des équipes en C++, Python et C#.

Relever les challenges techniques suivants : optimisation de la performance, grosse volumétrie de données, scalabilité
Pourquoi venir chez nous?
Vous êtes passionné(e) par la tech ? Vous souhaitez intégrer une petite équipe, très outillée et proche du business ? Nous sommes un cabinet de conseil en transformation digitale à taille humaine, spécialisé dans les problématiques à forte complexité technologique. Notre objectif est d’offrir à nos collaborateurs les projets les plus intéressants, présentant une forte complexité technique (multithreading, temps réel, optimisation des performances, grosse volumétrie de données…) afin de les faire évoluer et monter en compétences rapidement. description:
EN BREF
Candidater chez Ignition Program te permet de toucher 1200 startups, sélectionnées par nos soins. Nous travaillons en direct avec toi pour trouver un poste qui correspond à tes critères, te décrochons des entretiens et t’accompagnons sur ton positionnement. Le suivi continue après ton embauche : nous te coachons pendant ta prise de poste et animons une communauté de partage d’expérience pour appuyer ton évolution professionnelle. En gros, nous sommes ton agent.
Le coût : 35 minutes, le temps de créer ton profil chez nous. Tout est financé par nos startups partenaires.
UN POSTE SUR MESURE…
Une candidature chez nous t’ouvre des opportunités dans les 1200 startups avec lesquelles nous travaillons déjà, plus celles que tu voudras que l’on contacte pour toi. Par exemple :
Startups de plus de 80 salariés, en hypercroissance (20%) : Doctolib, Evaneos, HomeExchange, ManoMano, Morning Coworking, OpenClassrooms, Sendinblue, Théodo…
Startups de 30 à 80 salariés, en structuration (40%) : Agricool, Anaxago, BonneGueule, Captain Contrat, Cheerz, Comet, EarlyMetrics, FoodChéri, Habiteo, Heuritech, Karos, GeoPLC, LégalStart, Liegey Muller Pons, Lifen, Sézane, Shapr, SuperMood, RenovationMan, Ynsect…
Startups de 5 à 30 salariés, en amorçage (35%) : Amabilis, Data Impact, Finfrog, LiveMentor, LouYetu, Ma p’tite culotte, MoneySnap, Naver France, Plüm Energie, Selency, Prêt à Pousser, Solen, Vitaline, Vroomly, Wistiki, Yoopies, 360 Medics…
Startups en création (5%) : eFounders, BigBlank, Kamet, La Fabrique by CA, RedPill, Technofounders, top business angels, serial entrepreneurs...
Nous couvrons tous les secteurs : Greentech, Legaltech, Insurtech, Discotech, Medtech, Edtech, Agritech, Cleantech, IoT, Big Data, Adtech, Foodtech, Arttech, Retailtech, Marketplaces, IA et tant d’autres. Nous t’offrirons également des axes de lecture et de recherche qui vont plus loin que ce seul critère (par exemple l’équipe, les valeurs ou la vision).
Ces startups sont pour la plupart localisées sur Paris qui concentre 90% des startups en France, mais nous avons aussi de plus rares opportunités à Lyon, Lille, Nantes, Bordeaux, Marseille, Nice, Toulouse et à l’international.
… DOUBLÉ D’UN ACCOMPAGNEMENT SUR MESURE
Ignition Program, c’est 50 personnes qui se sont rendu compte que la recherche de job en startup était un vrai calvaire déshumanisé. Nous avons par la suite accompagné plus de 2000 personnes dans leur recrutement et leurs évolutions professionnelles, via une méthode bien à nous, gratuite pour un candidat :
Création d’un profil : une fois finalisé, nos coachs identifient les meilleurs talents entrepreneuriaux sur leurs expériences passées et leurs aspirations, et conseillent les autres sur leurs axes d’amélioration. En parallèle, nous sourçons en permanence des startups et postes à fort intérêt, sur lesquels nous positionnons les candidats retenus.
Matching : un coach attitré t’aide à te positionner sur les meilleures opportunités, qui correspondent à tes aspirations, et t’aide à te préparer pour tes entretiens. Comme tu le constateras, ta candidature a toujours plus de chances d’être retenue venant de nous que si tu contactes une entreprise en direct, car Ignition Program est un label de forte qualité reconnu. Profites-en !
Accompagnement : nous t’apportons tout ce qui est nécessaire pour une évolution professionnelle accélérée. Nos experts te coachent sur tes entretiens et tes négociations de salaire, dans tes étapes clés professionnelle (prise de poste, 1 an, évolutions), nos Crews t’apportent des partage d’expériences toutes les 6 semaines, notre réseau devient ton réseau, et tu as accès à tous nos événements (gratuitements) et nos formations (payantes), etc.
Si cette identification s’avère trop complexe, nous invitons chaque candidat à améliorer son profil en travaillant l’axe le plus pertinent. Une fois ton profil identifié et retenu par notre équipe, nous creuserons pour comprendre ta personnalité, tes aspirations et tes compétences.
SALAIRE :
Tout dépend bien sûr de ton profil et de la startup dans laquelle nous te trouverons un job ! Nous te donnerons un bench du marché et t’accompagnerons dans tes négociations salariales.
Si tu te poses des questions sur les salaires en startup, nous avons créé un simulateur qui recense les salaires moyens constatés.
POURQUOI IGNITION “PROGRAM”
Si notre seule ambition était de trouver des jobs à des candidats, nous aurions juste développé une plateforme. Mais notre leitmotiv, c’est faire en sorte que chaque candidat passé par chez nous soit dans la bonne mission, dans la bonne équipe et avec le bon accompagnement. D’ailleurs, notre accompagnement t’est ouvert à vie dès que tu rejoins le programme. Rejoins nous :-)
PROFIL RECHERCHÉ :
Pour t’aider à les mettre en avant, voici les éléments que nous cherchons à identifier dans le profil d’un candidat :
des exemples d’expériences de prise d’initiative forte, de mains dans le cambouis
des exemples d’environnement exigeants et/ou sélectifs et de résultats (chiffrés)
des exemples de prise de recul, d’erreurs, de choix difficiles, ambitieux, clivants

description:
3rd Largest Communications Group Worldwide, is a global leader in marketing, communication, and business transformation.
In a world marked by increased convergence and consumer empowerment,xxxx accompanies clients through their business transformation, offering a full range of services and expertise across digital, technology, consulting, creative, corporate communications and public affairs, media strategy, planning and buying, healthcare communications and brand asset production. Present in 108 countries, the Groupe employs more than 78,000 professionals.
Altaïr :
The deployment of an ERP (Enterprise Resources Planning), a very high-performance tool, aims to create consistent and efficient applications across our agencies on a global level, to facilitate real-time information sharing and analysis regardless of the size of the agency or its location. This project, named Altaïr (which signifies "Flying Eagle" in ancient Arabic and is also the name of the brightest star in the same constellation) is rolling out.
The Altaïr solution has been developed and piloted since Q2 2013. Parallel roll-out is running as of 2013. The solution is now deployed to Publicis entities supporting 35.000 end-users (of which 8.000 heavy users). The Altaïr solution will provide a common process and application platform for the following CORE processes:
Client set-up, Vendor set-up
Manage projects, Estimating
Manage time, Manage expenses
Purchasing & procurement
Production billing
Cash collection & credit receivables
Account payable
Inter-company
Treasur
GL
Month-end
Fixed assets
Budget forecasting
All these CORE processes are supported by extensive reporting capabilities.
The processes are run on SAP ECC6.0 (SD billing, MM purchasing, FI, CO, PS) and SAP Netweaver (Portal, PI, BI). The following project tools are in use: Solution manager, Quality center, RWD, Loadrunner.
The SAP platform is fully integrated into the Publicis application landscape: HFM for corporate reporting, TMS for treasury management and dedicated applications for Media planning and buying
Delivery Center
In order to deliver the next versions of CORE Solution design & build and the world-wide roll-out, Publicis Groupe manages its own Altair internal Delivery Center and with a number of proven SAP experts eager to contribute to the challenges of Altaïr. We are pioneering and leading the industry in many area's and will be to first major advertising & communication group to launch a global ERP. In this challenging environment we offer a number of challenging positions in a truly global environment in the fascinating world of advertising.

Au sein de l'équipe Sécurité Opérationnelle en charge de maîtriser la sécurité du réseau de télécommunication de Bouygues Telecom, vous aurez pour mission de maîtriser (identifier, qualifier et gérer) les risques de la Direction Réseau de Bouygues Telecom. Pour cela vous : • Pilotez les audits de sécurité externes, définissez en transverse et suivez les plans d'action • Contrôlez et suivez le niveau d'application de la Politique de Sécurité Réseau de Bouygues Telecom. • Procédez à des analyses de risques techniques • Animez un réseau de correspondants sécurité opérationnels dont vous suivez les plans d'action de remédiation. • Préparez les Comité de suivi des Risques présentés aux managers opérationnels de la Direction RESEAU. • Produisez les tableaux de bords sécurité (indicateurs, Tableau des risques RES…. • Participez aux projets Sécurité transverses : ex mise en œuvre de la LPM.

Procédez à des analyses de risques techniques
Animez un réseau de correspondants sécurité opérationnels dont vous suivez les plans d'action de remédiation.

Pourquoi venir chez nous?
Vous pensiez que nos ingénieurs évoluaient uniquement sur des projets Réseaux ? Non ! Développement (web, logiciels, mobile…), IA (chatbot, robotique…), Data, Cybersécurité, Architecture… Les opportunités ne manquent jamais, et particulièrement au sein de notre DSI, une entité et des métiers déterminants pour un opérateur. Sans elle ? Pas de de vente, pas de support aux clients, pas de facturation, pas de logistique… Nous rejoindre, c’est donc évoluer quotidiennement au cœur de notre business sur des projets agiles de grande ampleur. C’est aussi intégrer la communauté Bytech : 2 000 collaborateurs issus des métiers de l’IT & du Digital avec qui partager et accélérer vos savoir-faire au sein du Groupe Bouygues. Ce qui fait notre singularité ? Une culture d’entreprise où la qualité des relations humaines fait partie de notre ADN : et ce sont nos équipes (bientôt la vôtre ?) qui le disent. Vous hésitez encore ? Vous ne douterez plus quand vous aurez découvert notre Technopôle, un véri

description:
Job Description

This position, as part of the Subsurface Imaging CGG research organization in the Massy land processing research team, will be responsible and accountable for developing, implementing, testing, and supporting new algorithms to improve imaging of the subsurface in the context of land seismic.
Using your math skills you will have to abstract geophysical concepts with mathematical languages, whilst developing algorithms to solve geophysical problems.
More precisely you will:
Develop algorithms to solve specified geophysical problem associated to land seismic processing and imaging.
Validate the algorithm on synthetic and real data to assess the strengths and weaknesses of the proposed approach.
Support the porting of those algorithms on SI HPC infrastructure by providing algorithmic and mathematical expertise on them.
Support rollout of new technology through internal presentations and user support.
Promote use of new technology to clients through scientific publications and presentations.
Keep informed of internal requirements by building close relationships with the seismic imaging operations.
Develop knowledge by reading academic publications, attending technical presentations, workshops, conferences, seminars.
Required Education & Experience:
You have a passion for coding and analyzing real data to deliver high-end technical products. More precisely you have:
Strong skills in mathematics and physics in order to apply advanced mathematical tools and understand the underlying geophysical concepts;
Analytical and problem solving abilities with a great attention to detail.
Coding skills, essential for this role, particularly FORTRAN or C/C++;
Effective communication & presentation skills, in order to interface with production and to share knowledge;
High motivation to deal with real data, solve problems and deliver high end technological products;
Solid practice of English - both spoken and written.

Knowledge of seismic processing/imaging, experience in wave propagation, inversion, experience in Machine learning or a strong signal processing background are a plus.

Typical profile

M.S. degree with at least 3 years of successful research experience, PhD, school of engineering with background in Geophysics, Physics, Mathematics, Electrical Engineering or any other related technical degree.

Vous maitrisez la mathématique avancée et l’anglais technique. En terme d’infrastructure de développement, vous êtes familier avec les cadriciels tels que Hadoop, Data Lake, Hive, Spark distribué, Storm ou encore Pig., ainsi que MongoDB ou encore Cassandra, pour les bases de données.
Rigueur et organisation sont vos principales qualités auxquelles s’ajoutent votre curiosité et ouverture d’esprit qui vous permettent de travailler en équipe pluridisciplinaire avec des collaborateurs IT, métiers, Data scientists …

description:
Plateforme e-commerce leader en Europe et en Amérique latine, PrestaShop permet à chacun de créer sa boutique en ligne et de la développer afin de poursuivre son ambition. Fondée sur un modèle open source, PrestaShop permet à n’importe quel marchand d’opérer son projet e-commerce partout dans le monde, en bénéficiant d’une solution entièrement personnalisable et adaptable à chaque marché, une solution qui a déjà permis à l’ensemble de nos boutiques de générer en 2018 plus de 15 milliards d’euros de ventes. Aujourd’hui, toutes les 4 minutes, une boutique PrestaShop se crée dans le monde et chacune de ces boutiques raconte une histoire.

Poussée par une forte ambition, l’équipe data est amenée à accueillir plusieurs nouveaux profils dans les douze prochains mois. Les cas d’usages à développer vont du marketing digital (CRM, acquisition trafic, personnalisation/recommandation) au pilotage business de nos produits, avec une activité R&D sanctuarisée. L’infrastructure data, développée dans l’équipe, est basée sur Google Cloud Platform. Nos résultats ont un impact direct sur l’entreprise et le travail quotidien de nos collaborateurs.

Dans une ambiance jeune et dynamique, où le travail d’équipe est mis en valeur, nous recherchons un(e) Data Engineer pour rejoindre cette belle aventure qu’est PrestaShop !

Vous participez activement à la vie de l’équipe. Vous aiderez à structurer la chaîne Big Data, de la récupération de la donnée jusqu’à son exploitation finale, et garantissez un haut niveau de qualité.

De formation supérieure en école d’ingénieur/université (niveau Bac+5 ou plus), vous justifiez d'au moins 2 ans d'expérience dans un programme data.
Vos missions
Vous travaillez en étroite relation avec notre Lead Data scientist pour aider à la création des algorithmes nécessaires pour les cas d’usages développés pour les équipes métier
Vous mettez en place les nouveaux flux d’entrée et de sortie au sein de la plateforme data
Vous assurez le delivery, et êtes constamment en veille sur les nouvelles technos

Votre environnement technique

Google Cloud Platform
Big Query, SQL-like, Dataflow
Python / Spark, Node.js
Et tout autre outil que vous jugerez pertinent !

Savoir-faire

Vous avez déjà appliqué les technologies Big Data en production sur de fortes volumétries de données. Vous maitrisez le développement en Python ;
Vous avez la capacité à maintenir la chaîne Big Data, de la récupération de la donnée jusqu’à son exploitation finale.

Savoir-être

Vous avez l’esprit d’équipe et êtes impliqué(e) dans votre travail au quotidien ;
Vous êtes curieux (se), rigoureux (se), structuré(e) ;
Vous avez hâte de proposer des améliorations, les partager et les prioriser avec vos collègues ;
A l’externe, vous participez à des évènements de l’univers Big Data (meetups, conférence, etc.).

Job Description

Vous bénéficierez également d’un écosystème de partenaires technologiques de premier plan, de formations certifiantes et pourrez participer aux nombreux événements que nous organisons régulièrement autour de la Data et de l’IA.
Vos missions :
Concevoir et développer les architectures et solutions Big Data en utilisant les modules les plus pertinents ;
Proposer des solutions de stockage (sur site ou en lien avec la stratégie cloud)
Extraire, uniformiser et structurer les données depuis les datalakes de nos clients
Participer à la mise en place de référentiels
Mettre en place des flux de données entre les systèmes en ingestion et en exposition (batch, API, temps réel …)
Développer des composants pour monitorer les activités des plateformes Big Data
Explorer de nouvelles technologies et assurer veille;
Rédiger les documents et rapports associés à la conduite de ces missions
Expérimenter, évaluer, faire de la veille technologique

Qualifications

Vous êtes diplômé(e) d'une Grande École d'Ingénieur généraliste, informatique ou Master spécialisé en Big Data et avez une expérience minimum de 3-4 ans en environnement Big Data
Vous avez déjà participé au développement de solutions Big data en réponse à des besoins métier
Vous maîtrisez plusieurs des compétences et solutions listées ci-dessous :
Hadoop et son écosystème : Spark, HDFS, Hive, HBase, Kafka, Mesos, CouchBase…
Une ou plusieurs des distributions : HortonWorks, Cloudera, MapR.
Suite ELK.
Langages Big Data : Scala, Javascript,Python, R, …
Outils de virtualisation et container : Docker, Kubernetes,...
Orchestrateurs : KVM / Vagrant / Puppet / Ansible / Chef / Luigi,
Une certification relative à l’une des technologies ci-dessus est un plus
Vous disposez éventuellement d’une certification sur une des solutions Cloud Public Azure, GCP ou AWS
Vous souhaitez vous confronter et contribuer à une communauté d’experts, pour qui l’évolution des pratiques et l’apprentissage continu font particulièrement sens.
Vous disposez d’un très bon relationnel, d’un bon sens de l’écoute et d’empathie,
Vous faites preuve d’initiative, vous êtes naturellement force de propositions, vous avez envie de partager tes connaissances et savoir-faire et d’apprendre de vos pair

Additional Information

La data est l’un des déclencheurs de la quatrième révolution industrielle. En rejoignant la communauté brAIn de onepoint, vous participez à notre ambition auprès des marchés européens, américains et asiatiques, d’accompagner cette mutation, de bout en bout en construisant et délivrant des services basés sur solutions performantes, scalables et sécurisées qui révèlent tout le pouvoir de « la data ».
L’une des particularités de onepoint est que vous aurez la possibilité d’intervenir auprès de grands comptes mais aussi d’accompagner des start-up prometteuses dans leur développement via le Big Data.

Algolia - Paris (75)

description:
Since the early days, Algolia has been running hybrid infrastructure largely based on bare metal servers. This approach gives Algolia complete control over the performance of the system but also brings challenges in automation, maintenance and provisioning. As a member of the Foundation squad you'll evolve and maintain our infrastructure and the related automation.

With it's rapid growth, Algolia's infrastructure is growing by 100% every year and what used to be a handful servers in 1 datacenter is now over 1000 servers across 15 regions and 50+ data centers. All that without compromise on security of availability. There will be more servers, more data centers, more regions. Are up for a challenge?

No two problems are the same because all the systems evolve all the time. We expect you to be a resilient problem solver who isn’t afraid to think outside of the box and use the knowledge of system interactions in your favor. You’ll also take ownership of complete projects and execute them.

The team is composed of engineers with different backgrounds and experience both in the industry and academia. The diversity works in our favor and you should increase it by bringing your experience, your knowledge and your point of view. Thinking differently is a plus, not a minus.

We’re transparent with each other and to other teams both about our success and our failures. This way we learn, we accept our weaknesses and continuously strive to improve both personally and professionally.
Your role will consist of:
Develop and maintain Algolia's worldwide infrastructure
Discuss with vendors and partners hardware release plans
Test new preproduction hardware
Develop and maintain infrastructure automation systems
Perform capacity planning based on the growth and needs of the company
Provision new infrastructure
Troubleshoot issues and outages related to the infrastructure
You might be a fit if you have:
4+ years of engineering experience
Knowledge of server hardware
Knowledge of datacenter and colocation environment
Knowledge of Shell scripting and at least one scripting language (Python, Ruby, etc.)
Willing to learn Go (golang)
Understanding of Linux systems: I/O, process scheduling, filesystems
Understanding of computer networks: TCP/IP, DNS, load-balancing
Full professional English proficiency
Rigor in high code quality, automated testing, and other engineering best practices
Ability to make independent decisions and taking ownership for them
Nice to have:
Knowledge of Go (golang)
Ability to use a configuration management tool like Ansible, Puppet or Chef
Knowledge of low level principles of computers and network components

We’re looking for someone who can live our values:
GRIT - Problem-solving and perseverance capability in an ever-changing and growing environment.
TRUST - Willingness to trust our co-workers and to take ownership.
CANDOR - Ability to receive and give constructive feedback.
CARE - Genuine care about other team members, our clients and the decisions we make in the company.
HUMILITY - Aptitude for learning from others, putting ego aside.
Benefits:
Private Medical Insurance
Life and Disability Insurance
Business Travel Insurance
Relocation support
Company Canteen (high standard)
Flexible work hours and unlimited time off
Perks:
Competitive pay and equity
Coaching and sponsorship to participate and speak at leading industry conferences
Ongoing professional education opportunities through internal & external workshops, including public speaking, language learning (English/French)
Fun: we spend time together — team building, socializing and making tools that encourage getting to know teammates across offices and continents.
Charitable contribution matching
Unique referral rewards program: refer a candidate, and we’ll donate to your charity of choice
Corporate flats available for the first months of relocation and when you travel to different offices
Fully stocked kitchens
Team workouts
Meals & happy hours

meta1:
Software Engineer (Full Stack Python/JS)
Group IT - Paris (75)
date_publication:
AXA - il y a 27 jours
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Key responsibilities
The open position is within the Computer Vision and Imagery team. As a Software Engineer, you'll work with product owners and developers from REV, as well as other AXA people from IT throughout the world and with external partners (start-ups and big tech companies). Your role is to deliver innovation solutions that will redefine the way our industry is operating, leveraging the latest tech innovations regarding computer vision and imagery.
What will you do:
We are looking for a passionate software engineer who has experience in delivering industry-grade code to reinforce our team. The ideal candidate will have previous experience in a start-up or in a tech-driven company, with an entrepreneur mindset, meaning a wide understanding of technologies coupled with a sense of strategy and business impact.
We expect you to be autonomous and able to learn. The projects duration spans from 1 week to 6 months or beyond for the biggest of them. Be ready to regularly learn new things (methodologies, technologies, domains) and adapt to a moving world.
As a Software Engineer, you will have the following responsibilities:
Clarify the project requirements and help assess relevant User Experience patterns with stakeholders and users
Implement selected projects and coordinate with the Product Owner and external stakeholders
Perform technology surveys on emerging technology trends and startups.
Evaluate and choose technological components that fit technical requirements
Help elaborate architecture of software and deployment components
Deploy software components using modern DevOps techniques, in collaboration with DevOps engineers
Develop prototypes to demonstrate new technologies
Uses best practices in Software Engineering (frontend and backend)
If you are enthusiastic about this position, take the opportunity to apply! During the interview, candidates will be asked about their vision on software engineering and their knowledge of the digital industry: be prepared!

Qualifications
Skills and Experience
B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Computer Science or related field
3-5 years of related experience
Good knowledge of Software Engineering principles
Open to continuous improvement of Software Engineering techniques
Backend programming with Python and related frameworks, Flask a plus.
Experience with Web frontend development in Javascript (React or other JS web frameworks)
Knowledge of PAAS hosting solutions, AWS a plus.
Machine Learning and Deep Learning knowledge, a plus
Experience with agile methodologies, such as Scrum
Ability to work in an international and cross functional organization
Team player, fruitful interactions with the other team members and external stakeholders
Good communication skills
Languages: English and French. German a plus

About AXA
Would you like to wake up every day driven and inspired by our noble mission and to work together as one global team to empower people to live a better life? Here at AXA we strive to lead the transformation of our industry. We are looking for talented individuals who come from varied backgrounds, think differently and want to be part of this exciting transformation by challenging the status quo so we can push AXA - a leading global brand and one of the most innovative companies in our industry - onto even greater things.
In a fast-evolving world and with a presence in 64 countries, our 166,000 employees and exclusive distributors anticipate change to offer services and solutions tailored to the current and future needs of our 103 million customers.
About REV:
The position will be part of REV (Research, Engineering and Vision) having locations in Paris 17 th (France), on the EPFL campus in Lausanne (Switzerland) and in San Francisco (USA). This new unit was created in 2018 to contribute to a global strategic program of digital transformation and innovation to drive AXA towards becoming a tech-led company. It is not only an innovation unit but also, and above all, an engineering team helping AXA entities to “test and learn” their ideas leveraging emerging technologies and scale them across the group. We strongly believe in learning by doing and acknowledge we have the right to fail if we learn along the way. Our projects span from IT related topics, to computer vision, cognitive services, bots, drones and many other web/mobile initiatives. Our mission is to transform an idea into a first stage of execution. Once the feasibility and the value for users is confirmed, we scale it with the help of industrialization teams.
We are the Tech Innovation team of AXA Group. We are a group of passionate software engineers, data scientists, actuaries, product managers and designers on a mission to identify or invent the technologies that will support the transformation of insurance.

What We Offer
At AXA, we lead a an HR policy that encourages diversity, maintains your professional and private life balance and accelerates the skills and career development : promotion of diversity, remuneration policy, training device, ... Discover everything that makes AXA an employer of choice.
Whatever your job is, we strive to offer you career opportunities. Our goal is to develop your skills to support the transformation of our changing business.

Dans le cadre de votre activité, vous analyserez les besoins business et proposerez des solutions techniques adaptées (choix des technologies, de l’architecture, prise en compte de la scalabilité…), vous mettrez en place les MVP des solutions choisies, vous assurerez la gestion et le suivi technique d’un projet (développer les modules critiques, trouver le bon expert pour déléguer, paralléliser le travail de chacun…). Enfin, vous échangerez avec les partenaires techniques afin d’améliorer les solutions.
Ce que nous recherchons :
Vous êtes incollable sur Java et ses bonnes pratiques (java 8 minimum).
Vous maîtrisez à minima un langage de script (python de préférence).
Vous êtes à l’aise avec les bonnes pratiques de développement en général (SOLID, RAII, 12Factor, etc).
Vous avez une bonne connaissance de l’environnement UNIX et des outils GNU/Linux (sed, cut, etc) et des outils de collaboration (utilisation de git).
Vous vous adaptez facilement au potentiel changement de techno et/ou langage.
Quelques notions sur la stack ELK, Spring (framework java), la programmation réactive (RX Java, Akka, Kafka…) ou les technologies du Big Data (Hadoop, Spark…) sont les bienvenues, mais ne sont pas un prérequis.
À propos d’Adelean :
Adelean est une entreprise de conseil et développement dans les domaines des moteurs de recherche et analyse des données, établie en région parisienne.
Nous accompagnons nos clients et partenaires dans la mise en place de moteurs performants et pertinents pour la recherche, la navigation et l’analyse de données. Adelean intervient dans toutes les phases d’un projet informatique et dans une diversité d’environnements techniques et organisationnels.
Intégrateur, depuis 2011, de logiciels comme Lucene, Solr et la suite Elastic (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana et Beats), nous apportons l’expertise nécessaire pour déployer ces technologies et leurs écosystèmes dans un système d’information déjà existant et souvent complexe.
La force d’Adelean tient dans sa maîtrise des flux de données et des traitements préparatoires à l’indexation et à la recherche. Cette expertise est mise à disposition par sa plateforme A2, plateforme d’intégration de données et pilotage de moteurs de recherche, permettant aux utilisateurs métier de maîtriser le contenu et la qualité des recherches.
Nous délivrons des solutions innovantes pour les domaines de l’e-commerce, de l’assurance, de la distribution ou encore de la gestion électronique des documents.
Notre métier est l’extraction, la transformation et la restitution des données sous toutes leurs formes.
Type d'emploi : Temps plein

description:
Job Description

About the team
Dailymotion is seeking an experienced software engineer to join the Scale team in Paris for a full time position.
The scale team in Dailymotion is a world class back end engineering team responsible for building and maintaining Dailymotion’s metadata API at scale. All dailymotion services use this API to launch a video player or to recommend what to watch next. With more than 3 billion views per month this API has to run smoothly, quickly, be always available and secure!
Our team is at the center of Dailymotion’s engineering organization. We provide architecture, services, tools and guidelines to build a fast, geo-distributed Graph based API’s.
Our Activities include :
Development of scalable and high performance services
Orchestration/Automation (GCP/on-premise Kubernetes environment) CI/CD Jenkins Pipelines definition
Legacy features cleaning/migration (PHP/MySQL)
Defining requirements/technical specifications, and translating them into high performance & scalable services
Working closely with infrastructure operations to construct our footprint and improve our capacity planning.
Writing technical specifications & evangelizing our architecture and services across the engineering organization.
Driving and executing the migration from the relational database to our new column based database
Defining development operations guidelines, standards and tools with a high focus on code quality, testing, documentation, and following SOLID/KISS/TDD principles
About the Role
At Dailymotion, we value dynamic and motivated engineers and give them various opportunities to work on innovative projects and cool bleeding edge technologies. From backend architecture through code optimisation, you will be involved in every aspect of software development. The ideal candidate is excited about fast response times, efficient caching, scalable architecture & performance monitoring. Within the global architecture/core skill group of Dailymotion, you will be in charge of supporting the business growth by defining appropriate systems and architectures, capable to handle Dailymotion data and processing volumes. More specifically, you will be involved in the following projects:
Building and maintaining a versionned column oriented database, optimized for scale.
Integrating and maintaining A kafka based databus to stream data to our worldwide points of presence.
Building and maintiaining a custom made mapping solution (technical and functional) to migrate various data elements from a relational database to a flat column oriented database.

Qualifications

Required Experience
Minimum of 3 years hands-on software development experience.
Proven experience working on production running applications
2 or more years of experience the following programming language : Python
2 or more years of experience working with relational databases (e.g. MySQL, Postgres)
1 or more years of experience in container-based tooling (docker, kubernetes)
Experience with continuous integration, continuous deployment testing and automation tools (Jenkins, Travis or Gitlab CI)
Experience with continuous integration, continuous deployment testing and automation tools (Jenkins etc.)
Experience using modern software versioning systems (e.g. git)
Desired Experience
Experience in other programming languages (php, Go)
Experience with SOA architecture based applications
Ability to learn quickly, be proactive and autonomous
Strong communication skills - able to work effectively with both technical and non-technical teammates
Strong command of written/verbal English
Experience with distributed systems and message queues (Kafka, RabbitMQ)

Additional Information

Technical Environment
Python - Golang - PHP(legacy stack only)
Mysql - ElasticSearch - Redis - Memcached
Kafka - NSQ
Jenkins - Docker - K8S - Vault – EFK (ElasticSearch/Fluentd/Kibana)

description:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

We're looking to fill an opening for Vice President, Sales Engineering at Dataiku.

The VP of Sales Engineering oversees Dataiku’s global team of Sales Engineers and Sales Engineering managers. With more than 25 team members today, the team will likely grow to 40+ in the coming 12 months.

The Sales Engineering function at Dataiku is the primary technical function within the Sales organization, providing pre-sales support to the Account Executives and directly contributing to Dataiku’s revenue objectives. As the “trusted advisors” in the sales process, the Sales Engineers help to build interest in Dataiku, build the solution to the prospect’s needs, and then build the evaluation to provide the prospect with the proof that they need to make their purchasing decision.

The Vice President role is a key, senior management role at Dataiku, reporting directly into the Chief Revenue Officer. The VP of Sales Engineering will own objectives related to our ability to deliver compelling, highly technical customer engagements in the field. Key responsibilities in the coming months will be the enablement of the existing team, hiring for 2020, and ensuring excellence in our execution.

Given the cross-cutting nature of the function, this role will have direct interaction with top management and the executive team.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Monitor key metrics relevant to the efficiency and efficacy of our sales delivery
Establish and oversee technical enablement for the Sales Engineering team
Directly manage the Regional Sales Engineering Managers
Contribute to the development of the 2020 hiring plan, and then execute on that plan, directly overseeing the hiring of 15+ sales engineers
Oversee onboarding and enablement efforts
Coordinate closely with the post-sales Customer team to ensure smooth handovers of new clients
Coordinate closely with the Product, Engineering, and R&D teams to ensure that the needs of the field are appropriately communicated back to those who can address them in the product
REQUIRMENTS
10+ years of professional experience, including significant team management experience
Enterprise sales experience in the B2B software sector, ideally in the big data, analytics, ML, and/or AI spaces
Strong technical knowledge related to data science, analytics, distributed computing (on-premise and cloud), ML and their applications and constraints in the enterprise
Experience rapidly hiring highly technical profiles
Analytic, data-driven mindset for setting up and measuring team staffing and other key delivery metrics
A bridge-building communication style, with excellent written and verbal skills, to collaborate proactively with the many teams at Dataiku on which the success of the role dependsExperience working in a target driven environment, and the ability to work towards deadlines and in a fast-paced environment
Strong ambition and an appreciation for “reach” objectives, where the goal is to make a maximum impact with minimum resources
Ideally located in (or willing to relocate to) New York, Denver, Paris, or London. However, remote is a possibility for the right candidate
BENEFITS
Opportunity to have significant responsibility at Dataiku early on and help scale the company in a meaningful and measurable way
Competitive compensation package, equity, health benefits, and paid vacation
Opportunity to work with a smart, passionate and driven team
Dataiku has a strong culture based on key values: Ownership, Passion, Autonomy and Friendliness
Dataiku is an end-to-end collaboration platform that is revolutionizing how data science teams from 5 to 5,000 people work together to create and share insights from big data. Our software is designed to be the one place where everyone in the data science process works together: it’s as powerful for PhD data scientists as it is for Business Analysts as it is for Dev Ops engineers as it is for IT professionals. Our customers include companies like GE, Unilever, Fox, Comcast, Capgemini, and many more. We raised our $101 million Series C in December 2018 with Iconiq Ventures, a preeminent VC fund known for their highly selective investment strategy. We’re growing really quickly (more than doubling every year), and we’re building out our global presence with amazing team members in France, the US, the UK, the Netherlands, and Singapore (with more locations on the way). We’re looking for really talented, smart, kind, and genuinely curious individuals to work alongside us.

To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast (having just closed a $101 million Series C round in December 2018 and looking to double in 2019), but still maintains a startup spirit. Dataiku serves its global customer base from its headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Singapore, and Sydney. Each of our offices has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes.

At Criteo, we connect 1.5 billion active shoppers with the things they need and love. Our technology takes an algorithmic approach to predict what user we show an ad to, when, and for what products. Most of all, we are creators. From designing ground-breaking products to finding unique ways to tackle technical challenges at an extraordinary scale, our tech teams work with state of the art methodologies to shape the future of advertising.

Network teams provides connectivity services allowing the company to serve advertising business, develop new products and improve existing ones.

We constantly improve our reachability over the internet, managing transit, peering, and routing optimization solutions
We develop our own reverse proxy solution, leveraging service discovery with the goal of speeding up product delivery and securing their exposition to the Internet
We are engaged in a global vendor unlocking effort by leveraging open source software and commodity hardware

The company is exposed to all possible threats of the Internet, and for sure as a Network team, we have a role to play

Rattaché au Responsable Produit Data, tu animeras l'équipe User Data Platform, composée de Data Engineers et de Data Analysts, tu deviendras le garant de notre asset Data User. L'équipe User Data Platform a comme mission d'assurer la captation et la modélisation des données des utilisateurs de nos sites et applications mobiles pour les rendre intelligibles et exploitables par les autres entités (webanalytics, business analyses, segmentation, …).

Tes missions :
Tu travailles main dans la main avec les autres équipes data (Webanalystes, Data Analystes, Data Scientists, …), avec les différents Product Managers des feature teams web et avec les équipes marketing (pub, acquisition payante, ..) pour définir les besoins de l'entreprise autour de la donnée user (analyses, alimentation d'outils de webanalyse ou de segmentation, création de reporting ou dataviz, entraînement d'algorithmes de machine learning, …)

Tu déclines ces besoins en une roadmap que tu incarnes

Tu priorises les évolutions du tracking et du datalake user au sein d'un backlog que tu fais vivre avec l'équipe et tu communiques sur l'avancement des réalisations data de l'équipe

Tu définis et faits respecter les normes et les best practices pour assurer la cohérence, la qualité et la conformité de nos datasets clefs (harmonisation des nomenclatures et des modèles de données, KPIs, conformité GDPR, …)

Quelques exemples de projets :
Constituer un référentiel utilisateur unique pour rattacher toutes les identités possibles d'un utilisateur (logué ou non logué) et définir son profil (acheteur / vendeur / loueur / investisseur ..)

Construire une "plateforme GDPR" qui permet de répondre à tous les enjeux légaux quand à la captation et le stockage de données utilisateurs (du consentement jusqu'à l'anonymisation)

Mener le déploiement d'une nouvelle solution d'analytics nécessitant d'être alimentée par de la donnée "site-centric" (DMP, Outil Analytics, …)

Les bénéfices pour toi

Tu participes à la création du patrimoine data user pour un pure player du web

Deviens full stack data ! Tu manipuleras en effet aussi bien les "données Front" (webtracking des activités de + de 30 millions d'utilisateurs mensuels) que les "données back" (CRM).
Profil recherché Le mouton à 5 pattes n'existe pas. Nous recherchons avant tout quelqu'un avec la tête bien faite et qui a envie d'apprendre :

Au moins 3 ans d'expérience dans la data avec une expérience réussie en pilotage de projets agiles

Fort team spririt et très bon communiquant(e)

Tu es orienté(e) business et tu as envie de développer une connaissance 360° des données et des KPIs (quelles données, quel usage, quelle règle de calcul…)

Tu as déjà travaillé sur des données site-centric et/ ou CRM (idéalement les deux )

Tu n'as pas peur de mettre les mains dans le cambouis et tu sais manipuler les données pour des analyses de premier niveau (SQL, Python, …)

Idéalement, tu as déjà travaillé sur des problématiques de qualité de la donnée (dictionnaires, monitoring, alerting, ...) et de conformité (GDPR)

Techniquement ? :
Tu es familier avec tout ou partie de notre stack technique :
Front: GTM, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, AT Internet, Mediaritmics, Ecosystème Adtech (AppNexus, DV 360, …), Javascript …

Back: SQL, Python, Scala, Spark, Stack AWS (S3, Redshift, ECS, Kinesis, Cloudwatch...), Datadog …

Les + de cette offre :
Un esprit collaboratif très fort

Un état d'esprit qui cultive le challenge, l'initiative, la curiosité, l'apprentissage au quotidien

Un package de rémunération attractive : salaire sur 12 mois + prime variable sur objectif + participation + intéressement + avantages

Des locaux au top au cœur de Paris avec un cadre de travail comme à la maison
Entreprise SeLoger est l'acteur qui accompagne et coache les Français tout au long de leurs projets immobiliers et à chacun de leurs mouvements de vie. De l'avant-projet à l'emménagement, SeLoger est, depuis plus de 25 ans, aux côtés des Français. Financement (SeLoger Finances), estimation (LaCoteImmo by SeLoger), déménagement, accès internet, énergie, diagnostics, assurances, résiliations, devis de travaux (SeLoger Services), sont autant de solutions proposées pour accompagner chacun sur tous les aspects de son parcours et sur tous les projets (SeLoger Neuf, SeLoger Construire, Belles Demeures, SeLoger Vacances). Avec 30 millions de visites par mois, sur tous les supports, SeLoger est la marque préférée des Français pour se repérer et se lancer dans le monde de l'immobilier. « SeLoger, avec vous quand la vie bouge ! »

Group IT - Paris (75)

description:
Cloud, Distributed & Network Products
Within IT Services organization, the Cloud, Distributed & Network Products department provides AXA with high volume data processing platforms, secure, fast and reliable connectivity and access capabilities from everywhere at any time, easy to use productivity and collaboration solutions at global scale and any device – and improve them every day.
The Technology Product Team works closely with the CIO’s of the OpCo’s and our IT Service & Operations to guide products from conception to launch.

As part of the Network Products Team, the Network Product Engineer have to define the network evolution and the engineering to transform AXA network into a level similar to Tech-Led Companies. Creation of this Network Product and transformation path are done in close collaboration with CTO and Chapter Teams. This will include the definition and management of technology solution, technical choices and the definition of the HLD / LLD on the architectures of network, telecom and network part of security technical products.
Moreover , the Network product engineer must ensure, in relation with the chapter, the pilots and the first deployment to ensure a technology transfer as fluid as possible
His/her domain of exercise is the global network including :
Core Network for Data Center
Public cloud and Internet connection and usage,
Interconnections between AXA datacenters and offices and with partners and providers
Global WAN and Regional WAN,
Overall route management,
Office Lan and building
Network services and administration (Name space and resolution, monitoring …)
In this role, the mission will be to collaborate with other AXA entities, IT Services and Operations Business Unit to develop the next generation of Network Products.
He/she will act as the Subject Matter Expert both within AXA Services and at AXA. He/she will be driving requirements, user experience and delivery for the next generation of product and the lifecycle management for the production network
Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability. And our teams are dedicated to helping our AXA entities – developers, small and large businesses and AXA partners – see the benefits ot our technology come to life
Main Activities
The Network Product Engineer is responsible to define, advertise and ensure we build sustainable, robust and secured solutions at the right cost and that bring business value to support the corporate business and lines of business strategies, in close collaboration with , Group Security Architecture , CTO and Network Chapter
For that, the main activities include the following for his/her own area of responsibility:
• Define the product value proposition and confirm the value proposition with AXA entities/markets,
• Define a medium to long term product evolution and continuous product improvement,
• Manage the advisory, selection, design, secure build & integration for the products in scope
• Provide expert guidance to management, ensuring the product line strategy is optimally aligned with business strategy,
• Facilitate communications and interactions between functional groups, AXA IT Services team members, strategic partners and vendors.

Qualifications
Attitude
The person will have to manage the complexity of a global organization operating in a decentralized organisation. Goals can only be achieved through:
Openness to different opinions and creation of consensus
Agility to constantly address new topics and new stakeholders
Embracing of the new AXA values and new ways of working with courage to promote them against tradition
Willingness to serve the overall objective of enterprise-wide consistency above any tactical goal
Tenacity and endurance for dealing with ambiguity between management, OpCos and Operational teams
Acting as a leader in collaboration and generating attractive and effective ways of working
Experience
University degree (engineer profile) with 10 years experience in Network Domain in an international and Matrix organization,
Extensive experience of animating international teams in a modern, inclusive way
Must exhibit a strong understanding of today’s Network and infrastructure challenges and trends, mostly at Infrastructure and Technical levels.
Must have experience in driving large architecture, standardization & transformation initiatives
Established and demonstrably productive technical relationships with major IT vendors
Strives for excellence with deliverables of high quality and ability to work in sometimes tight planning
Network Skills
Must have experience in driving large architecture, standardization & transformation initiatives
Established Strong expertise in Network design patterns and IT infrastructure good practices
Passion for and experience with Network/Internet connectivity/Network Security/SD Network/Cloud/Automation and Analytics technologies
Maintains deep understanding of the Network technology and market practices (competition landscape, technology trends) with very good/established level of expertise
Understands the revenue and margin impact of the Product Management role within the business
Ability to execute evolution of the enterprise architecture through strategic thinking, in addition to possessing strong business, technical, and financial acumen
Expertise in the areas of analysis, critical thinking and decision making, information systems knowledge, innovation, knowledge of emerging technology, planning, risk management, systems thinking, application rationalization/TCO, IT Security and technical problem solving
Strong skills in influence, consultation and negotiating ability
Transversal skills
Leadership – Exhibits strong results orientation, change leadership, adaptability and the ability to drive collaborative behaviour
Vision – demonstrates architectural vision and beliefs and is able to express them clearly, champion them, and debate his point of view in on-line forums or in-person workshops
Communication skills – Exhibits strong skills in listening, spoken and written communication, collaboration and the ability to work in a global team. Network Products Engineer are expected to have the ability to understand and discuss with both senior managers and IT, and explain in clear language complicated architectural concepts and strategies
Openness and reaching out – Strong human relationship skills, exhibit curiosity and can see opportunities in situations, not just problems
International profile – A proven ability to work effectively in an international environment. In addition, exhibits a strong proficiency in English

About AXA
Would you like to wake up every day driven and inspired by our noble mission and to work together as one global team to empower people to live a better life? Here at AXA we strive to lead the transformation of our industry. We are looking for talented individuals who come from varied backgrounds, think differently and want to be part of this exciting transformation by challenging the status quo so we can push AXA - a leading global brand and one of the most innovative companies in our industry - onto even greater things.
In a fast-evolving world and with a presence in 64 countries, our 166,000 employees and exclusive distributors anticipate change to offer services and solutions tailored to the current and future needs of our 103 million customers.
JOB ENVIRONMENT
Our mission at AXA is to empower people to live a better life. We have to move from a perceived payer of claims to a strong partner in life for our customers. Thus, our role as Group Operations must be to support and to empower all AXA teams in the best way to achieve together this meaningful aspiration.
The most powerful levers to achieve this can be summarized as Innovation and Execution , and will drive all Operations teams:
Innovation: To create and provide the prerequisites and opportunities for all AXA teams to develop leading innovative solutions for the needs of our current and future customers
Execution: To create an environment which allows our teams all over the world to bring their ideas to reality and make our strong promise to the customers happen
Our concrete goals are to:
Reinforce and realize our value creation for the global AXA organization;
Support and foster innovation across AXA in a close alignment and teaming with Group Business Innovation;
Embed simplicity and empowerment in our day-to-day working as well as ensure that we contribute to AXA’s mission and strategy.

What We Offer
At AXA, we lead an HR policy that encourages diversity, maintains your professional and private life balance and accelerates the skills and career development : promotion of diversity, remuneration policy, training device, ... Discover everything that makes AXA an employer of choice.
Whatever your job is, we strive to offer you career opportunities. Our goal is to develop your skills to support the transformation of our changing business.

description:
Stuart is a leading last mile delivery platform that connects small and big businesses to a fleet of geolocalised couriers. We empower thousands of companies across Europe by providing same-day delivery, next-day delivery and return solutions. We work across verticals with retailers, grocery stores, restaurants and e-commerce merchants to enable smarter transportation models.
You will play a critical role in the development of our core platform and will guide & grow our French Data Engineering team of 5 people.
The role is based in 8 avenue des Ternes 75017 Paris. The district is very lively with tons of cool restaurants and shops nearby. It’s very central and easily accessible: the Metro Ternes is 2 minutes away and the Station Charles de Gaulle Etoile is just a few blocks away.
You will report to the Head of the Data Engineering based in Barcelona, Joan. ;-) Our team is distributed across 2 locations.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Lead the Data team in Paris made currently of 5 people and help growing it to 10 people + next year
Shape a solid data infrastructure that collects, stores, processes and streams massive amounts of data in a “Fast-Data” infrastructure
Work with spatial information and build leverageable solutions that our Front-end team will use to create powerful visualizations of a city’s deliveries
Dive deep into the core of real-time service and produce high-quality code that can help answer questions from business, operations and clients
Be part of a team of 60 engineers that makes Stuart the best delivery platform for businesses in a highly competitive market
Grow with us and share: https://medium.com/stuart-engineering (you might want to read the article about Data Ops team)
Requirements
Fluency in English
7 years + of experience
Proven track record in team management
Strong Object-Oriented experience, and a true passion for writing high-quality code
Experience with API-based architecture
Experience with large scale data/ distributed systems
Benefits
Great compensation package
Good work-life balance: work from home, flexible hours, extra days off - RTT
Learning and training opportunities
Tangible career development possibilities as we grow strong
Meal vouchers - Tickets restaurant LunchR
Monthly gym allowance to use in any gym or for any sport class
Excellent family private health care
Annual company offsite – Ibiza this year!


“Logistics for a sustainable world.” That is the mission at the heart of Stuart Delivery. While customer expectations around the delivery experience are skyrocketing, cities are limiting traditional logistics methods to improve congestion, pollution and liveability. The convergence of these two trends means that a disruptive approach to last mile delivery is not a nice-to-have but rather an inevitability.
Stuart sits at the crossroads of the future, using our best-in-class proprietary dispatch technology to connect small and big businesses alike to a shared fleet of geolocalised couriers. The result? Efficient, reliable, eco-friendly delivery to help retailers to meet their customers’ demands.
We launched in 2015 with a big vision and a handful of clients. Three and a half years later, couriers on our platform complete tens of millions of deliveries annually for the biggest brands across retail, ecommerce, grocery and food.

Stuart is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We don't discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

Superviser le stockage, le traitement et l’acheminement des données produites entre les différents intervenants, qu’ils soient locaux ou distants : vérification de l’intégrité, déploiement sur kits, archivage,

Configurer et, le cas échéant, développer les outils et scripts nécessaires au traitement automatique de ces données : génération de builds, intégration continue, planification de tâches, etc.

Assurer un fonctionnement optimal des processus pour une mise à disposition des données demandées en un temps minimal.

Dialoguer avec les responsables IT pour assurer le bon fonctionnement des divers matériels impliqués dans le processus de traitement des données.

Administrer les systèmes de versioning (serveur, proxy...), les serveurs de projet et les build machines.

Déployer et maintenir les pipelines de production convenus avec les responsables d’équipes.

Faire de la veille technologique et proposer des solutions innovantes dans la gestion des données et la génération des builds.

Informer par e-mail et, quand nécessaire, réaliser une documentation technique permettant aux équipes de comprendre comment fonctionne et s'utilise un système préexistant ou nouvellement installé.
Profil recherché BAC +5 en administration des systèmes et développement informatique.

Maitrise de la programmation objet ou système (Batch, C#.NET, Python, VBScript…)

Maîtrise d’au moins un logiciel de versioning (Perforce, SVN, Mercurial, Git, etc.) aussi bien en tant qu’utilisateur qu’en tant qu’administrateur.

Expérience avérée dans au moins un système d'intégration continue (Jenkis, Bamboo, Cruise Control, Team City, etc...)

Aisance dans l’appréhension de nouveaux SDK et la programmation d’outils.

Capacité à architecturer proprement des solutions de traitement de données.

Maitrise des outils de tracking du trafic réseau.

Autonome, rigoureux, proactif et efficace.

Une bonne maitrise de l'anglais technique est indispensable à l'écrit et à l'oral.
Entreprise Avec plus de 1500 employés à travers le monde, Virtuos est l'une des plus reconnues et des plus grandes compagnies développant des jeux vidéo pour les éditeurs parmi les plus renommés (Square Enix, Warner Bros., 2K, Ubisoft, EA, Activision, Sony, Microsoft...).

Notre studio français, basé à Cergy et spécialisé dans le co-développement de jeux Xbox One, PS4 et PC, s’étoffe afin de compléter une équipe ayant déjà travaillé sur plusieurs titres remarquables, parmi lesquels

(2017),

Vampyr

(2018) et

Assassin’s Creed Liberation Remastered

(2019), ainsi que d’autres tout aussi prestigieux en développement.

Pour nos projets en cours et à venir, nous recherchons un Data Manager/Ingénieur de build motivé par la gestion des processus de build de nos productions et l’administration des données produites par les équipes de développement.
