description:
3rd Largest Communications Group Worldwide, is a global leader in marketing, communication, and business transformation.
In a world marked by increased convergence and consumer empowerment,xxxx accompanies clients through their business transformation, offering a full range of services and expertise across digital, technology, consulting, creative, corporate communications and public affairs, media strategy, planning and buying, healthcare communications and brand asset production.
Present in 108 countries, the Groupe employs more than 78,000 professionals.
Altaïr :
The deployment of an ERP (Enterprise Resources Planning), a very high-performance tool, aims to create consistent and efficient applications across our agencies on a global level, to facilitate real-time information sharing and analysis regardless of the size of the agency or its location. This project, named Altaïr (which signifies "Flying Eagle" in ancient Arabic and is also the name of the brightest star in the same constellation) is rolling out.
The Altaïr solution has been developed and piloted since Q2 2013. Parallel roll-out is running as of 2013. The solution is now deployed to Publicis entities supporting 35.000 end-users (of which 8.000 heavy users). The Altaïr solution will provide a common process and application platform for the following CORE processes:
Client set-up, Vendor set-up
Manage projects, Estimating
Manage time, Manage expenses
Purchasing & procurement
Production billing
Cash collection & credit receivables
Account payable
Inter-company
Treasury
GL
Month-end
Fixed assets
Budget forecasting
All these CORE processes are supported by extensive reporting capabilities.
The processes are run on SAP ECC6.0 (SD billing, MM purchasing, FI, CO, PS) and SAP Netweaver (Portal, PI, BI). The following project tools are in use: Solution manager, Quality center, RWD, Loadrunner.
The SAP platform is fully integrated into the Publicis application landscape: HFM for corporate reporting, TMS for treasury management and dedicated applications for Media planning and buying.
Delivery Center
In order to deliver the next versions of CORE Solution design & build and the world-wide roll-out, Publicis Groupe manages its own Altair internal Delivery Center and with a number of proven SAP experts eager to contribute to the challenges of Altaïr. We are pioneering and leading the industry in many area's and will be to first major advertising & communication group to launch a global ERP. In this challenging environment we offer a number of challenging positions in a truly global environment in the fascinating world of advertising.

Notre mission ? Primo, accompagner les jeunes talents vers la carrière où ils s'épanouiront et grâce à laquelle ils feront avancer la société, en leur donnant tous les outils nécessaires à cette réussite. Deuxio, accompagner les entreprises afin qu'elles puissent continuer à attirer les jeunes pousses pétries de potentiel en leur sein, tout en s'adaptant aux changements de paradigme qui animent nos sociétés.

Pour cela, nous avons créé un écosystème unique, réunissant ainsi 70 000 entreprises, 600 établissements d'enseignements supérieurs et 2,5 millions d'étudiants à travers le continent. On ne compte bien sûr pas s'arrêter là, et viser la lune ne nous fait pas peur (nb : chanter du Amel Bent n'est pas un pré-requis pour postuler).

Avec qui travaille-t-on ? D'un côté, la grande majorité des écoles et universités françaises (HEC, ESSEC, Dauphine, Ponts, X...) et de plus en plus d'établissements européens (ESADE, Nova, Stockholm School of Economics, London School of Business...). De l'autre, de grandes entreprises comme Orange, Décathlon ou encore Coca-Cola, mais aussi de belles PME et de supers startups. Et nous au milieu, pour construire les ponts entre les deux.

Nous rejoindre ? Pour bosser chez nous il faut : de l'envie, du souffle, des idées, et de la suite dans les idées. Mais aussi et surtout, adhérer à nos valeurs, le fameux HEAT : Humilité, Engagement, Agilité, enThousiasme.

Summary
Posted: Oct 4, 2019
Weekly Hours: 35
Role Number: 200089658
Come help us build the next generation cloud platform to support internet services across Apple. Our software provides storage at massive scale and with the highest reliability to product teams inside Apple. We are looking for a world-class Software Engineer with experience in developing large scale services and infrastructure.
Key Qualifications
A successful track-record and proven experience as a backend internet services software developer.
Proven aptitude for building, launching and operating very large-scale production internet services.
Deep knowledge of Java, Java libraries, non-blocking and thread safe programming.
Understanding of C++ libraries and JNI integration a plus.
Some exposure to structured or unstructured storage and caching.
Experience Web UI, including modern JS frameworks (e.g. React) a plus.
Knowledge of continuous integration, testing methodologies, TDD and agile development methodologies.
Open to pair programming.
Description
We are building, and supporting new, critical infrastructural systems and frameworks which provide and support services like structured and unstructured storage, caching, queueing, searching, and much more. These form the platform upon which many iCloud and other backend systems at Apple are built. The team is responsible for the next generation platform that will power Apple’s infrastructural services. These services have huge scale and store hundreds of petabytes of data. The platform will support a variety of services based on open-source software, such as Apache Cassandra, SOLR, Zookeeper, Kafka, Redis, etc. We are looking for a strong, hardworking developer to join as a member of this group. This person will have a tremendous amount of individual responsibility and influence over the direction the backend of many critical Apple internet services take for years to come. You are someone with ideas and real passion for software delivered as a service to improve reuse, efficiency, and simplicity. This engineer’s work will impact hundreds of millions of users and be essential to the success of some of the most transparent current and future Apple features.
Education & Experience
Technical BS/MS degree or equivalent work experience.
Additional Requirements
Design, build and maintain software & services to improve the feature set, availability, scalability and security of Apple's internal cloud infrastructure.
Use proven testing methodology to assure system stability and performance.
Some international travel will be required in this role.

Overview
DDN Storage is the world leader in high performance and massively scalable data management and storage solutions that accelerate business results and scientific insights for data-centric organizations worldwide. Our unified, end-to-end platform uniquely addresses the tiered storage and large-scale data management demands of mixed workloads, multiple collaborative data centers and Web and cloud environments. Across traditional and commercial high-performance markets, customers rely on DDN Storage to solve the most demanding big data problems in industries such as High-Performance Computing (HPC), Cloud, online content and social networking, security and intelligence, life sciences, finance, energy and media production.
On behalf of DDN Storage, DDN’s French subsidiary, “SAS DataDirect Networks France”, 10 Rue Andras Beck, Immeuble le Dynasteur, 92360 Meudon-La-Fôret, is looking to hire for a “CDI” (contrat à durée indéterminée) a young Linux Engineer / Software Programmer, graduating in 2019 (or recent graduate )
Even though the employeer is SAS DataDirect Network France, the role will be located in the core HPC premises of DDN’s Client, “CEA”, Bruyères le Châtel (Commissariat à l’énergie atomique et aux énergies alternatives).
Job Description
Job Description
CEA is using the Parallel File System LUSTRE for their Super-Computers and DDN Storage is powering several CEA Super-Computers instances with DDN high-performance Storage Appliances, “running” the Lustre File System.

The work is based in CEA premises located in Bruyères le Châtel.
French citizenship required for security clearance
The work is to work closely with CEA HPC Storage Staff to
Troubleshoot Lustre issues at CEA file systems in production and provide accurate and timely responses when a fix is available;
Identify, and qualify “bugs” where a “fix” is not yet available;
Escalate recurring and un-fixed issues to system developers from DDN Lustre Engineering (Whamcloud Division)
Help to back-port existing bug fixes, or provide code-fix when not available, conduct adequate code reviews with DDN and CEA.

To provide regular reports on Lustre software bug fixes progress to CEA team members and DDN supervisors.

Experience in the Linux Operating System Administration, ideally familiarity with Linux kernel internals
DDN France will provide Advanced Training on Lustre code development, prior the on-site work will start at CEA
Comfortable with the Linux command line
Experience in developing in C
Experience scripting in Python, Bash for system automation
Ideally, ability to identify and troubleshoot TCP/IP issues, other networking issues (packet loss, connections timing out / refused), firewall issues, identifying problematic / misconfigured iptables rules.
Good written communication skills in English (fluent verbal is not mandatory)
Minimum of BS or MS; computer engineering, computer science or related technical field.
Lustre Parallel File System knowledge would be a great plus.

Location: CEA, Bruyères le Châtel, France

COMPANY DESCRIPTION
SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.
SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.
ROLE DESCRIPTION
C/4 Black Belts may be assigned to assist established teams that require or will benefit from “most expert, most experienced” short-term involvement.
Target audience will include: SAP sales, SAP product, DBS project-delivery, SAP IT, DBS expert consulting and select partner led implementation teams.
Assignments will include top strategic sales opportunities (POC Design and Engineering roles), Product and Customer Innovation (first-time) projects, SAP Strategic Partner programs, SAP internal strategic initiatives (eg. SAP runs SAP) and Escalations or Critical customer engagements.
Black Belts will maintain the closest relationship between C/4 HANA Product Development and SAP consulting services teams under CX Success and Services. They will serve as a subject matter expert for the Head of Practice, Practice Lead and Business Lead for their respective solution area (eg. Commerce, Marketing, etc…). They will act as a conduit for feedback from the Field Services and Cloud Adoption Services delivery teams but will also serve as mentors forthose teams in targeted situations.
They will also serve as key contributors for best practices creation and sharing. This will be in support of customer facing materials, internally facing (such as CX Works) and content targeted for partners and the broader ecosystem / community. Black belts will work directly with the Ecosystem Enablement team on content, presentations and certifications as needed.
Deployments will range globally with an “in region” preference to optimize travel time and expense.

experience

WHAT YOU GET FROM US
Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. About
Créée en 2013, iBanFirst fournit aux entreprises une plateforme de services financiers optimisés pour l’international, en combinant expertise technologique, financière et maîtrise de la réglementation. Depuis ses débuts, iBanFirst a levé 25 millions d’euros afin de devenir le leader européen des services financiers aux entreprises qui ont une activité à l’international. Agréée par la Banque Nationale de Belgique, iBanFirst est le seul service 100% en ligne qui crée des IBANs nominatifs dans 25 devises.
Depuis sa création, iBanFirst a su convaincre 2 500 clients pour lesquels la startup a traité 100 000 transactions (presque 40 000 en 2018), pour un volume total d’un peu moins de 5 milliards d’euros (2 milliards en 2018). Aujourd’hui, l’entreprise est implantée à Paris, Bruxelles, Dijon et Anvers et compte plus de 130 employés.
Avec déjà plusieurs récompenses à son actif, iBanFirst vient d’être élue « Fintech scale-up » de l’année 2018 en Belgique et fait partie du reconnu « Technology Fast 50 » de Deloitte.

Job description
Vous intégrerez une équipe dynamique (30 personnes), structurée en plusieurs pôles (Développement, Data Science, Architecture et Produit), en pleine croissance .
Fort de son succès et pour venir renforcer l'équipe R&D de Dijon, iBanFirst recherche un(e) ingénieur QA.

En tant qu’ingénieur QA, votre rôle sera d’être le dernier rempart fonctionnel, tout en étant le stratège opérationnel mais aussi la tour de contrôle des départs en production. Dans ce cadre, vos missions seront les suivantes :
Analyser les remontées d’incident : reproductibilité, qualification, pilotage des correctifs
Définitif le périmètre des tests de non régression lié à chaque release.

Réalisation des jeux de tests (création d’outils, script SQL).
Réalisation des tests de qualification, d’intégration, uat et test de performance
Réalisation et maintenance des automates de tests.

2 ans d'expérience en qualité de testeur avec au moins 1 an sur des processus back-end.
La connaissance de codeception ou de selenium serait un gros plus
Rigoureux(se), dynamique et doté(e) d’une curiosité, d’une agilité et d’un esprit d’équipe.
Bonne capacité à s’exprimer en anglais

Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

Dataiku is looking for a Partner Solution Architect (PSA) to join our Partnerships team covering France. Since the launch of our company in 2013, we have experienced healthy growth and strong market demand. The PSA activities are due to business expansion with responsibility for managing all technical aspects of our partner relationships and working with partners to develop new solutions based on Dataiku Data Science Studio (DSS).

We’re looking for someone who can express passion about new technologies and the business benefits of AI and who can tie the value of DSS to our partners’ capabilities and GTM offerings. The PSA will engage with ecosystem partners - system integrators, consultants, value-added resellers, and complementary technology partners - at the executive and field levels to develop solution offerings that deliver value for our joint customers.
RESPONSIBILITIES
The PSA is responsible for all aspects of partner technical enablement including:
Automating and streamlining the partner on-boarding process from a technical standpoint - DSS and data science training, data science enablement and support
Developing the partners’ demo skills
Facilitating continuous partner enablement through sales and product content creation and delivery

Other responsibilities include:
Pre-sales support for partner opportunities
Support for partner marketing events
Positioning and integrating DSS with partner solutions
Leveraging our partners’ expertise to develop joint solutions and assets to accelerate go to market
Activating the Partner and Certified User community through events, workshops and webinars
Acting as a Data Evangelist to carry the company’s philosophy around Data Analytics to the market and partner ecosystem

Dataiku is a fast-growing company with great momentum and the PSA will need to work cross-functionally with Sales, Services, Marketing, and other departments to drive sustainable company growth.
QUALIFICATIONS
Native level in French with strong written, and verbal communication skills
Fluent in English
5+ years previous experience in technical role in Analytics, Business Intelligence, consulting or technology startups
Strong interest in innovative technologies like Big Data and Predictive Analytics
Coding experience (Ex. R, Python, SQL or other structured programming language)
Familiarity with data storage and computing infrastructure for data of all sizes (SQL, NoSQL, Hadoop, Spark, on-premise, and cloud)
Knowledge of machine learning libraries and techniques

Definite plus:
Excellent interpersonal skills, self-directed\motivated, and strong ability to work with various profiles (engineers, sales managers, marketers, etc.)
To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast (having just closed a $101 million Series C round in December 2018 and looking to double in 2019), but still maintains a startup spirit. Dataiku serves its global customer base from its headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Singapore, and Sydney. Each of our offices has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes.

description:
Who are we?

PayFit simplifies payroll management and HR processes for SMBs. We have built a fast, intuitive and automated SaaS solution to help business owners and HR professionals save time and money allowing them to refocus and what really matters: their employees. Through PayFit, employees have a dedicated access for their payslips and are able to manage efficiently their leave and expense requests. To build such a solution, we have created our own programming language: JetLang. Thanks to JetLang we were able to code Labour Code and collective agreements, and today we continue to add new features.

We have set ourselves a mission to support the digital transformation of HR management through our ever growing range of product features and services. We have a strong presence in France since 2015 and have been quickly growing in Germany, Spain and the UK. More than 3000 companies such as Big Mamma, MinuteBuzz or Sellsy to name a few already trust us. Over 300 PayFiters have already joined the adventure and we have raised 95M€ to keep growing.

Your role Be the Product Manager of the Automation squad, at the heart of PayFiters' efficiency

Each month, PayFit's declaration teams send more than 5000 social declarations on behalf of our clients in 4 different countries (France, Germany, Spain and the UK). We must constantly devise new solutions to help teams send declaration on time. To do this, we want to build international and scalable tools that will allow us to process an exponential number of declarations while responding to the specificities of each country: sending within deadlines, data format, connection to state agencies' APIs, etc.

A real challenge that becomes possible thanks to squad Automation. This squad has already made it possible to automate part of the generation and sending of declarations thanks to the creation of the Back Office, which is used every day by the Declaration teams. But this is only the beginning, as the company's growth will double the number of declaration sent each month starting next year.

We are looking for a Product Manager to give the Automation squad the means to support the growth of PayFit and the Declaration teams!

Your team

You will join the International Product Ops team, already composed of 3 members.
You will work daily with a team of 4 developers, including an RPA specialist in UI Path technology.
The technical team of the Automation squad is growing with 2 additional recruitments already planned for the end of 2019 !

Your missions

Understand how declarations are coded in each country using JetLang language (key of Payfit's growth)
Build a roadmap with a strategic impact on team performance
Anticipate reporting errors through new developments
Reduce the processing time of declarations in teams all over the world (France, Spain, Germany, UK,...)
Improve the daily performance of the Declarations teams
Reduce the number of manual and repetitive tasks performed by Product Builders and Declarations teams
Work hand in hand with the Data team to track the impact of developments

This job is for you if...

You have an engineering background
You have at least 1 year of experience as a Product Manager in a startup.
You are super autonomous but you also know how to work in a team
You have had successful collaborations with teams of engineers
You have strong analytical skills
You are fluent in French and English and wish to work in an international environment

What we offer ❤️

A fulfilling workspace,
An attractive remuneration,
The possibility of visiting our various offices (Paris, Berlin, Barcelona, London, etc.), teleworking days,
A gym on our premises and a Gymlib subscription with preferential rates,
A Lunchr card credited every month,
4 weeks of paternity leave (paid for by PayFit) and 20 weeks of maternity leave (paid for by PayFit),
The Alan mutual insurance company (60% covered by PayFit),
Fruit, snacks, yoga classes and other team events,
A MacBook, and all the necessary equipment to achieve your objectives.
Want to know more about our epic team?

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b0uqNUw2JIk

We are looking for passionate and innovative people who want to build the next big success story with us! Do you describe yourself with these words? Do you want to join an incredible adventure?

Tell us who you are, what you’ve done and what you want to do. We’ll be more than happy to meet you :)

description:
Faurecia is an Equal Opportunity Employer
"Technical Perfection and automotive passion" is what defines Faurecia. We design, engineer and provide the best in technology, systems and services for automobile makers in every major market on all five continents. If you share our ambition for technical perfection and our passion for all things automotive, Faurecia has a career for you.
"Faurecia, a driving force…for your professional growth."

IT at Faurecia is a key player in our ongoing strategic transformation into a “Digital Enterprise.” IT also plays a major role in guaranteeing the service and support that ensures our business succeeds in our fast-moving world.
Each day, IT teams are tackling critical challenges to help build Faurecia’s competitive advantage throughout Digital Transformation. Examples include developing mobile apps, harnessing and applying Big Data, engaging in predictive analysis, leveraging the cloud and contributing to Faurecia’s cultural shift to become a digitally advanced company. IT also plays a lead role in ensuring continuous optimization and cybersecurity of our company processes.

Our cybersecurity team within our IT Department - Group Information Systems - GIS) is looking for an Incident Response Analyst (m/f) to be based in France (Etampes or Nanterre).

The Incident Response Analyst will perform IS/IT security incident response tasks within Faurecia’s Security Incident Response team (Level 3 SOC). This analyst will work closely with the Security Incident and Response Manager. This analyst shall also work with Faurecia’s partners, who typically perform Level 1 and 2 SOC tasks. He/she shall also contribute to enhance all documentation and procedures and suggest all necessary technical improvements to ensure proper responsiveness and efficiency of the team.

Principal Duties and Responsibilities
Detect and respond to IS/IT security threats within our global corporate landscape, be it production, development or datacenter environments
Execute on incident response plans, identify root cause and drive mitigations to prevent future occurrences
Operate on all necessary technologies to identify and respond to IS/IT threats (in particular but not limited to our SIEM)
Request necessary actions and follow up upon execution to other IT teams
Mentor and provide guidance to IT colleagues on response best practice
Identify and execute on projects that improve our intrusion detection and incident response capabilities
Refine incident response procedures. Improve existing and create new investigation & remediation workflows - automation, context and orchestration as code
Be part of Faurecia’s first line of defense. We handle active security events and cutting-edge threats from a variety of sources, you could be part of a 24/7 on call rotation
Assist in mitigating future threats and closing gaps through analysis of recurring incident trends - maintain incident metrics and assist in reporting to leadership

The ideal candidate will have/be:
Education and experience
“Cyber Security” relevant University degree
3 – 5 years of experience in the field of Cyber Security
Basic understanding and experience in IS/IT Security Incident Response and associated best practices
Experience in identifying, analyzing, scoping, isolating and eradicating malware or hacking threats
Understanding of the current threat landscape and adversary tactic, techniques and procedures
Knowledge of enterprise-scale security technologies and capabilities including SIEM, incident management (MISP), threat intelligence, full packet capture, protocol analysis/NetFlow usage, network and system monitoring and logging, malware analysis, firewalling / network filtering, IDS/IPS
Capacity to understand, design and enhance incident response processes
Strong knowledge in Linux, Windows, and network equipment’s operation
Basic knowledge in cloud technologies
Basic knowledge in OS X operating systems
Basic knowledge of network and host-based forensic methodologies, user behavioral analysis and other AI/ML oriented cyber security technologies
Experience in crisis management or legal constraints applicable to this role is a plus
Scripting skills are a plus
Key competencies
Stress tolerance
Methodology, rigor
Curiosity
Strong written and oral communication skills
Team work / Cross-functional orchestration skills
Ability to distinguish the various data confidentiality levels, to protect enterprise secrets
Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills
Flexibility
Languages
English: fluent
French and/or German is a plus

description:
Job Category
Products and Technology
Job Details
Salesforce is the #1 in CRM in the world, and best known as the Customer Success Platform. As an industry leader in Sales, Service, and Marketing, we have some of the most unique data sets in the world.
Salesforce is looking for data scientists with hands on experience transforming unique data into amazing products. At scale. You will have access to an enormous amount of high-value business activity data, including unstructured and semi-structured records, with a focus on information retrieval.

You will be working with a group of world-class data scientists and engineers who have years of experience in information retrieval. They aim at driving product strategy with data-driven insights.
We are a team with diverse technical backgrounds who share a passion for problem-solving, new technologies, and learning. We love to learn and teach and help each other, and we are looking for people with a collaborative attitude and openness to others' ideas.

A typical day for you might include some of the following:
Develop machine learning software and statistical data models that can generalize across hundreds of thousands of Salesforce customers, but can automatically adapt to each of their individual features.
Define Business Metrics of features, design feature Experiments (AB or other relevant methods) and evaluate success
Work with fellow engineers to build out other parts of the infrastructure, effectively communicating your needs and understanding theirs.
Build data pipelines using cutting edge technologies like Hadoop, Pig, Hive, HBase, Spark. Query Hadoop/Hive to prepare data-sets
Revamp prototypes to create production-ready data flows.
Harness operational excellence & continuous improvement with a can do leadership attitude.
Work with fellow engineers to build out other parts of the infrastructure, effectively communicating your needs and understanding theirs.
Enjoy the energy of a friendly office with a trailblazer culture.
Participate in meal conversations with your team members about really important topics, such as: Should the cuteness of panda bears be a factor in their survivability? Is love a decision tree or a regression model? How far ahead would society be today if we had 12 fingers instead of 10?
What we care about:
You have industry experience with writing code (e.g. SQL, Python, R, Spark) and analyzing large data sets with a customer mindset. Preference for 5+ years of experience. This is not an entry level / new college graduate role.
You have to love data - we do. We are looking for people who are excited about different and unique data sets, and all the ways that they could be used in order to improve user experience.
You take decisions based on data. Your judgments are based on bullet-proof statistical analysis. You exemplify the data-driven mindset.
Qualifications:
You share our values: Trust, Customer Success, Innovation and Equality
Experience presenting insights to executives and non-technical audiences around product analytics data and models
Proven knowledge with applied statistics and probability/ predictability data outputs
Proven record of applying data science methods to business problems
You are passionate about automating everything and applying scientific methods to solve business and engineering requirements
Can thrive in team environments; using agile methodology and interacting with Product Leaders, Scientists and Engineers to solve technology’s greatest challenges
Learn quickly in a fast-paced, dynamic team environment
Completed a Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degree related to Computer Science, Statistics or related major studying AI (artificial intelligence), ML (machine learning), NLP (natural language processing), Data Science or Mathematics
Preferred Qualifications:
MA/MS or PhD degree in computer science, artificial intelligence, machine learning, speech recognition, natural language processing, or related technical field.
Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages including but not limited to: Java, Scala, or Python.

Within the Dailymotion’s AdTech department, we are looking for a new intern to join the Business Operations & Analytics team, in our Paris office. The team’s mission statement is to drive growth, deliver insights & scale efficiency for the AdTech, Sales & Content tribes.

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES

WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU

UI/UX Designer (Paris)
Consensys - Paris (75)
date_publication:
il y a 30 jours

Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
About ConsenSys

ConsenSys is a venture production studio and the leading global blockchain technology firm. Our mission is to transform the emerging economic, social, and political operating systems of the planet by building and scaling applications, disruptive startups, and enterprise software products empowered by decentralized technology, specifically Ethereum. If you are someone that thrives in a fast-paced environment where being self-directed, determined, and resilient are a requirement, we would love for you to join us.

About CoFi OS

CoFi OS is a technology stack developed by ConsenSys, partly open sourced, and compatible with all projects related to financial assets. CoFi OS enables the issuance, management and transfer of "tokenized" financial assets in a completely secure way, and in compliance with regulations in an automated manner. CoFi OS was designed to be compliant with financial market requirements, including the European market. It proves to be a particularly relevant technology for the "tokenization" of non-listed shares, specifically the shares of Venture Capital funds, Private Equity funds, or the shares of real estate investment companies.

The "tokenization" of financial assets delivers important benefits for investors and issuers:

Operational efficiency: simplification and reduction of costs related to the issuance, management and transfer of assets.
Market expansion: broaden potential investor base through a simpler acquisition process and lower minimum entry tickets.
Additional features: opening/simplification of a secondary market, and easier transmission of information between issuers and investors.
Interoperability is a major challenge in the context of "tokenization," as only a solution for issuing generic financial assets that is compatible with a maximum number of blockchain platforms can facilitate adoption.

The interoperability of CoFi OS is based on:
An open-source standard specifically designed for financial assets (ERC1400), shared and reviewed by the Ethereum community, and backward compatible with the most widely used standard (ERC20).
Combination of Ethereum private networks (to meet the challenges of scalability, privacy, and finality of transactions) and the public network (for interoperability) with the ability to transfer securities from one network to another in a secure manner.
Using Ethereum blockchain technology, that today has the largest developer community in the world (+400K).
About the role

ConsenSys is looking for a UI/UX Designer to help drive new products in the Digital Asset space. As UI/UX Designer, you will be responsible for

Leading a collaborative design process from conception to launch: partner with small, global teams of engineers, product managers, and researchers to identify user needs, define product strategy, and create roadmaps
Develop storyboards, prototypes, and high-fidelity visual design to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas
Actively give and solicit feedback from other designers in order to continually raise the bar for quality
Evangelize design and product thinking methodology
Fearlessly take on highly complex problem areas and then publish what you learn
Grow a design team as products mature
Job requirements
Required

You have 2-4+ years of experience working as a product designer on agile teams
Experience working with product design tools like Figma, Sketch, InVision, Principle for Mac, Flinto, Framer, Whimsical, or similar
You have solved complex problems with an elegant, shipped product—evidenced in an online portfolio featuring end-to-end product design
You demonstrate product vision and use data and experimentation to provide product direction.
While you may not have a branding or marketing background, you understand customer experience and the relationship between brand and product design
You're excellent at articulating design decisions, presenting to clients or stakeholders
You're effective at prototyping at varying levels of fidelity
You demonstrate solid leadership skills and an ability to develop strong partnerships with product managers and engineers
A strong portfolio that contains not just final solutions, but the iterative artifacts which demonstrates your thinking, as well as your role within that process
Bonus points for

You're interested in or have experience with decentralized applications and blockchain
You're interested in or have experience designing for financial applications
Willing to travel occasionally to meet global clients or conduct research
You have experience at both large organizations and start-ups
You are able to facilitate design thinking workshops
You enjoy some amount of ambiguity and freedom to experiment
You've built or worked with design systems
You have experience animating interactions and UI elements
You have front-end development experience
Other skills to demonstrate

Excellent verbal and written communication in French and English
Teamwork, flexibility, initiative, communication and organisation
Willingness to constantly learn & improve, challenging yourself to stay at the top of your game
Why join ConsenSys?
Here are some of the perks of being part of a unique organization like ConsenSys

The forefront of a revolution. At ConsenSys we fundamentally believe that a next generation of technologies presents the opportunity to create a more just and equitable society. We believe that there is an opportunity to bring the remaining 2 billion unbanked people into the global economy and to radically transform our society for the enrichment of humankind
A dynamic startup environment. ConsenSys is a thought leader in the blockchain space and we are absorbing a significant portion of the mindshare. This is both exciting and challenging, as we learn to scale our organization while adhering to the principles of decentralization
Deep technical challenges. This entire ecosystem is less than 10 years old. Ethereum itself is still a toddler. There is much to be done before these platforms can scale to the order of millions or billions of users. ConsenSys is building the technology platforms that can get us to those next thresholds of scale
Continuous learning and improvements. You'll be constantly exposed to new concepts, ideas and frameworks from your peers and as you work on different projects -- challenging you to stay at the top of your game
ConsenSys was named a Top 100 FinTech company by KPMG's 2016 Fintech Innovators report
A few important things to know

Some travel could be required. Projects may be on client sites, so our team members need to be flexible and up for travel. We do our best to take people's personal situations into account, but we know it's not for everyone
To apply for a role at our Paris office, you need to live in Paris and speak French fluently. If you do not meet these criteria, we are certainly able to find another role for you at ConsenSys

description:
Safran est un groupe international de haute technologie opérant dans les domaines de la propulsion et des équipements aéronautiques, de l'espace et de la défense. Implanté sur tous les continents, le Groupe emploie plus de 92 000 collaborateurs pour un chiffre d'affaires de 21 milliards d'euros en 2018. Safran occupe, seul ou en partenariat, des positions de premier plan mondial ou européen sur ses marchés. Pour répondre à l'évolution des marchés, le Groupe s'engage dans des programmes de recherche et développement qui ont représenté en 2018 des dépenses totales d'environ 1,5 milliard d'euros.

Safran est classé dans le Top 100 Global Innovators de Thomson Reuters ainsi que dans le palmarès « Happy at work » des sociétés où il fait bon vivre. Le Groupe est en 4ème position du classement Universum des entreprises préférées des jeunes ingénieurs en France.

Les données sont partout chez Safran et le Big Data est un levier de croissance pour améliorer les performances du groupe et lui permettre de développer de nouvelles activités. Safran Analytics a pour mission d'accompagner les sociétés du groupe Safran dans la création de valeur à travers l'exploitation de leurs données.

Les locaux de Safran Analytics s'étendent sur 1500 m2, et ont été conçus en collaboration avec les collaborateurs. Résolument novateurs, ces lieux ont été pensés pour encourager la m, créativité, le transfert de compétences et l'innovation : Data Lab, Quiet Room, salle de conférence pour exposer librement de nouveaux sujets, Creative Room,…

Safran est classé dans le Top 100 Global Innovators de Thomson Reuters ainsi que dans le palmarès « Happy at work » des sociétés où il fait bon vivre. Le Groupe est en 4ème position du classement Universum des entreprises préférées des jeunes ingénieurs en France.

Le groupe SAFRAN recherche pour sa direction Safran Analytics un Ingénieur Ops au sein d'une équipe DevOps.
Vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec nos Software Engineers, Data Engineers, Data Scientists, et Experts Plateforme. Vous serez intégré(e) à une équipe de développement produits / services et vos missions seront :
Manager les infrastructures des produits / services: gestion des VMs et containers, gestion des comptes utilisateurs, des groupes de sécurité, création de load-balancer, Bases de données, mise à jour du socle…
Assurer le bon fonctionnement des produits / services (performance, automatisation, suivi opérationnel…)
Etre en capacité de garantir le bon fonctionnement et l'exploitabilité des développements (Code Review, Merge Requests)
Assistance en architecture logicielle :
Facilité d'exploitation
Robustesse d'implémentation
Implémenter les nouveaux outils (supervision, API Management…)
Documenter les évolutions apportées
Pourquoi venir chez nous?

Vous travaillerez sur des produits / services Data Aero pour un grand groupe, tout en intégrant une équipe technique dynamique à taille humaine travaillant sur des technologies à l'état de l'art, pour délivrer des produits / services Data innovants.
Linux : Redhat, Alpine, Docker (y compris Swarm), Openshift
Supervision : Prometheus, Grafana
BDD : MongoDB, PostgreSQL

Scripting Shell
Principes d'architecture : Micro-Services avec Api REST, Datalake
Kubernetes
Gitlab

Capacité d'adaptation, résistance au stress et changement, Gestion de la complexité (organisation)

description:
Après une intégration sur mesure vous permettant d’appréhender dans tous les domaines le rôle de chargé(e) de recrutement au sein de Quantmetry, votre travail consistera à :

Identifier et contacter par approche directe tous candidats passionnés par les sujets Data (LinkedIn, Git, Stack Overflow) ;
Participer aux entretiens et suivre le candidat dans sa réflexion jusqu’à la signature de son contrat ;
Gérer l’accueil et l’intégration des nouveaux entrants ;
Participer à divers chantiers RH (Participation à la stratégie RH, élaboration de KPIs, développement de la marque employeur et des relations écoles, participation au chantier d'Onboarding , etc...)
Vous êtes persuadé(e) que le rôle de recruteur(euse) est capital pour une entreprise ? Que l’IA n’est pas qu’un simple buzz word pour impressionner tonton lors du repas de Noel ? Alors n’hésitez pas à rejoindre notre Team RH !

P.S : Désolé nous n’avons pas de baby-foot par contre nous avons une vraie salle de sieste et de très jolis locaux dans le 8e à Paris.
Profil recherché Rassurez-vous, nous ne recherchons pas la licorne à 5 pattes (nous avons pu vérifier scientifiquement qu’elle n’existait pas). Nous souhaitons intégrer une personne qui saura faire face à des défis majeurs pour organiser et structurer la croissance de Quantmetry à travers le recrutement mais également ses chantiers RH. Aussi quelques prérequis sont nécessaires :

Formation supérieure de type Bac+4/+5 (de préférence) : de type écoles de commerces, Masters RH, Universités, IAE..
Une expérience de **2 ans minimum dans un contexte de recrutement à forte volumétrie sur des profils IT/Data **(ESN, cabinet de conseil par exemple) car nous recrutons toute l’année,
Un esprit d’équipe et une force de conviction aussi dures que le roc, car oui, recruter dans le monde de la Data n’est pas de tout repos, c’est un vrai challenge !
Une appétence pour les sujets techniques
Entreprise Qui sommes-nous ?

Nous pourrions commencer en nous présentant comme un des leaders sur le marché international du conseil en data, avec un chiffre d’affaires défiant ceux des G.A.F.A. Mais non. Nous préférons mettre en avant notre cadre de travail, nos réussites et surtout nos consultants. Allez venez, c’est par là…

Quantmetry, c’est un chiffre d’affaires de plus de 8 millions d’euros pour 2018 et plus d'une centaine personnes qui travaillent de concert pour accompagner nos clients dans leurs réflexions, P.O.C., industrialisation autour de la Data, l’Intelligence Artificielle, le Machine Learning et le Big Data. Nous sommes un cabinet de conseil pure player en Data s’adressant à de grands comptes (BPCE, Crédit Agricole, Swiss Life, PSA, Safran, Orange, EDF, SNCF…) sur plusieurs secteurs avec des problématiques diverses et variées (voici une liste non-exhaustive) :

La maintenance prédictive,
La segmentation clients, la détection de churn,
La détection de fraude, de corruption, de blanchiment d’argent,
Le développement des architectures de plateformes Data,
L’analyse de textes et d’images médicales.
Quantmetry

est un cabinet de conseil spécialisé en

IA

. Depuis 2011, Quantmetry accompagne des grands groupes français dans leur transformation data grâce à une approche de bout en bout et une équipe pluridiscplinaire : Business consultant, Data Scientist, Big Data Engineer. La R&D est un volet important pour Quantmetry afin de rester toujours à l’état de l’art des expertises en Data Science et Data Engineering.

Quantmetry, réalise une

croissance très importante

(près de

100 collaborateurs aujourd’hui)

. Ce qui différencie Quantmetry de ses concurrents est le niveau d’expertise de ses salariés (formation académique, process de recrutement exigeant, 20% de R&D, etc.) et un positionnement premium (TACE faible pour un cabinet de conseil mais TJ élevé).

Quantmetry a développé une culture fondée sur le management par les valeurs : Esprit d’Équipe, Excellence, Exceptionnalité et Accomplissement.

Quantmetry a également crée un start-up studio, Anova, afin de pouvoir financer des projets porteurs de propriété intellectuelle.

description:
Société : Varonis SystemSummary

The Account Manager is responsible for selling and presenting Varonis’ products and services to current and net-newprospective enterprise accounts.

The Varonis Account Managerwill be aligned with a local Sales Engineer. The goal, as a team, will be to build a strong business justification to the end-user, while ensuring that the given annual quota is met/exceeded.

Responsibilities

Prospect and identify key decision makers within the targeted leads.
Present and sell Varonis’ products and services to current and potential clients.
Follow up on leads and referrals resulting from field activity, while maintaining and expanding the database of contacts within the targeted organizations.
Uphold sales activities which includes prospecting, cold calling, booking appointments, performing demos, and creating proposals.
Present to C-Level prospective clients as well as to resellers through effective and enticing product demonstrations.
Partner with Sales Managers and Channel Managers to determine a strategic sales approach.
Establish and maintain current customer relationships by responding to customer requests and managing/resolving customer issues.
Support the reseller communication channel throughout the sales process.
Maintain accurate account information and activity detail in Customer Relationship Management system (CRM).
Participate in marketing events such as seminars and trade shows when necessary.
Percent of travel varies by territory.
Requirements

Bachelor’s Degree from a four-year College/University OR 5+ years of business-to-business sales experience/training OR equivalent combination of education and experience.
Technology industry experience preferred.
Microsoft Dynamics and Microsoft Outlook skills preferred.
Prior experience selling security software products through use of channel partners.
Strong communication and presentation skills.
Healthy list of pre-established and prospective contacts in given territory.
Willingness to learn technical aspects of selling the Varonis product.
Competencies

To perform this job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies:

Achievement Focus: Demonstrates persistence and overcomes obstacles; recognizes and acts on opportunities; sets and achieves challenging goals; takes calculated risks to accomplish goals.
Sales Skills: Achieves sales goals; initiates new contacts; maintains customer satisfaction; maintains records and promptly submits information; overcomes objections with persuasion and persistence.
Sense of Urgency: Displays a matter of utmost urgency; understands the importance of making critical business decision in a timely manner with strong attention to detail; realization that efficiency and prioritization is critical to success.
Customer Service: Manages difficult or emotional customer situations; meets commitments; responds promptly to customer needs; solicits customer feedback to improve service.
Problem Solving: Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; gathers and analyzes information skillfully; develops alternative solutions.
Written Communications: Edits work for spelling and grammar; presents numerical data effectively; varies writing style to meet needs; writes clearly and informatively.
Oral Communication: Demonstrates group presentation skills; listens and gets clarification; responds well to questions; speaks clearly and persuasively.
Adaptability: Adapts to changes in the work environment; manages competing demands; changes approach or method to best fit the situation; able to deal with frequent change, delays, or unexpected events.
Planning/Organizing: Prioritizes and plans work activities; uses time efficiently; plans for additional resources; sets goals and objectives; develops realistic action plans.

description:
Pourquoi Yanport ?
Yanport, depuis sa création, poursuit l'objectif de centraliser, consolider, et exploiter les données immobilières. Forte de sa culture technique, la société est devenue un des leaders du marché de la donnée, et accompagne au quotidien les professionnels grâce à ses solutions et son entrepôt de données unique.
Confiant dans l’avenir et en pleine croissance, Yanport cherche à renforcer ses équipes et prône un management centré sur l’humain favorisant le bien-être de chacun. Nous souhaitons passer le cap de jeune startup innovante à celui d’entreprise responsable et durable sur le long terme.
Descriptif du poste
Nous recherchons notre futur responsable Data Engineer, en lien direct avec l’équipe technique, la future recrue sera le garant de la qualité de la donnée dans tout son cycle de vie, de sa collecte par nos scrappers, en passant par nos algorithmes de traitement, jusqu’à sa restitution via notre APIet nos applicatifs.
« Il nous faut une personne qui ait touché à de la Big Data, fait de la mise en production d’algorithme sur des millions de données. Être Data Engineer ce n’est pas juste pusher un algo, il faut aussi monitorer et prendre du recul pour améliorer la donnée de façon continue » (Clément Lardeur - CTO)
Ainsi vos principales fonctions, par rapport à notre roadmap, seront les suivantes :
Détection de bruits / anomalies dans les données
Amélioration des algorithmes de matching et de similarités d’annonces immobilières (NLP)
Conception et prototypage de modèles d’analyse de prix et de durées de vente
Renforcement et amélioration de nos référentiels géographiques (intégration des parcels)
Matching des quartiers Iris avec des GeoJson d’annonces (Polygon, Cercle, …)
Renforcement de la fiabilité de nos indicateurs grâce à des modèles statistiques
Notre responsable Data devra donc avoir un bon dosage de compétences : à la fois techniques en Data Engineering (Java, Python, R, Monitoring) et des compétences dans la capacité à comprendre et à intégrer les problématiques Maths / Eco (régression linéaire, modèle probabiliste, ...).
Stack : Java, Python, Cassandra, Elasticsearch, Google Cloud Platform, Jenkins, Kibana, Grafana, Github

Expérience de 3 à 5 ans minimum, avec idéalement, une expérience significative dans la Data
Vous aimez maîtriser les données que vous traitez pour répondre aux enjeux métiers
Vous êtes sensible à la qualité du code pour réaliser des algorithmes robustes et maintenables
Vous serez amené à manager une équipe Data à moyen terme (1-2 personnes)

description:
Passionate about tech? Interested in Energy? Come work for Kayrros, a fast-growing start-up using artificial intelligence to transform the world’s biggest industry.
Kayrros is headquartered in Paris, with offices in New York, Houston, London, and Singapore. By working for Kayrros, you will join an energetic team of 100 people, with diverse professional backgrounds—from data science and petroleum engineering to sales and marketing—and over 15 different nationalities and 10 spoken languages.
Our team of energy experts and tech wizards are working to bring transparency to the global energy market. We employ innovative technologies, like satellite imagery processing and artificial intelligence, to capture and analyse data across the energy sector. Combined with our expert analysis, we give our clients valuable information on global market movements to make better business decisions—whether that’s trading, investing or managing their operations.
In September 2018, Kayrros received €21M in Serie B funding to continue breaking the boundaries of the energy market.
Interested in operating at the intersection of energy and the data revolution? Get in touch!
We are currently recruiting for our Paris office,
a Junior Data Engineer M/F (6 months)
Data Engineers play a central role in Kayrros. Working hand in hand with Data Scientists and Energy Analysts they gather and process raw data at scale and work closely with Software Engineers to integrate innovations and algorithms into our production system.
As a data engineer, you will therefore have to:
Convert prototypes into reliable products
Architect, build and test industry-grade data pipelines
Provide technical support to Data Scientists during exploratory analysis
Work closely with computer vision researchers to integrate and scale their algorithms
Evaluate performance and optimize all parts of the stack
Continuously provide ideas to improve products
Technology stack
Languages: Python, Java, C
Tools : Message brokers (RabbitMQ, Kafka), traitement de la donnée (Sci-kit learn, Pandas), imagerie (Rasterio, Gdal, Fiona…), tests (Unittest...)
Stack data: Hadoop (Apache Spark, Hbase…), Elasticsearch...
Infrastructure: Docker, Rancher, OpenIO, Gitlab...
Profile
This is an ideal opportunity if you are looking for a six-month contract starting immediately and you want to join a fast-growing start-up.
Strong Python 3 Engineer able to write reusable, testable and efficient code and coach others in doing so
Passion and proven record building data pipelines with an emphasis on software engineering, software architecture, code quality, best practices
You are dynamic, curious and eager to learn about the energy industry
You can work in a fast-paced environment
You can communicate clearly in English, including with non-technical people
You are willing to contribute actively and have a real impact to the company success
You can easily work in an UNIX environment
Optionally: experience with some components of our current stack: Spark, Docker, Elasticsearch, Pandas, Scikit-learn
Why joining Kayrros?
We are a young, fast-growing tech company and are extremely passionate about what we do.
We are located in the WeWork building on Rue la Fayette, 75009 (free drinks, events and a vibrant atmosphere).
You will work with an international team and practice your English (or Chinese, German, Swedish, Portuguese...) on a day to day basis.

The whole process will last one month at the maximum.

OpenClassrooms lance fin octobre une formation intitulée AI Engineer, en partenariat avec Microsoft. Cette collaboration permettra ainsi aux étudiants d’accéder aux compétences recherchées en IA et de se qualifier pour des emplois techniques.

Plateforme d’éducation en ligne leader en Europe, OpenClassrooms place l’innovation pédagogique au service de l’éducation pour tous avec plus de deux millions de membres.

Pourquoi devenir mentor ?
Partager vos connaissances : vous avez un impact clair et direct sur la vie de vos étudiants qui sont souvent en reconversion professionnelle.
Travailler en toute flexibilité : les mentors travaillent quand ils veulent, selon leurs disponibilités. Vous pourrez accompagner 1, 2 ou 10 étudiants, à vous de voir ! La formation a lieu entièrement en ligne.
Développer votre expérience : les mentors apprennent autant que leurs étudiants. Vous serez guidés par notre équipe ; un cours vous permettra d'acquérir toutes les compétences nécessaires : Devenez mentor sur OpenClassrooms . Vous pourrez aussi travailler en réseau avec les autres mentors.
Vous former : OpenClassrooms met à votre disposition plusieurs parcours et de nombreux cours afin de contribuer à votre développement de compétences.

Vous rencontrerez chaque étudiant en visioconférence une fois par semaine pour une session en ligne de 45 minutes. Vous le guiderez dans toutes les étapes de son acquisition de compétences, en vous appuyant sur le parcours de formation, en route vers l'obtention de son diplôme !

DS Fundamentals - Exploratory Data Analysis ( Azure Text Analytics Cognitive Services, Python + Data Science libraries)
ML Fundamentals - Classic ML models
Advanced ML - Unstructured Data Preprocessing (Azure app Services)
Advanced ML - Deep Learning (Azure ML services, Python NLP/CV librairies)
AI Product Deployment (Azure Databricks, Cloud)
AI Project management
Vous êtes à l’écoute et savez rassurer et accompagner dans la bonne direction
Vous êtes disponible au minimum 1h/semaine pour accompagner 1 étudiant. Vous pouvez augmenter le rythme par la suite : si vous choisissez d'avoir 10 étudiants, cela vous occupera donc 10h/semaine.
Vous avez réalisé le cours Devenez mentor sur OpenClassrooms qui répondra à toutes vos questions sur le mentorat.

Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect.

The Field Sales Engineer is responsible for the territory business growth strategy and execution in collaboration with a variety of field, distribution and factory resources. Best-in-class, real-time responsiveness is a passion of this FSE. A key element of this role is management of relationships at all levels of the customer. Additionally, the FSE is a strong and influential advocate for customers within Analog Devices.
The territory to be covered includes a blend of existing and emerging customers. The FSE’s sales strategy determines the right combination of these necessary for long term, sustainable and profitable growth. Customer relationships at ADI are measured in years and decades.
The size of the territory will require regular overnight travel to maximise efficiency of time and opportunity.
The ideal candidate will have a strong knowledge of the semiconductor marketplace ideally with existing relationships that can be leveraged into this role.
The Field Sales Engineer must have electronics technology competence to discuss system level architectural as well as influence circuit level component choice decisions and how these benefit the customer. The FSE will collaborate closely with a territory Field Applications Engineer; proven success in team environments is a must.
Additionally, the FSE should be comfortable with high-level business concepts as is often necessary for conversations with customer & ADI executives. The FSE ultimately runs the business in his/her territory.
Work with ADI Distribution demand creation partners, to develop the core market business within an assigned territory.
Total management of the pipeline of new business opportunities generated by our Distributors in the Territory. Responsibilities will include approval / rejection of registrations, monitoring the progress of key opportunities by value, distributor and focus market segments. Technical capability to challenge and understand information being presented is necessary.
There is an expectation of technical customer meetings jointly with ADI channel partners.
FSE should be a confident presenter and coordinate and support seminars and customer technical lunch and learn days

Desired Skills and Experience
Degree in Electronic Engineering or equivalent experience.
5 years of related experience in a variety of sales environments, preferably a technical sales role.
A mix of technical and commercial experience and competence.
Proven ability to achieve sales targets and develop new business.
Excellent negotiation and presentation skills.
Experience in both direct sales and collaboration with channel partners is desired.
Analog Devices product knowledge or any relevant analogue design expertise would be an advantage.

description:
Nous, c’est papernest.
Nous avons un rêve, celui d’un monde sans paperasse. Un monde où les phobiques administratifs comme nous vivent enfin protégés de l'angoisse du formulaire et des majorations pour retard de paiement.
Par contre, on ne va pas te mentir, il y a du boulot. C’est pourquoi nous cherchons des personnes investies, créatives et hyper enthousiastes comme toi pour nous accompagner dans l’aventure.
Car depuis 2015, nous n’avons pas chômé. Avec 3.5 millions de déménagements par an en France, et 76% des Français qui se disent stressés par l’événement, nous avons décidé d’attaquer le sujet en commençant par cette opportunité-là. Résultat : nous avons créé la seule plateforme qui permette de transférer tous ses contrats lors d’un déménagement, 100% gratuitement, 100% en ligne. A l’heure où nous soufflons notre 4ème bougie, nous sommes plus de 200 collaborateurs, avons accompagné plus de 200 000 utilisateurs, et avons ouvert un bureau à Barcelone.
Nous voyons les choses en grand : une équipe bouillonnante d'idées aux quatre coins du globe, un avenir où notre entière vie administrative est mise à portée de clic.
Pour relever ces défis, nous recrutons un(e) Data Manager.
Tes missions
Rattaché au Directeur Marketing & Commercial, tu as un rôle et une équipe transverses (Data, Marketing, Produit, Tech). Tu seras en charge de :
la réalisation de projet data (e.g., algo bidding, algo scoring, algo conversion probabilities, synchronisation CRM<>BI, ...)
la collecte et du stockage de la donnée (archi business, tagging, )
son organisation (naming, mise à disposition vis à vis des équipes via les outils pertinents)
la réponse aux besoins et objectifs métiers par l'analyse de la donnée (produit, SEA, CRM, SEO...)
Ce poste, stratégique et très ambitieux, couvre plusieurs activités/métiers : data analyse, data client, web-analyse et data science.
Requirements
Rôle et Périmètre
Partenaire business "architecture"
Compréhension de l'architecture data actuelle ; problem solving avec les équipes tech pour optimiser la "tool stack" (quels outils pour quels besoins, quels outils sont nécessaires...)
Collecte des données (pertinence de la collecte, modalités, stockage...)
Tu es le partenaire business des data engineers mais ne les remplace pas
Product Owner
Gestion de projets avec impacts data importants (e.g., algo conversion, algo sdu début du projet à la mise en oeuvre (identification, structuration, specs, développement quand pertinent, recette, mise en prod, ..)
Centralisation et planification des demandes venant des différentes équipes pour les sprints de data analyse et data engineering

Responsabilité des nomenclatures et de leur pertinence / respect / fiabilité

Après analyse des parcours clients, tu conçois le plan de taggage et est le/la garant(e) de la fiabilité des données remontées (recette de l'implémentation du taggage, analyse fonctionnelle...)
Tu mets en place les outils & process pour que la fiabilité des données soit continuellement améliorée (tracking back-end, parsing, alertes...)
Analyses et Uses Cases marketing/ produit / sales
A/B testing, parcours clients, tunnel d'achat, repeat, segmentation client..
Analyse des canaux d'acquisition (SEO, SEA, ...)
Analyse Performance commerciales avec SalesOps
Analyse des modèles d'attribution (first clic, last clic, 30j/7j/1j etc)
Management/ coordination
Management d'équipe (5 pers: 1 mgr, 4 data analyst)
Mise en place d'une gouvernance sur la donnée : coordination
Montée en compétences des autres équipes : formation, process

Profil recherché
Doté(e) d'une excellente compréhension business, tu dois également maîtriser les problématiques techniques (par ex. éviter la multiplication des outils ayant besoin des mêmes données, limiter les appels à des tables déjà très sollicités ; maîtriser les langages utilisés : SQL pour les requêtes, JavaScript simple pour les plans de taggage, la connaissance de python est un plus...).
Cet intérêt pour les sujets techniques te permettra ainsi de trouver les meilleurs solutions avec l'équipe tech pour répondre aux questions business.
3-10 ans d'expérience avec une forte expertise sur la structuration et l’analyse de données business et techniques
Top école d'ingénieur. Profil Top Ecole de commerce étudié si connaissance techniques.
Connaissance de l'écosystème marketing & tech (outils, technos, ...). Tu maîtrises idéalement certains des outils
Excellente maîtrise analytique et technique (compétences analytiques, maîtrise de SQL)
Excellente capacité de structuration, de problem solving et à l'aise en gestion de projet
Capacité à mêler vision stratégique et problem solving opérationnels et techniques
Dynamique, rigoureux et autonome, tu aimes le travail en équipe et est à l’aise au sein d’une équipe cross-fonctionnelle
Anglais courant.
Appétence et capacité à progresser dans ton rôle de manager
Au délà du SQL, des connaissances voire un maîtrise de python est un vrai plus
Benefits

Pour avoir de l’autonomie, de l’impact et relever de vrais challenges
Occuper un poste à responsabilités qui est clé pour le développement de l’entreprise
Relever des challenges techniques
Travailler au contact d’équipes motivées, dynamiques et engagées


Ton Manager
Tu sera rattaché/e à Quentin, notre Chief Marketing & Sales Officer. Il a déjà traversé la Manche en pleine tempête, et de nuit, sans moteur, au milieu des cargos. Alors tu penses bien que négocier un partenariat Web, ça ne lui fait pas peur.
Ses précédentes expériences en marketing & sales l’ont vu faire prendre le large à de nombreux projets de dimension internationale. Au gouvernail de la stratégie de croissance de papernest, il compte bien refaire le coup - plus vite, et plus fort.

description:
Site Reliability Engineers (SRE) at Algolia are both software and systems engineers that ensure we can reliably serve billions of queries every day, for users all around the world, despite datacenters being unavailable and undersea cables being cut. As we operate many services including our Search API, Places, DocSearch and Analytics, you’ll keep learning new things everyday and share what you have learned.

The platform we develop uses both virtual and bare-metal systems spanning over 50 data centers in 15 different regions serving millions of users from every corner of the globe. Since search is a critical component of many applications, the SRE team maintains a high level of expertise in system failures in order to prevent them and provide reliable service to our customers.

No two problems are the same because all the systems evolve all the time. We expect you to be a resilient problem solver who isn’t afraid to think outside of the box and use the knowledge of system interactions in your favor. You’ll also take ownership of complete projects and execute them.

The team is composed of engineers with different backgrounds and experience both in the industry and academia. The diversity works in our favour and you should increase it by bringing your experience, your knowledge and your point of view. Thinking differently is a plus, not a minus. We’re transparent with each other and to other teams both about our success and our failures. This way we learn, we accept our weaknesses and continuously strive to improve both personally and professionally.

Coming right from Sergio, from the SRE team: “If you want to grow yourself into a multidisciplinary environment, Algolia is the place to be. Our SRE team ensures the infrastructure is up and running with the minimum downtime possible. We use the right tool for the right job, with a strong value for ownership, you build and you run it. Besides we have a really flexible schedule, organize your day as you wish”.
YOUR ROLE WILL CONSIST OF:
Work with other teams to identify, troubleshoot, and resolve high impact issues
Evaluate performance of current and future systems, both software and hardware
Participate in design of new systems
Develop and maintain the automation framework used for all systems
Participate in on-call rotation to ensure fast response to production issues

A typical morning for Sergio looks like : "We have one sync meeting per week for our squad, where we know what each member of the team is working on or we comment the issues of the last on-call. The rest of the day I organize to work on the projects I'm involved"

YOU MIGHT BE A FIT IF YOU HAVE:
4+ years of software engineering experience
Knowledge of Shell scripting and at least one scripting language (Python, Ruby, etc.)
Willing to learn Go (golang)
Understanding of Linux systems: I/O, process scheduling, filesystems
Understanding of computer networks: TCP/IP, DNS, load-balancing
Full professional English proficiency
Rigor in high code quality, automated testing, and other engineering best practices
Ability to make independent decisions and taking ownership for them
NICE TO HAVE:
Knowledge of Go (golang)
Ability to use a configuration management tool like Ansible, Puppet or Chef
Knowledge of low level principles of computers and network components
Performance profiling of applications both in development and production
Knowledge of cloud platforms such AWS / GCP / Azure

We’re looking for someone who can live our values:
GRIT - Problem-solving and perseverance capability in an ever-changing and growing environment
TRUST - Willingness to trust our co-workers and to take ownership
CANDOR - Ability to receive and give constructive feedback.
CARE - Genuine care about other team members, our clients and the decisions we make in the company.
HUMILITY- Aptitude for learning from others, putting ego aside.
BENEFITS:
Private Medical Insurance
Life and Disability Insurance
Business Travel Insurance
Relocation support
Company Canteen (high standard)
Flexible work hours and unlimited time off
PERKS:
Competitive pay and equity
Coaching and sponsorship to participate and speak at leading industry conferences
Ongoing professional education opportunities through internal & external workshops, including public speaking, language learning (English/French)
Fun: we spend time together — team building, socializing and making tools that encourage getting to know teammates across offices and continents.
Charitable contribution matching
Unique referral rewards program: refer a candidate, and we’ll donate to your charity of choice
Corporate flats available for the first months of relocation and when you travel to different offices
Fully stocked kitchens
Team workouts
Meals & happy hours

As the product expert, you will have a deep understanding of the Slack Platform, handle tough objections, and lead successful evaluation cycles to gain product fit consensus.
Do you love closing large, complex deals and making a huge impact? Do you excel at building trust with both technical and non-technical executives? Last but not least, are you passionate about conveying value to your customers? If you’re an established sales professional with a consistent track record in helping customers achieve visionary goals, we should chat.
Slack has a positive, diverse, and supportive culture—we look for people who are curious, inventive, and work to be a little better every single day. Embedded Software Engineer (MCU) - AI

About
Snips is an AI-powered voice platform for connected devices. It enables makers and companies to add voice recognition and understanding to their products or services.
Created in 2013, the vision behind Snips has been to put an AI assistant in every device, making technology so intuitive that it disappears into the background. They are now over 70 people, with offices in Paris, Tokyo, and New York.
What makes Snips unique is that everything runs locally on the device the user is speaking to, meaning no data ever gets sent to the cloud. This guarantees Privacy by Design and resilience to internet outages, making Snips the first ever voice technology to be GDPR compliant.
The Snips web platform was launched in June of 2017, and has grown 400% since then to over 23,000 developers creating voice apps
Snips is looking for passionate people who want to contribute to our vision to make technology disappear. More than a company, we see ourselves as a community that values purpose, inclusiveness, curiosity, grit and impact. We expect future Snipsters to be curious and want to learn continuously, helping each other solve the various problems they are working on.

You will help our Embedded Software Engineering team to push the boundaries of which Artificial Intelligence algorithms can run on micro controllers like Cortex-M4/M7. Optimisation is key to our development. You will also help us to expand our range of hardware on which we can run.
English is the official language of the company, as we have over 12 different nationalities, so don't worry if you don't speak French!
