Organizations leverage the power of DDN technology and the deep technical expertise of our team to capture, store, process, analyse, collaborate and distribute data, information and content at largest scale in the most efficient, reliable and cost effective manner. Our customers include many of the world’s leading financial services firms and banks, healthcare and life science organizations, manufacturing and energy companies, government and research facilities, and web and cloud service providers.

DDN's sustained Vision and execution have made us the World’s largest privately held data storage company. Our technological and market leadership comes from our long term investments in leading edge research and development, our relentless focus on solving our customers’ end to end data and information management challenges, and the excellence of our employees around the globe, all relentlessly focused on delivering the highest levels of satisfaction to our customers.

We create and bring to market the most advanced and innovative technologies to solve our customers' complex Big Data challenges. Our technology centers are located in the US, France, Germany, Belarus, China, India and Japan, and our manufacturing facilities are based in the US. You can be proud to work for a dynamic company whose two founders are still actively involved in our operations, and which is helping improve the quality of human life throughout the World.
Job Description
We are currently seeking a Systems Engineer - HPC & Life Sciences.

Job Summary:

The Systems Engineer will primarily be responsible for pre-sales activity, supporting all sales efforts in HPC & Life Sciences in a given geographic territory. This position will be field based and involve travel of approximately 40%. The Systems Engineer will need to be able to partner strongly with Account Executives in pursuit of business opportunities; providing technical expertise to close sales opportunities. An SE must have considerable knowledge of the HPC & Life Sciences space and is able to speak the technical vernacular of that industry. Must have strong communication skills, including: developing and delivering presentations; and connecting with customers via phone, face to face, and in written correspondences including RFP responses.
Assist in closing new business opportunities by understanding the sales process and support Sales – qualify, identify, and close new opportunities.
Demonstrate a thorough technical and business understanding of clients’ needs and develop customized solutions to meet these needs using DDNs products and services
Participate in seminars, tradeshows, events, and trainings and clearly communicate complex technical topics to the varied knowledge levels of internal account executives and external customers.
Create RFP responses, technical drawings, presentations, and recommendations.
Conduct research and gain knowledge of all key products and technologies (including competitive market analysis).
Develop positive and trustworthy relationships with customers throughout the sales process and product implementation in order to build repeat business.
Ability to multi-task and manage competing priorities, ensuring all objectives are accomplished.
Qualifications :
Must have industry experience of 2+ years working with distributed and/or clustered file systems.
Experience supporting sales efforts is essential to success in this position.
BS or higher degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Sciences; or equivalent is required.
This position will be field based and involve travel approximately 40% of the time.
Technical Expectations: The following are preferred technical requirements: Linux OS, Unix OS, Windows OS, and Mac OS, SCSI, Lustre, GPFS, CXFS, QFS, ZFS, NAS, SAN, Pearl, Shell Scripting, Solaris, and Visio.
Identifying Customer Needs: Seeks to provide an appropriate solution by understanding what the customer is trying to accomplish; spends time in a needs analysis process that identifies key objectives specific to an individual customer; gives the customer’s agenda priority over a standard response; changes the sales approach or solution to accommodate the customer versus force fit the customer to an existing model.

Provides Reliable Information: Builds credibility in a resource role by remaining factual and timely in providing information; maintains his sources for quick access to time-sensitive information and to stay abreast of new developments; proactively educates customers or shares information as part of the service they deserve.

Makes One on One Sales Presentations: Communicates essential points in an informal and conversational manner; prefers to share information in a one-on-one or small group situation; varies style and language to ensure listener understanding and is attentive to closing the loop on communications; seeks feedback and responds appropriately to listener reactions; makes presentations that are unrehearsed and adapted to individual situations.

Delivers Added Value to Customers: Stays in touch with market trends, including environmental and competitive forces influencing the market, so that he can be seen as a valuable resource to important constituents internal or external to the organization; constantly seeks information that will be useful but is not readily available to colleagues; enjoys being sought for advice and instruction; spends the time to build a base of knowledge that ultimately helps others to be more effective.

Maximizes Results by Anticipating Obstacles that Could Impede Progress: Able to sort through bureaucracy, complexity, or politics to focus on required results; is not caught unprepared when obstacles are encountered; meets self-imposed standards of excellence by delivering agreed upon results that are straightforward and customer defined.
DDN Core Characteristics
DDN has a very strong orientation towards these 4 characteristics and any successful employee will demonstrate these capabilities:

Self-Starter - Takes independent action to identify and solve problems. Seeks out relevant information needed to make decisions. Gets involved with new initiatives.
Success/Achievement Orientation - Delivers quality results consistently. Targets, achieves (or exceeds) measurable results. Sets challenging goals, focuses on critical priorities, and is accountable.
Problem Solving - Recognizes problems and responds with a systematic assessment that identifies and addresses cause of issue. Practical, realistic, and resourceful.
Innovative - Builds and improves key business processes that enhance the effectiveness of DDN. Generates new ideas, challenges the status quo, and solves problems creatively.

DataDirect Networks, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender, sex stereotyping, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, protected Veteran Status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

description:
VOTRE FUTUR TERRAIN D’EXPRESSION

La mission d’AXA est de « donner à chacun les moyens de vivre une vie meilleure ». Nous souhaitons alors passer du rôle de payeur à celui de partenaire. La mission de notre division, Group Operations (GO), est de soutenir et responsabiliser l’ensemble des équipes d’AXA afin de concrétiser cette ambition commune.

L’innovation et l’exécution sont nos principaux leviers pour atteindre cet objectif. Ils guident l’ensemble des équipes de GO au quotidien :
Innovation : créer et fournir les bases et opportunités aux équipes d’AXA qui développeront des solutions innovantes afin de répondre aux besoins de nos clients actuels et futurs ;
Exécution : créer l’environnement qui permettra à nos équipes à travers le monde, de donner vie à leurs idées et de tenir les promesses faites à nos clients.

Nos objectifs concrets sont de :
Renforcer la création de valeur pour l’ensemble du groupe AXA ;
Soutenir et encourager l'innovation au sein d'AXA, en collaboration avec la division Group Business Innovation ;
Automatiser et intégrer la simplicité dans notre travail quotidien, en nous assurant de contribuer efficacement à la mission et stratégie d’AXA.

Les équipes de Group Operations sont alors composées de :
IT : définit la stratégie IT globale d’AXA ; favorise la convergence de l’IT au sein des entités et leur fournit des services partagés ;
Group Security : protège les salariés, nos parties prenantes et la marque AXA en sécurisant les informations et gérant les cyber sécurité, la sécurité physique ainsi que la résilience des opérations ;
Group Data-DIL : définit les ambitions concernant la maturité des données du Groupe ; construit et gère la communauté ; conduit la recherche et l’expertise ; assiste les entités les moins matures en termes de données ;
Technology Innovation : identifie les technologies de pointe et en développe des disruptives pour les entités ; crée des cas d’usage sur des technologies spécifiques avec les entités ;
Group Procurement : définit la stratégie d’achats d’AXA, ses lignes directrices et les normes du Groupe ; gère les relations avec nos fournisseurs stratégiques et accélère les achats métiers ;
Group Strategic Program Management : s’assure de la cohérence des projets globaux avec la stratégie du Groupe ; veille à la mise en œuvre et performance des projets stratégiques ;
AXA Business Services : offre des services partagés alignés aux priorités commerciales d’AXA ;
Group Operations Transformation : accélère la transformation agile au sein de Group Operations ; établit et met en œuvre une communication et stratégie RH commune à notre division.


VOTRE FUTURE CONTRIBUTION

Dans ce contexte, vous intégrerez le département IT et plus précisément, l’équipe « Workplace Products » composée de 15 collaborateurs en France. Celle-ci a pour mission de développer des outils collaboratifs informatiques permettant d’améliorer l’expérience des usagers internes d’AXA au niveau Groupe.

Notre ambition est d’offrir la meilleure expérience pour chaque salarié, de faire de l’environnement professionnel un élément fondamental du bien-être au travail, d’efficience, de ludisme, d’attractivité et de fidélisation des collaborateurs dans une démarche de collaboration et de co-construction.

Rattaché(e) à un Senior Technical Engineer, vous aurez pour missions principales de :

Participer à la définition et mise en place des produits workplace (déploiement de la téléphonie sur Teams & Skype essentiellement) :

o Collecter les informations d’annuaires téléphoniques hétérogènes ;
o Mettre à disposition un outil simple d’utilisation permettant l’entrée et la sortie des usagers à l’échelle mondiale ;
o Participer à la migration de plusieurs milliers collaborateurs AXA au niveau international sur la téléphonie (onboarding, formations, conduite du changement, etc.).

Entretenir une veille stratégique et technologique sur le domaine de la (télé)communication unifiée :

o Proposer des axes d’amélioration et des évolutions en fonction du cycle de vie du produit Teams délivré par Microsoft ;
o Mener une étude spécifique contribuant à la stratégie globale de nos travaux et pouvant être soutenu dans le cadre de votre thèse ou mémoire de fin d’études.

Vos missions seront alors susceptibles d’évoluer en fonction de l’actualité et de vos aspirations.

Qualifications
VOTRE BACKGROUND

…Vous aimez :
Travailler en équipe et de manière transverse
L’innovation et le secteur de l’IT de manière générale
Evoluer dans un environnement international

Formation : Ecole d’Ingénieur ou Universitaire de niveau Bac+2 à Master
Spécialisation : Développement, Communication unifiée

Rythme d’alternance idéal : semaines complètes en entreprise ; 3 semaines en entreprise / 1 semaine au centre de formation

Compétences comportementales / Soft skills:
Sens du service, orienté client
Ecoute active
Force de proposition et prise d’initiatives

Compétences techniques / Hard skills:
Web Services et SSO
Bot informatique
PowerShell, PHP
REST (Representational State Transfer)

Langues : Anglais : opérationnel (écrit, lu, parlé)

Outils informatiques :
Environnement Office 365 dont Skype Online & Teams
Linux
Apache
MySQL
Connaissances des technologies de téléphonie seraient un plus
A propos d'AXA
Aimeriez-vous vous lever chaque jour motivé(e) par une mission inspirante et travailler en équipe pour permettre de protéger les personnes et leurs proches? Chez AXA nous avons l’ambition de mener la transformation de notre métier. Nous cherchons des personnes talentueuses ayant une expérience diversifiée, qui pensent différemment, et qui veulent faire partie de cette transformation passionnante en challengeant le statu quo et faire d’AXA – marque globale leader et une des sociétés les plus innovantes dans notre secteur – une entreprise encore plus performante et responsable.

Dans un monde en perpétuelle évolution et avec une présence dans 64 pays, nos 166 000 salariés et distributeurs privilégiés anticipent le changement pour offrir des services et solutions adaptés aux besoins actuels et futurs de nos 103 millions de clients.
*
Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?
Chez AXA, nous menons une politique RH engagée qui favorise la diversité, préserve l’équilibre vie privée-vie professionnelle et accélère le développement des compétences et des carrières : promotion de la mixité, politique de rémunération, dispositif de formation,…

Quel que soit votre métier, nous veillons à vous offrir des perspectives d’évolution et des opportunités de carrières. Notre objectif est de développer vos talents et vos compétences pour accompagner les transformations de notre entreprise en pleine mutation.

Who is Odaseva?
10M+ Salesforce users from industry leading companies such as Schneider Electric, Heineken, Robert Half or General Electric, trust Odaseva as the ultimate solution to securely and rapidly address challenges such as data privacy compliance automation, data protection and data operations on Salesforce.
Odaseva offers the only all-in-one salesforce data governance platform (data protection, data compliance automation and data operations) built for large enterprises using Salesforce.
Odaseva is part of the Salesforce ecosystem: the most dynamic enterprise application ecosystem ever. Odaseva’s founders are Salesforce gurus in data governance & data security, and Salesforce’s former VP of sales.
Great place to work: Work hard – play hard, no politics, team spirit and collective intelligence (work as a team, not like a team). Lots of opps to have an impact on the company
International: Spans across Europe, APAC and the US, with more internationalization to come
Odaseva is growing very rapidly and is looking for good and smart people across multiple departments!
Your Role
Your job is to expand the relationship with Salesforce, System Integrators and ISVs in the ecosystem to create a long term strategic alignment as well as source and influence deals.
You develop and maintain broad and deep external partner relations with company partners in all solutions areas.
You are knowledgeable of the partner’s propositions, their markets, business challenges and customer opportunities.
You develop and execute attainable strategy plans in line with the market needs.
You build multi-level relationships with our partners including those in the executive level. You produce high-quality leads through constant engagements with partners in terms of marketing strategies.
You coordinate with internal resources to launch partner sales planning efforts of the company.
Within Odaseva, you work with sales, sales engineers, marketing, product managers, consultants. You provide feedback to fuel our growth strategy.
What you will bring:
5+ years of business development experience in a technical environment, of which 2y+ successful experience of managing an alliance in the Salesforce ecosystem.
You have exceptional communication skills as it is at the core of your success.
You know how to build relationships as well as how to maintain them.
You are disciplined in working with people as well as culturally sensitive in dealing with them.
Solid verbal, written, presentation and interpersonal communication skills
Full professional proficiency in English
Your soft skills:
Strong passion to learn and develop your skill-set
Loves design & technology and understands their value
Autonomous and proactive
Excellent communicator
Focused with a positive outlook
Leads by example
You will love:
Your personal success is directly tied to the success of your partners and your company.
Global team player: you enjoy working with team members and customers across cultures and timezones
Entrepreneurial: you are a structured self starter who manage priorities and focus to thrive in a fast paced environment
You are a geek, you love how technology drives growth and innovation.
You are a positive, fun, good person.
You will love:
Pro-Equality, Pro-Diversity
Human size team of smart and kind people, no politics, no BS, emulation not competition
Professional environment: culture of excellence & casual style
Great place to learn, make an impact and grow
Proud member of the French Tech, at the forefront of Data & Cloud innovation.
Headquartered in Paris (Saint-Lazare), truly global (Paris, San Francisco, New York, Seattle, Barcelona)
Competitive salary

meta1:
DevOps Reliability Engineer
Scality10 avis - Paris 8e (75)
date_publication:
il y a 30+ jours
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Department: Engineering

At Scality , we take pride in Software Development. We deliver innovative products through agile, continuous development, continuous integration. Scality is an industry recognized leader in distributed FS and object storage proven with 500 million users and over a trillion objects. You will be developing software for Scality’s open source, distributed, multi cloud controller called Zenko . If you are excited by constantly challenging engineering problems and can deliver exceptional quality in a fast-paced, agile environment, we'd like to meet you.

Job Description:
You will be working in a team responsible for the core of our S3-endpoint service(S3 connector) and open source Zenko functionality, enabling policy based data management and data mobility use-cases. Our DevOps Reliability Engineers are a hybrid of software DevOps and systems engineers. We code our way out of operational problems . We are responsible for reliability, scalability, and automation while keeping an eye on latency, performance, and capacity.

The role will involve, interacting with our product owner and customer facing technical sales team to understand customer use-cases and requirements, hardening the feature with leads and product architects, and writing the software code to automate operations, systems engineering, management and configuration to ensure reliability and scalability of the features. The Devops reliability engineer will work throughout the stack using Github for code versioning and will also be responsible for automated testing and leverage code as pipeline practices to automate (unit, function, integration and end to end testing) to ensure quality, and for performance, scalability, and triage-ability of newly added feature functionality for proprietary S3-endpoint service(S3 connector) and open source Zenko storage product using a variety of tools and technologies. The engineer will benefit from knowledge of, distributed environments, service oriented architectures, microservices architecture, containers, cloud native ecosystems, Object oriented design principles, async design patterns, REST, load balancers, API gateways, Cloud terminologies, Linux, Kubernetes and related tools and technologies.

Responsibilities

Design, write, and maintain software to improve the availability, scalability, latency, and efficiency of S3C and Zenko services, incorporating third-party open-source tools when available.
Work closely with release engineering to Automate use-cases for test driven deployment and operations in S3C and Zenko distributed systems stack.
Design and implement smart tools and processes for continuous integration, development & deployment.
Design, implement, execute, improve, automate configuration management.
Own, maintain, and continuously improve all systems provided as a service, such as monitoring and logging, hence improving product serviceability and triage-ability.
Engage in anticipating, investigating and fixing performance bottlenecks and software performance analysis and system tuning.
Must-Have Qualifications

Fluent in two or more of: C/C++, /JVM, JavaScript /Go/Python. (language doesn’t matter; we believe you can learn the syntax of the new languages if you have strong Object oriented fundamentals)
2+ years of industry experience in software engineering field
REST API; (We use Node.js and Go. knowledge in Node.js and awareness of server framework like Express/HAPI is a plus).
Able to optimize performance of their own code and system as a whole
Unit-function-integration test automation/ TDD experience. Experience building an automation‐focused culture, both in testing and build/deploy (we have a fully integrated CI/CD pipeline. Awareness a plus)
Client-focused, react well to change, work with teams and is able to multi-task on multiple projects
Experience working with Unix/Linux systems, understand the high-level concepts (processes, virtual memory, FS)
Familiarity with log analysis, triage using important tools for troubleshooting (like iperf, ps, lsof, iostat etc).
Experience working with file systems, and client-server protocols.
Experience with network protocols and theory (TCP/IP, UDP, ICMP, MAC addresses, IP packets, DNS, OSI layers, and load balancing, etc.)
Experience with Salt and ansible, or some other configuration management tool.
Nice-to-Have Qualifications

Expertise in designing, analyzing, and troubleshooting large-scale distributed systems.
Kubernetes (a plus)
Familiarity with Kafka, zookeeper, mongoDB, Redis, prometheus,grafana and concept of containers.
Familiarity with object storage / cloud storage (AWS /GCP/Azure/others) is a plus

meta1:
Product Manager / Product Owner
Scality10 avis - Paris 8e (75)
date_publication:
il y a 30+ jours
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Job Summary:
Scality, the world leader in object storage and distributed file systems, bridges the gap between application vendors, industry standard hardware providers and its customers’ storage scale, durability, cost, and performance requirements - with the Scality RING.

Our software-defined storage product, called the RING, allows our customers to store and access billions of objects or even petabyte-sized objects across standard x86-based platforms to meet the most demanding digital business and application requirements. Scality excels at delivering storage for service-oriented public and private clouds serving over 500 million end customers worldwide, with over 800 billion objects in production.
Scality software-defined Scality RING also natively provides a Scale Out File System (SOFS) for applications that require and depend on file system interfaces (mainly through NFS and SMB protocols), and need to organize data in folders, at multi petabytes scale.

Such Multi-petabytes, multi-sites, multi-applications, multi-protocols, performances demanding distributed infrastructures running on standard x86 platforms are requiring that Scality is always on the forefront of the deployment management, containerization, and orchestrations technologies. In deed our typical deployment can necessitate hundreds or thousands of servers that should be seamlessly setup, monitored and eventually orchestrated.

In order to define it’s next generation of products Scality is seeking an individual already well versed within these technologies and challenges and who’ll be willing to act as a leader to help define and maintain Scality strategy on deployment and orchestration, ensure execution is done with respect to customer expectations in close relationship with most of the active working forces within Scality.

Reporting directly to the Vice-President of Product, this role will drive frequent interactions with Sales, Sales Engineers and Support teams on the customer facing side as well as Tech-Leads, Architects and up to CTO level on the internal side.

The mission of the Product Owner/Product Manager will be to:
Understand Scality’s customer and market requirements, solutions and use cases
Translate requirements and solutions into roadmaps and detailed product features
Assist in research and specifying the features, and to justify their priority in the RING User Stories backlog
Be able to clearly articulate customer requirements into Epics and User Stories
Work closely with engineering teams including involvement in development team meetings, as the key liaison between the engineering team and product teams.
Communicate on the detailed specifications to Sales Engineers to ensure clear understanding on the feature and avoid scope creep.
Help in processing, understanding, refining and prioritizing the customer requirements coming from TS/SE.
Be able to hold the PO role for several teams in parallel
Travel up to 25% across US and Europe related to the above mentioned tasks
Desired Skills & Experience:
The ideal candidate would have the following knowledge and skills:

BS or MS degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent
2 years of experience as a PO in a High Tech software company ideally related to install, deployment, monitoring and management challenges of pure, hybrid cloud and distributed infrastructures.
Strong knowledge of Agile / Lean development methodology
Should the applicant add Software defined object storage and distributed file systems knowledge to this skill set that’d be even better.
Previous role as a Systems Engineer, System Administrator with preference given to candidates who have previous experience working closely with product management peers
Technical Skills:
Cloud Platforms: AWS / MS Azure / Google Cloud / Open Stack.
Datacenters technologies in general (Administration, storage, networking, security)
Containerizations (Docker, Rocket….)
Orchestration (Kubernetes, Swarm, Mesos…)
Conceptual and technical understanding of storage, including network interfaces, file system technology (NFS, SMB, REST and block), Object Storage (S3) data protection schemes, replication, management interfaces.
Linux distributions
Experience with network storage systems would also be highly valued, including related technologies such as backup, archive and replication.
NB: Candidates with expertise in networking, virtualization, Linux operation systems and other related technologies should also apply.

Interpersonal Skills:
Curious and open-minded, oriented knowledge sharing and able to create synergies between different teams
Good communication skills and teamwork, as well as ability to provide clear and organized documentation for all work performed
Passionate and current in new technologies
About Scality:
Scality is an industry leader in software-defined storage at petabyte-scale. Founded in 2009, Scality has deployed software-based storage solutions that deliver billions of files to more than two hundred million users daily with 100% availability. Scality’s customers include four of the top ten cable operators in the US, the second largest Telco in France, leading operators in Japan, leading television network in Germany, and the second largest online video site in the world.

Scality’s internal motto is: “work hard, play hard, eat well and amaze the customer!”

For more information about the company, visit: www.scality.com or follow @Scality on Twitter. To discover the company culture, view the Scality Book at
http://book.scality.com/ [http://book.scality.com/]

System IVV Engineer m/f
Airbus1,455 avis - Paris (75)
date_publication:
il y a 30+ jours
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Airbus Defence and Space SAS
Airbus is a global leader in aeronautics, space and related services. In 2018 it generated revenues of € 64 billion and employed a workforce of around 134,000. Airbus offers the most comprehensive range of passenger airliners. Airbus is also a European leader providing tanker, combat, transport and mission aircraft, as well as one of the world's leading space companies. In helicopters, Airbus provides the most efficient civil and military rotorcraft solutions worldwide.

Our people work with passion and determination to make the world a more connected, safer and smarter place. Taking pride in our work, we draw on each other's expertise and experience to achieve excellence. Our diversity and teamwork culture propel us to accomplish the extraordinary - on the ground, in the sky and in space.
Job Description
Contact :
Please apply on line for this vacancy on line at our careers site (www.jobs.airbus.com) with your CV and cover letter attached.

By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.

Description of the job :
Role Description
Airbus Defence and Space is looking for an experienced IVV Engineer (f/m) to join the IVV team responsible for the Integration, Verification and Validation of Maritime Surveillance Systems.
Airbus Defence and Space is providing for more than 20 years integrated Maritime Safety and Security solutions to Port Authorities, Coast Guards, Navies and also commercial administration all around the world. Over 250 Systems are in service in over 50 countries 20 are currently under development. 85% of our business is international.
STYRIS® is an Airbus Defence and Space product line for collection, processing, consolidation, enrichment, distribution and display of data deriving from a wide range of maritime sensors such as radars, automatic identification system, radio direction finder, cameras, weather stations and sonars. STYRIS® is based on a modular system architecture allowing integration and user friendly and ergonomic HMI to provide operators with the platform to monitor and interact with critical maritime situations, and provide the means to quickly communicate to all relevant authorities.
This position offers an exciting opportunity for an IV&V Engineer to work on small, medium and large-scale projects. It presents unique challenges and enables a strong sense of accomplishment.
This position is located in Bezons, suburb of Paris near La Defense.
You will report to the System Engineering Team Leader (TECSB6-TL1) and have as main interfaces the technical manager, software development team, and also the maintenance team.

Task & accountabilities :
Key Responsibilities
You will lead all the IV&V activities for small and medium size systems and you will be involved in IVV activities for large systems under the lead of an IV&V Manager as needed:
# Coordinate the Project IV&V Team (Estimated workload is between 20 and 40% depending on the project’s size and complexity)
Define the IV&V Strategy according to project’s requirements and constraints, including factory platform needs
- Elaborate the Traceability & Compliance Matrix (VCRI - Verification and Cross Reference Index)
Lead the Factory Acceptance Tests phases (FAT) and Site Acceptance Tests (SAT) phase in front of the Customer
Manage to closure the SW and Integration related bugs as well as Change Request, using the dedicated project’s tools and processes
Manage (or contribute to) the Engineering Reviews as per defined and applicable Project Life Cycle (e.g.: V Cycle)
# Perform IV&V activities (Estimated workload is between 60 and 80% depending on the project’s size and complexity)
Contribute to the Design of the System/Solution for the Project, based on STYRIS® System
Define, document and implement/perform IVV test cases, in accordance with project’s requirements
Build the system:
# Set-up the Integration & test platform (PF) in factory
# Configure network equipment (as part of the PF or of the final site delivery)
# Configure other equipment as needed (sensors, ...), for factory PF or for final site delivery
# Configure STYRIS® system/solution according to project’s requirements
# Integrate specific SW development with existing STYRIS® System for the Project
Participate in deployment and commissioning phase for the target system on Site

Required skills :
Education
# Master or diploma in computer science or a comparable field of study (e.g.: SW development (JAVA based) or System Administration)

Practical experience
# 3 years of successful experience as System or Software IV&V engineer
Competencies
# Knowledge in engineering processes, especially in IV&V cycles
# Knowledge of distributed Command & Control and Surveillance Systems architecture
# Willingness and ability to work in multidisciplinary teams in an international environment
# Organized and autonomous
# Capability to learn fast
# Team player and cooperative
# Rigorous, loyal and curious
Specific knowledge
Essential
# Linux / Shell and/or MS Windows scripting
# Git
# TestLink or similar test tool
# JIRA or similar bug reporting tool
# Virtualisation (HyperV, VMware)
# Networking equipment (Cisco)
# Ruby
# Puppet Desirable
# Cyber Security (for IT and Communication)
# Sensors: Radars, VHF, RDF, AIS
# DBMS (PostgreSQL, Cassandra)
# LDAP (Active Directory)
Language Skills
# Fluent in French (Oral and writing)
# Fluent in English (Oral and writing)
Trip availability
# Occasional business trips

This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth.

By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.
Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.

description:
Company Description:
Scality is an industry leader in software-defined and multi-cloud storage at petabyte-scale. Founded in 2009, Scality has deployed software-based storage solutions that deliver billions of files to more than two hundred million users daily with 100% availability. Scality’s customers include four of the top ten cable operators in the US, the second largest Telco in France, leading operators in Japan, leading television network in Germany, and the second largest online video site in the world.

Our internal motto? “Work hard, play hard, eat well, and AMAZE the customer!”

Learn more about Scality on our Careers [https://www.scality.com/careers/] page, and follow us on
Linkedin [https://www.linkedin.com/company/scality/], Twitter
[https://twitter.com/scality] & Glassdoor
[https://www.glassdoor.com/Overview/Working-at-Scality-EI_IE772433.11,18.htm] to stay up to date on jobs and company news. Also, you can get an inside look into the
culture and life at Scality [https://www.scality.com/life-at-scality/] (via The Muse).

Description

Scality is cloud storage leader and a vendor of high-performance distributed solutions, pursuing our mission of giving the company’s customers the freedom and control necessary to be competitive in a data driven economy. We are active in the open source world and a member of the Cloud Native Computing Foundation (
CNCF [https://www.cncf.io/]).

Scality is seeking a Senior Platform Backend Engineer to design and implement features for the new Scality Platform (on which rely all core Scality components), someone who is eager to join our platform team and apply their strong technical and analytical skills to the quick and efficient solving of tough problems.

Specifically, the successful candidate will work to enhance MetalK8s
[https://github.com/scality/metalk8s/tree/development/2.0] – Scality’s open source Kubernetes distribution – in terms of deployment, administration, security, and monitoring capabilities. In addition, the candidate will shoulder significant responsibility for Scality’s award-winning RING product, and will collaborate with and support other Scality teams working on a wide variety of in-development platform solutions.

Environment

Work on state-of-the-art technical stacks (e.g., Kubernetes, Prometheus, …)
Strong continuous integration and testing culture and infrastructure
Startup Perks! * High-end equipment (Apple/Dell laptop computers, Bring-Your-Own-OS policy, multiple screens)
Spacious, modern office space in central Paris (Madeleine)
Stock options distribution
Remote Work policy
Opportunity to travel
Sports and Wellness programs
Ample training allowance (e.g., internal/external skills training, conferences, coaching)
Donation-matching
Annual off-site company-wide “Kick-Off” event
Food fun: weekly company breakfast, a lunch delivery service, unlimited hot soothing coffee/tea/chocolate drinks, and more
Diversions: Babyfoot, Ping-Pong, board and card games, planned group activities
Qualifications

Computer Engineering and/or Computer Science degree (or equivalent)
English proficiency
Can justify of a successful experience in a similar role or position
Strong “can-do” (and do well!) determination and work ethic
Technical Skills

Linux proficiency (Debian / CentOS)
Working knowledge of shell scripting
Working knowledge of Go and/or Python; other languages may be acceptable
Working knowledge of Ansible and / or Salt and / or Puppet
Comfort with software development tools (e.g., git, Github, etc.)
Knowledge in the following areas is a plus!
Sysadmin, DevOps, SRE experience
API development
Packaging
Container orchestration (Kubernetes, ...)
Networking
Distributed storage
Open Source contribution
Monitoring (Elasticsearch, Prometheus, Grafana, Kibana, MongoDB, Kafka, ZooKeeper, …)
Interpersonal Skills

Curious, passionate, and open-minded
Driven to stay abreast of technology advances
Team player (knowledge sharing drive, creating bridges between different work groups)
Good communication skills, including the ability to provide clear and organized documentation for all work performed

The company
DNA Script is a leading company in manufacturing de novo synthetic nucleic acids using an enzymatic technology. The company aims at accelerating innovation in life science and technology through quick, decentralized solutions for laboratory work in life science and genomics. DNA Script's approach leverages nature's billions of years of evolution in synthesizing DNA to set a new standard for how nucleic acids are made and accelerate the adoption of synthetic biology across diverse disciplines such as biopharma, sustainable chemistry and data storage.
To date, DNA Script has raised over 58 M€ of financing, mostly through equity funding brought by prestigious players such as Illumina Ventures, LSP, Merck Ventures, Sofinnova Partners, BPIFrance, Kurma Partners and Idinvest. The company partners with leading institutions, in particular Institut Pasteur.
We are looking to assemble a team of world class, innovative and passionate people gathering their talents and skills to achieve one goal: unlock the power of DNA to write the future of life sciences. We offer the opportunity to join a dynamic, international and highly skilled team in a high-performance biotech startup. We offer a competitive benefits package (salary, equity, healthcare, meal vouchers and public transportation) along with a unique opportunity to work in the heart of Paris.
The role
DNA Script is looking for a talented individual to join the nucleotide chemistry team as a Process Scale Up Chemical Engineer. About us:
There are approximately 80,000 queries done every second on search engines. But more than 50% of pages on enterprise websites are not showing up at all in organic search results.
That’s a ton of missed opportunity!
Enter Botify.
We are building the new standard in enterprise search marketing.Our unified, data-driven, and user-friendly platform provides companies with the insights they need to impact every stage of the search process from the underlying technical requirements to content optimization, ranking, and real keywords.
Botify is used by 500+ leading global companies across industries including e-travel (Expedia, Luxury Retreats, Odigeo), e-commerce (Jet.com, Macy’s, Farfetch, Zalando), media (Axel Springer, Condé Nast, Refinery29), marketplace (eBay, RetailMeNot, Monster), and digital agencies (Merkle, iProspect, GroupM).
We are a fast-growing, VC-backed, SaaS company with $27M in funding and offices in New York, Seattle, Paris, and London.

Your role
You are a backend and data enthusiast. You add new features to the product and build them, from design to deployment: detailed conception, algorithm design, implementation, unit tests, performance optimization, developer documentation. Development takes place in short cycles with regular staging and production deployments as the product evolves.
As the whole technical team also does, you participate in customer support, by fixing analysis data, should it fail.
We work in a non-formal Agile mode with 2-week sprints during which the team shares ongoing topics and makes cross code reviews.
Some recent achievements of the team:
Internal Page Rank Algorithm
HTML code extraction from crawled pages
Detection of redirection tunnels within a site
Similarity rate between pages
Algorithmic optimizations to increase the number of analyzed pages



Requirements
Your skills
You have development experience in at least a language (for example C, C++, Java, Python, Go). You are language agnostic and ready to suggest or learn new languages to optimize algorithms depending on the context (we use mainly Go and Python).
You are interested in performance analysis (CPU, I/O, memory, application profiling).
You are interested in Big Data and Cloud infrastructures and have some knowledge in at least one technology used in our current backend stack: Amazon SWF workflows, Amazon S3 storage, ElasticSearch, Redis and PostgreSQL.
You are familiar with Git.
Bonus points
You have a very good knowledge of the Linux OS.
You already know Python and Go
Benefits
Why Botify?
Our team is customer-centric, innovative, collaborative and ambitious.
By joining Botify you will become part of a driven, diverse group of top talent. Our people are passionate about the business we are building and enthusiastic about the role they play in it.
With Botify, you will have the opportunity to directly impact company performance and be a part of a dynamic, exciting startup environment.
As a Botify-er, you will benefit from numerous perks including a great work environment, competitive salary, flexible vacation policy, and global career advancement opportunities.
If you’re the right person for the position, or you want to hear more about opportunities to work at Botify, send us your resume, work samples, or anything that can help us understand your skills, and let us know why you should join our growing team.

description:
About us

Zenly started in 2011 as a small team of passionate designers, engineers, and entrepreneurs gathered around the idea that frictionless location sharing is the next mobile commodity. Our R&D has brought us to release the best location sharing app in the world ;)

And now, Zenly is the mobile application that lets you instantaneously see where your friends are. We believe that making maps more social and personalised is our opportunity to improve the way people live, communicate and share moments together. Our product empowers people to find themselves, enjoy improvised moments and have fun together.
Role

Our Android app is 50% Java, 50% Kotlin as we develop new features using it and continue to migrate old Java classes to Kotlin. We have an extensive use of RxJava for communicating data flow from and to the UI through various threading mechanisms. As weird as it might sound, we also embed a custom library compiled from Go to help us handle complex heuristics that we can share between iOS and Android (maintained by a separated team even if you are welcome contributing to it).
Zenly is a very graphical app and as such, your work will be split between custom UI components, gestures, lots of animations and architectural challenges driven by the high level of communication between all different parts of the app.
You will work with passionated product and engineering people (mostly pure Android fanboys) to make Zenly one of the best Android app on the Play Store.
You will ensure a high standard of coding, following best practices and continuous integration processes. In your code, you will keep our core values in mind: usability, security and customer service.
Responsibilities
Architecting, developing, maintaining and releasing features as well as contributing to the core foundations of the Zenly mobile app
Push the limits of mobile devices and create great user experiences
Evaluate technical tradeoffs of every decision and work with design on the best UI and infrastructure practices
Write clear, maintainable, portable, and highly functional code
Accurately estimate schedules and deliver high quality work products to that schedule
Requirements
5+ years min of experience in developing mobile applications
Excellent knowledge of the Android SDK (View architecture, Measure/Layout/Draw, Architecture Components, Theming, etc..)
Strong experience of multi-threading and memory management specific to mobile devices
Solid software engineering practices (separation of concerns, testing, code reviews, continuous integration, design documentation…)
Excellent organization, prioritization and time management skills
Self-motivated and energetic team player with a very strong work ethic and cooperative attitude
Bonus
Experience building a mobile app from scratch to the Play Store
Experience in RxJava
Experience with maps and geographical data (OpenStreetMap, Vector tiles, GIS)
Experience with graphics programming and low-level graphics APIs ((DirectX/OpenGL/equivalent)
Perks

Our office in the Bastille area is built on 3 floors around a green atrium. It has a fully equipped kitchen, rest areas, and sound isolation booths. We also put up a climbing wall between 2 floors and a massive trampoline :)
Everyone at Zenly is offered a great package including:
Competitive salary and stock options
International phone allowance
Gym membership allowance
100% coverage of your health insurance: for you, your partner, and your family
100% coverage of your public transportation title
Fun: Trips abroad every year with the whole team (Sicilia in 2018)
Pet-friendly offices
Yoga classes
Free drinks and snacks of all kinds (homemade pastry, fruits, etc.)
Flexible time off policy
Handling of relocation/visa procedure
Applying
We are more interested in your experiences and projects, past and current, than your résumé. We'd rather hear about these and what you think you'll bring to the team. GitHub and Twitter usernames are also useful to share. All applications should be made in English.

meta1:
Post-Doctoral position: Carbon Nanotube-Based Sensor array for water contaminants detection
Ecole polytechnique et IFSTTAR - Palaiseau (91)
titre_poste: Post-Doctoral position: Carbon Nanotube-Based Sensor array for water contaminants detection
date_publication:
L'Intelli'agence - il y a 30+ jours
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Etablissements publics : Recherche et Enseignement
Site web :
http://
Poste et missions
Post-Doctoral position
Carbon Nanotube-Based Sensor array for water contaminants detection: Sensing performance enhancement using machine learning algorithms
Background
The proposed postdoctoral position will take place within the French ANR project 4Water "For WATER Quality Monitoring" dedicated to the development of environmental sensors for aquaculture application and the European-Indian Project LOTUS dedicated to the fabrication of "LOw-cost innovative Technology for water quality monitoring and water resources management for Urban and rural water Systems in India".
India is facing a water and sanitation crisis. While a staggering 17% of the world population resides in India, the country’s share of world water resources is small — only 4% — which creates a significant gap between water demand and availability. Furthermore, given that 80% of the country’s water is used for irrigation, only 20% is available for drinking water and other industrial needs. Only 32% of households have access to a drinking tap water from a treated water source.
Digital water solutions, i.e., integrating ICT to water management, have the potential to improve water quality and availability for municipalities and consumers worldwide. Much needed water quality monitoring, which is traditionally slow, expensive and requires specialized personnel, can now be achieved on a real-time basis with no expertise involved. LOTUS and 4Water projects bring new ICT solutions for water and sanitation challenges in rural and urban area.
It is based on an innovative multi-parameter, carbon-nanotube-based chemical sensor array for real time, adaptable water quality monitoring of contaminants. This sensor array is developed at Ecole polytechnique, within NACRE team, a joint research team between Ecole polytechnique, CNRS and IFSTTAR. The device exploits carbon-nanotubes-based resistive chemical sensors with optimized, differentiated chemical functionalizations. Sensitivity to pH, chlorine, chloride, hardness and nitrates has been demonstrated so far.
Principle of operation
Each sensor in the array consists of a conducting network of multi-walled carbon nanotubes (MWCNT) directly ink-jet printed on Silicon between interdigitated electrodes. The MWCNT are functionalized by specific polymers selected for their capability to interact reversibly and selectively with the target analytes and to interact strongly with the MWCNT. When the device is exposed to water containing a mixture of various species, in the absence of functionalization, most species interact with the MWCNT-based devices without selectivity. In the presence of functionalized MWCNT on the contrary, the devices respond selectively to the targeted analyte thanks to the functionalization.
Proposed research
The characterization in water of such sensor array, as well as their deployment in testing scenario (such as in Sense-City facility), generates massive amount of data. This data contains all the information on the sensitivity, the selectivity and the ageing features of the sensor array. So far, it is exploited in a straightforward statistical approach with little automation to derive the average sensitivities of the sensors to selected analytes. This approach has already enabled to prove results at the state of the art in terms of carbon nanotube sensor array for water monitoring.
However, it is fairly well-known that electronic tongue algorithms, capable to exploit deeply cross-correlations between sensors (principal component analysis & regression, partial least squares, various types of neural networks) may enable a drastic increase in sensitivity and selectivity. They may also provide information on factors perturbing measurements (such as cross-sensitivity to other chemicals, temperature…) as well as on sensor ageing.
The aim of the project is to evaluate the performances of such methods, and more generally of supervised and unsupervised machine learning, applied to carbon-nanotubes-based sensor array for chemical sensing in water.
The project includes not only the development and testing of e-tongue algorithms, but also in-depth interactions with the rest of the team (in charge of device fabrication and characterization) in view of developing experimental protocols and data management practices adapted to the use of automated data processing algorithms.
Team & organization
Position located in greater Paris area: Ecole polytechnique, Route de Saclay, 91128 Palaiseau, France.
Work within NACRE research team (IFSTTAR, Ecole polytechnique, CNRS), in Platine research platform (https://portail.polytechnique.edu/lms/fr/projet-platine) in LPICM laboratory (https://portail.polytechnique.edu/lpicm/en)
The team counts 3 researchers, 2 engineers, 1 technician, 8 to 10 young researchers (interns, PhDs, postdocs) and 2 startup projects. One of these startups (in creation) notably focuses on the commercialization of the sensor array technology for water monitoring.
The researcher will be in charge (typically 1/2 day per week, up to 1 day per week) of project management activity for LOTUS.
Mobilité géographique :
Européenne
Profil
The successful candidate will have a strong background in data sciences and artificial intelligence, more specifically in supervised and unsupervised learning methods. He will also have an interest in innovative technologies and applications.


Fluent English (written and spoken), high proficiency in technical writing and presentations. Autonomy, spirit of initiative, decision-making skills, creativity, team working. Project management skills.

En qualité de Data Engineer Confirmé (H/F), vous intégrez une équipe composée de Consultants BI et Big Data et interviendrez pour des clients des secteurs d'activités divers (transport, secteur public et ressources humaines).

A compétence égale, ce poste est ouvert aux travailleurs en situation de handicap.

Your future duties and responsibilities:
Accompagner des équipes métiers et Data Scientists dans leurs travaux d'identification et expression des besoins sur la data
Participer aux ateliers de conception et développement des architectures data
Développer des flux d'ingestion de données de Data Lake et de traitement des données
Participer à la création de stratégies d'extraction
Développer des processus permettant de collecter, nettoyer, organiser et modéliser efficacement les données (batch ou temps réel)
Industrialiser, optimiser et monitorer au quotidien les pipelines data
Mettre en place de système d'exposition et visualisation
Les missions évolueront dans des contextes Big Data autour des domaines/ technologies suivantes :

Elasticsearch ;
Cassandra ;
MongoDB ;
Neo4j ;
Kafka.
Required qualifications to be successful in this role:
Ingénieur Informatique ou diplômé(e) d'un Master en Data Science / Statistics, vous justifiez impérativement de 3 ans d'expérience en tant que Data Engineer ou similaire. Vous possédez de solides compétences analytiques et êtes capable de travailler avec des jeux de données non structurés. Une expérience de projet en équipe type mode agile serait un plus.

What you can expect from us:
Donnez un élan à votre carrière.

Le secteur des technologies de l'information (TI) connaît une période extraordinaire. La transformation numérique des organisations continue de s'accélérer, et CGI est au premier plan de ce changement. Nous accompagnons nos clients dans leur démarche numérique et offrons à nos professionnels des opportunités de carrière stimulantes.

La réussite de CGI repose sur le talent et l'engagement de nos professionnels. Ensemble, nous relevons les défis et partageons les bénéfices issus de la croissance de notre entreprise. Cette approche renforce notre culture d'actionnaire-propriétaire ainsi, tous nos professionnels bénéficient de la valeur que nous créons collectivement.

Joignez-vous à nous pour prendre part à la croissance de l'une des plus importantes entreprises indépendantes de services en technologies de l'information (TI) et en gestion des processus d'affaires au monde.

Pour en savoir davantage à propos de CGI : www.cgi.com.

Les candidatures non sollicitées provenant de cabinets de recrutement ne seront pas retenues.

CGI favorise l'équité en matière d'emploi.

administration et désign de base de données

base de données MYSQL et architecture répliquée

de très grands ensembles de données et prise en charge d’un niveau de données complexe
en Linux
scripting en Pyton, Perl ou Shell

Connaissance dans une technologie de données persistantes (NewSQL, NoSQL)
Expérience de migration entre différents systèmes de base de données avec l’utilisation d’outil ou code spécifique

Expérience en automatisation et déploiement de scénarios avec Jenkins ou Chef

Implanté sur tous les continents, le Groupe emploie plus de 92 000 collaborateurs pour un chiffre d'affaires de 21 milliards d'euros en 2018. Safran occupe, seul ou en partenariat, des positions de premier plan mondial ou européen sur ses marchés. Pour répondre à l'évolution des marchés, le Groupe s'engage dans des programmes de recherche et développement qui ont représenté en 2018 des dépenses d'environ 1,5 milliard d'euros.

Safran est classé dans le Top 100 Global Innovators de Thomson Reuters ainsi que dans le palmarès " Happy at work " des sociétés où il fait bon vivre. Le Groupe est en 4ème position du classement Universum des entreprises préférées des jeunes ingénieurs en France.
Le groupe Safran recherche pour sa direction Safran Analytics, un(e) Data Integration Specialist. Au sein d'une équipe dédiée aux sujets d'intégration vous participerez à la mise en oeuvre des moyens nécessaires à l'analyse de données d'un bout à l'autre de la chaine de valeur.
Le périmètre d'intervention s'étend depuis la collecte des données brutes (issues de machines de fabrication ou d'aéronefs par exemples), jusqu'à la fourniture de tableaux de bord, ou d'applications d'analyses pour les utilisateurs métiers en passant par toutes les étapes de consolidation, nettoyage, analyses etc.

En fortes interactions avec les différentes équipes, vous pourrez vous appuyer sur des solutions/services groupes (par exemple, la connexion physique aux machines dans les usines), des solutions de traitement de données du marché, ou encore sur les équipes internes de Safran Analytics (équipe de DataScientists, Data Engineer etc.).

En tant que Data Integration Specialist, votre rôle sera de configurer et d'installer certains composants techniques et de prendre en charge le paramétrage applicatif (à minima pour vérifier que la chaine applicative fonctionne).
Plus précisément, et en étroite collaboration avec le leader de l'équipe Intégration et l'architecte End to End, vous serez en charge de :

Assembler et déployer rapidement des solutions de stockage et d'analyse (Build et déploiement Cloud / VM / Docker / K8S etc)
Automatiser des tâches (script shell / python)
Explorer et manipuler des fichiers texte avec parfois des volumétries très significatives
Installer et configurer des outils d'analyse de données (soit du commerce, soit développés en interne), sur le cloud interne de Safran Analytics
Effectuer la configuration technique de ces outils (ex. sécurité/authentification, accès à une base de données etc)

Vous pourrez également être amené(e) à :
Documenter les procédures d'install, de configuration des chaines en vue de leur reprise ultérieure par le département Informatique (dans le cas de l'industrialisation de la solution)
Tester fonctionnellement (a minima) et plus occasionnellement effectuer des tests en charge, résilience, backup/reprise
Développer des scripts de déploiement, config etc
Effectuer des configurations / Investigations réseau
Effectuer des activités d'administration simples (purge de filesystem, relance etc)
De formation Bac+5, vous êtes intéressé par la mise en oeuvre de solutions Data en environnement complexe. Curieux(euse), créatif(ve) vous êtes très motivé(e) par le challenge technique et la volonté de livrer des solutions qui sont utilisées par le plus grand nombre, avec un impact maximum. Vous avez à coeur de garantir l'accès aux services dans de bonnes conditions pour les utilisateurs.
Un bon niveau d'anglais sera nécessaire pour interagir avec tous vos interlocuteurs.

You must have an experience with Python development
You must have an experience with contributing to full-stack solutions and performance optimization
You must have an Interest in understanding and implementing data science algorithms
An experience with Agile development is highly appreciated
An experience with ElasticSearch and some Big Data technologies (Spark, HDFS, Kafka) is highly appreciated
You can communicate clearly in English, including with non-technical people
Why joining Kayrros?

description:
Passionné(e) par les nouvelles technologies ? Intéressé(e) par le secteur de l’énergie ? Rejoignez Kayrros, la start-up qui révolutionne le monde de l’énergie.
Kayrros est une start-up créée en 2016 et spécialisée dans l’énergie et l’intelligence artificielle. Rejoindre Kayrros, c’est rejoindre une équipe dynamique de 100 personnes basée à Paris (HQ) et dans nos bureaux de New-York, Houston, Singapour et Londres. Notre équipe internationale est principalement composée de Data Scientists, Data Engineers et Energy Analysts, dont le but est d’apporter de la transparence au secteur de l’énergie.
Kayrros utilise des technologies innovantes, telles que le traitement d'images par satellite et l'intelligence artificielle, pour capturer et analyser des données dans le secteur de l'énergie. Ces données combinées à notre expertise nous permettent de fournir à nos clients (traders, fond d’investissement et grandes entreprises), des informations sur les mouvements du marché mondial, afin de les aider à prendre de meilleures décisions d’investissement.
En septembre 2018, Kayrros a réalisé une deuxième levée de fonds de 21 millions d’euros, nous permettant de continuer notre croissance.
Nous recherchons actuellement pour notre bureau de Paris
un Software Engineer H/F (CDI)
Au sein de Kayrros, l’équipe Signal est en charge de maintenir et optimiser le Produit existant. Vous travaillerez au sein d’une équipe composée de 6 personnes (un Product Manager, un Data Engineer et plusieurs Oil & Gas Analysts).

En tant que Software Engineer, vous devrez donc :
Participer au développement d’un produit, de sa conception à l'industrialisation et prendre part aux choix techniques (architecture, technologies utilisées…).
Créer des pipelines de données et des modules réutilisables qui s’intégreront dans la plateforme Kayrros.
Travailler avec des Data Scientists pour mener des expériences, concevoir des solutions et déployer des modèles sur un grand volume de données.
Développer votre propre expérience, partager des conseils et profiter de ceux de l’équipe Engineering dans les domaines clés de Kayrros (computer vision, remote sensing, machine learning at scale…).
Déployer des pipelines CI / CD entièrement automatisés qui permettent à la fois de réduire le time-to-market et une fiabilité élevée en production.
Garantir la qualité de la code base Kayrros en participant entre autres à des code reviews.
Notre technologie
Langages: Python (notamment pyspark), la maitrise d’autres langages est appreciée
Outils: Linux, Git, Docker, Message brokers (Kafka/RabbitMQ)
Big Data: Hadoop (Yarn + HDFS), Spark, Elasticsearch

Le profil idéal
Vous êtes intéressé(e) par travailler au sein d’une start-up dynamique et en pleine croissance et vous êtes à la recherche d’une nouvelle opportunité.
Vous avez entre un et quatre ans d’expérience en tant que Software Engineer ou Back-End Engineer.
Vous avez une expérience du développement Python
Vous avez déjà contribué à des projets full-stack et pris en compte l’optimisation des performances
Vous avez envie de comprendre et déployer des algorithmes de Data Science
Une expérience de développement Agile est hautement appréciée
Une expérience avec ElasticSearch et certaines technologies Big Data (Spark, HDFS, Kafka) est très appréciée
Vous pouvez communiquer clairement en anglais, y compris avec des personnes non techniques.
Vous êtes dynamique, curieux et désireux d’en apprendre davantage sur le secteur de l’énergie et l’intelligence économique
Pourquoi Kayrros ?
Nous sommes une jeune entreprise en croissance et nous sommes extrêmement passionnés par ce que nous faisons
Nous sommes situés dans l’espace de co-working WeWork, rue la Fayette, 75009 (boissons gratuites, événements et atmosphère animée)
Vous travaillerez avec une équipe internationale et pratiquerez votre anglais (ou chinois, allemand, suédois, portugais ...) au jour le jour.
Notre processus de recrutement

description:
VOS PRINCIPALES MISSIONS

:

En tant que Cloud Data Engineer vous participez à la mise en place de plateformes Data innovantes et industrielles en architecture Cloud hybride pour nos grands clients des secteurs Banque / Assurances et Grande Distribution principalement.

Sous le pilotage d'un architecte Cloud Data Platform :
Vous concevez et développez en mode agile des composants logiciels d'automatisation du cycle de vie des données (ingestion, stockage, préparation, analyse, distribution...) y compris les aspects DevOps

Vous en accompagnez la validation et la mise en production au travers de la réalisation d'usage data-driven (v360°, analyse de sentiment, détection d'opportunité, reconnaissance automatique de document...)

Vous en opérez le transfert de compétence auprès des équipes chargées de leur maintien en condition opérationnelle

Selon votre appétence et votre expérience, vous participez en amont aux phases de cadrage des besoins métiers (définition des cas d'usage, identification des données, spécifications des exigences fonctionnelles et non fonctionnelles) et à la définition de l'architecture de la solution et aux choix des technologies.

Vous serez également amené à contribuer au développement et à l’enrichissement de notre Framework d'Industrialisation de Data Fabric,

smartfoundations™ Data Backbone

, que nous déployons sur la plupart de nos projets et qui permet d'accélérer le déploiement des patterns data-centric dans une logique multi-tenants/multi-usages.
Profil recherché UN POSTE FAIT POUR VOUS SI…

Vous êtes diplômé(e) d’un Bac+5 (école d’ingénieur, université…)

Vous avez à minima un premier niveau d'expérience comme Data Engineer ou équivalent sur une Cloud Data Platform (Google, Amazon, Microsoft, IBM, Alibaba)

Vous maîtrisez un ou plusieurs langages de programmation (Java Scala, Python...), plateforme d'intégration continue (Jenkins, Git, Sonar, Puppet, Chef...) et solution d'automatisation du déploiement 'Infrastructure-as-code' (Ansible, Terraform...)

Vous avez une âme d'explorateur des nouvelles technologies, aimez sortir de votre zone de confort et découvrir de nouveaux horizons. Vous êtes structuré et rigoureux et souhaitez évoluer vers un poste d'architecte solution cloud certifié sur une ou plusieurs de ces plateformes.
Entreprise Sentelis

est un cabinet de conseil en Stratégie, Gouvernance et Architecture du système d'information, spécialisé dans sa transformation par la mise en œuvre de plateformes digitales innovantes et industrielles.

Nos clients sont des décideurs des très grandes entreprises tous secteurs d’activité confondus. Nous connaissons une croissance soutenue et une notoriété grandissante grâce à la pertinence de notre vision et la qualité de nos prestations.

Sentelis recrute sur profil ; capacités, qualités, et potentiel d’évolution sont ce que nous privilégions.

Cloudmark as part of Proofpoint is looking for a Messaging Gateway Software Engineer to join our engineering team in Paris. The Cloudmark team builds software to provide high performance messaging security services to customers around the world, including AT&T, Time Warner Cable, Orange and Swisscom. We are looking for someone who is passionate about building high performance software and joining the fight against messaging abuse.
Your day-to-day
Major areas of responsibility will include writing software for our high-performance, multi-protocol, message processing solution
Design, architect and develop new features in the product with high quality implementations and performance constraints
Play a vital role in the delivery of ambitious new features and products from Engineering through to Production

Propose and implement improvements and optimizations to the code base to increase stability, performance, conformance
Contribute to the maintenance of released versions of the product.
What you bring to the team
Expert C developer, especially with low-level/system development. Knowledge of Python is a plus

Good knowledge of Git, the GNU toolchain, cmake, and other common development UNIX tools.
Very comfortable with fundamental Computer Science concepts such as algorithms, data structures, memory management, multithreading, etc.
Great focus on work quality. High expectations for your work and proud of what you achieve. Passionate and curious about technology in general. Always looking for ways to improve quality of the software.
Good communication skills both verbal and written (documentation) and good team player
Autonomous with good management of time
Have an Undergraduate or Graduate degree in computer science, mathematics, engineering or a related field or equivalent years of experience
Fluent in French and English

Provide with strategic administrative and project management support for the CTO (agenda, travel, expenses, meetings)
Assist the executive team in project management, supporting also critical initiatives (taking meeting notes during weekly meetings, organizing team meetings and team offsites, etc.)
Partner with different stakeholders on projects/events related to the R&D growth and communication (R&D All Hands, Beer&Tech, X-team initiatives, global events…)
Coordinate and facilitate administrative for the Department (Budget & procurements, invoices, contractors, etc.)
Coordinate R&D small internal events included communication (social & tech events, talks, corporate evening, breakfast, etc.) and punctual help on external events.
What do we require from you?
At least 4 years of significant experience as assisting a C-Level.
Ability to work in sync with internal parties as Marketing, Workplace Experience, Finance, Human Resources and Communications.
You are known for being organized, smart, inventive, autonomous, rigorous, proactive, collaborative and dynamic, well known for being a problem-solver.
Proficient with Office tools (O365 suite, Adobe reader and acrobat…).
You’re fulfilling yourself in a multicultural and dynamic environment who are in continuous growth.
You are fluent in English and another language will be a plus.
Bonus Point :
Interested by new technology, internet and digital world.
Join us and contribute to one of the best technical teams in Europe. We're lucky to have some of the brightest minds in the field. We value team work, openness, technical innovation, and results-oriented thinking. Criteo corporate culture is all about attracting and retaining the best talent. We aim to reward excellence so there are fantastic opportunities for the right candidate.

Benefits:
Competitive compensation package
35+ annual holidays days
Health insurance
Discounted transport and sports activities
Personalized relocation package if moving from abroad
Catered lunch
Private nursery
Maternity and paternity leave

Contract is a permanent contract. Candidates must be eligible to work in Paris full time without restriction

At Criteo, we dare to be different. We believe that diversity fuels innovation and creates an energy that can be seen and felt all over Criteo. We champion different perspectives and are committed to creating a workplace where all Criteos are heard, feel a sense of belonging, and are treated with respect and dignity.

description:
We are looking for a high-performing and ambitious Solution Manager with a proven experience and a passion for selling technology solutions to senior executives.
Within the Sales team, you will be based in Paris and reporting to the Chief Revenue Officer .
As a customer-focused technical sales professional you will participate in the pre-sales efforts in EUROPE/MEA regions by creating opportunities and partnering with the Sales Manager (based in Paris) to build a customer-centric sales value proposition.
To be successful in this role you must be comfortable managing multiple campaigns, while serving as the central point of technical contact for the customers, as well as the first go-to technical referent for Intersec’s sales team.
Requirements
The goal is to establish a trusted relationship and strong understanding of the customer’s business, translating business needs into technical requirement and developing and presenting a technical vision, business case and physical solution specifically modeled for the customer.
You will own the technical customer relationship and leverages strong technical and interpersonal skills to lead technical discussions and apply advanced subject matter expertise, providing guidance on current market landscape, challenges and the telco industry trends.

Responsibilities
Partner with the Sales Manager to define the business account plan
Support opportunity prospecting by proactively generating leads through your deep understanding of product capabilities to address business issues and provide business value.
Develop deep understanding of the customer business, industry drivers, major transformational factors and resulting business requirements to align Intersec solutions to address the customer’s requirements.
Support and lead large scale enterprise transactions as a Sales Engineer by using industry knowledge and understanding to move deals forward.
Manage the technical response to the response to RFI/RFP/RFQ including products, solutions, software and services.
Take the lead on moving deals through the sales process by knowing how and when to engage the appropriate Intersec and partner resources, tools and programs to accelerate the sales process and reduce the time to technical close
Define solution options and articulate benefits and ROI, effectively highlighting technological advantages and disadvantages from the customer’s perspective
Build with the customer a compelling business-case based on Intersec use-cases portfolio, and present it to the C-Level Executives.
Lead, Manage and optionally run PoC (Proof of Concept), value-based workshops and presentations of Intersec solutions to customers, including white-boarding and presentation of technical material
Be the customer advocate and liaison for product management and development
Work with multiple stakeholders in different functions such as Product Manager, Solution Architects and Marketing to illustrate use cases where Intersec can add value. This requires strong account management capability as well as a passion and enthusiasm for introducing disruptive technology.
Communicate and commit to internal technology and solutions roadmaps and NDAs, to help spur conversations around innovation.
Understand ecosystem of solution providers and ISVs likely to positively influence customer decisions
Provide proactive support to customers and prospects to ensure their successful adoption of the technology
Participate as a speaker in key company events and other marketing related activity.


Who we’re looking for :
A seasoned sales professional able to open new accounts through outstanding pre-sales activities
Profound understanding of various licenses of business models (subscription, SaaS, term-licensed)
Experience in selling in Telco environment (Core Network equipment, CRM, VAS Platform)
Trusted advisor, selling on C level in B2C and B2B markets
Knowledge of GSM/UMTS/LTE architectures and 3GPP standard protocols
Knowledge of Big data infrastructures, cloud solutions, virtualization technologies, IP routing and TCP
Business case focus : able to drive a business case, build a value proposition
Ability to sell a commercial proposal to both technical and non-technical teams
Strong skills on selling on value proposition and customer benefits
Knowledge of CRM software (Salesforce ideally) and Microsoft Office Suite
English is mandatory, local language is a plus
Strong leadership, communication, and technical skills
Persuasive presentation and public speaking skills. Must be able to command an audience while articulating a meaningful message
Self-motivated, self-starter and results oriented
Able to work in unstructured environments and situations, and prioritize effectively with minimal supervision
Availability to travel as needed
Benefits
Why join Intersec :
If you look up to strategic solution selling challenges and care about managing end-to-end opportunities with stature clients
If you're passionate about big data and cutting-edge solutions : we install a completely innovative solution, which manages phenomenal amounts of data and which allows our clients to find new sources of revenue (Big Data, Campaign Manager, Geolocation, Location based analytics,...)
If you're looking for an international scope and eager to travel for business necessities
If you enjoy multicultural environments (+22 nationalities)
Casual dress code, "wear your biggest smile" , Company restaurant, RTT & home-office
Ready for the challenge ? Let us know more about you !

titre_poste: Senior Chief Engineer Data Center Operations
date_publication:
Capijobnew.com - il y a 30+ jours
