description:
Datacenter Technician, Build & Delivery
Based: Paris, Amsterdam, Frankfurt or London
Salary: €50K + Bonus & Training + Bens
URGENT INTERVIEW NOW
A really exciting opportunity for a solid Datacenter Technical Engineer to work closely with Partners, Engineers & customer Stakeholder on Engagements for the Data Centre or Infrastructure Project build needs. You will use your technical experience as an Infrastructure Engineer to understand the customer’s Rack capacity, network and storage systems needs and pain points. Working in a small EMEA Team of Engineers with the IT Partners you will help on-site in the Data Centre required or the Network/Data Infrastructure needed to support their business critical requirements and deliver a “right first time” support in the Data Centre or IaaS experience. You will join this expanding Global Solution Provider, oversee & build DC Racks & Stacks with TCP/IP connectivity to configure Networking and Systems, set up Routers & Switches for their Computing Application needs across all vertical markets, Retail, eTail, Finance etc. as required.
This is a very “hands on” Technical Engineer position as a “Jack of all Trades” where you will identify, and deliver with Partners on Design Plans using Cisco Networks, EMC, DELL Servers and Storage, Security, DCIM, Power needs & cooling for Energy efficiencies for the Data Centre etc. You will work with Global Engineering Team to provide the delivery from the wide Portfolio of Products for the right solution for various networks software with LinuX, Windows or iOS or new IT systems or storage, high availability and 24/7 cover etc. as needed in various industry requirements needs etc. You will work with the Project Team & Regional Engineer & other Technical and Subject Matter Experts to understand customer requirements and deliver on-site for Projects required for various stages of the design and build plan, to meet expectations and realistic timescales. You will need English and French or German, as your local language, as required on Technical needs. As you will be supporting the European Regions too, these will be in English as the 1st Global language. All Training will be conducted in English too, therefore fluent English is a must.
This is a challenging opportunity and you may be working with some Legacy systems to transfer to faster networking, virtualisation or Optimisation to SaaS Projects. Migration, needs from the existing systems design needs for a new Data Centre or Co-location etc. and Systems which could be within various heavily regulated domains covering eTail, Retail, Financial, Energy, Banking, Insurance, Government & Utilities etc. Commissioning & decommissioning experience would be good to have.
Responsibilities will be varied and include:
Using your strong technical “hands on” delivery background in DC build, cabling, Fibre Channel etc. networking and storage needs for IaaS and on-site Data Centre planning needs.
You will be responsible for helping with the engineering life cycle, the delivery of the Data Centre or IaaS or PaaS etc Project to be rolled out. Good Electricity & Power experience, DR etc.
Continuously update technical knowledge and learn new products in Data Centre design and build such as Schneider Struxtureware, Emerson, Multipower UPS, APC, Energy & Cooling etc. Networking and Storage for service offerings and support.
Continuously maintain awareness of competitor offerings, strengths and weaknesses.
When up & running, you can progress to:
Working with the Stakeholders and team on the “As is & To be” model required and needs with the customer stakeholders or Partner Consultants and ensure that the design & Project Plan and timescales for the full life cycle are shared with the Engineers, Customer & Partners to agree on the needs and statement of works SOW to be delivered with the timescales and planned delivery, and potential issues, etc.
Projects initially will be cross vertical & you will help with small & larger Data Centre delivery across Cisco & integration needs.
Below is the wish list – as you will need to enjoy learning new skills and technologies as you cannot have them all:
An example could be - You will help with the plans to migrate data from old IT Infrastructure to new integrated systems to and this could be moving from on-premise to a new IaaS or Data Centre with DR and Co-location for expansion in Storage and faster network needs. This could include Unified Comms to deliver enhancements for Data Networks, LAN, WAN, Voice & Video, multiple devices, POS, laptops, virtual, remote working & integrate to secure networks & Cisco infrastructure. Hence you will be a “trusted Engineer” in a “hands on” role to deliver to the customer needs and provide confidence and a positive “can do” approach. You will add value and carry out trouble shooting on the Operating systems etc. Linux, Unix etc. as needed to provide best practice solutions. Knowledge and experience of Cisco Networking builds, switches, routers, Cisco Unified Comms, UCCX would be great etc. A lapsed CCNA or similar with IaaS and Virtualisation, Hyper V or VMWare based Apps would be advantageous, not essential.
You will work with Best Practice and understand regulatory Power & Energy issues for the customer journey, working with them on site, helping to make their daily IT systems easier to manage and ensure customer satisfaction etc.
Ideal Profile:
An experienced Datacenter Technical Engineer with full lifecycle over 3-5 years experience, used to working in a small regional team.
Used to delivering on some of the above needs together with:
Raise Issues, create break & fix issues and present to the Stakeholders with timescales and plan of delivery.
Passionate about a “right first time” Customer Support Journey experience & Best Practice.
Good capacity planning – lapsed CCNA or similar for networking and poss. low latency and connectivity needs etc. TCP/IP, Rack & Stack, Servers etc.
Good Technical and responding to issues and other Technical support & knowledge of Enterprise Architecture Systems and any knowledge of rack space, decommissioning and working on Co-location projects.
Degree. BSc. IT, Software, Systems or relevant experience in Enterprise, for larger systems for 24/7 transactions. Professional who enjoys delivering Data Center needs in a customer facing role with travel across your region & EMEA.
An exciting progressive career awaits you with a friendly & fun, passionate Company Team Spirit.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: 50,000.00€ /year
Experience:
Data Center: 1 year (Preferred)

meta1:
Senior P&C Actuary - (F/H)
GIE AXA2,274 avis - Paris (75)
date_publication:
AXA - il y a 30+ jours
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Primary mission
Position belongs to the P&C Group Risk Management team which is organized in several excellence centers (Actuarial & Business Reviews, Cat Modeling & Reinsurance, Economic Capital).
The candidate will report to the Group Head of P&C Actuarial & Business Reviews.
The Group Risk Management is a strategic department within AXA dealing with the most sophisticated P&C challenges and influencing strategic development decisions in P&C operations of a leading international insurance and reinsurance company.
The candidate will have to play a strong role in the achievement of the team objectives, notably maintaining the Group’s reserves at an adequate level, modelling all P&C Lines of Business’ risks (except natural events) and coordinating / conducting in-depth reviews of entities sponsored by the Group Management.
The candidate will interact with entity’s top management and in particular with the Heads of Actuarial, Underwriting, Claims and Finance departments.
Core activities of the team
Provide the Group with opinion on the Technical Reserves.
Regularly conduct in-depth reviews (IDR) of P&C entities to review the local underwriting, the claims management processes and the reserving.
Perform specific Technical Reserves review on a particular portion of the business whose complexity or materiality may require a Group opinion.
Support other Finance Group teams in handling matters dealing with reserves and profitability for P&C operations (e.g. M&A, IFRS17,…).
Identify strengths and weaknesses in the Group P&C reserving process in order to better engineer and forecast the profitability of P&C business.
Set-up and update the Reserving Standard, Solvency 2 Policy, guidelines and ensure their consistent application within the Group.
Operations (underwriting, claim management, pricing), governance and control
Contribute to the definition of the Group Standards and Solvency 2 Policies for underwriting, claims management and reinsurance.
Lead the Product Approval Process (PAP) which is applicable group-wide to portfolio review and new business launch.
Elaborate Group Risk Management’s opinion on risks and initiatives submitted to the Group Underwriting Committee (GUC) approval.
Develop Risk Management community’s second line of defense for P&C’s business areas. This means giving direct support to local entities by taking on new actions at the pre-P&C operation stage and at the post-operation stage as regards 2 nd level control.
Ensure Group Risk Management’s P&C Business expertise.
Group modelling tools and Risk Appetite
Define and supervise the P&C exposure collection In the Clymene Group Reporting tool for local entities’ P&C lines of business exposure (except Natural Catastrophes).
Lead and develop the modelling of the Group P&C risk for all P&C business (e.g. Liability, Cyber,…) except Natural Catastrophe risk. Hence deduce the reinsurance cover to be purchased at Group level in line with Group Risk Appetite.
Suggest and discuss the Group Risk Appetite limits for the various P&C lines of business, to be set by the Group Audit Risk & Compliance Committee (ARCC).
Prepare and update the P&C Risk Appetite to be validated quarterly by the Group Financial Committee.
Control local entities’ risk appetite complies with the Group Risk Appetite framework.
AXA XL integration
Following the acquisition of XL Group, AXA has transformed itself from a predominantly Life & Savings (L&S) focused company (with a risk profile “very much linked to financial market risks”) to a majority Property & Casualty (P&C) Company.
The deal creates the world’s largest P&C commercial lines writer and dramatically extends the P&C business scope where the team operates with:
New geographical areas of which the US market, the largest in the world
New Lines of business in P&C insurance, especially in the Specialty Lines segment
New type of underwriting with the Assumed Reinsurance segment.
The team is directly involved in making AXA XL integration a success on technical matters, ensuring that
The Group P&C risk appetite framework is appropriately set and extended to include the legacy XL Group business
The Group underwriting risk is identified, controlled and framed within the new enlarged scope
The governance is adjusted.
Qualifications
Technical and professional skills (technical expertise)
Solid background in all Insurance and Reinsurance business aspects
Technical P&C actuarial expertise in Reserving, Underwriting, Pricing and Modelling
Experience in large property / casualty commercial lines, specialty risks and assumed reinsurance is a strong asset.
Ability to build, use and understand various actuarial models. Knowledge of the data analytics techniques is an asset.
Knowledge of insurance accounting, reinsurance and audit techniques.
Good understanding of Underwriting, Claims and Reserves assessment connections.
Soft skills and competencies
Ability to build good working relationships, good communicator, flexible.
Ability to present key results in a factual concise format, communicate and persuade members of entities’ Senior Management.
Ability to work and lead projects within a network organization (project management skills)
Ability to coordinate several teams of senior underwriting and claims experts.
Ability to lead interviews with members of Senior Management.
Speak and write good English (must have).
Open to different cultures and to travelling.
Autonomy, organization, flexibility and capacity to adapt to new situations such as to carry unplanned workloads and a keen ability to enhance/organize team working practices.
Management skills
No direct FTE management but transversal management skills needed and ability to coordinate team experts works.
Experience
At least 5 years of experience in P&C actuarial fields, with significant experience as P&C Actuary.


A propos d'AXA
Aimeriez-vous vous lever chaque jour motivé(e) par une mission inspirante et travailler en équipe pour permettre de protéger les personnes et leurs proches?
Chez AXA nous avons l’ambition de mener la transformation de notre métier. Nous cherchons des personnes talentueuses ayant une expérience diversifiée, qui pensent différemment, et qui veulent faire partie de cette transformation passionnante en challengeant le statu quo et faire d’AXA – marque globale leader et une des sociétés les plus innovantes dans notre secteur – une entreprise encore plus performante et responsable.

description:
Datacenter Technician
Based: Paris
Salary: €50K + Bonus & Training + Bens
A really exciting opportunity for a solid Datacenter Technical Engineer to work closely with the customer Stakeholder on Engagements for the Data Centre or Infrastructure Project needs. You will use your technical experience as an Engineer to understand the customer’s network and storage systems needs and pain points. Working in a small EMEA Team of Engineers with the IT Partners you will help on-site in the Data Centre required or the Network/Data Infrastructure needed to support their business critical requirements and deliver a “right first time” support in the Data Centre or IaaS experience. You will join this expanding Global Solution Provider to configure Networking and Systems for their Computing Application needs across all vertical markets, Retail, eTail, Finance etc. as required.
This is a challenging opportunity and you may be working with some Legacy systems to transfer to faster networking, virtualisation or Optimisation to SaaS Projects. Migration, needs from the existing systems design needs for a new Data Centre or Co-location etc. and Systems which could be within various heavily regulated domains covering eTail, Retail, Financial, Energy, Banking, Insurance, Government & Utilities etc.
Responsibilities will be varied and include:
Using your strong technical “hands on” delivery background in networking and storage needs for IaaS and on-site Data Centre planning needs.
You will be responsible for helping with the engineering life cycle, the delivery of the Data Centre or IaaS or PaaS etc Project to be rolled out.
Working with the Stakeholders and team on the “As is & To be” model required and needs with the customer stakeholders or Partner Consultants and ensure that the design & Project Plan and timescales for the full life cycle are shared with the customer & Partners to agree on the needs and statement of works SOW to be delivered with the timescales and planned delivery, and potential issues, etc.
Projects initially will be cross vertical & you will help with small & larger Data Centre delivery.
Below is the wish list – as you will need to enjoy learning new skills and technologies as you cannot have them all:
An example could be - You will help with the plans to migrate data from old IT Infrastructure to new integrated systems to and this could be moving from on-premise to a new IaaS or Data Centre with DR and Co-location for expansion in Storage and faster network needs. This could include Unified Comms to deliver enhancements for Data Networks, LAN, WAN, Voice & Video, multiple devices, POS, laptops, virtual, remote working & integrate to secure networks & Cisco infrastructure. Hence you will be a “trusted Engineer” in a “hands on” role to deliver to the customer needs and provide confidence and a positive “can do” approach. You will add value and carry out trouble shooting on the Operating systems etc. Linux, Unix etc. as needed to provide best practice solutions. Knowledge and experience of Cisco Networking builds, switches, routers, Cisco Unified Comms, UCCX would be great etc. A lapsed CCNA or similar with IaaS and Virtualisation, Hyper V or VMWare based Apps would be advantageous.
You will work with Best Practice and understand regulatory issues for the customer journey, working with them on site, helping to make their daily IT systems easier to manage and review reports via DCIM needs etc.
Ideal Profile:
An experienced Datacenter Technical Engineer with full lifecycle over 3-5 years experience, used to working in a small regional team.
Who is used to delivering on some of the above needs together with:
Assist on any scoping projects that are needed and bring confidence to the customers, Raise Issues, create break & fix issues and present to the Stakeholders with timescales and plan of delivery.
Passionate about a “right first time” Customer Support Journey experience & Best Practice.
Good capacity planning – CCNA or similar for networking and poss. low latency and connectivity needs etc. TCP/IP, Rack & Stack, Servers etc.
Good Technical and responding to issues and other Technical support & knowledge of Enterprise Architecture Systems and any knowledge of rack space, decommissioning and working on Co-location projects.
Degree. BSc. IT, Software, Systems or relevant experience in Enterprise, for larger systems for 24/7 transactions. Professional who enjoys delivering Data Center needs in a customer facing role with travel.
An exciting progressive career awaits you with a friendly & fun, passionate Company Team Spirit.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: 45,000.00€ to 50,000.00€ /month
Experience:
Data Center: 3 years (Preferred)

description:
You are curious, rigorous and you like challenges?
Join the AXA Group Risk Management and the Life team!
The AXA Group , one of the worldwide leading companies in Financial Protection stays along and advises clients (individuals or companies) at each step of their life, answering to their needs in terms of products and insurance services concerning protection, health and savings.
The headquarters of the AXA Group, based in Paris 8th, gather the whole corporate activities of the Group. It coordinates with the different operating entities the group’s strategy and ensures the steering of international projects. The headquarters main characteristic is the important international culture with more than 42 nationalities.
The AXA Group Risk Management brings together high level and multidisciplinary staff with engineers, actuaries and financials split between Paris, Zurich, Madrid and the US.
Its mains missions are focused on the following key areas:
Analyze, model and aggregate the Group’s risks (economic capital and emergence of economic value),
Define the process enabling to limit the undertaken risks (assets accumulation, longevity, natural catastrophe...)
Optimize the Group’s protection (reinsurance, securitization, etc.).
Description
As part of the new Solvency II regulation, AXA has developed its own internal model for the calculation of the economic capital. The GRM Life team is responsible for the developments linked to the Life risks (Mortality, Longevity, etc.) and works continuously on the model’s improvements and on the quantification of these risks.
GRM offers a Life CAT Risk Analyst position within the Health and Protection team on the modeling of the whole Mortality risk including shocks by catastrophic events such as pandemic event.
The Mortality risk, mainly by its catastrophic component is equally one of the most important for Life Insurance companies. With the aim of defining its risk appetite, each insurance company has to quantify how it will resist to extreme mortality scenarios such as terrorism, earthquakes or pandemic events. In this respect, GRM Life has a direct contact with the data scientists of the AXA Data Innovation Lab to build the mortality concentration database of the Group (from a data lake of internal data supplemented by external one) as well as with researchers to propose innovative solutions concerning the improvement of the pandemic risk in the internal model.
Main tasks
Within the Health and Protection team your objectives will be defined as follows:
Participate in the building of the mortality concentration database using Big Data technics,
Participate to the improvement of the Life Catastrophic part of the internal model mainly on pandemic risk but also on earthquake and terrorism risks
Understand stochastic models of mortality internally developed and be proactive to improve it,
Make a link between the recent studies by researchers on Mortality/CAT risks and Internal Model,
Develop these improvements in internally developed tools and measuring impacts for the AXA Group.
Qualifications
Required skills
Graduate in statistics, actuary, engineer (Master or Phd), if possible with an IT and Data Science sensitivity,
You enjoy working in an international and a multicultural environment,
You are an expert when programming and you master at least one of the following languages (or equivalent): VBA, R, Python or C++ along with an excellent knowledge of Excel,
You have strong mathematical knowledge (Stochastic models, Monte Carlo simulations),
You have to be fluent in English (written and spoken language).
A propos d'AXA
Aimeriez-vous vous lever chaque jour motivé(e) par une mission inspirante et travailler en équipe pour permettre de protéger les personnes et leurs proches?
Chez AXA nous avons l’ambition de mener la transformation de notre métier. Nous cherchons des personnes talentueuses ayant une expérience diversifiée, qui pensent différemment, et qui veulent faire partie de cette transformation passionnante en challengeant le statu quo et faire d’AXA – marque globale leader et une des sociétés les plus innovantes dans notre secteur – une entreprise encore plus performante et responsable.
Dans un monde en perpétuelle évolution et avec une présence dans 64 pays, nos 165 000 salariés et distributeurs privilégiés anticipent le changement pour offrir des services et solutions adaptés aux besoins actuels et futurs de nos 107 millions de clients.
Le siège du Groupe AXA, basé à Paris 8ème, regroupe les activités Corporate du Groupe. Il coordonne avec les différentes entités la stratégie du Groupe, et assure le pilotage des projets internationaux. La particularité du siège réside notamment en la présence d’une forte culture internationale (39 nationalités).
Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?
Nous vous offrons de nombreuses perspectives de carrière dans un environnement international. N’hésitez pas à postuler si vous êtes intéressés !

description:
Primary purpose of this position:
Members of the Group Operational Risk Management (4 people) main duties are:
Animate and coordinate operational risk network, ensure harmonization of practices and implementation of Group guidelines, promote best practices exchange.
Ensure the qualitative and quantitative assessment of the major operational risk amongst the AXA entities and compute the Group Operational risk STEC quantification
Optimize the capital charge within the AXA Group and monitor the implementation of actions plans against the main operational risks.
Ensure and promote the operational risk losses and incident data collection
In this context, the objectives of the the candidate are the following:

Principles and methodologies:
Define and spread the Group’s quantitative and qualitative principles and requirements.
Support and challenge the operational risk scenarios identified and assessed by the AXA Entities on both quantitative and qualitative aspects.
Ensure follow-up and effectiveness of the Group losses and incidents database.
Challenge, share and follow-up the action plans on major risks.
Modelling:
Ensure entities are in line with internal operational risk modelling approach and contribute to the related justification vis à vis regulators
Be the priviledged point of contact on operational risk modelling topics
Capital Charge validation/Production:
Compute the annual production of the Group Operational risk capital charge
Apply validation requirements at Group level and ensure entities are in line with local requirements.
Participate to the evolution and maintenance of Group operational risks software.
Prepare reports on the Group operational risk profile to the Group Executive Management, the regulator….
Local Coordination :
Be a privileged contact point with the local Operational Risks Managers (from 7 to 10 countries/areas).
Define methodological principles with regards to identification, measurement and reduction of operational risk
Ensure the roll out of these methodologies within the Operational risk community
Monitor the losses and incidents’ data collection.
Follow-up on action plans.
Ensure that local specificities are well reflected in the local operational risk profile.
Ensure consistency of local practices with Group requirements.

Qualifications

Technical and professional skills (technical expertise)
Strong mathematical background (engineer/actuary degree)

Knowledge of internal and external requirements (regulators, rating agencies) with regards to the risk management and assessment within the frame of Solvency II.
General knowledge of insurance industry.

description:
We believe in a world where all cars are shared. Carsharing empowers people to get going in a smarter, easier way, while also having a positive impact on the environment and making cities more liveable. It’s this vision that propels us forward and inspires us to think even bigger.
Since April 2019, Drivy is now part of Getaround. Together, we’re the world's leading carsharing platform with a community of more than 5 million users sharing over 11,000 connected cars across 7 countries.
Our team is collaborative, positive, curious, and engaged. We think fast, work smart, laugh often, and are looking for like-minded people to join us in our mission to disrupt car ownership and make cities better.
Who you’ll work with
You will join the engineering team (27 brilliant people!) as a Data Engineer in our growing Data Engineering squad (2 people). You’ll report toMichaeland will take on many different challenges.
Our team has a great impact and high-leverage: it helps the entire company be more productive and make better decisions. We love to be open about the work we do. Some examples are:
Why we've chosen Snowflake ❄️as our Data Warehouse
Airflow Architecture
Data quality checkers
From member voice to UX
Redshift - Tips & Tricks
Embulk
We also give back to the community by contributing to different projects like Redash, Apache Airflow, Telegraf, Embulk or many different Ruby projects.
What you'll work on
Our main challenge this year is to make our data stack and pipelines more reliable to go from a model where data is used mainly for reporting and ad-hoc analysis to one where we can use this data in our product.
Here are a few more detailed examples of what you'll take on:
Ensure high SLAs on our core tables, making sure they have excellent freshness, reliability, and documentation.
Work closely with data analysts/data scientists and other groups to support them with various tasks and implement new ETL pipelines.
Maintain and enhance our growing core data infrastructure and ETL framework.
Build tools to improve company productivity with data.
Develop processes to monitor and ensure data integrity.
We’re building a marketplace that will scale to millions of users in many different countries in the coming years. You can imagine that there will also be many challenging problems that we haven’t even thought of yet!
What you'll bring to the table
2+ years experience
You are able to write complex SQL in your sleep and you're fluent in Python.
You care about agile software processes, reliability, data quality, and responsible experimentation. You are also pragmatically lazy. If it can be automated, it will be automated.
You’re a team player, have excellent communication and organisational skills, understand the value of collaboration and work well within a team.
You take satisfaction in clearing roadblocks for the team.
Knowledge of ETL design, implementation and maintenance
Experience withMPP or a columnar database and with cloud-based infrastructures such as AWS or GCP.
Able to communicate in English
Our Tech Stack
Apache Airflowfor ETL workflows
Embulk with various Python, Ruby and Shell scripts for ETL
SparkandEMRfor large scale data processing
Snowflakeas our Data warehouse
Telegraf/InfluxDB/Grafanafor instrumentation and monitoring
CircleCIfor continuous integration
Redashand Tableaufor visualizations
Internal tool for tracking (Ruby, Javascript, Python, Redis and AWS Mobile Analytics)
What we offer:
A solid engineering team with a lot of experience
The peace of mind of a large test suite and pull requests to stay sane and ship often
Getting to learn from your peers and to share your knowledge on the blog and in our internal presentations every two weeks
A ticket to one technical conference of your choice each year
Open source projects are being extracted from the codebase when appropriate
We'll buy any non fiction books you want to read, and you'll get access to our growing library
Offices in Paris, San Francisco, Berlin, London, Barcelona, New York...
We often organise meetups in our office
Tickets restaurants, a good health insurance
"Hack days" to experiment with new technologies and ideas as well as other team events

Expérience:
data engineer (m/w) ou similaire: 2 ans (Souhaité)

Our SaaS platform streamlines the management of digital product content (i.e., packaging, ingredients, visuals, promotions, rich media), extracts structured metadata for optimal quality and usability, and automates delivery to retail partners and third party service providers.
Founded in 2011, and backed by world renowned investors (Index Ventures, Serena Capital, Cathay Innovation, Partech Ventures), Alkemics has 70+ talented employees, and has offices in the very heart of Paris.
Our startup culture allows for very flat hierarchy, and for everyone, regardless of seniority, to have a big impact. We are looking to continue building a kickass team, so if you're looking for a new challenge, give us a sign!

At Alkemics every day is different but your mission will include:
Building the client-facing applications of our data exchange platform
Creating an effective UX/UI to enable our clients to be successful in their missions
Using and developing APIs that can handle billions of requests
Proposing and developing features involving our full stack
Using cutting edge technologies: ReactJS + Redux, ES6+, testing with Jest + Enzyme, Webdriver.io
Requirements
What we're looking for in your:
2+ years of XP working as a Frontend Software Engineer in a strong engineering environment
Experience with ReactJS + Redux
Experience in testing (unit tests, end-to-end tests)
Broad knowledge and genuine curiosity about frontend development
Experience designing large single-page applications in a B2B software company is a plus
Capacity to handle a continuous integration workflow
Experience working in an agile team
Capacity to get things done
Fluency in English. French is a plus
Benefits
True startup experience in one of the fastest growing startup in Paris: no bureaucracy and daily successes that have a real impact on the business
Competitive monthly salary (according to your experience)
Inner source culture
Work with dynamic, smart and passionate people
Extras: weekly sport sessions, meditation, team offsites, lunch sessions.

With more and more data, Medical Imaging is becoming more and more complex. We use Artificial Intelligence technology to transform Medical Imaging. This is a fantastic opportunity to empower physicians, saving them time, bringing them closer to their patients, and helping most of the population get access to the best modern care.

Among R&D team, you play a key role in the design and development of our SaaS platforms for co-creation and distribution of AI based applications for medical imaging.

Job Details
The Signature Success team provides the highest level of support and expertise to some of our largest and most strategic accounts, globally. This responsibility includes developing a strong partnership across Worldwide Support, R&D, and our Support Operations team.

As a designated Support Engineer in the Signature Success Team, you would be responsible for on-boarding, implementing and managing the delivery of Signature Success to your customers. This includes seamless on-boarding, performing weekly business reviews, understanding customer roadmap, enabling technical engineers internally to solve customer issues, building effective customer relationships and being deeply vested in your customers’ success.

Key Responsibilities:

As Support Engineer (Mission Critical):
You own ultimate responsibility for your customer’s daily operations and end-to-end customer experience.
Accountable for customer satisfaction for which you go above and beyond that includes but not limited to managing expectations, following-through on issues that matter to customer using all possible channels to engage customer, strategically plan their roadmap and layout Signature Success support requirements/plan.
Manage highly visible, global and strategic enterprise accounts and ensure the highest levels of customer satisfaction with Signature Success Support. You are the sole representative of customer requirements and their expectations from Signature Success.
Quarterback critical issues of high impact to customer, managing customer communications, coordinating with internal Salesforce teams to orchestrate the right support and be the voice of customer internally.
Oversee and manage the resolution of technical issues, ensuring prompt and complete resolution to technical challenges and business issues. Capable of managing expectations with cross-functional teams with the common goal of customer success and willing to do hands-on where applicable to help accelerate the investigation process. Review the progress or lack thereof periodically with the customer.
You promote maximum value from the customer's investment in Salesforce Signature. In partnership with the account team, you will prepare, and deliver quarterly business reviews with strategic customer stakeholders for your assigned accounts complete with KPIs and 90-day plans.
Serve as a Trusted Advisor, drive conversations with our customer's Business Stakeholders armed with best practices for enterprise architecture functions such as Security, Performance, Development Process, Release Management and Application Governance.
Understand and document how the customer uses our technology and to ensure the larger Signature Success Technical team understand & has the appropriate level of customer knowledge to increase familiarity while resolving cases.
Provide proactive support, including but not limited to; preparing/presenting trending graphs/reports, leverage the Signature Success Technical team for deeper analysis, engage with customer's account team to understand their technology road map and provide recommendations and best practices to minimise potential service disruptions.
Advocate Signature Success customer's priorities internally within Salesforce. Liaise and work closely with the Salesforce R&D and Infrastructure teams on escalated technical issues and product roadmap changes/new features.
Participation in Signature Success project work, including but not limited to; envisioning and sourcing new monitoring and/or reporting tools, creating or improving existing processes/procedures, as well as developing/providing additional "white glove" support practices associated to incident prediction and prevention capabilities.
Be part of building Signature Success Ohana, inspiring the rest of the team to work cohesively with customer success as common goal.
Serve as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) exhibiting the highest level of expertise in providing Salesforce Support. The SME may be asked to review, improve, and approve technical work; to guide others; and to mentor or teach.
Create knowledge base materials dedicated towards operational efficiency while also empowering and enabling the greater support community. Share best practices with team members to enhance the quality and efficiency of customer support.
Ability to orchestrate all salesforce teams efforts and ensure we are single point of contact for all post sales support activities.

Comfortable interacting with all levels of customer and Salesforce management
Develop strong relationships with appropriate key decision makers
Familiarity of Cloud technologies and business

ITIL and/or PMP certification

description:
The Paris-Saclay CDS for has opened data science positions to reinforce the data science ecosystem and to build and support a data science platform. The data scientist will work on (in order of priority):
Data-science support: The CDS has many collaborations between scientists and engineers across scientific disciplines. The candidate will work on a small number of data-science projects with different scientific partners. The candidate should be interested in a variety of scientific applications of data processing and able to understand an application, to communicate with scientists of a different culture, and to deploy data-processing solutions for their needs. Current projects include:
Galaxy/star classification for preparing the LSST data processing pipeline.
Particle tracking for the ATLAS/LHC upgrade.
Segmenting and classifying Solar wind time series data.
Classifying hospital stays (PMSI coding) with APHP.
Laser spectrometry to improve the safety of intravenous drug administration.
Improving search in large biological and biomedical data sets.
Analyzing sensor data for tracking pollution and its health effects (Polluscope).
Classifying crowdsourced ecology data (Spipoll).
Software engineering: The objective to enable researchers to do better science thanks to better software tools. It means bringing state of the art data science research software into high quality toolboxes (as scikit-learn). Getting involved with open source development. Assisting data scientists (students, postdoctoral fellows, permanent researchers) to develop their software engineering skills and to get them involved with open source development.
Training: Accompany domain scientists in their data analysis efforts. Accompany data scientists in their methodological research. Designing training sprints and practical material for the courses (cf. based on software carpentry)
Team
The data scientist will work with scikit-learn core developers such as Gaël Varoquaux, Olivier Grisel, Loic Estève, Alexandre Gramfort and others. Possible collaboration with data and domain science researchers such as Balazs Kegl, Isabelle Guyon, Sarah Cohen-Boulakia, Karine Zeitouni, David Rousseau, and others.
Qualifications
M.S. / Ph.D. in Computer Science, Statistical Machine Learning
Good understanding of the data science workflow. Experience with data challenges is a plus.
Strong programming experience with one or more data science languages (Python, R, Matlab)
Experience with open source development (desired but not required).

The applicant should send a CV, a statement of purpose, and up to three letters of recommendations to cdsupsay@gmail.com.

Position is open now and will be open until it is filled.

Be part of an elite team in a rapidly growing international software company. Your career with us will combine cutting edge technology, exposure to worldwide partners and clients across all industries (Financial Services, Automotive, Insurance, Pharma, etc.), exciting growth path for technical, product and customer-facing roles, direct mentorship, and access to senior management as part of a global team. Your mission is to help our clients and prospects in the region to realize their full potential through accelerated adoption and productive use of Denodo's data virtualization capability in many solutions.

Duties & Responsibilities
As a Partner Sales Engineer at Denodo, you play an integral role in the sales of our Data Virtualization software through our growing partner and channel ecosystem. You work closely with the business development team to understand partners’ technical and business needs and to demonstrate how those can be achieved through the capabilities of our Denodo Platform. You own the technical dimension of the partner sales cycle and successfully employ a combination of high technical expertise, project implementation, communication and coordination skills between partners and internal Denodo teams to achieve your mission.
Work closely with the business development team and the account managers for the assigned partner accounts as an extended member of this team in the region.
Deliver ongoing product education, coaching, and support during the introduction as well as ongoing partner lead projects with the Denodo Platform to achieve a high level of partner success and client satisfaction.
Work with partners to architect appropriate technical solutions and reference architectures to meet customer needs.
Support partners throughout the sales cycle, providing support for demos, RFIs/RFPs and Proofs of Concepts.
Diagnose and resolve partner inquiries related to operating Denodo software products in their environment.
Participate in problem escalation and call prevention projects to help partners and other technical specialists increase their efficiency when using Denodo products.
Contribute to knowledge management activities and promote best practices for project execution.
Implement product demos and pilots to showcase Data Virtualization in enterprise scenarios, cloud deployments, and Big Data projects.
Provide timely, prioritized and complete partner-based feedback to Product Management, Sales, Support and/or Development regarding client’s business cases, requirements and issues.

Qualifications

Experience Range: 5+ years working in a pre or post sales role.
University Degree relating to information systems or computer science (Bachelor, Master)
Understanding of Data Integration patterns: ETL, Data Virtualization, Application Integration/ESB
Solid understanding of SQL and a good grasp of relational and analytical database management theory and practice. Good knowledge of software development and architectural patterns.
Technical skills include Java development, JDBC, XML, Web Service related APIs, experience with version control systems (e.g. SVN, git).
Basic experience in Big Data, NoSQL, and InMemory environments is welcome.
Experience in Windows & Linux (and UNIX) operating systems in server environments.
Personal and Relationship qualities: Professional curiosity and the ability to enable yourself in new technologies and tasks. Active listener. Curiosity and continuous learning. Creativity. Team worker.
Communications: Good written/verbal communication skills (other international languages is a plus) are essential for interaction with clients, making presentations, attending meetings and writing technical documentation.
Willingness to travel.

Additional Information

Employment Practices
We are committed to equal employment opportunity.
We respect, value and welcome diversity in our workforce.
We do not accept resumes from headhunters or suppliers that have not signed a formal fee agreement. Therefore, any resume received from an unapproved supplier will be considered unsolicited, and we will not be obligated to pay a referral fee.

Trimble supports the adoption of BIM technology and processes through project-based services, allowing teams to advance their use of these critical systems while meeting project schedules. We provide training and knowledge transfer as part of every engagement. Our project teams can innovate with confidence while serving shared goals of the highest quality, speed, and maximum value.

As Senior VDC Consultant you are responsible for the implementation of digital design methods and tools on a range of project phases and types, with a focus on advanced systems.

In conjunction with a Project Manager you will define, design and implement project solutions for architects, engineers and builders. Daily tasks include building process and technical standards, technology configuration and implementation, automation via scripting and leading/participating in internal and external project teams.

As Senior Consultant, you have developed advanced capabilities in multiple technical areas and are capable of defining & leading technical missions. You have demonstrated advanced abilities to work with clients, communicate, and problem-solve, and are a valuable contribution to your team and the project team.

Responsibilities
Review and develop advanced BIM/VDC systems and platforms for both project teams and organizations.
Exhibited superior client-management and team-management and leadership skills.
Comfortable leading teams, defining goals from the perspective of the Trimble Client, and managing project schedules.
Define and map key project processes, and continuously seek ways to improve and eliminate waste.
Develop and host workshops, attend and actively participate in large project meetings to present and defend the deliverables of Trimble and those of its partners.
Develop well-structured documents including scope of work, client communication, and written deliverables describing project vision, mission, organization and work plans.
Liaise with a Director on client management, project invoicing, and operations.
Skills & Experience Required:
3-5+ years of professional experience
Graduate degree in architecture, engineering, or construction management
Experience in industry standard and advanced digital design tools
Exceptional skills in Revit and Rhino
Experience in using Navisworks
Experience in integrating multiple technology platforms
Ambition to contribute to new and developing technologies and workflows.
Proven ability to collaborate as part of a multidisciplinary team.
Desirable skills :
Technical expertise with Dynamo and Revit add-in development
Technical expertise with Rhino and Grasshopper
Familiarity with Tekla.
Trimble is transforming the way the world works by delivering products and services that connect the physical and digital worlds. Core technologies in positioning, modeling, connectivity and data analytics enable customers to improve productivity, quality, safety and sustainability. From purpose-built products to enterprise lifecycle solutions, Trimble software, hardware and services are transforming a broad range of industries such as agriculture, construction, geospatial and transportation and logistics.

Trimble is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, gender, age, color, religion, national origin, marital status, disability, sexual orientation, status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws, or any other protected factor. description:
Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience presenting and delivering technical presentations.
Experience with big data and machine learning frameworks, as well as numerical programming frameworks.

Preferred qualifications:
Master's degree in Computer Science or other technical field
Experience in data and information management.
Experience architecting and developing software or infrastructure for scalable, distributed systems.
Ability to quickly learn, understand, and work with new emerging technologies, methodologies, and solutions in the Cloud/IT technology space.
About the job
The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and evolve their business through the use of Google’s global network, web-scale data centers and software infrastructure. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.
As a Sales Engineer for Machine Learning, you'll work hand-in-hand with Technical Sales teams as a Machine Learning subject matter expert to differentiate Google Cloud to our customers. You will help prospective customers and partners understand the power of Google Cloud, explaining technical features, helping customers design architectures, and problem-solving any potential roadblocks. You will also have the opportunity to help customers to leverage specialized Machine Learning (ML) hardware developed by Google, called Tensor Processing Unit (TPU). The TPU is Google’s most advanced ML technology and in this role you will work hand-in-hand with customers and product development to shape the future of the platform.
Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life.
Responsibilities
Work with the team to identify and qualify business opportunities, understand key customer technical objections and develop the strategy to resolve technical blockers.
Provide in-depth Machine Learning expertise to support the technical relationship with Google’s customers, including product and solution briefings, proof-of-concept work, and partner directly with product management to prioritize solutions impacting customer adoption to Google Cloud.
Work hands-on with customers to demonstrate and prototype Google Cloud product integrations in customer/partner environments.
Recommend integration strategies, enterprise architectures, platforms and application infrastructure required to successfully implement a complete solution using best practices on Google Cloud.
Travel to customer sites, conferences, and other related events as required.
At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. description:
Position Goals
Contributes to the Ipsen vision to be a global leading biotech company focused on innovation and Specialty Care. Enables the Ipsen ID (Information Technology & Digital) vision to be systematically “one move ahead”, and to deliver enterprise solutions as that are as intuitive and friendly to use as consumer applications we use in our personal lives. Contributes to integrate Ipsen in the digitized world and to become a data-driven company.
Serves as an IT Partner to Ipsen’s Regulatory Affairs domain (GRA) and will be empowered to lead the analysis of complex business problems and the translation of business requirements into successful technical solutions and processes. Leads development of scope definition and business priority and will be responsible for proactively identifying technology solutions to meet business objectives, understanding complex business processes, eliciting, and documenting requirements, and coordinating communication, considering the implications of change on the organization and all stakeholders.
Focuses continuously on opportunities to improve or innovate business processes through technology, especially monitoring digital trends and fostering data integration solutions between applications in the business domain both internally and externally to the organization.
Main Responsibilities and Tasks
Responsibilities
Tasks
Extreme Customer-Centricity
Places the customer in the center systematically.
Adopts a go and see approach and lives in the shoes of our customers.
Owns & tackles customer pain points and/or irritants and seeks opportunities to increase client satisfaction and adoption.
Proactively proposes innovative solutions to the business to address its changing goals and needs.
Guarantees the proper selection of IT solutions for the customer business domain
Understands the goals, challenges, plans, and processes related to the customer business domain.
Manages requirements gathering, prioritizing and negotiating with business stakeholders to ensure the delivered solution meets or exceeds end user’s expectations.
Validates and interprets business needs by conducting feasibility studies and drafting business cases.
Develops the necessary documentation for solution selection, including as-is and to-be business processes and clear and testable business requirements, business use cases and RFPs.
Recommends business process and system changes to innovate and improve efficiency and business outcomes.
Assists in solution identification and selection, including recommendations for buy vs. build or on-premise vs. external implementations.
Solves or leads others to resolve complex problems, aiming to influence the business in a positive way. Evaluates ways of prioritizing opportunities to streamline business and/or system processes.
Participates as a key member of implementations
Assures proper selection, planning, implementation, testing and validation, training, and transition to Support of solutions which meet end user requirements.
Develops the necessary documentation for implementation and ongoing support of IT solutions projects, including test plans & scripts, and system application support, and end-user knowledge transfer.
Serves as a technical/functional expert for pilots, prototypes, application configuration and migration of historical data.
Helps facilitate clear communication and coordination between business stakeholders, IT delivery teams, and vendors.
Reports to management & steering committees, makes recommendations, suggesting options and acknowledging risks and mitigations.
May perform other project management activities as required.
Coordinates and communicates system lifecycle activities and ensures the solutions continue to meet the needs of the GMA business unit.
Ensures all documentation respects Quality standards, policies and procedures.
Maintains current knowledge of IT and business domains
Acts as subject matter expert in the business domain and actively shares emerging industry standards/trends with customers and peers.
Monitors technology and methodology evolutions in his/her domain.
Understands and influences vendor solutions/roadmaps and industry technology advancements along with evolving regulatory requirements.
Participates in the ongoing governance of the applications for his/her business clientele.
Builds and maintains an external network of contacts.
Digital transformation
Seeks to introduce cloud, digital workspace, and data-driven approaches.
Embraces and promotes digital mindset: lean start-up, design thinking, agile methodologies.
Experience / Qualifications
Experience:
Minimum: Bachelor’s or Engineer in IT or life sciences, with 5-7 years of experience working as an IT professional in the biotechnology or pharmaceutical industries required, particularly supporting the regulatory affairs domain.
Other Specifications:
Strong knowledge of processes and solutions related to regulatory affairs: regulatory submissions management, regulatory reporting, regulatory labeling processes. Knowledge of compliance international regulations and ICH environment foundations.
Diverse experience in IT solutions for pharmaceutical or biotechnology regulatory affairs, especially Veeva Vaults.
Experience with international and/or multi-site IT projects is required.
Knowledge of computerized system quality and lifecycle processes, with specific experience in GxP validation processes, is required. Knowledge of IT quality procedures and best practices related to FDA, EMA, GxP, CFR 21 Part 11, Computer system validation.
French/English bilingualism is required, ability to write, speak and present in the English language.
PMI-PBA or PMI-PMP certification is a plus.
Required Skills
Technical skills
Ability to analyze, synthesize, evaluate, and translate business needs and processes into user specifications and test plans, and to select the best solutions for the Regulatory Affairs Business domain.
Specifies data integration solutions between applications both internally and externally to the organization.
Knowledge of data modeling and business architecture concepts and techniques.
Experience working with IT delivery teams such as infrastructure and architecture, applications development & integration, and application and Service Desk support in the implementation and maintenance of scientific computing platforms & applications.
Functional skills
Strong leadership in project execution, driving business requirements implementation and vendors relationship. Engages to deliver solutions on time, on scope, on quality and on budget for a better user experience.
A positive attitude and demonstrated ability to build relationships with multiple audiences and engaged to providing excellent customer service.
Well-developed business partnering & collaboration skills.
Excellent elicitation, written and oral communication skills.
Customer-centric, focused on action and results.
Well-developed abilities to work autonomously, to organize, to coordinate, to prioritize, and to multi-task.
Ability to work under pressure and to adapt and innovate in an ever-changing business and IT environment.
The position is based in Les Ulis, France, but global in scope. There could be occasional travel to our UK & US R&D sites.
Dans le cadre de ses recrutements IPSEN s’engage au respect de l’égalité de traitement des candidats, indépendamment du sexe, de l’âge, de l'orientation sexuelle, de l'origine ethnique, de la couleur de la peau, de la nationalité, du handicap ou de l'appartenance à un syndicat.

Bien plus qu’une startup technologique, iziwork est une startup data. En transverse de nos produits, toute l’intelligence et la performance d’iziwork repose sur notre plateforme data - qui doit être demain l’atout de notre compétitivité.
Vous rejoignez notre Product Team dans le cadre d’une création de poste hautement stratégique pour iziwork. Directement rattaché à notre Head Of Product, vous prenez le lead sur l’activité Data d’iziwork et serez amené à superviser une équipe de PMs sur des dimensions spécifiques.
En tant que Senior Product Manager, vous êtes en charge de toute l’activité PM liées à nos sujets data : outils et plateformes data, algorithmes de matching et de scoring, programme d’enrichissement des données utilisateurs/métiers, catalogue/référentiel ...
Votre périmètre couvre notamment:
Mener des recherches qualitatives et quantitatives pour comprendre les besoins utilisateurs ;
Collecter et analyser les données pour optimiser l’utilisation et la conversion ;
Comprendre les besoins aussi bien business que technique et leurs implications ;
Construire et faire évoluer la vision produit sur la base de ces éléments et donnés, comme de l’analyse de la concurrence et des feedback des équipes (tech et métier) ;
Concevoir la stratégie et définir la roadmap associée pour s’assurer que nous construisons les bonnes fonctionnalités au bon moment ;
Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes internes tout au long du cycle de conception et développement ;
Garantir la qualité et la conformité des nouvelles fonctionnalités ;
Mesurer et analyser les performances des fonctionnalités et des produits dans une démarche d’amélioration continue.
Assurer la bonne communication et l’implication de l’ensemble des collaborateurs autours de vos projets.
EXPÉRIENCE & COMPÉTENCES
Expérience minimum de 5 ans comme Product Manager, dont expérience obligatoire sur des sujets Data / Algorithme, idéalement en environnement SaaS.
Issue d’une formation orientée tech (informatique, mathématique…), vous avez idéalement de précédentes expériences comme Data Engineer, Data Scientist ou Software Engineer sur des sujets data et/ou algorithme.
Connaissance avancée de l’écosystème data : outils, technologies, usages …
Excellente compétence en communication vis à vis de toutes les parties prenantes d’un projet et à tous les niveaux.
Véritable vision produit aussi bien du côté business que de l’expérience utilisateur.

description:
La Tech chez Kapten (ex-Chauffeur Privé), c'est... une équipe pluridisciplinaire d'environ 70 personnes regroupant des talents complémentaires : développeurs back, front et full-stack, développeurs iOS et Android, SRE, DBA, Data Analyst, Scientist et Engineer, QA et Product Manager. La tech est composée de 6 Tribes regroupant plusieurs squads (feature teams), sur un modèle inspiré par Spotify. Plus de détails sur notre organisation tech ici : https://bit.ly/2yZPWyB
Environnement technique... La plateforme Kapten est composée de plusieurs micro-services et applications web, chacun d’entre eux possédant leurs propres BDD et API. Notre stack technique repose sur Node.js, React, Go, Python connectée à des bases de données MongoDB, Postgres, ElasticSearch.
Nous recrutons actuellement plusieurs Développeurs(-euses) Fullstack pour rejoindre nos équipes en stage !
Ambition du stage : Améliorer, développer et construire ensemble la stack technique Kapten de demain pour apporter la meilleure expérience à nos millions d’utilisateurs.
Notre environnement de production "data driven" permet de suivre et améliorer continuellement nos KPI métiers.
Nous recherchons actuellement des stagiaires pour les départements :
B2C : au service de nos clients pour améliorer leur expérience de ride
Supply : accompagner nos chauffeurs partenaires à optimiser leur journée (chiffre d'affaire, temps d'attente, etc..)
B2B : accompagner les entreprises (des startups au grands comptes) à se déplacer au quotidien
Nos trois obsessions :
Robustesse : nous visons un uptime de 100%, nos développements doivent êtres robustes, nous migrons sans downtime et somme ultra-rigoureux, notamment sur les tests unitaires et fonctionnels
Scalabilité : notre trafic augmente sans cesse, nos services doivent pouvoir absorber la charge actuelle et future
Pertinence : juste ce qu’il faut, ni plus, ni moins, pour la fonctionnalité comme pour son implémentation
Missions :
Vous travaillez en SCRUM avec les autres membres de l’équipe sur un ensemble de projets, de nouvelles fonctionnalités, et de correctifs ;
Vous participez en Pair Review à la revue de code de vos coéquipiers et des l'ensemble des équipes Tech ;
Vous êtes impliqué(e) dans la priorisation des projets de votre équipe ;
Vous prenez part aux discussions transverses d’architecture qui ont lieu avant chaque changement important ;
Vous présentez votre travail à des collègues non techniques durant des réunions métiers ;
Vous faites des présentations techniques au Stand-Up Tech hebdomadaire ;
Vous maintenez une veille permanente sur les nouvelles technologies de votre domaine d'expertise.
Requirements
Votre profil :
Vous avez eu l’occasion d’effectuer un ou plusieurs stages dans le cadre de votre cursus et recherchez un stage de fin d’études ;
Vous connaissez idéalement les méthodes Agiles telles que le Scrum / DevOps / TDD (Test Driven Development) ;
Un dépôt Github et/ou un(des) projet(s) web personnel(s) serait un atout.
Benefits
Notre philosophie au travail :
Un esprit sain dans un corps sain : panier de fruits, thé et café offert, cours de yoga, douches pour les sportifs
Un environnement de travail agréable : bureaux neufs avec une vue à 360° de La Défense au Sacré-Cœur, jeux vidéo, ping-pong, cafétéria...
… qui s’adapte à vos besoins : ordinateur au choix
Un désamour assumé du métro : 100 euros de crédits Kapten par mois
Nos références :
Découvrez les avis Glassdoor de vos futurs collaborateurs ici
Suivez notre actualité sur notre page LinkedIn
Rendez-vous dans les coulisses de Kapten sur notre page Welcome to the jungle ou sur notre chaîne Youtube

Situé dans un espace de co-working, au cœur de Paris et plongé dans le monde des start’ups, Thales Digital Factory apporte un support opérationnel à la mise en œuvre de la transformation digitale de Thales.
Thales a pour ambition de devenir un acteur incontournable et exemplaire du digital, et ce dans l’ensemble de ses marchés. Le programme de Transformation Digitale lancé par le groupe a pour objectif d’offrir aux clients de Thales des offres « best in class » et à ses propres employés de nouvelles méthodes de travail adaptées à leurs besoins, en s’appuyant sur des technologies et une culture digitale.
Pour accélérer cette transformation, Thales Digital Factory a été créée. Elle a pour objectif d’apporter un support opérationnel à la mise en œuvre de la transformation digitale de Thales et s'articule autour de quatre pôles :
Une plateforme digitale ;
Un centre d'excellence autour de la connectivité, du Big Data, de l’intelligence artificielle et de la cybersécurité ;

Un incubateur de start-ups internes et externes.

description:
Start date: 27th July 2020
Training Hub Location: Amsterdam for 12 months
Location after training: Paris

Why you will love Cisco:

We connect everything: people, processes, data, and things. We innovate everywhere, taking bold risks to shape the technologies that give you smart cities, connected cars and hospitals. Cisco didn’t just build the Internet. We keep building it. We believe our innovation and our edge comes from our people.

Ranked in the top 30 best places to work globally by both Fortune and LinkedIn, you’ll be joining a world recognized brand with a great reputation.


Cisco has a strong culture of openness, trust and fun. You’ll be working with some of the best brains in the business in a supportive, connected and technologically advanced environment.

We ensure you are recognized for you contribution to Cisco through bonus schemes and our reward program ‘Connected Recognition’.


Our employees have great work-life balance and celebrate their birthdays on Cisco! This means that you will be able to take your own birthday day off and enjoy an extra day’s holiday.


Work for the benefit of everyone. All our employees receive 5 days a year to pursue voluntary causes they are passionate about through our ‘Time2Give’ initiative.


We offer our employees the Freedom to choose how and where they work most efficiently and effectively.




What You’ll Do:


You’ll be part of our Cisco Sales Associates Program (CSAP), an award-winning graduate training program for young talent aspiring to move into sales or engineering roles. For the first months of the program you’ll learn about the latest technology advancements and how to position Cisco’s architectures, solutions and products to our customers. During the second part of your CSAP year, you’ll move into an engineering role as part of your on-the-job-experience within the Global Virtual Engineering (GVE) Team. You will be actively involved in sales opportunities and assigned to specific projects that align to your skill set.

The program, while challenging, will push you to become the best version of yourself. You’ll be encouraged to pursue industry-standard certifications and be assessed and coached through customer simulations and on-the-job activities. We’ll offer you a safe and fun environment to practice what you’ve learnt, all the while providing you with feedback to develop your potential. Thanks to this rigourous training plan, we’ve earned a strong reputation within our internal sales organization.

Who You'll Work With:

You’ll train alongside incredibly talented individuals, like yourself, from different countries and diverse backgrounds. Early on, you’ll make long-lasting friendships and belong to a rich human network that will support you through out your career. As a successful Associate Solutions Engineer (ASE), you’ll expand your software and networking knowledge to collaborate with Cisco sales professionals and provide technical solutions for our customers and partners. You’ll learn from top experts and coaches in a unique classroom setting where we use our own ‘state-of-the-art’ collaboration technology. You’ll have your own mentor, a CSAP alumnus who’s been in your shoes and will guide you in your first year. With a strong Cisco team committed to your success, you’ll gain hands-on education and experience, while receiving an attractive salary and pursuing your career aspirations.

Who You Are:
Technology enthusiast, who enjoys talking about innovation and always keeps up with the latest technology news.
A strong communicator with the confidence to engage and talk to a wide range of people.
View team collaboration as instrumental to achieving success.
Enjoy looking at practical real life challenges and thinking creatively to solve them.
Approach situations with an open and curious mind, taking on challenges with an eye for opportunity.

What You Need To Be Eligible
Graduate by the start date of the program, 27th of July 2020.
Graduate from a relevant technical degree such as; Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, Electronics Engineering, Telecommunications Engineering, Cyber Security, Information Technology, Mathematics, Physics, Informatics, Data Science or similar.
Fluent in English and French
Hold the right to live and work in the country that you are applying for, without future company sponsorship required. Student visas and temporary permits obtained on your own will not be acceptable.
Willing to relocate for 12 months of training to hub. Visa assistance and relocation package to training hub will be provided as required.
Willing to return to your country you applied for, unless otherwise required due to business needs.
Knowledge and experience in software languages. C, C++, C#, Java or Python are desired.

description:
À propos d’Atos
Atos est un leader international de la transformation digitale avec plus de 110 000 collaborateurs dans 73 pays et un chiffre d’affaires annuel de plus de 11 milliards d’euros. Numéro un européen du Cloud, de la cybersécurité et des supercalculateurs, le groupe fournit des solutions intégrées de Cloud Hybride Orchestré, Big Data, Applications Métiers et Environnement de Travail Connecté. Partenaire informatique mondial des Jeux Olympiques et Paralympiques, le Groupe exerce ses activités sous les marques Atos, Atos Syntel, et Unify. Atos est une SE (Société Européenne) cotée sur Euronext Paris et fait partie de l’indice CAC 40.
La raison d’être d’Atos est de contribuer à façonner l’espace informationnel. Avec ses compétences et ses services, le groupe supporte le développement de la connaissance, de l’éducation et de la recherche dans une approche pluriculturelle et contribue au développement de l’excellence scientifique et technologique. Partout dans le monde, Atos permet à ses clients et à ses collaborateurs, et plus généralement au plus grand nombre, de vivre, travailler et progresser durablement et en toute confiance dans l’espace informationnel.

Descriptif du poste

Au sein d’Atos, la division Big Data & Security est responsable de la définition, de la conception et de la construction de plateformes et de solutions sécurisées Big Data.

Vous interviendrez au sein d’une équipe jeune et dynamique en très forte croissance réalisant des activités allant du conseil en architecture et gouvernance de la donnée aux aspects Data analytiques et DataScience, en passant par la mise en place, l’intégration, le développement et l’optimisation de solutions souples et évolutives pour les projets stratégiques de nos clients. Notre valeur ajoutée repose sur une forte expertise technique et business de la data renforcée par de nombreux partenariats avec les éditeurs actifs dans les domaines des architectures applicatives distribuées et du Big Data & Analytics.

L’équipe Big Data & Security a un esprit Start-Up de confiance, de partage et de collaboration et elle est fortement impliquée dans le programme WellBeing@Work.
Dans le cadre de notre croissance et pour répondre aux nouveaux besoins de nos clients, nous recherchons à étoffer nos équipes Big Data en intégrant un data engineer confirmé.
Au sein d’une équipe, et sous la responsabilité de managers confirmés, vous interviendrez en amont pour aider au choix d’outils et à la mise en place de solutions big data
Vous mettrez en œuvre au sein de projets au forfait ou en régie pour nos clients :
l’alimentation et la préparation des données,
le scraping de données
les traitements de la donnée afin d’en tirer de la valeur.
La modélisation et implémentation des systèmes de gestion de la base des données (base SQL et/ou NoSql)

Ce domaine technologique étant très dynamique, plus que des connaissances et des compétences techniques, vous devrez démontrer une réelle envie d’apprendre, de progresser et de se tenir à jour sur toutes les technologies et architectures
INFORMATIONS ADDITIONNELLES :
Chez Atos la diversité est au cœur de notre politique RH. C'est pourquoi Atos a mis en place un accord relatif à l’égalité professionnelle entre les hommes et les femmes. Par ailleurs, nos métiers sont tous accessibles aux personnes en situation de handicap, et ce quelle que soit la nature de leur handicap.

Au sein du pôle Data science, nous souhaitons intégrer à notre équipe un profil data engineer orienté infrastructure big data, pour nous aider à accéder plus facilement et plus rapidement à la data issues des sources :
DMP mediarithmics : data navigation + CRM
Big query : data navigation
Oracle : data client
Base interne : data NL & comportement email
Nous avons à notre disposition google cloud storage pour stocker la donnée, Dataiku/R/Python pour requêter, valoriser et analyser cette donnée.
Le DATA Engineer aura comme mission principale :
Accompagner la migration de la data CRM vers le cloud, effectuer les branchements entre le cloud et nos outils datascience en collaboration avec notre équipe IT
Optimiser le stockage GCS
Préparer les datamart pour la modélisation statistique
Réconcilier les différentes sources de données

Calculer l’âge/ sexe scorés de nos cookies visiteurs (clonage de la base CRM)
L'enrichissement de la BDD Prisma via l'open data
L'élaboration d'un moteur de reco ou des modèles de prédiction (score d’appétence, prédiction d’audience)
La création de segment d’audience via google analytics/clonage des segments google ou via notre DMP
L'Analyse de la pression commerciale (email)

Le DATA Engineer doit avoir comme pré-requis :
Maîtrise avancée de l’environnement big data Hadoop/Spark (obligatoire)
Maîtrise des langages : Python/R, Scala, Java (obligatoire)
Connaissance de google analytics, Dataiku, BigQuery (un plus)
Connaissance de l’environnement cloud de google (obligatoire)
des bases en analyse de données / statistiques (test statistiques, régression linéaire/logistique, arbre de décision, ACP/ACM, clusturing k-means) (un plus)

Formation :
Master ou école d’ingénieur en informatique et/ou big data (avec au moins un premier stage effectué en entreprise dans un environnement big data). Au moins 2 ans d’expériences
Les qualités humaines :
Le candidat doit être passionné par le big data / la datascience, curieux, fiable, agile, pédagogue et bon communiquant, fort esprit d'équipe et de partage.

Avec un portefeuille de 25 marques incontournables, le groupe est présent sur les principaux segments grand public (féminin, cuisine, télé, people, découverte, économie…).
Porté par la mission de devancer les besoins et envies de ses lecteurs et utilisateurs sur tous les supports, Prisma Media adopte une stratégie offensive de développement et d'innovation dans les secteurs en forte croissance tels que la monétisation de la data, la vidéo et le mobile, avec une ambition d'avoir toujours UN MÉDIA D'AVANCE.
Au sein du pôle Data science, nous souhaitons intégrer à notre équipe un profil data engineer orienté infrastructure big data, pour nous aider à accéder plus facilement et plus rapidement à la data issues des sources :
DMP mediarithmics : data navigation + CRM
Big query : data navigation
Oracle : data client
Base interne : data NL & comportement email
Nous avons à notre disposition google cloud storage pour stocker la donnée, Dataiku/R/Python pour requêter, valoriser et analyser cette donnée.
Le DATA Engineer aura comme mission principale :
Accompagner la migration de la data CRM vers le cloud, effectuer les branchements entre le cloud et nos outils datascience en collaboration avec notre équipe IT
Optimiser le stockage GCS
Préparer les datamart pour la modélisation statistique
Réconcilier les différentes sources de données
Le DATA Engineer pourrait participer aux projets :
Calculer l’âge/ sexe scorés de nos cookies visiteurs (clonage de la base CRM)
L'enrichissement de la BDD Prisma via l'open data
L'élaboration d'un moteur de reco ou des modèles de prédiction (score d’appétence, prédiction d’audience)
La création de segment d’audience via google analytics/clonage des segments google ou via notre DMP
L'Analyse de la pression commerciale (email)

Le DATA Engineer doit avoir comme pré-requis :
Maîtrise avancée de l’environnement big data Hadoop/Spark (obligatoire)
Maîtrise des langages : Python/R, Scala, Java (obligatoire)
Connaissance de google analytics, Dataiku, BigQuery (un plus)
Connaissance de l’environnement cloud de google (obligatoire)
des bases en analyse de données / statistiques (test statistiques, régression linéaire/logistique, arbre de décision, ACP/ACM, clusturing k-means) (un plus)

Formation :
Master ou école d’ingénieur en informatique et/ou big data (avec au moins un premier stage effectué en entreprise dans un environnement big data). Au moins 2 ans d’expériences
Les qualités humaines :
Le candidat doit être passionné par le big data / la datascience, curieux, fiable, agile, pédagogue et bon communiquant, fort esprit d'équipe et de partage.

Prisma Media propose tous ses postes aux personnes en situation de handicap en privilégiant une logique de compétence et d'emploi pérenne. Le groupe est signataire de la Charte de la Diversité et partenaire de l'association Adapt.
Exercice de vos droits
Conformément à la réglementation en vigueur, vous pouvez exercer vos droits d'accès, de rectification, d'opposition, de suppression, de limitation du traitement, et à la portabilité des données à caractère personnel, en adressant votre demande au DPO du Groupe Prisma Media, soit à dpo@prismamedia.com soit par courrier à Prisma Media - DPO, 13 Rue Henri Barbusse. 92230 Gennevilliers.
