description:
Job Description

Où en est la data chez happytal ?
Nous évoluons vers une plateforme distribuée en microservices, en diversifiant nos stockages de données (SQL Server, Mongo, ElasticSearch, File server) selon les besoins et opportunités. Nos microservices et CRON sont principalement développés en .Net Core mais nous développons également en node.js ou Python (et restons très ouvert en termes de stack technique). Nous commençons également à travailler avec Docker et avons quelques briques de machine learning. Vous serez amené à intervenir sur une grande partie de cet écosystème, de ce fait, des connaissances sur une partie de ces technos sont souhaitées.
Tu seras en charge des missions suivantes
Mise en place de flux de transfert et de consolidation de données (Sql Server, NoSql - MongoDb, ElasticSearch -, fichier csv, json)
Intégration de sources de données externes (webApis, web scraping)
Interconnexion avec nos outils métiers (gestion financière, outils RH)
Evolution des modèles décisionnels existants et de notre base CRM pour les adapter aux nouveaux besoins opérationnels
Evolution de notre plateforme de supervision en y intégrant des briques de machine learning et de détection automatique d'incident

Qualifications

Tu possèdes une bonne expérience en base de données relationnelles, en ETL (Extract, Transform and Load) mais aussi en développement logiciel.
Tu maîtrises le SQL et as une expérience prouvée en manipulation de données avec la suite Microsoft BI (SQL Server, SSIS)
Tu as de bonnes notions de développement (Python ou .Net ou autre ...)
Des notions de machine learning sont un plus, tout comme la maîtrise de git et des process d'intégration continue
Ambitieux(se) et entrepreneur(se), tu es motivé(e) par les challenges et souhaites booster la croissance d’une startup leader sur son marché #verslinfinietlaudela
La happyattitude frétille déjà en toi : ton sourire rayonne au quotidien et tu te projettes dans un environnement audacieux et collaboratif.

Additional Information

happytal garantit l'égalité des chances et la diversité sous toutes ses formes, en s’engageant notamment dans une démarche en faveur de l'emploi des personnes en situation de handicap.

Site Reliability Engineer (SRE)
Dalenys - Levallois-Perret (92)
date_publication:
il y a 30+ jours

description:
Créé en 2002, Dalenys est désormais une fintech experte du Payment Marketing. Nous disposons de plus de 180 collaborateurs en France et à l’international. Notre forte culture technologique et nos compétences nous permettent d’accompagner au quotidien plus de 2 500 marchands dans le développement de leurs activités avec des solutions de paiement agiles, innovantes et créatrices de valeur.
Avec notre solution de paiement 100% omnicanal, en e-commerce, en magasins et sur mobile, notre mission est de simplifier le paiement pour générer plus de ventes en optimisant les taux de conversions et en luttant contre la fraude. Notre accompagnement sur mesure de chaque marchand par un Payment Manager dédié et notre plateforme omnicanale permettent une approche innovante orientée data.
En rejoignant Natixis Payments, Dalenys s’inscrit dans une dynamique vertueuse lui permettant d’aborder sereinement les évolutions à venir.
Description de l'offre
Vous intégrerez une squad qui a pour responsabilité de créer et maintenir des fonctionnalités innovantes et à forte valeurs ajoutée autour du paiement pour nos marchands.
Vous participerez activement à la transition de notre infrastructure vers une architecture microservices.
Au sein d’une petite équipe pluridisciplinaire (PO+ DEV + SRE) vous serez en charge du maintien en production des différents produits délivrés par l’équipe, notamment leur scalabilité, leur disponibilité et leur sécurité.
Vous aurez sous votre responsabilité un ensemble de composants techniques liés au périmètre fonctionnel de votre équipe et vous participerez aux choix d’architecture, d’infrastructure ainsi qu’a l’ensemble des décisions impactant l’orientation technique comme fonctionnelle de l’équipe.
En tant que SRE de l’équipe, vous serez en charge de:
Occuper un poste de référent et d’encadrement technique au sein de votre équipe
Etre le garant de la disponibilité de service, des performances et de la continuité de service
Promouvoir et appliquer la culture de l’automatisation qui vous est chère
Participer à la mise en place d’une stratégie fiable et performante d’Intégration et de Déploiement Continu (CI / CD)
Faire corps avec nos objectifs d’Amélioration Continue (performance, supervision, optimisation des coûts, …)
Intégrer notre process d’astreinte technique
La team
L’équipe technique bascule actuellement l’ensemble de sa plateforme vers une architecture microservices. Vous serez un acteur de poids dans cette transition !
Nous sommes aujourd’hui notre propre hébergeur (multi datacenteur) avec une maîtrise totale de notre infrastructure (backbone réseau, hébergement, transit …).
L’ensemble des équipes sont organisé en Feature Team (petites équipes, autonomes, spécialisées sur un domaine fonctionnel, et pluridisciplinaire) afin d’adresser idéalement nos objectifs de productivité et qualité des livrables.
Du fait de son activité de Fournisseur de Solution de Paiement (online et offline) vous interviendrez dans un contexte de ‘Trés Haute Disponibilité et de Sécurité’ ( plateforme certifiée PCI-DSS Service Provider Level 1).
Stack technique
Méthodologies: Devops, Agile (scrum et/ou kanban)
Observability: Grafana, Kibana, librenms, nagios, munin, graphite, statsd
Automatisation: pupet, ansible, gitlab
SGBD: MySQL, MariaDB, Redis, MongoDb, ElasticSearch
Web: nginx, apache, php-fpm, ha-proxy
Messaging: RabbitMQ
Virtualisation: VMWare
Langages (dev et ops): PHP, Python, Bash, node
Protocoles bancaires: CB2A, CBAE
Infrastructure As Code: Packer
Cryptographie, HSM, SSL
…
Profil requis
Fort d’une solide expérience dans une équipe d’administrateurs systèmes, vous êtes très autonome et vous portez l’automatisation dans vos valeurs.
Vous êtes imprégné(e)s de la culture devops et le code ne vous fait pas peur ! La sécurité des infrastructures technique n’a également plus de secret pour vous.
Vous maîtrisez les enjeux liés aux opérations sur des systèmes critiques (haute disponibilité, charge, performances).
Vous maîtrisez l’environnement Linux. Des connaissances en OpenBSD seront un plus.
Une expérience dans un contexte Cloud (interne ou public), orchestration (type K8s, swarm), sur un environnement microservices sont des atouts qui nous aideront dans notre transition technique..

meta1:
Database Reliability Engineer, Engineering - Site Reliability
Criteo46 avis - Paris (75)
titre_poste: Database Reliability Engineer, Engineering - Site Reliability
date_publication:
il y a 30+ jours
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Who we are
At Criteo, we connect 1.5 billion active shoppers with the things they need and love. Our technology takes an algorithmic approach to predict what user we show an ad to, when, and for what products. Our dataset is about 50 petabytes in Hadoop (more than 120 TB extra per day) and we take less than 10ms to respond to an ad request. This is truly big data and machine learning without the buzzwords. If scale and complexity excite you, join us.

Most of all, we are creators. From designing ground-breaking products to finding unique ways to solve technical challenges at an exceptional scale, our tech teams work with state of the art methodologies to shape the future of advertising.

The Site Reliability teams keep one of the largest computing platforms in the AdTech world functioning like clockwork. They are processing, storing and monitoring through large scale data compute & storage services (Hadoop, SQL & NoSQL), streaming (Kafka), platform as a service (Chef, Mesos), identity management (Kerberos) and analytics (Hive, Druid, Vertica).

What you'll do

As part of the SRE Data group (Referential Data team), you will be responsible of the production MariaDB Service and its Industrialisation at Criteo.
This service supports critical back office components (Data pipeline scheduler, Asset Manager, Performance analyzer, Monitoring ...), some of them being Open Source (Grafana, Hive, Presto ..)
Challenges of this role
Design, Build and improve part of our infrastructure to address scaling, performances and resiliency in a worlwide datacenters context,
Deploy infrastructure as code,
Integrate or build your own automation and industrialization tools,
Build, maintain and continously improve a self-service MariaDB platform for our internal customers (on-demand database creation and restoration, performance analysis, etc), being extremely watchful of customers' feedback,
Enforce service reliability according to SLA,
Ensure critical data are only available to relevant people,
Share your knowledge with team members and develop your skills on other SGBD (like MSSQL)
Work with software engineers (to evangelize best practices...)
On-call in a production environment
Work with peers within Data teams : NoSql/Hadoop/Data Governance
Who you are
Coding and scripting skills (Python, Ruby, Bash, SQL, Java…),
Familiar to SRE/DevOps environments,
Exposure to high availability environment, through multiple datacenters,
MariaDB and/or MySQL administration, Replication, Performance analysis and reporting knowledge,
A passion for building things, automate, and innovate,
Exposure to NoSQL technologies,
Familiar with Chef or Puppet,
Experience with Linux administration (e.g. filesystems, Kerberos, debugging, auditing ...)

About Alkemics
Alkemics connects brands and retailers to help them market & sell their products everywhere, driving business growth, by allowing them to collect, enrich, and share product data across the retail ecosystem.
Our mission is to connect every brand with every retailer in the world. Our SaaS platform streamlines the management of digital product content (i.e., packaging, ingredients, visuals, promotions, rich media), extracts structured metadata for optimal quality and usability, and automates delivery to retail partners and third party service providers.
Founded in 2011, and backed by world renowned investors (Index Ventures, Serena Capital, Cathay Innovation, Partech Ventures), Alkemics has 70+ talented employees, and has offices in the very heart of Paris.
Our startup culture allows for very flat hierarchy, and for everyone, regardless of seniority, to have a big impact. We are looking to continue building a kickass team, so if you're looking for a new challenge, give us a sign!

At Alkemics, every day is different, but your main missions will include:
As a member of the R&D team, the QA Engineer will coordinate and conduct testing on a project-by-project basis, and:
Develop test plans and test cases, run test scripts, provide test reports for each application
Participate in the process of automation
Report and record defect and bugs in a timely manner, assess their priority and severity, and close resolved ones
Provide regular follow up on the applications quality, identifying issues and provide qualified reporting
Ensure our action plans are on track and optimized, working closely with Marketing, Development and Support
Review functional specification and design documents to create test plans and ensure that all requirements are testable
Continuously look for ways to improve the Quality Assurance process
Requirements
What we're looking for in you:
We're currently looking for an enthusiastic Test QA Engineer with a first experience in web testing who:
likes to work in a team and share his/her experience in an Agile environment
has a first experience in test validation
is autonomous, rigorous, enthusiastic and adaptable
good knowledge of French and English
previous experience with BDD is a plus
knowledge of Python and JavaScript is a plus
Benefits
What you’ll get from us?
A true startup experience in one of the fastest growing startups in Paris
Low bureaucracy and daily successes that have a real impact on the business
You will participate to the team's growth and the revolution of the CPG industry
A fast learning-curve with growing responsibilities
Working with smart people, hungry to change the retail world and passionate for success

description:
Who we are
At Criteo, we connect 1.5 billion active shoppers with the things they need and love. Our technology takes an algorithmic approach to predict what user we show an ad to, when, and for what products. Our dataset is about 50 petabytes in Hadoop (more than 120 TB extra per day) and we take less than 10ms to respond to an ad request. This is truly big data and machine learning without the buzzwords. If scale and complexity excite you, join us.

Most of all, we are creators. From designing ground-breaking products to finding unique ways to tackle technical challenges at an extraordinary scale, our tech teams work with state of the art methodologies to shape the future of advertising.

Our Infrastructure teams are designing and operating the overall capacity and connectivity supporting the Criteo platform. They are in charge of designing, planning, scaling and operating hardware, system, network and datacenter layers.

What you'll do

Criteo is seeking a Software Engineer to join Qapla, our Infrastructure Capacity Planning team. In a fast-growing environment, capacity planning has become a critical mission to support our Hosting and Network engineers. Qapla team aims at forecasting, budgeting and allocating the resources that will allow Criteo Infrastructure to scale up, open new datacenters and extend existing ones at an even greater pace.
Such an ambitious undertaking includes (not limited to):
Revisiting metrics exposition
Assisting with forecast analysis
Streamlining data flows
Automating alerts
As well as being creative with visualization

Who you are
You have at least 5 years of successful professional experience getting things done
You know what it means to put code into production
Feel responsible for the successes and failures of his/her whole team.
Communication skills in English
Strong teamwork ability
Prior knowledge or interest about infrastructure and/or monitoring
You are proficient with at least two languages of different paradigm (Python is a plus)
Competitive compensation package
35+ annual holidays days
Health insurance
Discounted transport and sports activities
Personalized relocation package if moving from abroad
Catered lunch and breakfast
Private nursery
Maternity and paternity leave
Annual cross teams hackathon
2 conferences per year of your choice
Internal mobility programs
Tailored educational resources
Want to know more?
What does it feel like to be part of something big? Get a snapshot
Get the story directly from our R&D engineers, check our Medium R&D blog
Interested in discovering your Criteo community first? Let’s meet

At Criteo, we dare to be different. We believe that diversity fuels innovation and creates an energy that can be seen and felt all over Criteo. We champion different perspectives and are committed to creating a workplace where all Criteos are heard, feel a sense of belonging, and are treated with respect and dignity.

Criteo collects your personal data for the purposes of managing Criteo's recruitment related activities. Consequently, Criteo may use your personal data in relation to the evaluation and selection of applicants. Your information will be accessible to the different Criteo entities across the world. meta1:
SPDM Solution Architect (m/f/d)
ANSYS84 avis - Paris (75)
date_publication:
il y a 30+ jours

Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
SUMMARY
ANSYS is the WW leading simulation software company. Engineering simulation has become a key area of product development. It is recognized as instrumental in the digital transformation of industries: simulation and analysis tools are a key technology to reduce the use of physical prototypes, to replace with their digital version. With a connected product (IoT), simulation provides predictive analysis for product maintenance and increased performance.

The Simulation Process and Data Management (SPDM) Solution Architect is a strategic member of the EMEA Field Engineering organization. He/She is responsible for leveraging advanced-level engineering and product development knowledge to design enterprise-level solutions to enable customers to more effectively utilize advanced simulation technologies throughout their product development and engineering process.

This position will work closely with sales to engage customers in detailed evaluations of their as-is product development processes and environment, and understand ANSYS simulation solutions and tools at a deep enough level to be able to design to-be solutions that enable customers to more fully benefit from the power of simulation throughout the Product Lifecycle.

Successful candidates will also work with ANSYS product development to understand and influence product capabilities and roadmaps, and should have a passion for applying technology to deliver solutions that help customers engineer better products.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Lead/Assist in coordinating and executing all technical activities throughout the sales opportunity such as customer meetings and product presentations, demonstrations and evaluations
Analyze business and technical needs, requirements, and the state of a customer’s current infrastructure, operations, and engineering workflows
Consult our customers on process design and process optimization
Utilize the ANSYS SPDM platform as the foundation to select the appropriate technologies and architect/design complete solutions that transform customer product development processes around simulation to facilitate more engineering in the digital domain
Participate in internal corporate initiatives to further enhance the solution suites, presales/sales enablement and professional growth
Articulate the ANSYS value proposition, which may encompass its entire suite of products (mechanical, fluid, electrical, electronics, optical, systems...).
Create creative and useful solutions to solve complex business problems by working across various teams and understanding the needs of customers
Be a team player who can collaborate effectively with all key ANSYS and customer stakeholders including sales, product development, project management, implementation engineers, and end users

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor degree in Engineering
A minimum of 8 years of experience in an engineering software environment
Experience with enterprise class product development systems like PLM, PDM, ALM, and ERP
Demonstrated use of relevant ANSYS software or knowledge of other commercial CAE, CAD, EDA software package
Logical problem-solving approach and the ability to clearly communicate the situation and proposed solution to the customer
Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to facilitate and conduct webinars and presentations to customers
Demonstrated skills in writing and presenting in fluent English
Projects a professional image and strong business acumen during customer interactions
Self-starter who possesses a sense of urgency, strong organizational and follow up skills
Willing to evolve in a dynamic and innovative environment, eager to learn
Communicate equally effectively at the executive level to discuss business requirements and value, as well as the engineering level to discuss technical requirements, capabilities, and benefits

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
MS or PhD degree a plus
Experience with Aras Innovator
Experience with Web server technologies, such as Microsoft SQL Server,
Good understanding of web architecture, distributed systems and web APIs (such as REST, gRPC etc.)
Experience with DevOps/continuous integration
Practical knowledge of agile project management
A minimum of 5 years of programming experience in high-level language such as Java, Python, C#, Javascript and/or any JavaScript frameworks, such as React
Ability to travel up to 50%
CULTURE AND VALUES
Culture and values are incredibly important to ANSYS. They inform us of who we are, of how we act. Values aren't posters hanging on a wall or about trite or glib slogans. They aren't about rules and regulations. They can't just be handed down the organization. They are shared beliefs – guideposts that we all follow when we're facing a challenge or a decision. Our values tell us how we live our lives; how we approach our jobs. Our values are crucial for fostering a culture of winning for our company:
Customer focus
Results and Accountability
Innovation
Transparency and Integrity
Mastery
Inclusiveness
Sense of urgency
Collaboration and Teamwork
ANSYS does not accept unsolicited referrals for vacancies, and any unsolicited referral will become the property of ANSYS. Upon hire, no fee will be owed to the agency, person, or entity.

Medallia’s mission is to help companies win through customer experience. Here, we value people for each of the aspects that make them whole. We believe that people should not be defined only by a job title—nobody is "just an engineer" or "just a salesperson." We are each partners, parents, children, siblings, friends, and former classmates. We have different backgrounds and we celebrate different cultures. And, just like our product, we honor each of the experiences that build our people.

At Medallia we hire the whole person, not just a part of them.

Analyste Technique
Aperçu du rôle
En tant qu'Analyste Technique dans les services professionnels, vous serez affecté à plusieurs projets et comptes en fonction de nos besoins, de vos intérêts et de votre expertise. Les tâches vont de la conception et de la mise en œuvre de notre logiciel pour les nouveaux clients à l’amélioration et à la gestion des comptes clients en direct. Vous devrez, avec le temps, devenir un expert en matière de configuration de la plate-forme Medallia, apprendre des méthodologies de livraison techniques et développer vos connaissances du paysage informatique environnant. Développer une compréhension approfondie de la suite des produits Medallia

Travailler en collaboration avec les équipes clients pour la résolution des demandes techniques / liées au système
S’assurer de la qualité des fonctionnalités supplémentaires
Appuyer les clients lors d’analyses de grandes données
Compétences
Compétences fonctionnelles

Souci du détail et capacité à effectuer des travaux sans erreur
Capacité d’apprendre rapidement et de résoudres des problèmes effectivement, en particulier face aux défis techniques
Expérience de travail en équipe pour résoudre de manière collaborative des problèmes techniques
Sans relâche, orienté client avec une compréhension innée des principes du bon service aux clients
Maîtrise du français et de l'anglais

Compétences techniques

Preuve de compréhension des technologies web ordinaires par exemple javascript, CSS, HTML, API
Solides compétences analytiques, surtout pour la manipulation des données et analyse des données (par exemple Excel, R, Stata, SPSS)
Bac +3/4 en un sujet analytique (par exemple, sciences naturelles, mathématiques, informatique, ingénierie, économie, etc.) ou un fort intérêt pour la technologie démontrée ailleurs (par exemple, développement de sites Web, cours de programmation, etc.)

At Medallia, we don’t just accept difference - we celebrate it and recognize the value it brings to our customers and employees. description:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

Dataiku is looking for a Field Product Manager to support the deployment of its Data Science Platform. The position is available in Paris (FR) or London (UK).

The role of the Field Product Manager involves a mixture of many skills, from running requirements meeting with customers, gathering and structuring the needs, understanding of the market and the positioning of our product, and communicating the high level picture of the roadmap. The Field Product Manager will have 5 or more years demonstrated experience with data related products (e.g. database, cloud services, analytical platform, etc.) and some experience in Enterprise Sales. Previous work experience as a Product Manager, Technical Product Manager, Sales Engineer, Customer Success Manager or Consultant, especially with implementing technical consulting engagements, solution design, and business process assessments, will help a successful candidate.

Dataiku is a young company with great momentum and at this early stage, the Field Product Manager will work cross-functionally with Sales, Product Management, Data Science, Engineering and Marketing. We’re looking for someone who can express passion about the new technologies and possibilities of Big Data and Advanced Analytics.
Responsibilities
Understand the market and support the sales team
Gather and structures product requirements coming from prioritized opportunities or customers in assigned region or assigned industry
Proactively help the sales and customers support team regarding any product related questions
Work closely with Technical Product Managers to communicate needs and sharpen product offerings based on feedback from customers, sales, and competitive offerings

Evangelize the Product
Provide summaries of new developments to customers in the assigned region or industry
Support large deals that require product manager input where highly competitive or unusual scenarios exist
Handle objections and clarification statements on all issues relating to product roadmap working closely with the Customer Success Managers and Sales Engineers
Act as nominated speaker for all roadmap related discussions
Coordinate technical and user research meetings in close coordination with Technical Product Management (TPM) during feature ideation phases
Maintain proper product explanation and provides timely and accurate communications to clients and all customer facing teams
Minimum qualifications
5 years of related customer facing experience in a technical context
Proven ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authority.
Experience developing Professional products, technologies or services.
MS, MBA or PhD in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics or related technical field or equivalent.
Strong experience with Data and Machine Learning and/or product management with a focus on software products and technologies.
Preferred qualifications:
Knowledge of multiple functional areas such as engineering, UI, sales, customer support, finance or marketing.
Excellent problem-solving, organizational and analytical skills.

To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast (having just closed a $101 million Series C round in December 2018 and looking to double in 2019), but still maintains a startup spirit. Dataiku serves its global customer base from its headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Singapore, and Sydney. Each of our offices has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes.

About us
Synthesio is a global organization with offices in NY, London, Paris, Brussels and Singapore. Best way to define us is as an "established startup" with a team of about 140 employees, created in 2006 and which is recently part of IPSOS group, one of the global market research leader.
We are a technology company that provides a Social Intelligence platform to our customers that allows them to make sense of the chatter that goes on throughout social media. Essentially, we pull large sets of unstructured conversations that occur on Facebook, Twitter, Linkedin, Instagram etc, blogs, forums, and using our proprietary technology and analytics, we can offer to our customers a way to understand what these discussions mean to their brands.
We sell into the Marketing or Communication leaders in large F1000 companies - such as Mastercard, Nissan, Estee - or large agencies - such as WPP. Best way to think of the Synthesio solution is that we are offering an innovative take on classic Market Research, Consumer Insight or brand management that is powered by conversations happening real-time on social media.
Our culture is:
Global: Global organisation, very flat, we interact daily with all offices, all time zones, more than 30 differents cultures, so we appreciate being open minded, respectful.
Simple: We take pride in finding simple solution to complex problems, so we look for scalable solutions, we are prone looking for/ giving feedback, being assertive, honest.
Fun: We believe that autonomy, trust, conviviality, being one self and have fun is the best way to flourish and give the best of oneself
About the role
We are looking for a Data Engineer who will participate in building, scaling and evolving our constantly growing product and infrastructure. You will be part of a diversified squad with a PO, frontend developers and designers tasked to deliver new product features in complete autonomy, as well as to provide support for clients and operational teams.
As a Data Engineer, you will also work on long term projects such as infrastructure (re)design, datastore and processing optimization, solving complex problem similar but not limited to: full text search, massive data querying (100TB+ Elasticsearch, 25TB+ MySQL cluster), service monitoring (20+ HTTP APIs, 25+ Processing Daemons), data denormalization.

Build and operate infrastructure, toolset and deployment pipelines
Collaborate closely with other engineers and become a valued member of an autonomous, cross functional team

Work in an environment that supports your individual growth

Interested in manipulating dozens of microservices in data processing pipelines handling billions of data

Our Stack : ReactJS, NodeJS, Go, Mysql, ElasticSearch, Kafka, REST & GraphQL APIs, Git, Vagrant, Docker, Jenkins, Python, Cassandra (ScyllaDB), Ansible
**Soft skills**
Interested in understanding user needs
Rigourness and strong appetite for software quality
Good communication and collaboration skills

Teemo est la plateforme Drive-to-Store qui révolutionne le marketing des magasins physiques.
Notre technologie unique génère du trafic dans les magasins de nos clients en combinant données de géolocalisation et algorithmes. Nous mesurons avec précision l'impact de notre solution pour optimiser la performance.
Plus de 100 clients dans le secteur de l’automobile, l’alimentaire, le bricolage ou encore l’ameublement (Volkswagen, Carrefour, Brico Dépôt, Gautier) nous ont choisi pour répondre à leur enjeu stratégique marketing numéro 1 : attirer davantage de consommateurs en magasin !
Co-fondée en 2014 par des anciens de Google, de Criteo, et un serial entrepreneur du mobile, teemo est accompagnée d'investisseurs prestigieux tels que ISAI (BlaBlaCar) ou Index Ventures (Criteo) et a levé 15 millions d’euros au printemps 2017.
Teemo est une entreprise jeune et dynamique avec un objectif : devenir la référence mondiale du Drive-to-Store !

Vous travaillerez également sur l’amélioration de notre solution RTB (real-time bidding) pour répondre en temps réel à des milliers de requêtes toujours plus intelligemment.
Pour répondre à ces besoins, nous utilisons des technologies de pointe telles que Vert.x, Spark, Redis, Docker, Google Cloud Platform (Big Query, Dataflow, GCE, …), Kafka ainsi qu’une architecture micro-services. It takes powerful technology to connect our brands and partners with an audience of 1 billion. Nearly half of Verizon Media employees are building the code and platforms that help us achieve that. Whether you’re looking to write mobile app code, engineer the servers behind our massive ad tech stacks, or develop algorithms to help us process 4 trillion data points a day, what you do here will have a huge impact on our business—and the world. Want in? As Verizon’s media unit, our brands like Yahoo, TechCrunch and HuffPost help people stay informed and entertained, communicate and transact, while creating new ways for advertisers and partners to connect. With technologies like XR, AI, machine-learning, and 5G, we’re transforming media for tomorrow, too. We're creators and coders, dreamers and doers creating what's next in content, advertising and technology.
Working at Verizon Media / AlephD
Verizon Media (previously Yahoo / AOL) is a global leader in digital publishing (Yahoo, Huff post, Techcrunch) and monetization technologies. In 2016, Verizon Media acquired AlephD, a French startup developing data-driven, real-time solutions for publishers, ranging from in-depth analytics to fully automated decision making in milliseconds for revenue optimization. To stay at the forefront of innovation, AlephD is growing its data-science team.
If you are a skilled data-scientist with strong mathematical background and a taste for implementing new ideas to solve real-life problems, join our team and help build great real-time, online-learning and big data solutions.

You will work in the R&D team in close collaboration with the IT team and the product guys to build awesome real-time + big-data algos to power AlephD products.
You will be in charge of the follow-up and evaluation of existing algos and propose improvements and new approaches.
You will provide expertise and technical leadership in mathematical modelling, statistics, machine-learning and algorithm design for big-data or real-time processing.
You will take part in the design of new algos.
You will contribute to the toolset of the team, building machine learning libraries, coding or testing frameworks.
You will take part in the design of some data-viz aspects of our products.
You will help foster a culture of best practice in data-science.
You will participate to the scientific communication efforts of AlephD.
Qualifications
You have a MS degree or PhD from a top-notch institution in a field such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, quantitative Economics or Finance; or you have a track record proving similar skills.

Tintri builds storage. Those three words may not light your hair on fire … but it’s lighting up our customers’ lives. We offer a user-centric business banking solution on mobile and desktop, a very responsive customer service and transparent pricing. We are targeting all businesses from 1 to 250 employees and can either replace a traditional bank account or act as a complement to make business banking as easy, efficient and hassle-free as it should be.

Our mission is to create the bank all businesses love. We focus on client satisfaction and people development through our core values:

Ambition: we tackle big problems
Teamwork: we can only create magic by working together
Mastery: we grow and get better every day
Integrity: we care and respect our community

The expansion of 3 additional European markets: Germany, Italy and Spain

As part of the tech team, you join a crew of experienced engineers working on crafting the best possible user experience and building a highly scalable code base. Our stacks are Ruby and Go for the backend; EmberJS for the frontend; Kotlin and Swift for the mobile. Our tools/stack include Kafka, Kubernetes, ELK, AWS services and all the good stuffs you could think of!

As a software backend engineer, you will work on improving and scaling the most sensitive piece of Qonto infrastructure. You will ensure the safety and robustness of systems handling hundreds of thousands of complex requests a day. You will also work on shipping innovative new banking features for an exponentially growing user base.

description:
*DNA Script
*
DNA Script is a leading company in manufacturing de novo synthetic nucleic acids using an enzymatic technology. The company aims at accelerating innovation in life science and technology through quick, decentralized solutions for laboratory work in life science and genomics. DNA Script's approach leverages nature's billions of years of evolution in synthesizing DNA to set a new standard for how nucleic acids are made and accelerate the adoption of synthetic biology across diverse disciplines such as biopharma, sustainable chemistry and data storage.
To date, DNA Script has raised over 58 M€ of financing, mostly through equity funding brought by prestigious players such as Illumina Ventures, LSP, Merck Ventures, Sofinnova Partners, BPIFrance, Kurma Partners and Idinvest. The company partners with leading institutions, in particular Institut Pasteur.
We are looking to assemble a team of world class, innovative and passionate people gathering their talents and skills to achieve one goal: unlock the power of DNA to write the future of life sciences. We offer the opportunity to join a dynamic, international and highly skilled team in a high-performance biotech startup. We offer a competitive benefits package (salary, equity, healthcare, meal vouchers and public transportation) along with a unique opportunity to work in the heart of Paris.
The role
The Nucleotide Chemistry Group Leader will be in charge of the development, production and quality control of modified nucleotides, one of the key reagents in DNA Script's technology.
You will play a key role at DNA Script, since we plan to enter the DNA market in the coming years and need to secure sourcing and pricing of these key reagents. Development of new modified nucleotides with additional functionalities is also crucial to broaden our technology applications.
Your roles will be to:
(i) Manage the Chemistry R&D team for the development of multiple types of modified nucleotides
(ii) Ensure the sourcing, production and quality of these nucleotides at large scale in adequation with the Company development and business plans
Responsibilities
Lead a team of 5 scientists (PhDs, engineers, technicians) to complete projects according to established timelines
Provide guidance to the team for developing new synthetic routes, establishing scalable and economical processes, optimizing process parameters and increasing internal production capabilities
Define strategy roadmap for the production of the modified nucleotide portfolio (internal/external) and the associated cost reduction
Lead the transfer of products from R&D to Contract Manufacturing Organizations (CMO)
Work with CMOs for large scale production, find new partners, negotiate mutually beneficial contracts and build strong beneficial partnerships
Author, review, and/or approve technology documents such as tech transfer documents, validation protocols, reports
Ensure the delivery of modified nucleotides and their quality at standards compatible with R&D needs and with upcoming DNA production operations
Experience and skills
Essential
Holds a Master or PhD degree in the field of Chemistry, Chemical Engineering or similar with a minimum of 8-10 years of industry experience required
Experience in R&D team and project management
Expertise in nucleic acid chemistry
Experience in sourcing and procurement
Experience in industrial process and scale-up
Experience in technology transfer with CMO
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Team player, efficient interaction with internal team members as well as external partners
Fluent English speaker
Desirable
Expertise in nucleoside and nucleotide chemistry
Experience with phosphoramidite chemistry
Miscellaneous
Job located in Kremlin-Bicêtre (Paris area)
Start date: ASAP
Job Type: Permanent
Experience:
chimie: 8 years (Required)

Dashlane is a password manager and online security app for everyone who lives, works, and plays on the internet. With a simple, intuitive design and patented security technology, Dashlane keeps passwords, personal data, and payment info at people's fingertips, so they can stop guessing passwords and wasting time filling out forms. Dashlane has helped over 11 million users in 180 countries manage and secure their digital identities and has enabled over $17 billion in e-commerce transactions. Our team in Paris, New York and Lisbon is united by our passion for password security and the belief that our success is built on the diverse backgrounds of every member.

Job Description

Dashlane is looking for a hands-on Engineering Manager to join our growing team in Paris and take on a leadership position within our Backend team.

As a hands-on engineering manager, you will manage and empower developers while continuing to contribute to our codebase and be involved in technical and architectural decisions.

The Backend team is in charge of all our APIs, providing core functionalities to all our client applications like data synchronisation between devices, support for business features, subscriptions management among other things. These services are used daily by millions of users (which translates into hundreds of millions of requests per day). The team is also in charge of securely storing our users' data and maintaining our infrastructure.

The role will be instrumental in improving Dashlane's current systems, processes, and infrastructure necessary to support future growth and expansion plans.

Responsibilities

Manage developers in the Backend team, help them grow as engineers and follow their career development
Work in collaboration with the other Backend Engineering Manager and business stakeholders to prioritize work and help the team achieve its goals
Recruit new developers and participate in Dashlane's effort to be visible in the tech community (e.g. by talking at meetups or conferences)

Manage and forecast backend budget expenses, work on cost optimizations

1+ year(s) experience in people management or mentoring other developers
Proficient in at least one backend programming language (Node.js, Java, Go, Python...)
Proficient in English

You have a track record for managing critical services that need to stay up 24/7

Learn every day and be involved in many various projects

Wake up every morning, be excited to go to work and have fun!

description:
It takes powerful technology to connect our brands and partners with an audience of 1 billion. Nearly half of Verizon Media employees are building the code and platforms that help us achieve that. Whether you’re looking to write mobile app code, engineer the servers behind our massive ad tech stacks, or develop algorithms to help us process 4 trillion data points a day, what you do here will have a huge impact on our business—and the world. Want in? As Verizon’s media unit, our brands like Yahoo, TechCrunch and HuffPost help people stay informed and entertained, communicate and transact, while creating new ways for advertisers and partners to connect. With technologies like XR, AI, machine-learning, and 5G, we’re transforming media for tomorrow, too. We're creators and coders, dreamers and doers creating what's next in content, advertising and technology.
Working at Verizon Media / AlephD
Verizon Media (previously Yahoo / AOL) is a global leader in digital publishing (Yahoo, Huff post, Techcrunch) and monetization technologies. In 2016, Verizon Media acquired AlephD, a French startup developing data-driven, real-time solutions for publishers, ranging from in-depth analytics to fully automated decision making in milliseconds. To develop world-class analytics solutions and machine-learning based products to help publishers and advertisers be more successful, AlephD is recruiting well-rounded developers, thereby growing its Paris-based team.
Job Description
We are looking for a senior experienced full-stack web or back-end developers responsible for building our advanced analytics tools and new experimental products which include:
Building backend APIs which expose data from various Big-Data and traditional databases. (Vertica, Redis, Hadoop, MySQL, etc.)
Architecting and maintaining backend data-sources and ensuring high performance and responsiveness to requests from the front-end.
Data Engineering: ETL, advanced aggregations and building efficient data pipelines. (Hadoop, EMR, Spark, Kafka, Flink, Luigi, etc.)
Working closely with the product teams to build features quickly, iterate and re-iterate to find the best solutions to difficult problems.
Interfacing with different internal and external systems and platforms for data retrieval, authentication and other needs.
Contributions and improvements our CI/CD pipelines.
Our philosophy is that it is not important to check all the boxes of our requirements, but that your fundamentals are strong and you have the ability and desire to learn.
You
Are looking to join a dynamic, fast-paced and friendly team who built a successful startup and continue to operate with a high degree of autonomy.
Want to work closely with the product team to build an ambitious user-facing product with a global footprint.
Want to be part of an industry where tech is constantly disrupting businesses.
Skills And Qualifications
Strong understanding of computer science fundamentals, algorithms, data structures and concurrent programming models.
Deep knowledge of web-related technologies.
Solid experience building web applications. Knowledge in backend frameworks such as Django/Rails/Node.js or front-end frameworks such as Angular/React/Ember/Vue is a plus.
Good knowledge / experience in SQL databases. Experience with NoSQL and big-data technologies (Hadoop, Spark, Vertica, etc) is a plus.
Ability to design and create clean, maintainable, performant code and systems.
Good awareness of security and privacy considerations of web technologies.
Good understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git or Mercurial.
Some experience with dev-ops on AWS a plus.
Good score on Stack-overflow or meaningful projects on GitHub a plus.
Information
Location: Paris (city center near Opéra)
Contact: careers@alephd.com
Twitter: @alephd_labs
And much more: free food, full medical coverage, friendly and intellectually stimulating atmosphere.

COMPANY DESCRIPTION
SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.
SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.
PURPOSE AND OBJECTIVES
The Global Real Estate & Facilities organization takes care of SAP's Global Real Estate Portfolio and operational Facility Management (FM). It attends to tasks in the area of Real Estate such as contract negotiations and rental agreements as well as the realization of technical and constructional major projects relating to Facility Management. Global Real Estate & Facilities (GRF) is also responsible for operating the SAP Data Centers and Office Buildings.
EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS
Manage facility operations and project activity in the Sub-Region
Report activity to FM-Head of Region EMEA and local CFO's
Coordinate alignment of activity with GRF metrics and Lines of Business direction and goals.
Lead subregion facilities team including contractors to set clear objectives, monitor and report activity, and to insure delivery by maximizing the resources.
Establish solid relationships with internal and external service providers, Business Partners and Executives.
Establish relationships and regular briefings where appropriate with The French Works
Implementation and promotion of operational initiatives, such as ‘Green’ or sustainable improvements.
Hire and manage contractors or personnel for projects and operations for each location within the Sub-Region.
Lead ongoing collaboration and partnership with regional shared service providers of HR, IT, GPS and GPO
Oversight for security in sub region and liaison with Global Physical Security team
Manage and prepare operating budgets for each facility and monitor and review expenses on an ongoing basis
Negotiation of fee and service arrangements with professional firms and contract vendors, in coordination with GPO
Coordinate project activity of new office construction, office renovations and building repairs

SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES
Functional knowledge of various aspects of Facility and Project Management
Strong leadership skills with ability to build and develop a team, relationships and trust
Strong financial acumen with an attention to detail
Change management and personnel management skill sets
Executive management presence
The ability to build and maintain strong partnership relations both internal GRF and to our customers within SAP
Strong negotiating skills
The ability to manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment that is often ambiguous and extremely dynamic. A proven ability to multitask and balance multiple priorities while remaining organized is key
A strong customer focus attitude. The ability to understand our customers viewpoint and provide solutions that helps them be more successful
A team player with the mindset of team success being paramount to one’s own success and progress
Strong presentation and communication skills
A strong sense of empathy for colleagues, peers and the wider GRF community
An understanding and acknowledgement of diverse geographical cultural values
Availability to travel
English language skills at an advanced level and additional language spoken would be an advantage
The individual is a creative and innovative individual who is smart, candid, direct and non-political, with a highly developed sense of ethics, energy, passion, confidence, creativity, and ambition
LOCATION: Paris

WHAT YOU GET FROM US
Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.
SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.
SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).
Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

description:
The Ingenico retail enterprise organisation offers a payment gateway that process billions of transactions each year for major retailers. From a software stand point, this requires a highly scalable, highly resilient platform that is at the same time able to be updated easily and constantly.
The solution architect will play a critical role to craft highly scalable, flexible and resilient architectures that address consistent solutions for customers and the industry, as well as for establishing global best practices across the enterprise. You'll have the opportunity to work alongside for important European Retailers to help design B2B payment services solutions.
Job purpose
The primary function of the Solution Architect is to develop architectures and solutions for projects and programs in addition to consulting on key technology decisions. We are looking for a passionate architect to help us develop solution architectures to support our business and contribute to the ongoing maturity of the Ingenico architecture discipline. Especially solution architect will participate to design and discovery phases with big retailers in order to define and adapt our solutions to their specific needs.
The Solution Architect leads key technical discussions and considerations around change programs both with internal teams (business and IT) and customer facing. The solution Architect is a subject matter expert in the implementation of business data flows across multiple data sources (devices, services and third parties).
Key responsabilities
The solution Architect is a subject matter expert in the implementation of business data flows across multiple data sources (devices, services and third parties).
Responsible for project architectures and solutions. Main deliverables include the Solution Architecture Design and Architecture Decisions.
Provide assessment of feasible solution options.
Provide technical leadership and guidance across the lifecycle of a project to drive delivery of high-quality solutions.
Act as a liaison with other architect functions (security architects, data architects, infrastructure architects).
Identifying opportunities to reuse or develop shared technology services between platforms.
Interpersonal Skills
As a person you are result driven, have the ability to influence and have good communication skills which you can use in stakeholder management Customer focused. Driven to improve Ingenico’s business by the application of information technology.
You have analytical skills and the ability to manage complex bids, and are customer focused. Driven to improve Ingenico’s business by the application of our product strategy.
You are a strong team player with leadership potential.
You can share knowledge with colleagues and make useful additions to the Ingenico knowledge base.
Last, but not least, a great colleague to work with. We hugely value people with ambition, humility and a great sense of humour.
Education / Experience
Education in Information technology at bachelor or master level
English – excellent communication skills (both spoken and written) – working language
At least one experience in Service AS A Service (SAAS).
(Preferred) Experience scaling solutions to millions of transactions / large data volumes / high concurrency requests
(Preferred) Experience with Service Orientated and Event Driven Architecture
(Preferred) Experience in the payments industry
Computer / IT Skills:
UML (domain model, activity- and state diagram, sequence diagrams, use cases)
A seasoned Dev Engineer in one or more technologies / languages (Java, C++, Go, Python, SQL, ...)
Knowledge of Open Group Architecture Framework is a plus
Dans le cadre de sa politique Diversité & Handicap, Ingenico étudie toutes candidatures à compétences égales.

Conditions
En tant qu’ingénieur logiciel, vous serez responsable de l’avancement des solutions logicielles pour la plateforme d’analyse. Vos solides compétences analytiques et votre capacité à développer des solutions innovantes de résolution de problèmes soutiendront l’analyse décisionnelle décisionnelle des missions des clients. Permettre aux particuliers de concrétiser leurs travaux de rénovation en toute

description:
Passionné(e) par les nouvelles technologies ? Intéressé(e) par le secteur de l’énergie ? Rejoignez Kayrros, la start-up qui révolutionne le monde de l’énergie.
Kayrros est une start-up créée en 2016 et spécialisée dans l’énergie et l’intelligence artificielle. Rejoindre Kayrros, c’est rejoindre une équipe dynamique de 100 personnes basée à Paris (HQ) et dans nos bureaux de New-York, Houston, Singapour et Londres. Notre équipe internationale est principalement composée de Data Scientists, Data Engineers et Energy Analysts, dont le but est d’apporter de la transparence au secteur de l’énergie.
Kayrros utilise des technologies innovantes, telles que le traitement d'images par satellite et l'intelligence artificielle, pour capturer et analyser des données dans le secteur de l'énergie. Ces données combinées à notre expertise nous permettent de fournir à nos clients (traders, fond d’investissement et grandes entreprises), des informations sur les mouvements du marché mondial, afin de les aider à prendre de meilleures décisions d’investissement.
En septembre 2018, Kayrros a réalisé une deuxième levée de fonds de 21 millions d’euros, nous permettant de continuer notre croissance.
Nous recherchons actuellement pour notre bureau de Paris
un Data Engineer H/F (CDI)
Les Data Engineers jouent un rôle central au sein de Kayrros. Travaillant main dans la main avec les Data Scientists et O&G Analysts, ils collectent et traitent des données brutes à grande échelle et travaillent en étroite collaboration avec les développeurs.

En tant que Data Engineer, vous devrez donc :

Saipem offre une gamme complète de services avec des contrats sur une base “EPC” et / ou “EPCI”, souvent clé en main, et possède des capacités distinctives et des actifs uniques à très hautes valeurs technologiques.
Dans l'industrie de l'énergie, Saipem repousse les frontières technologiques depuis plus de 60 ans et continue à relever des défis planétaires en inventant de nouvelles normes.
SAIPEM, ENGINEERING ENERGY
Dans le cadre du développement de nos équipes « Offshore Plant Technical Management », nous recherchons un(e) .
Mission et descriptif de tâches
Dans le cadre de la digitalisation de nos processus d’ingénierie, sous la responsabilité directe du Technical Manager sur projet, vous vous assurerez de :
La complétude et qualité des données d’ingénierie dans les Databases du projet (EDMS, SP P&ID, SP Instrumentation, AVEVA Engineering, AVEVA E3D, AVEVA DRAW, TEKLA, Smart Materials)
La collection, vérification et intégration des données Vendeurs dans les databases du projet

Les administrateurs des différents outils
Les différentes disciplines d’ingénierie, qui vont travailler dans les Databases

description:
LaFourchette/TheFork i s looking for a Quality Assurance and Test Automation engineer with significant experience in a pure play internet company. We are working to improve the culinary experience by offering simple and intuitive tools for restaurateurs and consumers, both on the web and though native apps. You will be in charge of supporting the different teams in their software quality approach, to pilot the projects necessary for the improvement of the software quality and to improve continuous integration and deployment processes.

LaFourchette, a TripAdvisor Company, is the European leader in online restaurant booking. We are an innovative and fast-growing company building a unique community to transform the way people eat out! LaFourchette's goal is to become the #1 app for online restaurant booking world-wide.

Why join us?
You are passionate about technology and comfortable with an international and agile environment. You're
ready for the challenge of building a web-scale SaaS solution that reliably serves millions of consumers
24x7 in a dozen countries. You want to build fast and intuitive front-ends alongside scalable services to
power the leader in online restaurant bookings. You will join a dynamic and agile team in a quickly
changing environment. You will be involved in an international organization that empowers its employees
and works hard to allow each person reach their full potential.

As Tests Automation Engineer, you will work with development teams in order to :
Maintain and improve tests tools and ensure their suitability through the addition of new tests
Support development teams and managers in the implementation of their quality approach:
Help them to go forward with automatic functional test framework (Behat, Selenium, Appium)
List any missing or unsuitable tools with their test needs
Track possible regressions and set up mitigation solutions with the teams involved
Evangelize our dev teams to best practices defined by the QA in an international context
Manage deployment and support software quality tools with development teams
Follow up automation of functional and/or integration tests
Promote the improvement of functional test coverage
As Quality Assurance Engineer , you will:
Participate in the prevention and correction of software quality problem
Participate in project new project definition and identify potential risks / side effects
Participate in the implementation of monitoring tools and pre / post release alert
Fluidify the deployment process (continuous deployment)
Ensure an active technological watch to be proactive in adopting new tools and / or new technologies to ensure scalability of TheFork products
In addition , you will:
Assist the head of Agility and Quality department in the set-up of KPI's Dashboards for
developments teams, Product teams and top management.
Participate in the implementation of performance and quality tracking tools
What technologies are we using?
Our front-end solutions are built upon ReactJS, Redux, LESS/SASS, Webpack, ES6, respecting BEM methodology over material design styleguides,
Our back-end technical stack relies mainly on PHP/Symfony and NodeJS framework. We also use relationa l databases (MySQL and PostgreSQL), memcache, R abbitMQ ,
Our architecture is moving to a SOA system with API and services communicating through JSON-RPC
Our websites and servers are monitored with New Relic and mobile apps with Fabrics (Crashlytics)
We are using unit, functional and integration testing to have quality proof software
We are using Capistrano, Jenkins, Docker, chef, vagrant to setup our continuous integration system
We are in the process of migrating to Kubernetes for orchestration
Qualifications requirements
You have experience as web developer in a pure player or as Quality Asssurance Engineer
You know front-end framework like AngularJS ou ReactJS
You have experienced in Continuous Integration with Jenkins, Github and Gitlab
You are aware about monitoring tools like Grafana or Promotheus
You are seasoned in the collection and analysis of logs (Elastic Search, Logstash or FileBeat)
Passionate and attentive to new technologies, you are rigorous, dynamic & curious, equipped with an agile mindset and a strong team spirit that allow you to adapt to a changing environment.
You are comfortable writing and speaking in both English and French.
You are data-driven but also have excellent soft skills.
LaFourchette Core Values
Speed Wins • We never stop learning • Act as an owner • We are better together • We love food •We believe in Transparency.

#LI-BD1

A leading advertising technology company, Adikteev has been recognized as #10 among Inc Magazine’s Top 5000 fastest growing companies and #2 in global retargeting, of the AppsFlyer Performance Index. Its team of 60 people is based in Paris, NYC and San Francisco.

Adikteev is now looking for a talented Senior Data Engineer to join the engineering team in Paris. Your role as a key member of the team will be to work hand-in-hand with Data Science and Product teams to create scalable, reliable APIs, stream processes and algorithms to serve the business.
With TBs of data per day and over 1 million incoming requests per second, real time data is not an empty promise at Adikteev. To tackle this complexity, our advertising platform relies on state of the art stream processing technology for machine learning, analytics and elasticity. The backend team is a vector of both efficiency and innovation at the company, allowing the BI and Data Science team to get fast insights. We also eat our own dog food, have a craftsman mentality and like moving fast.

Examples of ongoing interest include unified log architecture, elastic stream processes, distributed tables, distributed machine learning.

Seul AMD dispose d’un savoir faire et de connaissances à la fois dans les domaines des hautes performances graphiques et de l’architecture x86.
Il existe actuellement un marché de plus de $50B lié aux activités de AMD, et nous sommes aujourd’hui dans une excellente position pour accroître nos activités.
Rejoignez nos équipes pour une expérience unique vous permettant de réaliser un travail créatif, et de faire la différence.

AMD recherche un ingénieur développeur dans ses locaux basés à Paris. Ceci est une excellente opportunité pour intégrer une équipe innovante et pour donner forme aux futures technologies.

If you haven’t looked at AMD lately – NOW IS THE TIME!
No other company in the world can match our IP for both high-performance graphics and x86 compute.
There is a $50B market with AMD’s name on it and we’ve never been in a better position to capitalize on it.
Join us for a unique opportunity to do creative work that makes a difference for our company, the industry, and end-users.

AMD is seeking a Software Engineer at our Paris, France location. This is an exciting opportunity to join a team of innovators and shape the future of technology.

Be part of the top guns 3D software engineering team. You will be part of an amazing skilled 3D engineering team where you can grow you knowledge and experience in 3D graphics at the hardware level but also working with the cutting edge 3D rendering algorithms and developing the 3D technologies of tomorrow.

ISV Software Engineers act as the main technical contact between AMD Radeon Pro workstation graphics and 3rd party software developers. Areas of responsibility include, but are not limited to:
Work directly with 3rd party software developers to embed AMD graphics technology into product offerings including the design and implementation of original software.
Tune and optimize 3rd party software to insure optimal performance on AMD graphics hardware.
Drive technology direction and adoption of current and future AMD graphics technologies.
Diagnose and resolve customer issues, working to resolve AMD workstation graphics specific software issues as necessary.
Help drive future AMD workstation graphics product direction & features

Knowedge, Skills and Attributes:
Fluent in English.
Technical BS/MS degree and demonstrated successful experience in 2D/3D graphics
Excellent written and spoken communication skills
Strong problem solving and debugging skills
Proficiency in 3D graphics, particularly OpenGL and/or Direct3D
Expert programming skills in C and/or C++ in the Windows environment
Experience with performance tuning and optimization
Familiarity with CAD products highly desirable
Unix experience and GPU compute (OpenCL, Cuda, etc.) experience preferred.

Passionné(e) par les nouvelles technologies ? Intéressé(e) par le secteur de l’énergie ? Rejoignez Kayrros, la start-up qui révolutionne le monde de l’énergie.
Kayrros est une start-up créée en 2016 et spécialisée dans l’énergie et l’intelligence artificielle. Rejoindre Kayrros, c’est rejoindre une équipe dynamique de 100 personnes basée à Paris (HQ) et dans nos bureaux de New-York, Houston, Singapour et Londres. Notre équipe internationale est principalement composée de Data Scientists, Data Engineers et Energy Analysts, dont le but est d’apporter de la transparence au secteur de l’énergie.
Kayrros utilise des technologies innovantes, telles que le traitement d'images par satellite et l'intelligence artificielle, pour capturer et analyser des données dans le secteur de l'énergie. Ces données combinées à notre expertise nous permettent de fournir à nos clients (traders, fond d’investissement et grandes entreprises), des informations sur les mouvements du marché mondial, afin de les aider à prendre de meilleures décisions d’investissement.
En septembre 2018, Kayrros a réalisé une deuxième levée de fonds de 21 millions d’euros, nous permettant de continuer notre croissance.

description:
Who we are looking for
Do you want to join the team that will transform life insurance actuarial modelling using our cutting edge software?
Do you want to address the modelling challenges faced by insurers?
Do you enjoy working on client facing projects as part of a team?
If so, and you have a Life insurance background we will be interested in speaking with you.
About the role
As a member of our growing Life team you will play a vital role in meeting the expectations of our clients, and will be involved in delivering high quality cutting-edge life insurance actuarial modelling solutions.
There will be great emphasis on helping clients re-engineer existing modelling estates to meet their pricing, valuation, reporting and capital modelling needs. You will be part of a team who are developing, implementing and testing models in either joint client-RPC collaborations or full RPC teams.
You will be responsible for the preparation of data and the technical delivery of model development and testing. You will use your knowledge and experience to provide input into decision making and by using out software platform, Tyche, you will advise clients about solutions and strategies for their business. You may use your understanding of the industry and the different market segments to provide support and advice to clients and to deliver commercial solutions that drive the business forward.
Candidate profile
Educated to degree level with a minimum of a 2:1 or equivalent qualification and ideally working towards an actuarial qualification with experience of:
Technical skills:
Modelling: gained at either another consulting firm or from within a modelling team at an Insurance company;
Knowledge of MoSes or Prophet Software or knowledge with other modelling tools such as C#, VBA, SQL, etc.
Some experience of Life insurance modelling;
Strong analytical skills with a logical and thorough approach to define and solve a problem;
Consulting skills:
Self-starter who is adaptable and can deal with ambiguity in order to make things happen;
Excellent organisational skills with the ability to work under pressure and effectively prioritise and execute tasks;
Enjoy working in a team orientated, collaborative environment;
Standard working hours are 09.30 to 5.30pm with additional hours required during times of increased activity. We are open to applications from candidates who require flexible working patterns.
Before you meet us, get to know us
Located in our prestigious offices in London and more recently Paris, RPC Consulting delivers modelling and software solutions combined with consultancy support to the insurance industry. We help those in insurance and related sectors do things better. We deploy our team of highly skilled actuaries, accountants, MBAs and PhDs - all of whom specialise in insurance - to help our clients get ahead.
We have developed our own proprietary modelling platform, Tyche, to solve this industry need. With Tyche we are able to tackle the most challenging of modelling problems and provide companies with solutions that can be implemented into their daily business discussions by leveraging affordable “commodity” hardware and ground breaking advances in parallel software design.
RPC Consulting has a fresh, dynamic work atmosphere, but you will benefit from its relationship with, and therefore the security of, a larger organisation, RPC. The firm now has over 80 people bringing deep insurance knowledge, actuarial science, data science and software development skills to a growing client base both in the UK, French and US markets.
Inclusion and Diversity
People are at the heart of everything we do. We want every member of our team to feel welcome, valued and confident they'll achieve their career objectives here. It's the minimum our employees should expect of us - and it's good for business, too.
We've put into place a number of initiatives and development programmes to ensure that our population is as reflective of society as possible, both internally with allies@RPC & RPC RAIN, and externally, we partner with the 30% Club, Business in the Community, Cityparents, Stonewall, InterLaw and University of Law.

description:
La Customer Digital Factory du groupe PSA regroupe les compétences de la Direction du Digital, Data & Connectivity Engineering (DDCE) et de la Direction Digitale (DDIG).
Au sein de la DDCE, l'entité Digital Engineering for Sales & Marketing a pour mission d'accompagner les 3 Marques et les Métiers du commerce (Digital et CRM) du groupe PSA dans la bonne exécution de la stratégie « Push to Pass ».

2. Mission principale
Les programmes de la Digital Factory s'organisent autour du framework SAFe. Le RTE pose le cadre méthodologique et veille à sa bonne application tout en améliorant le système au fur et à mesure.

Le RTE est chargé de la conduite opérationnelle d'un programme ou plusieurs projets. Il doit maîtriser les méthodes de gestion de projet en agile mais aussi avoir de solides connaissances des technologies liées aux systèmes d'information et des pratiques liées à son périmètre d'activités.

Il travaille en étroite collaboration avec un « Product Manger » et un « System Architect » pour assurer la gouvernance du programme sur lequel il est embarqué.

Les projets qu'il mène s'appuient sur des « user stories » elles même dans un « program backlog » qu'il doit traduire, en « features ». Il doit ensuite faire réaliser ces dernières par les équipes qu'il coordonne en s'appuyant au maximum sur des produits/applications existants et des composants de la plate-forme Digital du Groupe PSA.

Il est le garant du respect de l'implémentation du programme en termes de coût, de délais, de qualité et de performance. Il est également force de proposition tout au long du projet et notamment au titre d'éventuels ajustements en lien avec les contraintes techniques.

3. Tâches principales

Ses missions principales sont :
Qualifier le projet et proposer le dispositif méthodologique et technologique à mettre en œuvre ainsi que les équipes techniques à même de porter sa réalisation ;
Veiller à la traduction de « l'expression de besoin » métier en éléments exploitables par le programme ;
Etablir le planning, prévoir les ressources et attribuer les tâches, cadrer le budget en accord avec les acteurs métier;
Accompagner et coordonner les différentes parties prenantes internes ou externes liées au programme ;
Suivre le périmètre, les coûts, les délais et la qualité ainsi que gérer les priorités et les risques du programme,
Présenter l'avancement du programme et remonter les éventuelles alertes lors de rituels réguliers adapté
S'assurer de la cohérence finale entre l'expression de besoin et la solution technique apportée, notamment à travers des phases de test et la mise en place de l'accompagnement des futurs utilisateurs.
Il est le facilitateur du PI planning pour gérer et optimiser les flux au sein du programme.
Profil
De formation Bac + 5, type Ecole d'Ingénieur ou équivalent, le RTE Digital recherché possède une expérience minimum de 5 ans sur des fonctions de pilotage de projet informatique de préférence dans le secteur du commerce et/ou de l'industrie automobile et dans un contexte mettant en œuvre les technologies du Digital.
Une expérience au sein d'un programme utilisant SAFe et la tenue d'un poste de RTE au sein d'un train AGILE sont des points important dans le choix du candidat.
Une expérience en pilotage de la relation fournisseur serait un plus (élaboration de cahier des charges, suivi, recette).

Le poste peut nécessiter des déplacements ponctuels en France et à l'étranger.
Un niveau d'anglais opérationnel est requis (niveau B2 minimum datant de moins de deux ans obligatoire).
Savoir-faire
Pilotage de projet : maîtrise de la gestion d'équipe, de la conduite de réunion, des méthodes de planification et du suivi du budget
Connaissance des méthodologies projet lié au cycle en V comme à l'agile (Scrum en particulier)
Systèmes d'Information (SI) : maîtrise des principes d'architecture fonctionnelle et des méthodes, normes et outils permettant de concevoir, de modéliser et d'implémenter un système d'information (application, site web, application mobile, API…)
Connaissance des technologies du Digital et en particulier du Digital Marketing et du Big Data
Savoir-être
Culture du Digital
Orienté « business »
Agilité, capacité à fonctionner en organisation horizontale
Sens du management : implication et motivation, animation d'équipe
Sens du relationnel : écoute, capacité à communiquer, à négocier, à résoudre des conflits et à travailler en équipe
Force de proposition, capacité d'arbitrage et pragmatisme
Autonomie, rigueur et polyvalence
Esprit de synthèse et organisation

Vous parlez couramment anglais. (Un niveau minimum B2 est requis pour toute embauche Cadre au sein du Groupe PSA.)
Localisation du poste
Pays
Europe, France, Ile-de-France, Yvelines (78)
Ville
Poissy
Critères candidat
Niveau d'expérience min. requis
5 à 10 ans
Langues
