description:
Sales Support Associate
Le(la) Gestionnaire de support Commercial fait partie de l’équipe Support Commercial au sein de l’organisation opération commerciale en Europe
Le(la) Gestionnaire de support Commercial a une bonne connaissance de Siebel et SFDC ainsi qu’une connaissance des technologies (produits) du datacentre. Le SSA a une forte expérience et sait travailler avec les différents outils qui sont mis à sa disposition. Le SSA a un bon sens du relationnel avec les clients et les commerciaux et est réactif aux demandes qui lui sont faites.
Le(la) Gestionnaire de support Commercial a un rôle transversal avec différents services liés aux bons de commandes. Il coordonnera et contactera les personnes clés pour résoudre et ou avancer sur un dossier et ou une commande. Il informera le commercial et le client (avec l’accord préalable du commercial en charge du compte) des derniers changements ou nouvelles procédures pouvant les impacter.
Le(la) Gestionnaire de support Commercial est impliqué dans les projets client et devra établir la quote répondant au différents besoins clients en adéquation avec notre système et nos procédures.
Le(la) Gestionnaire de support Commercial a la responsabilité journalière de gérer et répondre aux différents « cases » qui arrivent dans la boite aux lettres de SFDC.
Le commercial sait créer des commandes standards et simples pour un client ou prospect demandant un nouvel espace, mais pourra demander l’assistance du SSA pour valider le bon de commande à établir. Le SSA pourra être sollicité afin de suivre les commandes faites par le commercial et s’assurer que les dates de livraisons soient respectées.
Le(la) Gestionnaire de support Commercial maitrise la gestion de tous les types de commandes et la réconciliation des espaces. Il est également en charge d’actions proactives dans le nettoyage de comptes clients avant chaque fin de trimestre. Il s’assure que l’échéancier de prix soient corrects et en relation avec la durée du contrat, que les demandes de résiliations soient approuvées (suivre la procédure du pays) avant de créer la commande de désinstallation, que tous les contrats soient signés et contresignés.
Il veille à ce que, pour tous les nouveaux clients, le contrat soit impérativement signé et tamponné du cachet de la société.
Les contrats devront être répertoriés dans le dossier du client qui se trouve sur le serveur.
Son rôle est de travailler en transversal avec différents services comme, le commercial, responsable service client (Customer Service), l’ingénieur avant-vente (Sales Engineers), le responsable d’infrastructure (Capacity), la facturation (Billing) et le contrôle financier (crédit control), le Service Desk et apporter son expertise auprès de ces services.
Le(la) Gestionnaire de support Commercial est également le 1er point de contact et support dans les actions administratives liées aux comptes clients tels que le changement de nom d’un compte, le transfert du nom de responsable de compte. Il a la charge de vérifier qu’une opportunité a bien été créée pour chaque échelonnement de prix ‘ramp up’et opportunités de résiliation dans SFDC.
Le(la) Gestionnaire de support Commercial sera en relation avec l’équipe finance via la facturation et en interface client. Le SSA peut être invité à participer et à préparer des commandes suite à un appel d’offre. Voyager en Europe pourra être demandé.
Activités journalières
Support client et commercial => création et suivi des commandes jusqu’à leur approbation. Répondre aux différents besoins du commercial qui peuvent être : résoudre un problème lié aux fonctionnalités de notre système, aider à la création d’une commande complexe. Savoir expliquer et former les commerciaux à nos outils, répondre à une forte demande de création de commande à titre ponctuel. Des déplacements sont possibles en dehors du bureau et du pays.
Consolider et valider les différents besoins client et commercial dans une commande. Suivre avec le commercial la commande et apporter les compléments d’informations nécessaires pour établir la commande et la faire valider dans un temps imparti.
Suivre, gérer les “cases” dans SFDC et créer les commandes en correspondance avec la demande reçue et en cohérence avec les produits et notre système.
Maitriser tous types de création de commande et ses complexités (échéancier de prix ‘ramp up’, contrat de prix ‘price agreement’), et ajouter des informations légales transmises par les commerciaux.
Avant tout envoi de commande à un client, s’assurer que la commande soit bien conforme techniquement et validée par le département juridique en cas de condition non standard et autres départements impliqués de la commande.
Travailler avec le commercial pour établir un contrat récapitulant les produits bénéficiant d’accord tarifaire.
Répondre et apporter le support adapté aux différentes demandes faites par le commercial et être le point de contact pour toutes les questions relatives à notre système et ses évolutions, et procédures (ECO et ses évolutions)
Apporter son support et son expertise auprès des différents territoires commerciaux tels que Majors, GAM et Network basé en local et/ou à l’international
Aider le commercial dans ses demandes de création de GTC et MCA, savoir le guider et l’informer sur les bonnes procédures et démarches à suivre dans nos différents systèmes et outils
Aider au quotidien le responsable commercial dans ses problématiques liées aux systèmes et procédures.
Communiquer/ transmettre des points d’amélioration susceptibles d’améliorer nos systèmes et procédures.
Avoir une communication efficace auprès des différents services avec lesquels vous serez en relation
Suivre et gérer les différents rapports liés à l’activité commerciale et à la gestion des commandes.
Description de fonction
Formation et Experience
Expérience de Siebel, Salesforce et Excel
Connaissances; Compétences et Habilités
Bonne connaissance de Siebel et SFDC
Sens de l’organisation, de la communication, bon sens du relationnel auprès des intervenants internes et externes, capacité d’anticipation
Important sens du détail et de la précision
Capacité de travailler et de s’adapter à un nouvel environnement et aux changements rapides
Interface client
Savoir gérer les priorités, dissocier de ce qui est important et urgent, travailler dans la confidentialité et être autonome
Bonne connaissance du pack Office : Word, PowerPoint et Excel (tableau croisé dynamique inclus)
Compétences analytiques, comprendre et faire appliquer les procédures, avoir le sens du résultat (solutions)
Connaissance souhaitée d’internet, de l’hébergement et du réseau
Capacité à voyager de temps en temps
Sales Support Associate
Equinix is looking for an enthusiastic Sales Support Associate to join our Sales Support department.
Being part of the EMEA Sales Support Organisation our mission is to be the single point of contact for all pre-sales related requests and issues. In your role as SSA (Sales Support Associate) you will be acting as a project manager for all pre-sales activities. As a team, we are responsible for tracking and coordinating progress on all opportunity-related requests, such as legal agreements, quotes, and customer signatures. The SSA is responsible for supporting the Sales team on pre-sales system and process changes.
As our SSA, you play a key role in project handling pre-sales activities and you work cross-functionally to solve issues related to quotes, orders and data. You are the pre-sales operations contact who coordinates tasks seamlessly behind the scenes. You are handling multiple deals across the EMEA region ensuring they conform to Equinix standards, making sure the scope and direction of each is on schedule. Additionally, where there is a policy, process tool or system change impacting the customer or Sales, the SSA will make sure they are aware and help them through adoption.

What is the role about?
Support pre-sales operational activities for complex customer accounts or multi country deals (e.g. Majors, GAM, Network)
Support Customers and Sales reps with creating, tracking status and garnering approvals for quotes. You also support for system functionality issues, quote complexity, knowledge/training, and high volume of quotes
Work with the sales executive to ensure pricing agreements are in place and accurate
Provide live sales support for all system related questions and be the subject matter expertise for any system or process improvements (e.g., ECO enhancements)
Validate quoting info provided by customers/ Sales reps for non-standard quotes. Follow up directly with Sales reps on any clarifications or additional info required to accurately generate quote
Monitor quote request queues and generate quotes related to new orders, amendments, and renewals. Run quote revisions, approvals, pricing ramps, and pricing agreements and contract language as needed
Ensure any/all non-system-managed approvals are properly maintained before quotes or other legal documents are released to customers
Communicate effectively with a variety of departments within Equinix and function well within a team

Who are you?
BA/BS degree or equivalent experience, preferably in computer-related field
Extensive experience in Project Managing/ Quote Support / Customer Support Organization
Siebel, Salesforce, Excel expertise is a plus
Excellent organisational, communication and interpersonal skills, ability to professionally communicate and interact with all levels of internal and external customers
Strong attention to detail with a high degree of accuracy
Ability to juggle multiple priorities, handle highly confidential information, and a self-starter attitude
You have a customer service focus

What we offer
The opportunity to leave your mark in a company that is growing quickly and still manages to keep a pioneer spirit. We offer you a competitive salary in return for your time and drive, sharing your knowledge and experience. On top of that, you'll be offered an quarterly bonus scheme, but overall an environment where you can flourish, grab opportunities and enjoy yourself whilst working.

Equinix
Equinix, Inc. is an American multinational company that specialises in enabling global interconnection between organisations and their employees, customers, partners, data and clouds. The company is the leading global colocation data center provider by market share and it operates 180+ data centers in 44 major metropolitan areas in 22 countries on 5 continents.
Keep yourself up to date with Equinix news by browsing our website and subscribing to our LinkedIn, YouTube, Twitter and Facebook feeds and watch this video to see what it’s like to work at Equinix: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GIUL_ggfWCs

Want to learn more or apply?
Please use the link to apply, so we can get back to you as soon as possible.

We look forward to meeting you!

description:
Cloud Data Architect Manager (H/F)
Groupe mondial évoluant dans l’univers de la santé, notre division Industrie représente plus de 80 sites de production produisant plus de 5 Milliards d’unités produits par an. Nous sommes largement engagés dans la transformation digitale de l’entreprise et en route vers un modèle d’Usine 4.0. Gérer la variété des projets à mener en mode agile, nous permet de conduire la transformation numérique des process en exploitant les actifs data, tout en favorisant de nouvelles approches et méthodes de travail. Aujourd’hui nos enjeux sont d’internaliser l’expertise technique data et cloud en passant d’une informatique support à un avantage compétitif pour l’industrie, le tout dans un contexte réglementaire fort. Pour cela, nous recrutons un Cloud Data Architect Manager.

Une mission phare dans notre organisation :
En collaboration avec l’équipe développement (5 personnes à ce jour), vous vous assurez que la stratégie ainsi que les décisions relatives à l’architecture commune sont mises en œuvre de manière cohérente dans l’ensemble de l’entreprise et des services informatiques. Par ailleurs, vous portez la vision globale et évangélisez toutes les parties prenantes.
Au quotidien vos principales responsabilités porteront sur :
Amener et porter la vision technique et la roadmap
Diriger la conception technique du data lake et l’intégration des données
Concevoir et contribuer à la mise en œuvre des solutions techniques requises pour une intégration et un accès optimal aux données à partir d’un large éventail de sources en utilisant les infrastructures et les services managés cloud AWS, ou GCP
Créer et gérer des pipelines de traitement pour des ensembles de données volumineux et complexes
Fournir des solutions « scalables » exploitant un ou plusieurs services cloud AWS
Travailler aux côtés des équipes Cloud Data Engineers, Cloud System Developers pour mettre en œuvre les architectures définies
Collaborer avec les datas scientists et le métier exploitant la données pour bien connaître les exigences métiers
Partager son expertise et contribuer au reskilling des équipes internes existantes
Prendre en compte un environnement réglementé
Être constamment en veille et tester de nouvelles approches et technos
Participer au recrutement de nouvelles compétences pour renforcer l’équipe
Assurer un reporting régulier de vos actions
Environnement technique :
Technologies Cloud / IaaS / SaaS / PaaS (Clouds privés et publics comme AWS, Azure, Google)
API first
DevOps et intégration continue / livraison continue/infra as code/serveless platform
Cloud Native Platforms / Microservices
Stockage de données NoSQL
Une solide expérience de l’architecture data :
De formation supérieure, anglais courant, vous avez au moins cinq années d’expérience dans un poste similaire, et avez notamment mis en place conçu et mis en place une architecture data dans le cloud dans des contextes à forte volumétrie. Vous y avez développé votre savoir-faire de manager d’équipes tant internes qu’externes.
Vous avez une bonne compréhension des plates-formes cloud et en particulier d’AWS (avec utilisation de services managés tels que Glue, Lambda, S3, redshift…), également des outils et de frameworks Big Data (Spark…), ainsi que des principales technos autour des architectures cloud et data. Idéalement vous avez déjà participé à des projets de conception ainsi qu’à des implémentations de data lake.
Aujourd’hui vous recherchez une responsabilité élargie sur des projets ambitieux et disposant de moyens conséquents.
Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?
Un secteur d’activité porteur de sens et de valeurs : la santé
Un poste à fort impact dans l’entreprise
Une forte ambition, autour de l’exploitation de la data, portée par notre VP Industrie Monde
Des choix technos de pointe ainsi que de gros moyens pour les mettre en place
Une création de poste vous laissant l’opportunité de bâtir entièrement la plateforme data de demain et par ailleurs de constituer votre équipe
Une forte attention portée à l’équilibre travail et vie personnelle
Un environnement de travail productif et agréable

titre_poste: Site Reliability Engineer (French & English fluent), Paris Office
date_publication:
il y a 30+ jours
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
The Company
Synthesio allows global brands and agencies to listen to conversations about their products and measure their impact on the market.
After a first data crawling phase, we enrich and aggregate data in many different visualizations that will enable marketing professionals to optimize their decisions and strategy for their business.
The Team
We're 4 seniors and 1 junior SRE, plus a backend engineer, colocated in Paris.
We're part of the R&D team, about 50 people: backend engineers, frontend engineers, QA, data scientists, PO/PM, designers. Most of us are located in Paris, some are full time remote.
In this organization there's a good, intelligent cross-teams collaboration, and we take care of keeping it going as smooth as possible.
We work in a sort of Agile/Kanban style with priorities and interest : what needs to be done? what would you like to do that can help to meet our objectives?
We write what we do (documentation, blog posts) and present our projects internally and externally.
As SRE, we cooperate a lot with backend engineers. For the Frontend aspects, as it's a B2B platform, there's not much outgoing web traffic, so the impact is quite limited for us. Our challenges are more concentrated on the ingestion, enrichment and storage of the data, their performance and availability.
The current SRE team is perfectly working, but still, we want to extend it !
We have big forthcoming challenges, and as projects will accelerate, we need to be ready for the next steps !
The Platform
Most of the platform is composed of bare metal with some VMware, about 900 machines in total. Mostly Debian - some FreeBSD for specific needs - more than 2.5PB storage in total.
Globally, it's a data processing chain architecture with daemons written in Go and Kafka messaging, processing 60 millions new documents per day.
For the datastores, ElasticSearch clusters represent about half of the platform. We also have quite big MySQL instances (>10TB per machine): Galera, master/master, MyRocks ... and some ScyllaDB (Cassandra) clusters too (about 100TB in total).
Everything is automated with Ansible, from OS installation to application deployment and monitoring.
For Observability, metrics gathering and alerting are done with Prometheus- more than 2M active time series (still have Zabbix running, though).
Logs are centralized on a platform based on syslog + kafka + hindsight + ES/Kibana.
About Tracing, we use zipkin, quite sporadically for the moment.
Of course, we have legacy components, some old versions of PHP for instance, but we don't forget them and do what's needed to tackle them along time.
For the less pleasant part of the job, yes, there is an On call rotation, weekly based, handled by the whole SRE team. Hopefully we don't deal directly with clients, there's a great support team here for this. And we take very seriously the oncall interventions and the impact on the health/fatigue of our Engineers. No single incident is left without long term remediation action, whether it's on Dev or SRE side.
Skills expected
As we have 2 positions opened, we're interested in any experience level, from junior with a 1st meaningful experience to very senior.
Diversity matters too, on all its dimensions: professional/personal background, cultural, gender.
We don't look necessarily for people who master every single technology we operate. We believe that the mindset is more important, and then the skills will follow.
Operating a platform at this scale requires great rigor, and a bit of imagination, sometimes... particularly when it's 4 a.m. and you're on call!
If you are genuinely curious, want to improve your skills, either soft or technical, learn from failures in a blameless and accountable way, we want to meet you!
At least, you should know how to use git, vim, Debian, Bash, know what centralized configuration management is.
That said, if you are the kind of person that always ends up reading the code to really understand 'how it works', if you debug performance issues with Delve and perf, if you want to discuss the problem of write amplifications on LSM-tree data structures, we also want to hear from you! Even more if you like to share your knowledge!
About the language, you'll have to be fluent in French, and also in English.
BBzQ4Nlz4F

description:
LaFourchette/TheFork i s looking for a Quality Assurance and Test Automation engineer with significant experience in a pure play internet company. We are working to improve the culinary experience by offering simple and intuitive tools for restaurateurs and consumers, both on the web and though native apps. You will be in charge of supporting the different teams in their software quality approach, to pilot the projects necessary for the improvement of the software quality and to improve continuous integration and deployment processes.
LaFourchette, a TripAdvisor Company, is the European leader in online restaurant booking. We are an innovative and fast-growing company building a unique community to transform the way people eat out! LaFourchette’s goal is to become the #1 app for online restaurant booking world-wide.
Why join us?
You are passionate about technology and comfortable with an international and agile environment. You're
ready for the challenge of building a web-scale SaaS solution that reliably serves millions of consumers
24x7 in a dozen countries. You want to build fast and intuitive front-ends alongside scalable services to
power the leader in online restaurant bookings. You will join a dynamic and agile team in a quickly
changing environment. You will be involved in an international organization that empowers its employees
and works hard to allow each person reach their full potential.
As Tests Automation Engineer, you will work with development teams in order to :
Maintain and improve tests tools and ensure their suitability through the addition of new tests
Support development teams and managers in the implementation of their quality approach:
Help them to go forward with automatic functional test framework (Behat, Selenium, Appium)
List any missing or unsuitable tools with their test needs
Track possible regressions and set up mitigation solutions with the teams involved
Evangelize our dev teams to best practices defined by the QA in an international context
Manage deployment and support software quality tools with development teams
Follow up automation of functional and/or integration tests
Promote the improvement of functional test coverage

As Quality Assurance Engineer , you will:
Participate in the prevention and correction of software quality problem
Participate in project new project definition and identify potential risks / side effects
Participate in the implementation of monitoring tools and pre / post release alert
Fluidify the deployment process (continuous deployment)
Ensure an active technological watch to be proactive in adopting new tools and / or new technologies to ensure scalability of TheFork products

In addition , you will:
Assist the head of Agility and Quality department in the set-up of KPI's Dashboards for
developments teams, Product teams and top management.
Participate in the implementation of performance and quality tracking tools
What technologies are we using?
Our front-end solutions are built upon ReactJS, Redux, LESS/SASS, Webpack, ES6, respecting BEM methodology over material design styleguides,
Our back-end technical stack relies mainly on PHP/Symfony and NodeJS framework. We also use relationa l databases (MySQL and PostgreSQL), memcache, R abbitMQ ,
Our architecture is moving to a SOA system with API and services communicating through JSON-RPC
Our websites and servers are monitored with New Relic and mobile apps with Fabrics (Crashlytics)
We are using unit, functional and integration testing to have quality proof software
We are using Capistrano, Jenkins, Docker, chef, vagrant to setup our continuous integration system
We are in the process of migrating to Kubernetes for orchestration
Qualifications requirements
You have experience as web developer in a pure player or as Quality Asssurance Engineer
You know front-end framework like AngularJS ou ReactJS
You have experienced in Continuous Integration with Jenkins, Github and Gitlab
You are aware about monitoring tools like Grafana or Promotheus
You are seasoned in the collection and analysis of logs (Elastic Search, Logstash or FileBeat)
Passionate and attentive to new technologies, you are rigorous, dynamic & curious, equipped with an agile mindset and a strong team spirit that allow you to adapt to a changing environment.
You are comfortable writing and speaking in both English and French.
You are data-driven but also have excellent soft skills.
LaFourchette Core Values
Speed Wins • We never stop learning • Act as an owner • We are better together • We love food •We believe in Transparency.

We create smart innovations to meet the mobility challenges of now and the future. We design and manufacture a complete range of transportation systems, from high-speed trains to electric buses, autonomous subways, signalling and digital mobility solutions. Joining us means joining a truly global community of 36 300 people dedicated to solving real-world mobility challenges and achieving international projects with sustainable local impact.
What are my responsibilities?
As Data Architect, you lead the industrialization and the deployment of our PHM applications worldwide. You partner with our data capture experts, fellow data scientists and IT guys to create a cohesive working environment driven by curiosity and innovation.
Your responsibilities include:
Contributing to the design and development of the architecture of the data platform which hosts our PHM applications.
Adapting the dataflow management and data storage strategy to our range of solutions and customers, partnering with PHM data scientists, PHM engineers and our customer’s IT department and our Alstom IS&T.
Ensuring the maintainability, upgradeability and scalability of our solutions through careful planning of feature deployment at the platform level, in agreement with the product roadmap defined by the Solution Director.
Supporting the team in planning a development roadmap.
Contributing hands-on to the actual implementation of the platform functionalities.

What do I need to qualify for this job?

description:
Dashlane is a password manager and online security app for everyone who lives, works, and plays on the internet. With a simple, intuitive design and patented security technology, Dashlane keeps passwords, personal data, and payment info at people's fingertips, so they can stop guessing passwords and wasting time filling out forms. Dashlane has helped over 11 million users in 180 countries manage and secure their digital identities and has enabled over $17 billion in e-commerce transactions. Our team in Paris, New York and Lisbon is united by our passion for password security and the belief that our success is built on the diverse backgrounds of every member.

You will be based in Paris, France.

The Role

Dashlane is looking for a Release Engineer in Paris to support our growth. The primary purpose of this role is to help us scale and industrialize our current multi-platform release pipeline that enables our product development teams to own and run their release processes.

You will support all phases of the software life-cycle - including multi-platform build systems, continuous integration, crash reporting, code coverage, analysis tools, and test environments, to allow our code and features to be released in a streamlined and automated way, from development to production.

In collaboration with the engineering teams and in an agile and cross-platform environment, you will design, implement, document, improve and maintain a solid release infrastructure that optimizes our development speed, accelerates our agile delivery cadence, while still providing a very high degree of stability and reliability for our customers.

At Dashlane you will:
Support and improve our tools for continuous integration (CI) and continuous delivery (CD), in a cross-platform environment (windows, mac, android, ios, web)
Improve and maintain our automated release pipelines that package, test and deploy code
Contribute to defining and documenting our code branching, merge strategies and release procedures
Improve and adapt our release processes based on business needs and a fast growing engineering team
Integrate and maintain a common set of tools that help automate and monitor everything as much as possible
Define and promote industry best practices across multiple teams
Apply best practices in CI/CD security (privilege separation, secret management, pipeline security testing, etc.)
Requirements:
4+ years in a Software Engineering, Release Engineering or a similar role
We're also looking for:
Proficient with version control, continuous integration, and multi-platform development environments
Expertise in automating release and build processes
Expertise in working with CI tools like Gitlab, Jenkins or Bamboo.
Experience in coding and scripting in one or more programming languages (Java, typescript, python, bash, etc).
Experience with Docker and/or Kubernetes
Experience with configuration management tools (ansible, terraform, puppet, packer)
Diversity at Dashlane:
A true international company, founded in Paris and currently split between Paris, New York, and Lisbon, we thrive off diverse perspectives. We recognize that diversity has different aspects: gender, sexual orientation, ability, ethnic origin, social background, age, lifestyle, and more. We're committed to hiring people that create a diverse community and foster a culture where everyone is heard and feels a sense of belonging.

meta1:
Java Agent Engineer
Sqreen - Paris (75)
date_publication: il y a 30+ jours
description:
Who we are

Sqreen is the industry’s first provider of Application Security Management (ASM), unifying application security needs into one single platform, giving over 600 companies unprecedented visibility and protection in production. Sqreen enables developers, operations and security teams to scale their security without impacting engineering velocity.

The company was founded by security veterans who previously led the offensive security team at Apple. Sqreen is backed by Greylock Partners, Y Combinator, Alven and Point Nine.

For more information, please visit www.sqreen.com.

What we need your help with

As part of the product engineering team you'll be in charge of designing and implementing the new features of the Sqreen Java agent.

Our technology protects web applications at run-time through dynamic instrumentation. You’ll work on server modules performing dynamic instrumentation, application security protection, and run-time monitoring to protect our Java customers' applications.

Your challenge? Make our customers' applications as safe as possible without compromising on performance.

We are a customer centric company. The Sqreen agents are protecting more than 500 customers, in production. As such, you will be in touch with our customers in order to get feedback on our features but also to get information about potential performance or stability improvement. Fixing bugs for our customers (so that no other customers will encounter them!) is a critical part of the job.

Day to day you'll:

> Own, build, test and release Sqreen's Java agent
> Design and implement key features, protocols and protections running within our customers' applications
> Use modern development methods and tools to put your code in production quickly
> Work with backend teams to enhance data flow, performance and reliability
> Produce technical blog posts and document the software you ship
> Attend conferences and meetups to share your work
> Forecast Java language and runtime evolutions to ensure the Sqreen agent has a first in class Java support
> Follow the Java ecosystem evolutions to stay close to application servers, frameworks, popular deployment mechanisms etc.

Who you are

We'd love to hear from you if you have:

> A strong interest in leading implementation of a mission critical piece of software
> The ability to design custom protocols, services and frameworks
> Significant experience with the Java ecosystem
> A high consideration of reliability, low-latency, redundancy, and security
> Excellent communication skills (we work in English)
> A product mindset and enjoy working with people outside your area of expertise - every engineer at Sqreen collaborates daily with Sales, Support and other teams

Sqreeners come from all corners of the globe and all walks of life. Diversity is important to us, so if you're unsure, please apply!
Why work for Sqreen

> Be part of an incredibly talented team who are passionate about democratising security
> Join at a crucial stage of our development with a huge amount of runway for you to add value
> Contribute tangibly to our core product, bringing value to our customers each and every week
> Join a product-focused company, with a deep commitment to learning
> Ask for any book you like and enjoy a week per quarter to focus on a side project of your choice
> Attend great conferences all year round
> Enjoy premium health insurance, healthy snacks every day and coached Sqreenfit sessions every fortnight
> A relaxed working environment with regular social activities
> Beautiful 'Sqreenhouses' in central Paris (Sentier), and San Francisco (SoMa)
> An international, English speaking work environment with the opportunity to visit SF

Sqreen participates actively in the tech and security ecosystem in Paris and San Francisco so you'll have access to some of the most interesting and talented people from our network and beyond!

You need to be autonomous, concerned with producing readable and maintainable code, and having a knack for solving problems in a pragmatic and efficient way.

That will give you many opportunities to have a major impact on the company’s success by producing bleeding edge features.

Are you a developer willing to contribute in a C++ codebase? We’re looking someone who doesn’t just maintain, but raises the bar for how we think about search and relevance. description:
Who we are
At Criteo, we connect 1.5 billion active shoppers with the things they need and love. Our technology takes an algorithmic approach to predict what user we show an ad to, when, and for what products. Our dataset is about 50 petabytes in Hadoop (more than 120 TB extra per day) and we take less than 10ms to respond to an ad request. This is truly big data and machine learning without the buzzwords. If scale and complexity excite you, join us.

Most of all, we are creators. From designing ground-breaking products to solving technical challenges at an exceptional scale, our tech teams work with state of the art methodologies to shape the future of our datacenters

The SRE Webscale team builds the frameworks and SDKs that keeps our 15k+ servers functioning like clockwork. Their low-latency code is critical to support business in processing over 5M QPS (300B+ HTTP requests/day)

What you will do:

You will take the lead of an engineering team in the the Web Scalability group. The team owns part of our internal SDK, providing technical services & features to our Product Engineering teams.

The main challenges ahead are:
Ownership and convergence of our dimension-based configuration solutions, powering all A/B Tests in the company.
High performance and stability of our in-house C# Kafka, Memcache & Couchbase drivers.
Re-design our distributed caching solutions on top of relational databases for increased scalability.

You will:
Manage a small number of engineers in the team (4-5).
Effectively prioritize and make calls regarding team roadmap and deliverables.
Contribute code in the team among engineers (this is a very hands-on role).
Solve problems at a scale you never experienced previously.
Work with you fellow team leads and principal engineers in the group who will be able to support you.
Who you are
Solid development engineer experience with high-level object-oriented language such as C# (preferably) & Java.
Experience or deep interest in online, real-time distributed systems.
Experience with balancing a hands-on engineering role while managing teams of 3-5 engineers.
Good communication skills both written and spoken in English.
“can do” attitude and an ability to work around problems by thinking positively and in a collaborative manner.
Previous experience in web scalability, Kafka, Distributed caches & C# is a definitely plus

For more information, please visit www.sqreen.com.

What we need your help with

As part of the Paris-based product engineering team you'll be in charge of designing and implementing one of the Sqreen agents.

Our technology protects web applications at run-time through dynamic instrumentation. Work on server modules performing dynamic instrumentation, application security protection, and run-time monitoring to protect our customers' applications.

Your challenge? Make our customers' applications as safe as possible without compromising on performance.

Day to day you'll:

> Own, build, test and release a Sqreen agent
> Design and implement key features, protocols and protections running within our customers' applications
> Use modern development methods and tools to put your code in production quickly
> Work with backend teams to enhance data flow, performance and reliability
> Produce technical blog posts and document the software you ship
> Attend conferences and meetups to share your work
> Forecast the language and runtime evolutions to ensure the Sqreen agent has a first in class support
> Follow the language ecosystem evolutions to stay close to new frameworks, popular deployment mechanisms etc.

Who you are

We'd love to hear from you if you have:

> A strong interest in leading implementation of a mission critical piece of software
> The ability to design custom protocols, services and frameworks
> Strong experience with C programming
> Experience with C++ and Python is a bonus!
> A high consideration of reliability, low-latency, redundancy, and security
> Excellent communication skills (we work in English)
> A product mindset and enjoy working with people outside your area of expertise - every engineer at Sqreen collaborates daily with Sales, Support and other teams

Sqreeners come from all corners of the globe and all walks of life. Diversity is important to us, so if you're unsure, please apply!
Why work for Sqreen

> Be part of an incredibly talented team who are passionate about democratising security
> Join at a crucial stage of our development with a huge amount of runway for you to add value
> Contribute tangibly to our core product, bringing value to our customers each and every week
> Join a product-focused company, with a deep commitment to learning
> Ask for any book you like and enjoy a week per quarter to focus on a side project of your choice
> Attend great conferences all year round
> Enjoy premium health insurance, healthy snacks every day and coached Sqreenfit sessions every fortnight
> A relaxed working environment with regular social activities
> Beautiful 'Sqreenhouses' in central Paris (Sentier), and San Francisco (SoMa)
> An international, English speaking work environment with the opportunity to visit SF

Sqreen participates actively in the tech and security ecosystem in Paris and San Francisco so you'll have access to some of the most interesting and talented people from our network and beyond!

Apprenticeship - Configurable tool development
GE Renewable Energy56 avis - Massy (91)
date_publication:

description:
Role Summary:
Development of a configurable tool for the implementation of validation rules using existing APIs

Le/La titulaire de ce poste est chargé(e) du développement d'un outil configurable pour la mise en œuvre de règles de validation à l'aide des API existants.
Essential Responsibilities:
Within GE Renewable Energy, the Application Engineering team is in charge of delivering advanced software solutions for Energy Management in Transmission, Distribution and Market areas.

CIMNet is the Network analysis and validation module. It provides a collection of high-performance functionalities necessary to ensure fast and efficient Network Model verification in terms of consistency and network security, leveraging almost 40 years of experience in efficient and reliable network analysis algorithms by GE. CIMNet has been designed as a flexible multipurpose application. Its fast and high-quality CIM-based Network analysis modules can be used to quickly validate the Master models imported and/or modified in Source, as they can be used independently to load, merge and run Power Systems calculations from CGMES files. It is therefore the perfect solution to cover all model validation, Model merge and advanced network analysis business requirements of TSOs and RSCs

CIMNET was certified for full support of CGMES models including detailed HVDC data processing using the first version of ENTSOE conformity rules and these conformity rules are changing and expanding all over the years.

The purpose of this apprenticeship is to extend existing validation rules implemented in CIMNet with a complementary tool providing further possibilities to implement new rules from ENTSOE with high degree of configurability using CIMNet APIs.



The intern will be required to:
Understand the APIs or extension points available in CIMNET,
Understand the existing validation rules from ENTSOE with a support of Power Systems engineers from the team.
Design and develop this new configurable tool for the implementation of validation rules.
Provide all required documentations: detail User Guide, validation test book and online help.


Duration of the apprenticeship : 1-2 years

Principales responsabilités :

Au sein de GE Renewable Energy, l'équipe Ingénierie d'applications est chargée de développer des solutions logicielles avancées dédiées à la gestion de l'énergie dans les domaines de la transmission, de la distribution et du marché de réseaux électriques.



CIMNet est le module utilisé pour l'analyse et la validation de réseau. Il offre un ensemble de fonctionnalités ultra-performantes qui garantissent une vérification rapide et efficace du modèle de réseau en matière de cohérence et de sécurité, et qui s'appuient sur l'expérience de GE qui développe depuis 40 ans des algorithmes d'analyse de réseau à la fois fiables et efficaces. CIMNet a été conçu comme une application polyvalente et flexible. Ses modules d'analyse de réseau basés sur CIM sont rapides et de haute qualité, et peuvent être utilisés pour valider en un clin d'œil les modèles originaux importés et/ou modifiés dans Source. Ils peuvent également être utilisés indépendamment pour charger, combiner et exécuter les calculs Power Systems à partir de fichiers CGMES. Il s'agit donc de la solution parfaite pour couvrir toutes les exigences en matière de validation de modèle, de combinaison de modèles et d'analyse de réseau avancée des TSO et RSC



Le module CIMNET a été certifié pour la prise en charge des modèles CGMES, y compris pour le traitement des données HVDC détaillées, à l'aide de la première version des règles de conformité ENTSOE, règles de conformité qui évoluent et s'étoffent au fil des années.


L'objectif de cet apprentissage est d'étendre les règles de validation existantes et mises en œuvre au niveau du module CIMNet en créant un outil complémentaire offrant davantage de possibilités d'implémenter de nouvelles règles à partir des règles ENTSOE, avec de nombreuses options de configuration et en utilisant les API CIMNet.

Qualifications/Requirements:
Software development engineering studies – PhD or Master degree.
Good understanding of standard data sharing tools XML, RDFS
Good understanding of UML with at least a strong contribution in one project.
Strong programming skills in C++, Java and Python

Études d'ingénierie en développement logiciel – Doctorat ou BAC+4
Bonne compréhension des outils de partage de données standard (XML, RDFS)
Bonne compréhension d'UML avec au moins une contribution concrète au cours d'un projet
Solides compétences de programmation sous C++, Java et Python



Principales responsabilités :

L’apprenti(e) assumera les responsabilités suivantes :
Comprendre les API ou les points d'extension du module CIMNET
Comprendre les règles de validation ENTSOE existantes avec l'aide des ingénieurs Power Systems de l'équipe
Concevoir et développer ce nouvel outil configurable pour la mise en œuvre de règles de validation
Fournir toute la documentation requise, y compris le guide de l'utilisateur, le livret des essais de validation et l'aide en ligne


Durée du contrat d'apprentissage : 1 à 2 ans

About Us:
GE (NYSE:GE) drives the world forward by tackling its biggest challenges. By combining world-class engineering with software and analytics, GE helps the world work more efficiently, reliably, and safely. GE people are global, diverse and dedicated, operating with the highest integrity and passion to fulfill GE’s mission and deliver for our customers. www.ge.com
Additional Locations:
France;Massy;

Who are we?

PayFit simplifies payroll management and HR processes for SMBs. We have built a fast, intuitive and automated SaaS solution to help business owners and HR professionals save time and money allowing them to refocus and what really matters: their employees. Through PayFit, employees have a dedicated access for their payslips and are able to manage efficiently their leave and expense requests. To build such a solution, we have created our own programming language: JetLang. Thanks to JetLang we were able to code Labour Code and collective agreements, and today we continue to add new features.

We have set ourselves a mission to support the digital transformation of HR management through our ever growing range of product features and services. We have a strong presence in France since 2015 and have been quickly growing in Germany, Spain and the UK. More than 3000 companies such as Big Mamma, MinuteBuzz or Sellsy to name a few already trust us. Over 300 PayFiters have already joined the adventure and we have raised 95M€ to keep growing.

Your role: design and build tech solutions to increase our clients satisfaction and address the growth of our client base

Do you believe customer experience should be fluid, transparent and powerful? Do you want to be technically challenged while juggling multiple projects working with various teams? Are you eager to build and develop your own team?

The PayFit Customer Success team (> 50 people in 4 countries) is looking for a Lead Engineer to make sure our clients have the best experience with PayFit in every part of their journey. The rapid growth of our client base means we need to continuously integrate and enhance tools and technologies to ensure client satisfaction and customer experience are at their highest.

You will work on multiple projects within the Global Customer Success team and will collaborate with Engineering, Product and Design teams. You will help us build personalized services, more targeted support services, deliver content in a fluid and efficient manner and will ultimately affect the way users interact with PayFit.

designing and building web solutions solving pressing customer needs
building a uniform user interface for our self-service platforms

From day one, you will be working with experienced engineers and designers who love what they do. You will drive your own development with guidance and coaching from your manager and team, not to mention the excellent long-term development prospects you would expect from AWS.

When leading companies choose Google Cloud it's a huge win for spreading the power of cloud computing globally. Once educational institutions, government agencies, and other businesses sign on to use Google Cloud products, you come in to facilitate making their work more productive, mobile, and collaborative. Guide customers through assessments of their existing legacy application environment(s). Provide recommendations on a prioritization roadmap for application modernization. Identify candidate applications for migration to hybrid-cloud computing models.
Structure and execute prototyping workshops to prove out proposed new architectures, developing best practices, and documenting key blocking requirements for prioritization with engineering.

description:
Who we are
At Criteo, we connect 1.5 billion active shoppers with the things they need and love. Our technology takes an algorithmic approach to predict what user we show an ad to, when, and for what products. Our dataset is about 50 petabytes in Hadoop (more than 120 TB extra per day) and we take less than 10ms to respond to an ad request. This is truly big data and machine learning without the buzzwords. If scale and complexity excite you, join us.

Most of all, we are creators. From designing ground-breaking products to solving technical challenges at an exceptional scale, our tech teams work with state of the art methodologies to shape the future of our datacenters

The SRE Webscale team builds the frameworks and SDKs that keeps our 15k+ servers functioning like clockwork. Their low-latency code is critical to support business in processing over 5M QPS (300B+ HTTP requests/day)

What you will do:


The main challenges ahead are:
Ownership and convergence of our dimension-based configuration solutions, powering all A/B Tests in the company.
High performance and stability of our in-house C# Kafka, Memcache & Couchbase drivers.
Re-design our distributed caching solutions on top of relational databases for increased scalability.

You will:
Manage a small number of engineers in the team (4-5).
Effectively prioritize and make calls regarding team roadmap and deliverables.
Contribute code in the team among engineers (this is a very hands-on role).
Solve problems at a scale you never experienced previously.
Work with you fellow team leads and principal engineers in the group who will be able to support you.
Who you are
Solid development engineer experience with high-level object-oriented language such as C# (preferably) & Java.
Experience or deep interest in online, real-time distributed systems.
Experience with balancing a hands-on engineering role while managing teams of 3-5 engineers.
Good communication skills both written and spoken in English.
“can do” attitude and an ability to work around problems by thinking positively and in a collaborative manner.
Previous experience in web scalability, Kafka, Distributed caches & C# is a definitely plus
At Criteo, we dare to be different. We believe that diversity fuels innovation and creates an energy that can be seen and felt all over Criteo. We champion different perspectives and are committed to creating a workplace where all Criteos are heard, feel a sense of belonging, and are treated with respect and dignity.

description:
Streamroot: Building the video delivery of tomorrow
At Streamroot, we're working to overcome one of the biggest challenges facing the internet today: the explosion of video traffic.
Our goal is to redesign the way we deliver video online, create more robust, cost-effective infrastructures, and bring high-quality video to every corner of the world.
With a hybrid peer-to-peer video streaming solution, Streamroot helps online broadcasters improve quality of service, scale to growing audiences and cut bandwidth costs by up to 70%.
As market leaders in both Europe and the US, Streamroot powers over 500 million video sessions every month. Our growing customer base includes premier media groups such as Canal+, Dailymotion, TF1, Eurosport, and Russia Today.
Founded in 2013 by three engineers from Ecole Centrale Paris, Streamroot is backed by renowned VC firms and now has offices in New York, Paris and Denver with its 30 talented employees hailing from 13 countries.
As a Product Manager intern, you will have the opportunity to work with all of Streamroot's teams: You will help our development team to define and build the best product on the market, our sales team to sell it, our marketing team to understand its value and our QA team to test it.
Your responsibilities will range from interviewing customers, evaluating competitors products, creating feature specifications and mockups, organising internal product events, writing convincing product-marketing material on our best features and sharing our successes with the team and the outside world.

Key Responsibilities:
Establishing product requirements by interviewing customers and teams and understanding their needs.

Collaborate with regional and global marketing stakeholders to gain input into the program strategy, campaign approach, creative direction and impact measurement (goals/performance).

5+ years of experience in marketing communications, field marketing, ABM or campaigns, preferably in a B2B2C environment

description:
Are you an expert designer obsessed with solving complex UX problems and creating intuitive, unified experiences? Are you passionate about how the user-centred design can humanize technology, address usability puzzles, achieve business goals, and help to bring to market innovative digital products that delight customers? Join Dashlane as a Senior Product Designer and take part in a mission to create intuitive and usable software with global impact.

Dashlane is a top-rated password manager and online security app, created for everyone who lives, works, and plays on the internet. With a simple, intuitive design and patented security technology, Dashlane keeps passwords, personal data, and payment info at users' fingertips, so they can stop guessing passwords and wasting time filling out forms. Dashlane has helped over 11 million users in 180 countries manage and secure their digital identities and has enabled over $17 billion in e-commerce transactions. Our teams in New York, Paris, and Lisbon are united by our passion for password security — and the belief that our success is built on the diverse backgrounds of every member.

As a Senior Product Designer you will be a key member of an international team committed to building the best online identity and security app — and be part of the culture in which design and user experience is the cornerstone of everything we do. You will work alongside a broad mix of stakeholders including product managers, engineers, marketers, copywriters, user researchers and fellow designers in a creative, highly collaborative environment. You will influence the direction our apps are taking in look and feel and in user experience, and champion the user perspective at every step. At Dashlane you will be relied upon to create exemplary prototypes, interfaces and experiences, whilst balancing user needs, constraints of technology, company brand values and KPIs. As we continue to push the boundaries of modern UX, we will be looking to you to integrate motion and interaction design into your usability solutions.

You will be based in Paris, France.

--------------------
At Dashlane you will
--------------------

Work on something important and meaningful. Our Desktop, Mobile and Web applications are already enhancing the web experience of millions of people worldwide, and are essential to making their online lives more secure.
Create cutting-edge user experience that takes our apps to the next level, and always strive to push them further.
Design and iterate layouts and assets that reflect the brand and enforce messaging.
Produce top-notch work that injects usability and beauty into the product and delight into the user experience.
Create and own high-quality UI and design, from concept to execution;
Work to briefs that may require shifting priorities. You will be expected to balance business needs and constraints of technology and will challenge the brief in order to drive innovation with the aim of improving user experience and usability of the product.
Own not only the features you design, but actively contribute to all sides of the Dashlane application, and participate in setting the design direction for the Product.
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends in UX design and influence our understanding of the Mac, Windows, web, iOS and Android environments, their unique differentiators and quirks.
Work closely with developers, Product Managers, and Copywriters on a daily basis to aid implementation of the designed interface and to ensure the UX success. The team will depend on your keen eye for details.
Work with our Analytics and User Testing teams to validate assumptions, test design solutions and fine-tune the messaging.
Be the team expert on all things pertaining to motion and animation in UX. Create exemplary prototypes, propose enhancements and be obsessed with fine-tuning the smallest of interactions.
Participate in UX workshops and lead Design Sprints in solving problems and building the best experience.
-------------------------
Minimum requirements
-------------------------

You are an expert in InVision, and Sketch or Adobe suite.
A relevant degree (BA or equivalent, or higher).
Experience with wireframes, storyboards, user flows, Personas and other UX methodologies such as Card Sorting, Eye Movement Tracking, various types of Usability Testing.
5 or more years working in app development environment.
Working experience within Agile cycles and ceremonies.
A track record of delivering UX solutions in more than one digital platform.
A portfolio in addition to resume. (Submissions without a portfolio will not be considered).
-------------------
The ideal candidate
-------------------

You have a practical grasp of animation and understand the importance of interaction design in the user experience.
A solid understanding of the interplay between typography, colour, and motion, and their roles in visual communication.
Motion graphics is your strongest side: you have proficiency and passion for motion, and have specific expertise in After Effects and equivalent software.
The ability to translate complex ideas into a simple language. Your fluency in English will be essential both when communicating in writing and verbally.
You are comfortable in putting the team first and sharing ownership in the company's success.
You are a self-starter and can manage your own time, juggling many projects with changing priorities, with the ability to work under pressure and tight deadlines.
You have a passion for consumer apps and follow new developments in the world of software development.
You have the illustration / digital art skills.
---------------------
Diversity at Dashlane
---------------------

A true international company, founded in Paris and currently split between Paris, New York, and Lisbon, we thrive off diverse perspectives. We recognize that diversity has different aspects: gender, sexual orientation, ability, ethnic origin, social background, age, lifestyle, and more. We're committed to hiring people that create a diverse community and foster a culture where everyone is heard and feels a sense of belonging.

description:
Non-Destructive Testing Engineer (M/F)

Company Summary

TechnipFMC is a global oil and gas leader, specialized in subsea, onshore, offshore, and surface technologies. Our mission: to enhance the performance of world’s energy industry. How we do it: by constantly challenging conventions and investing in our 37 000+ employees, across 48 countries. At TechnipFMC, we aim to offer an inspiring working experience: tackling some of the most complex technical and engineering challenges in the world in collaboration with a truly global team.

Introduction to the Job

At TechnipFMC, we deliver critical projects of a scale, scope and difficulty that you simply won’t find anywhere else. We are looking for a Non-Destructive Testing Engineer (M/F) who can join our multicultural team in Paris

Job description
Under the responsibility of the Manager Pipeline Production Technologies, you will be in charge of the management of the NDT platform, associated experimental means and development programs. the engineer will also participate to the industrialization of the developed solutions in collaboration with the selected inspection services company.
and will provide operational support to TechnipFMC regions for the deployment and project qualification of developed technologies and solutions.
The missions of the NDT Engineer will cover all aspects of the NDT technologies development from R&D, experimental validation, participation to the industrialization of developed technologies and provide the support to operations for deployment of developed solutions.
The position is highly practical, as a large part of the activity is hands-on inspection (feasibility studies, development of setups, & procedures improvement on challenging applications such as CRA & duplex, robustness evaluation, validation).
The scope of the position is technical, specifically dedicated to NDT of rigid pipeline welds.
You are meant for this job if you have / are:
An engineering diploma with a “welding specialty” and a NDT experience in an industrial environment.
NDT certification (UT2 certificate according to ISO 9712) is a real plus.
Autonomous and willing to perform experimental work.
Knowledge of welding process, experience in ultrasonic modelling and simulation (CIVA software), skills in signal analysis and processing, programming
Fluent in French and English
Your future at TechnipFMC
Potential career path, if possible
Global mobility opportunities if relevant
Training and development
Diverse and international team if relevant
Learn more about TechnipFMC

Learn more about us and find other open positions at our Career Page.

Follow us on LinkedIn for company updates.

Responsible for providing onsite system diagnostic and analytical support to customers within a geographic territory supporting the install base per the terms of the SLA (Service Level Agreement) with PPT. Must have a thorough and broad knowledge of system configuration and equipment compatibility requirements and limitations across various OEM product lines. The FSE has the skillset to review machine logs internal to the device. Participate in After Hours Support Team - providing first response to incoming customer service requests after normal business hours. During normal business hours this is a function of our customer support center.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Provides onsite technical customer support:
Ensures timely, professional, and effective response to customer service needs to maintain a high level of customer satisfaction. Must be able to be scheduled for work on shifts occurring at any time of day.
Performs service in a cost effective manner.
Displays professional attitude and courtesy while on site. Maintains effective communication with customer and our customer support center during repair process and any projected delay.
Analyzes software and hardware error logs, utilizes diagnostic and troubleshooting techniques and operating system analysis to ensure timely and effective repair.
Analyzes, diagnoses, troubleshoots and repairs hardware, storage area network and systems configuration and compatibility problems.
Utilizes multiple tools for remote system connection to perform remote diagnosis, repair or configuration changes.
Follows customer specific repair procedures.
Assesses current and future customer needs based on usage of the system.

Determines needed parts and quantities based on contracts in service area
Returns bad or excess parts in a timely manner.
Manages accurate inventory count, daily and as required and performs bi-yearly physical count inventory.

Administrative:
Accurately completes and timely returns audit forms, email replies, timesheets and expense reports. Attends and participates in regularly scheduled team meetings.
* Accounts for all activities correctly using Field Point time reporting utility*

OTHER DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Other duties as assigned.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:
May serve as “senior” or mentor role to Associate Field Service Engineer (Associate FSE).

Understanding of different OEM equipment with the ability to grasp new products/concepts.

Proven ability to work independently, while exhibiting leadership and collaboration, when working with others.

Certifications or Licenses Not required, but A+ Certification and other OEM computer hardware certifications from major vendors such as Dell, IBM, HP, etc. are helpful.

Reasoning Ability: Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situation where only limited standardization exists. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form.

Ability to clearly and concisely articulate technical information in layman’s terms. Strong decision making and problem solving / troubleshooting skills. Excellent ability to manage stress and work with customers in stressful situations.
TRAVEL REQUIRED:

description:
The Paris-Saclay CDS 2 has opened a data engineering position to reinforce the data science ecosystem and to build and support a data science platform. The data engineer will work on (in order of priority):
Software engineering. The objective to enable researchers to do better science thanks to better software tools. It means bringing state of the art data science research software into high quality toolboxes (as scikit-learn). Getting involved with open source development. Assisting data scientists (students, postdoctoral fellows, permanent researchers) to develop their software engineering skills and to get them involved with open source development.
Platform support. The CDS has developed tools to foster data-driven collaborative work between scientists and engineers across disciplines. The RAMP platform is web based service developed with this objective. The candidate should be able to contribute to its development and maintenance (technologies are Python, flask, django, docker, scikit-learn, HTML, Javascript, cloud tech such as Amazon Web Services).
Training. Accompany domain scientists in their data analysis efforts. Accompany data scientists in their methodological research. Designing training sprints and practical material for the courses (cf. based on software carpentry)
Team
The data engineer will work with scikit-learn core developers such as Gaël Varoquaux, Olivier Grisel, Loic Estève, Alexandre Gramfort and others. Possible collaboration with data and domain science researchers such as Balazs Kegl, Isabelle Guyon, Sarah Cohen-Boulakia, Karine Zeitouni, David Rousseau, and others.
Qualifications
M.S. / Ph.D. in Computer Science, Statistical Machine Learning
Good understanding of the data science workflow. Experience with data challenges is a plus.
Strong programming experience with one or more data science languages (Python, R, Matlab)
Experience with open source development .
The applicant should send a CV, a statement of purpose, and up to three letters of recommendations to cdsupsay@gmail.com.
Position is open now and will be open until it is filled.

Duration: 18 months

Reporter l'activité auprès du Chef de projet
Participer à la maintenance corrective et évolutive des outils de reporting
Quel profil ?
Titulaire d’un Bac +5 ou équivalent, vous avez au moins 5 ans d’expérience sur un poste similaire. Idéalement, vous êtes familier avec les produits assurantiels (prévoyance, santé, IARD…). Vous êtes reconnu auprès de vos collègues pour votre bonne humeur et votre diplomatie légendaire ? Postulez dès maintenant !
Pourquoi ? Nous vous accompagnerons sur votre montée en compétences. Vous interviendrez sur des missions évolutives (méthodologies, complexité…) de 2/3 ans, dans l’optique de votre projet de carrière. Ces missions vous permettront de consolider vos compétences en gestion de projet et de consolider vos connaissances en santé et prévoyance.

En 2019 et pour la 4ème année consécutive, CAPFI s’est vu décerner le Label HappyIndex®AtWork par ses collaborateurs avec une note de 4,46/5.
La valeur plaisir est essentielle au sein de notre communauté : nous pensons que l’entreprise doit être un lieu d’accomplissement de soi et de plaisir partagé.
Outre les compétences opérationnelles, l’adhésion aux valeurs intrinsèques du groupe seront primordiales dans le choix de la personne recrutée.

description:
Are you passionate about solving complex customer, business, and technology puzzles? Do you have a proven track record in delivering innovative solutions in modern consumer technologies? Do you love working with world-class, collaborative, and passionate teams? If so, then we have a career opportunity for you as a Product Manager at Dashlane.

Dashlane simplifies and secures your digital identity, helping you take control of your personal information that lives online. Available across all major platforms and devices, Dashlane automatically fills and stores passwords, personal data, and payment details to help you manage and protect - using our patented security architecture - your digital identity. We have helped over 12 million users in 180 countries manage and secure their digital identities, allowing people to live safely and seamlessly online—at home, at work, and everywhere in between. Our vision is to evolve beyond password management and become the world's most-trusted Digital Identity Provider. By offering holistic, convenient, private, and secure solutions to manage your life online, we will bring the promise of the internet to its full potential: Making the world a safer, more open, more connected place. Our team in Paris, New York and Lisbon is united by our passion to deliver this vision, and the belief our success is built on the diverse backgrounds of every team member.

As a Product Manager at Dashlane, you will play a critical role in the future direction of digital identity management. You will lead an Agile, cross-functional mission team focused on one of our key strategic initiatives: Perfect the Value Proposition. Your mission team will have complete autonomy to pursue a goal related to accelerating engaged user growth. Your team will be free to determine the inputs, and will be accountable only for the outputs and outcomes. You will work closely with engineers, product designers, researchers, and data analysts to identify opportunities and solve complex user problems using hypothesis-driven experimentation. And you will be part of an engaged and collaborative Product team that is eager to learn from and support each other. To succeed in this role, you should be a perceptive and creative leader, and a reliable problem-solver. You should be able to make tricky choices when called for and rally the team around a decision; expect a tough job you will be proud and excited to do.

You will be based in Paris, France.

At Dashlane, you will:
Contribute to our Perfect the Value Proposition product strategy
Lead a cross-functional Perfect the Value Proposition mission team to create, own, and execute impactful experiments to accelerate engaged user growth
Drive the creation of bottom-up roadmaps and metrics of success (including OKR and KPI definitions)
Collaborate with customers, user research, analytics, product marketing, and user supports to deeply understand and synthesize user needs into product priorities, roadmap plans, and detailed specifications
Act as the link between your mission team, stakeholders and executives
Split projects into relevant milestones and deliver value iteratively (from 'MVP' to full product)
Advocate for the user, raising the bar for product decisions and experiment execution
Think out-of-the-box to bypass technical limitations or complexity
Experience you'll bring:
2+ years' product management experience
Experience in agile development and product ownership of consumer apps
Bachelors degree or above
We're also looking for:
Impact focus and a consistent history of delivering measurable results for both users and businesses (experience working on user growth initiatives is a significant plus)
Experience in OKR-driven strategy, planning, and execution
Experience in product-driven data analysis (SQL knowledge is a plus)
Experience in end-to-end management of projects (from idea to operations)
Organizational and leadership abilities
Ability to plan an 'MVP' release, and break down projects into iterations towards a longer term vision
Deep knowledge on the apps ecosystem and platform guidelines
Excellent English communication skills
An ability to adapt to new and potentially unfamiliar methods or technologies
Curiosity
Ambition
Nice-to-haves:
MBA or advanced degree in Computer Science, Design, Economics, Statistics, or other technical, analytical, or creative fields
Product Management and/or Product Owner certification
Diversity at Dashlane:
----------------------

A true international company, founded in Paris and currently split between Paris, New York, and Lisbon, we thrive off diverse perspectives. We recognize that diversity has different aspects: gender, sexual orientation, ability, ethnic origin, social background, age, lifestyle, and more. We're committed to hiring people that create a diverse community and foster a culture where everyone is heard and feels a sense of belonging.

description:
Partner Sales Engineer – Strategic Partners & System Integrators
South Region

Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success.
As a Splunk Partner Sales Engineer – Strategic Partners & System Integrators you will be responsible for driving growth through your assigned partners. Working closely with the Partner sales team, sales engineering and consulting team you will ensure the technical excellence and adoption through technical account planning, evangelization and education on Splunk products and selling strategies.

Job Requirements

The Partner SE is responsible for all technical enablement of assigned partners. Understanding the partners business model and current capabilities whilst developing new strategies and services is key. The Partner SE is also responsible for the development of a Technical Account Plan, and this should be constructed in accordance to the requirements of the Splunk Partner+ program, the partner sales team and the partner needs.

2.Evangelization
The Partner SE drives excitement and interest in Splunk by evangelizing on new use-cases, services and solutions based on the Splunk platform - on-premise or in the cloud. The Partner SE will drive growth with the partner and ensure the Partner is investing in additional technical capabilities.

3.Relationship-Building
The Partner SE must manage strong working relationships with key stakeholders within Splunk and the Partner. This ensures efficient work on a given opportunity as well as having the right resources in place at the right time. Building this technical community will lead to partner engineers advocating for Splunk at their customers and help driving growth.

4.Sales support
Where a Partner needs support from Splunk the Partner SE will engage in opportunities. He will support those by training the partner through shadowing or by pairing the Partner technical lead with the appropriate Splunk Account Sales Engineer.
The Partner SE is responsible that the correct Splunk resources are known and utilized properly by the partner. The Partner SE will stay on top of all key pre-sales activities in order to ensure the Partner needs are being addressed in time.

Additional Duties and Responsibilities
Push joint offering and innovation with key partners
Support the creation of specific solutions based on Splunk applications
Serve as the technical spearhead in joint lighthouse projects and pilots
Act as the interface between Splunk engineering and partners to help drive future innovation
Develop an understanding of partner offerings and capabilities and evangelize within Splunk
Create and deliver passionate and motivating presentations, both business-focused and technical.
Support and manage knowledge transfer of Splunk technical excellence and best practice
Present our solutions at field events, such as conferences and trade shows.
Work with partners to deliver and lead Proof of Value and Proof of Concept engagements to a successful outcome.
Answer complex business and technical questions, addressing customer and partner concerns.
Work closely with pre-sales teams to continually improve operating rhythm and pre-sales processes.
Conduct workshops, enablement, and partner certification sessions.
Advocate for our partners to ensure they have a voice within the Splunk community.
Overcome sales obstacles using creative and adaptive approaches.
Communicate and deliver product messaging at all levels, from an SE-level deep dive to a C-level elevator pitch.
Ability and willingnessto travel 50%.
5+ years experience in selling Enterprise software solutions or services.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.

Business Knowledge and Experience
Domain experience in at least one of the following areas: Big Data,Machine Learning, Application Performance Management, Security & Compliance, Web Analytics, Operational Intelligence, ITOA, App/Dev Lifecycle, and Internet of Things.
A knowledgeable understanding of the business challenges, drivers, technology, and market challenges of big data/machine data in different verticals.
Previous experience working in or with Value Added Resellers, System Integrators or Service Providers.
Understanding of primary sales drivers for partners. i.e. Margin/MDF.
Ability to participate in account/business planning sessions to identify new and follow-up solution, services, and education opportunities.
Ability to develop and articulate business value

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying. For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
