As a Senior Product Designer, you will work together with our Head of Design to analyze users feedback and market trends to identify and prioritize product features and improvements, being involved in every aspect of the product design process, from brainstorming the next great product innovation to tweaking pixels right before launch. In this role, you will define and drive the future of design across our web and products and you will be expected to utilize your full range of product design, interaction design, and visual design skills.

We are looking for someone who is passionate about developing strategies based off of insights of real people and has the mastery of their craft to turn these insights into beautifully designed solutions.

What your day will look like
You will create simple and intuitive experiences by distilling product requirements and user goals into sketches, wireframes, and prototypes and continuously iterating to meet customer needs.
You will use your deep user empathy and situational awareness to craft workflows that help users glide through the challenges of using new technology.
You will partner closely with the wider design team, engineering, product, and business folks to find elegant but practical solutions to design challenges.
You will take full ownership of your work, and you take responsibility for every last detail, every step of the way.
You will rapidly produce multiple concepts and prototypes; knowing when to apply pixel-perfect attention to detail, and when to make low-fi sketches and prototypes.
You will articulate and evangelize design decisions performing user testing, analyze feedback, data and iterate!
You will care about elyps users and want to blow their mind with an app experience they would never expect from a financial services product.
Your Skills
You have 5+ years of experience designing at consumer-focused tech companies or high growth startups.
You have hands-on experience of working at least 2 years as a UX designer.
You are proficiency with design and prototyping tools such as Sketch, Photoshop, Invision, Figma Framer, or Principle.
You have hands-on experience working directly with Engineers & Product Managers.
You have shipped many mobile consumer products over the years, and understand what it takes to create awesome, consumer-oriented experiences.
You have the communication skills to help set up frameworks and brainstorm initial design concepts. You also have the ability to mentor others to deliver work and make strategy come to life.
You are constantly looking to hone your design instinct through user feedback. Whether through hands-on user research or by designing options for an A/B test.
You are resilient, reliable, and optimistic.
Compensation
Our salary range for the role is 60,000 € - 70,000 € per annum depending on experience.
Stock Options.
A lot of employee benefits coming soon.
Going beyond your everyday banking needs empowers everything we do at Elyps.

We believe in simplifying your banking experience whilst giving you the tools to manage your financial future. We are redefining how financial services are made with a multi-currency money app built on blockchain and powered by AI.

Elyps has a growing-team working behind the scene with an extensive experience in financial services and the expertise of successfully dealing with the pains of scaling high-growth tech products.

You will be working in a fast-paced environment with talented and ambitious people, all passionate in taking part of building a game-changing company that impacts positively on people’s lives. We are devoted to build a diverse work environment where our employees are motivated and proud every single day.

description:
Who are we?

PayFit simplifies payroll management and HR processes for SMBs. We have built a fast, intuitive and automated SaaS solution to help business owners and HR professionals save time and money allowing them to refocus and what really matters: their employees. Through PayFit, employees have a dedicated access for their payslips and are able to manage efficiently their leave and expense requests. To build such a solution, we have created our own programming language: JetLang. Thanks to JetLang we were able to code Labour Code and collective agreements, and today we continue to add new features.

We have set ourselves a mission to support the digital transformation of HR management through our ever growing range of product features and services. We have a strong presence in France since 2015 and have been quickly growing in Germany, Spain and the UK. More than 3000 companies such as Big Mamma, MinuteBuzz or Sellsy to name a few already trust us. Over 300 PayFiters have already joined the adventure and we have raised 95M€ to keep growing.

Your missions

The Tech team already counts more than 40 talented software engineers and is growing at a very fast pace. We are looking for an experimented Site Reliabilty Engineer to help us design and implement the future of PayFit's infrastructure.

Your missions will include:
designing, improving and maintaining an automated, scalable and resilient infrastructure,
making interacting with infrastructure as easy and as automated as possible for all developers,
leveraging monitoring, logging and tracing tools to detect and fix issues before they impact our clients,
write some of the most performance critical blocks of our backend infrastructure (proxies, file encryption backends, compute intensive data pipelines...).

This job has been tailored for you if...

you are solution-oriented,
you love designing resilient and horizontally scalable distributed systems,
you are pro-actively automating yourself out of routine tasks
you have strong experience with Docker and/or Kubernetes in production,
you have strong backend design & programming skills,
experience with Infrastructure as code tools (Terraform, Chef/Puppet/Ansible/Salt, Helm...),
experience with systems monitoring (logging, metric reporting, tracing and, of course, alerting),
experience with distributed database management (MongoDB...),
experience with message oriented systems (Kafka/NSQ/Nats).

The technologies we use in the SRE team:
Infrastructure management: the AWS Cloud, Terraform, Kubernetes and Helm
CVS and CI/CD: Git, Github, CircleCI, Argo Workflows
Languages: Golang, NodeJS, TypeScript
Monitoring: Prometheus, Fluent-bit & Kibana, Jaeger, Sentry, PagerDuty
Message broker: NSQ, Pusher
Databases: MongoDB (sharded), Postgres, Elasticsearch

Of course, bringing other technologies (and/or SaaS software) into our stack will be part of your daily job at PayFit

We are meant to work together if...

you are a real team player who want to build a big success story with us,
you speak both french and english fluently and you want to work in an international and dynamic environment,
you have a strong interpersonal and communication skills,
you want to learn, improve and gain responsibility.

What we offer ❤️

an amazing working environment, designed for kindness and blossoming,
an attractive remuneration package,
an international and dynamic team with the opportunity to visit our different offices (Paris, Berlin, Barcelona, London),
remote friendly policy,
a gym inside the office and Gymlib subscription with preferential rate,
regular team and global events,
restaurant tickets,
4 weeks of paternity leave (fully covered) and 20 weeks of maternity leave (fully covered),
Alan insurance (60% covered by PayFit),
great coffee, fruits, snacks, foosball, MPG Teams or even team yoga classes,
MacBooks are our standard, but we'll provide whatever equipment you need to help you get your job done!

1️⃣ Initial call with the hiring manager
2️⃣ Technical call
3️⃣ On-site meetings with the direct team
4️⃣ BBQ test to share a drink with the entire PayFit team (no sausage, no test )

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b0uqNUw2JIk

Logistics Coordinator- Data Center
Amazon Data Services France SA38,548 avis - Paris (75)
date_publication:

description:
You must be be at least 18 years old
High School diploma or equivalent
Being able to work overtime as required
Being able to read and take direction in English
You must be able to lift loads of up to 20 kilos and carry them for short distances
You might participate in group lifts of 20 kilos or more
You should be able to push or pull heavy objects into position
Work in a noisy environment
Due to the nature of the role a valid driver's license and access to a vehicle is required

Job Description – Logistics Coordinator

Be a part of operating the world’s largest cloud computing infrastructure. Amazon Web Services is seeking bright, motivated, hardworking individuals to fill Data center Logistics Coordinator position. The ideal candidate possesses a strong work ethic, attention to detail, the ability to meet deadlines, and a commitment to Operational Excellence.

The Logistics Coordinator reviews data center inventory, in-bound shipments, and ongoing demand to ensure that proper stock levels are maintained in the all locations to support build and repair activities. Working with the Logistics Manager, they create plans to optimize the flow of parts through their lifecycle; tracking inventory location, movement, age, and turns. They work closely with Data center Operations Technicians and Data center Engineers to fulfill parts quickly and accurately. They work with Procurement and Hardware Engineering to purchase new parts and interface directly with vendors to process RMAs and receive replacements. They are responsible for accurate data entry and resolving questions from peer organizations.

Responsibilities can include manual tasks, such as assembling, addressing, stamping and arranging for the shipment of merchandise and materials. They may also assist in daily scheduling of deliveries and pick-ups to and from production locations. In handling incoming shipments, he or she may have to unpack boxes and verify contents. The Logistic Coordinator will be required to keep precise records of all commodities going in and out of company. This role will require shift work if determined.

The ideal Logistics Coordinator will dive deep into data to understand everything about the data center asset lifecycle. Working with software development teams, they will contribute to continuous process improvements to deliver on our goals of high availability and low cost. They maintain up-to-date metrics dashboards and will create reports for internal and external suppliers and management as required.

Logistics Coordinators are expected to understand all aspects of production, adhere to strict safety standards, maintain very high quality, and be willing and able to work on powered equipment (i.e forklift or cherry picker).

Please send you CV in English.

Preferred Qualifications:
Proficient with computers and Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel)
Strong understanding of shipping & receiving, inventory and warehousing practices.
Knowledge of IT Industry Logistics would be an advantage.
Experience using metrics to perform analyses
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Familiarity with producing process documentation
Punctuality; excellent organizational skills for orderliness; and ability to focus on multiple tasks simultaneously to ensure department objectives are met
Demonstrated positive work attitude & leadership skills
Demonstrated ability to perform above minimum for extended periods of time
Commitment to a culture of safety

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build.

Description
Nutanix is looking for a Territory Account Manager for the Education & Research Sector. As a Territory Account Manager, you are responsible for selling Nutanix’s Products and Solutions through Channel Partners and interacting directly with Education and Research customers in France. You will also be working closely with a Sales Engineer in the territory.

Essential to success in this role is a keen ability develop new accounts and to penetrate new divisions and organizations within your assigned accounts. Nutanix provides unrivaled support and tools from the Engineering, Marketing, and Product Development departments for you to leverage to exceed sales performance goals. In this position you would be working very closely the co-founders and VPs and have a large amount of influence on sales team decisions and initiatives.
Responsibilities
Use relationship management techniques to develop selling opportunities within partner organizations; penetrate new divisions and organizations within assigned partner account; develop new selling relationships within assigned partner account; develop new direct selling opportunities.
Schedule and attend sales call appointments with a prospect in partner organization. Nutanix Channel Partner Representatives may also participate in the sales call to help qualify the opportunity.
Utilizing a consultative approach, discuss business issues with prospect and develop a formal quote, a written sales proposal or a formal sales presentation addressing their business needs.
Respond to RFP's and follow up with prospects.
Develop an account plan to sell to customers based on their business needs.
Build and strengthen the business relationship with current accounts and new prospects.
Recommend marketing strategies.
Provide status information to your Manager including forecast/pipeline information.
Provide, or facilitate training opportunities for your accounts.
Identify Nutanix customer references that can be utilized when reference selling.
Provide product feedback back to engineering to improve Nutanix complete block solutions
Requirements
Strong verbal and written communications skills including presentation skills
Ability to work collaboratively with employees within the sales function and across functions including Marketing, Sales Operations, System Engineering, and Product Development
Experience with target account selling, solution selling, and/or consultative sales techniques
An aptitude for understanding how technology products and solutions solve business problems as well as the competitive landscape
Ability to communicate with senior managers about their business challenges and Nutanix data management storage solutions
Experience using SFDC and other CRM software
Track record of exceeding assigned sales quotas in contiguous, multiple years
Qualifications and Experience
3 to 10 years of sales experience preferred
Experience that demonstrates a strong level of expertise in technical specifications required to sell Nutanix products and services is required
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience
Bilingual language skills in French and English required

Have you got a passion for engineering? Come and join the French Insurtech leader to change the insurance world with A.I.!

As a member of Shift Technology’s engineering productivity team, part of the greater dev team, your mission will be to build software, infrastructure and tools to help the dev team deliver excellent products quickly and reliably.

Your day-to-day will include:

Designing technical solutions to challenges faced by developers in the course of their work, whether they are related to the development environment, code analysis, testing frameworks, or build system.
Continuously improving our build, test and release pipeline, focusing on its quality, traceability and reproducibility.
- Defining and driving adoption of best practices and processes around code quality and maintainability-
Influencing, and contributing to our systems design and code in a way that can drive improvements in our release process or in testability.
Ensuring the necessary information flows between all the teams involved in our development and release process through automated means.

Your toolkit
We work with modern technologies and always encourage our team to explore what’s new in the market. Our main tools today are:

C# in the backend, written with Visual Studio and Resharper
React (es6) and Less in the frontend, written with Visual Studio Code, and packaged with Webpack
SQL Server and Elasticsearch in the data layer
A continuous delivery pipeline that uses Git, Nunit, Teamcity and Octopus Deploy

Your profile
You are a software engineer, with a degree in computer science and/or relevant experience in such a role.
You love developing tools that help your fellow developers
You believe that automation and monitoring are key to having a fast and reliable, software release process, and you are looking to share this culture with your teammates.
You have excellent coding/scripting skills: whatever your tool of choice, your projects are beautifully designed and cleanly implemented
You show leadership by being proactive and taking ownership of your work
You want your work to have an impact: rather than a cog, you see yourself as the engine
You are comfortable dealing with the pressure of delivering an excellent service to our customers
You can communicate clearly in English. French is a bonus, but not necessary.

Full-time role, to start asap in Paris 12th (Cour St Emilion)
Attractive compensation (depending on profile, experience and expertise)
To apply, click below and let us know why we could be a great fit!
Recognized by Wired as one of Paris’ hottest startups and proud member of the Next40, here at Shift Technology we are using advanced artificial intelligence and data science to help revolutionize insurance from the inside out. We started with fraud, where we've built a fast-growing business that is scaling globally; and now we're helping insurance companies to automate claims, all the way from the user experience to the payment processing.

description:
Who are we?

PayFit simplifies payroll management and HR processes for SMBs. We have built a fast, intuitive and automated SaaS solution to help business owners and HR professionals save time and money allowing them to refocus and what really matters: their employees. Through PayFit, employees have a dedicated access for their payslips and are able to manage efficiently their leave and expense requests. To build such a solution, we have created our own programming language: JetLang. Thanks to JetLang we were able to code Labour Code and collective agreements, and today we continue to add new features.

We have set ourselves a mission to support the digital transformation of HR management through our ever growing range of product features and services. We have a strong presence in France since 2015 and have been quickly growing in Germany, Spain and the UK. More than 3000 companies such as Big Mamma, MinuteBuzz or Sellsy to name a few already trust us. Over 300 PayFiters have already joined the adventure and we have raised 95M€ to keep growing.

Your missions

The Tech team already counts 40 passionate people who develop our app and collaborate with the Product Team to be (very) fast. Divided into five teams to better address our diverse technical challenges.

The Payroll team is in charge of our business language, Jetlang, developed internally. The language is used by product teams in different countries to create all rules and manage payroll computations. We are always adding new features and improving its performance with new technologies such as WebAssemby. The Payroll team is in charge of a smart NodeJS API which distribute data to our front-ends. We also build & maintain our JetLang IDE.

Your mission will include:
build, lead, and manage a fullstack engineering team; to deliver, support, and maintain our Payroll Product,
lead by example, write (and review) code, raise the bar with innovative thinking,
help constantly improve our software engineering practices, processes, and tools,
build a positive team culture where you're supporting colleagues and empowering them to grow as technical leaders and people,
raise awareness of our engineering team within the tech community; through meet-ups, conferences, papers etc...

This job has been tailored for you if...

you are "problem-solving" oriented, technical challenges motivate you,
you have experience line managing a group of software engineers,
you have excellent communication skills with both technical and non-technical people,
you have knowledge and experience of software engineering and best practices,
you have xperience improving and maintaining employee performance,
you feel passionated about developing your direct reports to ensure they succeed,
you have strong development experience, ideally with Javascript.

We are meant to work together if...

you are a real team player who want to build a big success story with us,
you speak both french and english fluently and you want to work in an international and dynamic environment,
you have a strong interpersonal and communication skills,
you want to learn, improve and gain responsibility.

What we offer ❤️

an amazing working environment, designed for kindness and blossoming,
an attractive remuneration package,
an international and dynamic team with the opportunity to visit our different offices (Paris, Berlin, Barcelona, London),
remote friendly policy,
a gym inside the office and Gymlib subscription with preferential rate,
regular team and global events,
restaurant tickets,
4 weeks of paternity leave (fully covered) and 20 weeks of maternity leave (fully covered),
Alan insurance (60% covered by PayFit),
great coffee, fruits, snacks, foosball, MPG Teams or even team yoga classes,
MacBooks are our standard, but we'll provide whatever equipment you need to help you get your job done!
Hiring process ️

1️⃣ Initial call with the hiring manager
2️⃣ Technical call
3️⃣ On-site meetings with the direct team
4️⃣ BBQ test to share a drink with the entire PayFit team (no sausage, no test )

Want to know more about our epic team?

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b0uqNUw2JIk
We are looking for passionate and innovative people who want to build the next big success story with us! Do you describe yourself with these words? Do you want to join an incredible adventure?
Tell us who you are, what you’ve done and what you want to do. We’ll be more than happy to meet you :)

description:
POSTE

Dans le cadre de la transition de DataHub – son logiciel de Data Management – dans le Cloud, NeoXam recherche un Développeur Java (H/F). L’équipe de développement du produit DataHub est basée à Paris et Tunis, et composée d’une cinquantaine de personnes.

MISSIONS

Au sein de cette équipe, vos principales missions seront les suivantes :

Vous travaillerez sur un système d’architecture distribuée dans des environnements gérants de fortes volumétries de données
Vous participerez à la conception et à l’analyse des solutions, en appliquant les méthodologies de conduite de projet, sous assurance qualité
Vous prenez en charge, en grande autonomie, des projets de conception et développement et êtes force de proposition sur l’architecture technique et fonctionnelle des solutions
Vous travaillerez sur la maintenance corrective de l’application (reproduction d’anomalies et proposition de corrections)
Vous interviendrez sur des sujets à la fois très techniques (large panel de technologies issues du monde java) mais aussi très fonctionnels

NOUS PROPOSONS

Un poste en CDI
Des bureaux agréables dans le quartier central de Bourse/Grands Boulevards à Paris 2e
Une ambiance de travail agréable où l'esprit d'équipe est clé
Un package compétitif composé de : fixe, bonus individuel, participation & intéressement, tickets restaurant, mutuelle & prévoyance, RTT, congés d’ancienneté
Et bien plus…

PROFIL

Vous avez un diplôme d’Ecole d'ingénieur, BAC + 5 ou équivalent
Vous avez travaillé au moins 1 an en développement Java
Vous avez fait du développement orienté objet
Vous avez travaillé sur des optimisations logicielles : Tuning applicatif, Profiling et monitoring
Vous avez des connaissances en APIs XML, Webservices (SOAP / REST), Web Application servers (Tomcat / JBoss / Webphere), Messaging, IHM SWING ou SWT, OS (Unix et Windows), SGBD (Oracle, Sybase ou SqlServer)
Vous avez une bonne connaissance des outils classiques de développement (Eclipse…) et de la méthodologie Scrum / Agile
Vous avez une bonne maîtrise de l’anglais (écrit et oral)

C’est encore mieux si :

Vous connaissez ou avez un intérêt pour la finance de marché (sociétés de gestion, banques d'investissement, valorisateurs, dépositaires, etc.)
Vous savez analyser, concevoir, développer des logiciels ayant des contraintes de fonctionnement fortes (robustesse, performances etc…)

Chez NeoXam, nous aimons les personnes curieuses, impliquées et autonomes, qui aiment proposer de nouvelles solutions et pour lesquelles il est essentiel de continuer à apprendre et à se développer au quotidien.

Le poste nécessite une grande rigueur et ténacité, une capacité à communiquer et promouvoir les bonnes pratiques.

NeoXam est Handi-capable ! Tous nos postes sont ouverts aux personnes en situation de handicap.

meta1:
Field Service Engineer
Harmonic Inc. - Paris (75)
date_publication:
il y a 4 mois
- Continuer pour postuler
description:
Harmonic recruits its new Field Service Engineer!

Harmonic (NASDAQ: HLIT), the worldwide leader in video delivery technology and services, enables media companies and service providers to deliver ultra-high-quality broadcast and OTT video services to consumers globally.
The company has also revolutionized cable access networking via the industry’s first virtualized CCAP solution, enabling cable operators to more flexibly deploy gigabit internet service to consumers’ homes and mobile devices. Whether simplifying OTT video delivery via innovative cloud and software-as-a-service (SaaS) technologies, or powering the delivery of gigabit internet cable services, Harmonic is changing the way media companies and service providers monetize live and VOD content on every screen.

More information is available at www.harmonicinc.com.

The company has 1,300 employees worldwide with 300 employees in France dispersed throughout three locations (Rennes, Brest and Issy-les-Moulineaux).
We offer a flexible and fulfilling work environment with the ability to help our employees learn, grow and evolve throughout their career.

Key Responsibilities:
A Field Service Engineer (FSE) performs installation, integration, configuration, commissioning, test, training, tuning, troubleshooting, and break/fix activities for Harmonic’s XOS appliances and VOS Cloud based digital media Distribution and Playout solutions for EMEA Region. The regional Field Service Engineers (FSE) are primary resources for on-site Customer support in and troubleshooting.
Duties include, but are not limited to:
Delivering technical support to Harmonic Customers in the region, both on-site and remotely.
Provision of system commissioning and Customer acceptance testing.
Provide on-site and remote support for Harmonic hardware and software applications with the capability to be On Call 24/7.
Resolving equipment performance issues within Harmonic equipment and in conjunction with Application Partners, utilizing Harmonic’s technical issue logging/escalation systems as appropriate.
Provision of technical and operational training to Harmonic Customers and Partners.
Use of the Harmonic internal Customer Relationship Management databases to ensure accurate logging of relevant details.
Work on complex problems where analysis of ‘system-wide’ situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of multiple factors.
Investigate, diagnose and resolve Customer issues on site in a timely manner and if needed escalate problems for assistance.
Use independent, professional judgment to avoid errors that would impact Customer Service.
Regular follow up of the customer overall Service and Support situation to ensure Service Level Agreements are properly delivered to Premium customers.

Required Job Skills:
Working knowledge/experience with Video Distribution over IP: IPTV, OTT, transcoding, origin/packaging, CDN is a must have with the following skillset:
Working knowledge and/or experience with audio/video compression formats and familiarity with the broadcast and multimedia industry is a must have.
Operating systems: Linux distros (CentOS, Ubuntu), Unix administration
Data Center technologies: VMware vSphere and Hyper-V multi-tenant data center infrastructure, including IaaS, SaaS, PaaS.
Networking: IP routing (RIP, OSPF), IP multicast (ASM, SSM, PIM, IGMPv1/2/3), QoS (DiffServ, queuing), and switching. CCNA/CCNP is a plus
Working knowledge/experience with Cloud based technologies and architecture is a highly desirable including deep understanding of : Docker/Containers, Kubernetes, Mesos, AWS, Google Cloud, Microsoft Azure, and hybrid clouds
As described above, we are looking for a profile who combines IT and Video Distribution skills. A training program could be implemented to reinforce one of these two areas.
Years of Direct Experience Required:
A minimum of three years of relevant work experience is required. Direct experience providing post-sales service and technical support to Customers within IT infrastructure and Television Broadcast Industry is needed.
Areas of Direct Experience:
Experience in installing and supporting Cloud base, VM Ware or bare metal solutions for the Digital Video/Broadcast and/or IT Storage Industries is a major plus. Knowledge of digital video and audio broadcast technology and operational practices, experience with products that transport, encode, compress, store and play out audio and video media for the Broadcast Industry, with a strong emphasis on a systems perspective. Some pre-sales technical support may also be required to augment the existing pre-sales technical team in the region

Educational Requirements:
A technical college degree in Electrical Engineering/Computer Science preferred, or equivalent work experience is acceptable.

Travel and Location:
This position requires travel within the EMEA Region from time to time, based on short notice.

Languages
Fluent English is a must to have.

Do you want to join a high energy, market leading, international company with the only market available end-to-end solutions?

Do you have a team spirit, passionate about technology, and motivated to work for an international company?

Join Harmonic and send us your application so we can get in touch as soon as possible!

#LI-CN1

Job Description
The ideal candidate for this position is a self-driven individual with a passion for software development. The opportunity involves primary architecture, design, and implementation responsibilities for mobile iPad applications as well as applications that utilize our inertial sensing hardware. Experience with unit testing concepts

Follow development processes through all aspects of software development

Why Work at Appareo Systems?
Appareo Systems is focused on dramatic growth and innovation. With that in mind, Appareo Systems is committed to providing opportunities for individual growth and career satisfaction, and assisting employees to realize their potential by providing appropriate training and development opportunities.

Culture is Everything
Our culture is deeply rooted in our company purpose and core values. We love what we do and we’re passionate about it. le candidat idéal pour ce poste est un individu décidé passionné par le développement logiciel. Ce poste ouvre des opportunités de compétences dans le champs de la réalité augmentée, de la visualisation et animation, du data mining et analyse ainsi que de l'integration système.

Compétences requises
Master ou Ingénieur en informatique ou équivalent
Connaissance d'au moins un langage orienté objet (de préférence objective C/C#)
Capacité à suivre un processus de développement / conception
Experience en base de données relationnelles

Execute l'implementation des fonctionnalités au cours d'un processus itératif
Suivi du processus de développement à travers tous les aspects du développement logiciel
Suivi des deadlines, aide à l'identification des risques importants
Maintien des serveurs de build automatique (à l'aide de systèmes d'integration continue basés sur des logiciels de contrôle de code)
Le poste requiert occasionnellement des visites sur site, réunion et conférences
Pourquoi travailler chez Appareo Systems?
Appareo se concentre sur une croissance spectaculaire et sur l'innovation. Ainsi Appareo est engagé à fournir des opportunités de croissance personnelle et de satisfaction de carrière, ainsi que dans l'assistance à ses employés afin qu'ils puissent réaliser leur potentiel en leur fournissant une formation appropriée et des opportunités de développement. Appareo Systems est une entreprise spécialisée dans la haute technologie qui conçoit, fabrique et maintient des produits électroniques, mécanique et des logiciels pour l'industrie aérospatiale, la défense, et les transports dans le monde entier. Nous créons des produits à haute valeur pour nos clients grace à l'utilisation innovante des technologies de pointe. Nos équipes de conception hardware travaillent principalement avec des équipements de perception spatiale, des capteurs inertiels et optique, tandis que les équipes de développement logiciel sont spécialisés dans le développement d'applications mobiles et multi-plateformes.

description:
Safran est un groupe international de haute technologie opérant dans les domaines de la propulsion et des équipements aéronautiques, de l'espace et de la défense. Implanté sur tous les continents, le Groupe emploie plus de 92 000 collaborateurs pour un chiffre d'affaires de 21 milliards d'euros en 2018. Safran occupe, seul ou en partenariat, des positions de premier plan mondial ou européen sur ses marchés. Pour répondre à l'évolution des marchés, le Groupe s'engage dans des programmes de recherche et développement qui ont représenté en 2018 des dépenses totales d'environ 1,5 milliard d'euros.

Safran est classé dans le Top 100 Global Innovators de Thomson Reuters ainsi que dans le palmarès « Happy at work » des sociétés où il fait bon vivre. Le Groupe est en 4ème position du classement Universum des entreprises préférées des jeunes ingénieurs en France.

Le groupe Safran recherche pour sa direction Safran Analytics, un(e) Data Integration Specialist. Au sein d'une équipe dédiée aux sujets d'intégration vous participerez à la mise en œuvre des moyens nécessaires à l'analyse de données d'un bout à l'autre de la chaine de valeur.
Le périmètre d'intervention s'étend depuis la collecte des données brutes (issues de machines de fabrication ou d'aéronefs par exemples), jusqu'à la fourniture de tableaux de bord, ou d'applications d'analyses pour les utilisateurs métiers en passant par toutes les étapes de consolidation, nettoyage, analyses etc.

En fortes interactions avec les différentes équipes, vous pourrez vous appuyer sur des solutions/services groupes (par exemple, la connexion physique aux machines dans les usines), des solutions de traitement de données du marché, ou encore sur les équipes internes de Safran Analytics (équipe de DataScientists, Data Engineer etc.).

En tant que Data Integration Specialist, votre rôle sera de configurer et d'installer certains composants techniques et de prendre en charge le paramétrage applicatif (à minima pour vérifier que la chaine applicative fonctionne).
Plus précisément, et en étroite collaboration avec le leader de l'équipe Intégration et l'architecte End to End, vous serez en charge de :

Assembler et déployer rapidement des solutions de stockage et d'analyse (Build et déploiement Cloud / VM / Docker / K8S etc)
Automatiser des tâches (script shell / python)
Explorer et manipuler des fichiers texte avec parfois des volumétries très significatives
Installer et configurer des outils d'analyse de données (soit du commerce, soit développés en interne), sur le cloud interne de Safran Analytics
Effectuer la configuration technique de ces outils (ex. sécurité/authentification, accès à une base de données etc)
Vous pourrez également être amené(e) à :
Documenter les procédures d'install, de configuration des chaines en vue de leur reprise ultérieure par le département Informatique (dans le cas de l'industrialisation de la solution)
Tester fonctionnellement (a minima) et plus occasionnellement effectuer des tests en charge, résilience, backup/reprise
Développer des scripts de déploiement, config etc
Effectuer des configurations / Investigations réseau
Effectuer des activités d'administration simples (purge de filesystem, relance etc)
De formation Bac+5, vous êtes intéressé par la mise en œuvre de solutions Data en environnement complexe. Curieux(euse), créatif(ve) vous êtes très motivé(e) par le challenge technique et la volonté de livrer des solutions qui sont utilisées par le plus grand nombre, avec un impact maximum. Vous avez à cœur de garantir l'accès aux services dans de bonnes conditions pour les utilisateurs.
Un bon niveau d'anglais sera nécessaire pour interagir avec tous vos interlocuteurs.

Vous êtes désireux(euse) de découvrir des environnements métiers variés et vous êtes enthousiaste à l'idée de rejoindre et d'accompagner une structure dynamique au sein d'un grand groupe. Vous êtes assez résilient(e) aux difficultés inhérentes à l'IT. Vous êtes ouvert(e) aux autres, à l'écoute et avez le goût pour le travail en équipe.
N'hésitez plus et rejoignez-nous !

The ideal candidate for this position is a highly motivated individual that will provide software design services for embedded systems throughout the entire project cycle to include design, development, and project completion. Processors used in our current designs range from TI F28XX digital signal controllers to TI DM355 DaVinci arm based image processors. Development activities generally fall into 2 categories. Hard real time systems are generally developed in code composer studio and based on a custom cyclic executive scheduler. meta1:
Internship Data Scientist, Product Analytics
Criteo46 avis - Paris (75)
date_publication:
il y a 4 mois
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Who we are
At Criteo, we connect 1.5 billion active shoppers with the things they need and love. Our technology takes an algorithmic approach to predict what user we show an ad to, when, and for what products. Our dataset is about 50 petabytes in Hadoop (more than 120 TB extra per day) and we take less than 10ms to respond to an ad request. This is truly big data and machine learning without the buzzwords. If scale and complexity excite you, join us.

We are innovative, passionate and result-driven. We are an interdisciplinary team, leveraging the strengths of engineers and scientists.
The Data Science - Product Analytics team uses cutting edge technology, advanced statistics and machine learning to understand the most complex business problems at Criteo. We are committed to designing and building technical solutions to drive Criteo’s development and keep up with a fast-evolving product landscape.
We serve as trusted partners to leadership and work closely with PMs, R&D, Finance or Business teams.
Inside Data Science - Product Analytics:
Find new ways to optimize the bidding strategy
Optimize our capability to recognize users across all their devices and their interactions in the open-internet
Define, drive and analyze results of A/B tests to assess whether online performance is in line with offline simulations
Provide data-driven insights to ensure Criteo remains one step ahead of competitive threats
Identify and size development opportunities for new products
What will you do?
You enjoy solving real-world problems with data. You will be assigned to one or several projects.
Overall, your responsibilities include:
Mine large data sets and turn them into understandable and actionable insights
Build scalable analytic solutions using state of the art tools based on large and granular datasets
Design and execute a stream of analysis and tests to measure the impact of your solutions
Master our internal analytic datasets and reporting tools
Who are you?
Last year of Master’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, Economics,etc.)
Internship of a minimum of 6 months
Outstanding analytical skills and creative thinking
Fluency in the core toolkit of Data Science:
R/Python; SQL/Hive
Manipulating large-scale data sets
Building data pipelines
Descriptive and predictive modelling
Implementing visualizations, dashboards, and reports
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, pro-active and independent
Fun to work with!


At Criteo, we dare to be different. We believe that diversity fuels innovation and creates an energy that can be seen and felt all over Criteo. We champion different perspectives and are committed to creating a workplace where all Criteos are heard, feel a sense of belonging, and are treated with respect and dignity.

Criteo collects your personal data for the purposes of managing Criteo's recruitment related activities. Consequently, Criteo may use your personal data in relation to the evaluation and selection of applicants. Your information will be accessible to the different Criteo entities across the world. By clicking the "Apply" button you expressly give your consent.

Job description :

About SCOR
SCOR is the 5th largest Reinsurance Company worldwide, following a profit-driven underwriting policy and practising selectively across all branches of reinsurance. Our specialist teams operate in over 120 countries, developing value added and innovative products and services and making long-term commitments to their clients, namely insurers and large corporations.
SCOR's aim, as an independent global reinsurance company, is to develop its Life and P&C business lines, to provide its clients with a broad range of innovative reinsurance solutions and to pursue an underwriting policy founded on profitability, supported by effective risk management and a prudent investment policy, in order to offer its clients an optimum level of security, to create value for its shareholders, and to contribute to the welfare and resilience of Society by helping to protect insureds against the risks they face.
- Job Summary
As part of our strategic development on SAP HANA, SCOR is seeking an experienced Business analysis expert for Group Finance systems and processes.
Working between business and SAP Competency Center (in charge of Group Finance tools), you strongly contribute or lead the development and enhancement of the SAP-based systems. Also, you are responsible of the data quality between the various applications of our Finance landscape inside our SAP HANA central data repository.
- Department
SCOR is an independent, leading reinsurance company, working on a global scale through its 35 locations on five continents and its 4 Hubs located in Paris-London, Zurich-Cologne, New York, and Singapore.
Financial department is organized between the 5 hubs and 3 division (Life, Non-Life and Investment)
The SAP Competency Center (SAP CC) is located in Paris (~7 employees), Zurich (~4 employees) and New York (1 employee) and some external consultants.
The SAP CC role is to:
Maintain the Group Finance applications called “1GL” (administration, bug fixing and enhancements)
Provide strong support to the business end-users (Finance community) worldwide
Assist to design of the financial processes
Manage projects for evolution and reengineering initiatives
Support for the roll-out of the 1GL solution into new locations and for the integration with other projects
The 1GL environment is a full, integrated, SAP-based financial system:
Treasury: TRM, BCM
P2P process: Ariba, SAP MM, ReadSoft
Travel & Expense: CONCUR
SAP FI / CO: GL, AP, AR, AA
Consolidation: FIM, BFC on HANA
Reporting and EPM: BW on HANA, BFC on HANA, SAP DM, Analysis for MS Office, BPC embedded, SAP Analytics Cloud
- Key duties and responsibilities
The ideal candidate is a confident senior professional with extensive knowledge of the latest SAP HANA technologies and familiar with Finance processes & reporting.
His/her main duties are:
Propose innovative solutions, assess potential impacts or side effect of any system bug fixing, changes or enhancements
Support business in developing and proposing innovative solutions (Analysis for Office, SAP Analytics Cloud)
Support Business Closing & Business as Usual as well as the critical reporting activities
Proactively identify, propose, document, argument potential new business requirements and assess, document solutions & deliver
Provide guidance to external partner, review the delivery and ensure functional & technical quality and integrity of the solution
Ensure system data quality
Lead small & medium size Group Finance projects or initiatives (coordination, follow-up, reporting, risk monitoring, issue management…)
Build strong sustainable business relationships at various levels throughout organization
You are also expected to perform early-bird analysis on market evolution & trends, digital innovations, competitor benchmark
As part of the business as usual, you are responsible of maintenance, continuous enhancement of analytics (in SAP HANA):
Ensure overall data quality
Document processes including master data overview
Maintain and enhance the reports repository (i.e. Analysis for Office)
Maintain a central data & KPIs repository, to ensure a relevant single point of truth for all Finance related reporting
Ensure detailed and accurate documentation of solutions that is being developed is delivered
Analyze & validate any system enhancements, challenge business requirement & solutions, ensure full integration on the platform, anticipate and monitor potential side effects
Travel to other locations of the company is required on an occasional basis.
- Required experience & competencies

5-7 years’ experience in implementation / maintenance of SAP BW projects, mostly HANA based
Finance project experience mandatory
Strong experience with Analysis for Office is a must have
Experience with SAP BI Dashboarding solutions is a nice to have (Lumira, BO, SAC,…)
Experience in solution roll-out or system maintenance / evolution in particular in a SAP-based environment
Clearly and precisely communicate orally and in writing to individuals and groups
Personal Competencies:
Strong analysis capabilities
Conscientious, curious and enthusiastic
Well organized, reliable with deadlines, efficient and autonomous
Ability to work with a multi-location team (cross-cultural environment)
Ability to drill down to explore root causes of observable facts / issue
Ability to reduce complicated factual contents to the essentials
Ability to collect and execute business requirements
Ability to challenge business requirements to focus on the global landscape consistency
Ability to communicate in English

Team player
Collaborative spirit
Autonomous mindset with a strong initiative spirit
Digital Competencies:
Expertise with SAP HANA
Strong Expertise with SAP BW and eBPC

Business or Engineer School (Bac + 5 equivalent).
HR Contact: Delphine Le Gallais

DRT/LIST- CDD/POST DOC in biostatistic and bioinformatics: Innovative math.méthods
CEA - Commissariat à l'Energie Atomique278 avis - Saclay (91)
titre_poste: DRT/LIST- CDD/POST DOC in biostatistic and bioinformatics: Innovative math.méthods
date_publication:

Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
General information
Organisation
The French Alternative Energies and Atomic Energy Commission (CEA) is a key player in research, development and innovation in four main areas :
defence and security,
nuclear energy (fission and fusion),
technological research for industry,
fundamental research in the physical sciences and life sciences.

Drawing on its widely acknowledged expertise, and thanks to its 16000 technicians, engineers, researchers and staff, the CEA actively participates in collaborative projects with a large number of academic and industrial partners.

The CEA is established in ten centers spread throughout France
Reference number
2019-9682
process delay
3 months
Job details
Category
Information system
Contract
Post-doctorat
Job title
DRT/LIST- CDD/POST DOC in biostatistic and bioinformatics: Innovative math.méthods
Subject
biostatistics and bioinformatics: Innovative mathematical methods for the integration of omics data
Contract duration (months)
24
Job description
Context :
Proteomics and metabolomics provide unique and complementary information to decipher gene function and pathways, elucidate phenotypes, and robustly discover new biomarkers for disease treatments.
Integration of both approaches is a mathematical challenge because of the heterogeneity and the complexity of the proteomics and metabolomics data, and the partial annotation (i.e. metabolite identification) provided by the metabolomics mass spectrometry technologies.
The national infrastructures in bioinformatics (IFB), metabolomics (MetaboHUB), proteomics (ProFI), genomics (France Génomique), and mouse phenogenomics (PHENOMIN) have decided to join forces and develop new biostatistics and bioinformatics methods and tools for high-throughput and combined proteomics and metabolomics data analysis.

Project :
First, statistical modeling will be used to explore the specific and common information from each type of omics data, and to determine how their combination as molecular signatures can optimally be used to interpret and predict the phenotypes. Such approaches will include linear and nonlinear methods for multivariate analysis.
Second, network integration will be used to facilitate interpretation and annotation of the data. Proteins and metabolites will be mapped on the metabolic networks to facilitate chemical annotation and biological interpretation, and to suggest new biomarkers and metabolic functions.
The mathematical approaches and tools will be validated on two use cases: 1) the high-throughput molecular phenotyping of comprehensive collections of mouse models and 2) the discovery of new gene functions in a bacterial model of interest for environmental and biotechnological applications.
Applicant Profile
Interested applicants should have a strong background in statistics (data analysis, network analysis), and be motivated by multidisciplinary applications (chemistry, biology, clinic).
Job location
Site
Saclay
Location
Route du Cyclotron, 91400 Saclay, France
Candidate criteria
PhD opportunity
Non

Vos missions
Vous rejoignez notre équipe basée au Plessis Robinson (92) au sein du Pôle Data.

En tant que Data Engineer, vous aurez en charge de définir et d’accompagner la stratégie d’échange de données entre le secteur Finance et les autres secteurs de l'entreprise (Ingénierie, Fabrication, Logistique, Commerce, ...).

Vous analyserez les besoins avec les équipes métiers et data analystes et formaliserez les cas d'usages Finance du Big Data. Vous structurerez le stockage des données et développerez leur collecte, concevrez et développerez leurs traitements (raffinage, croisements, détections, prédictions) et réaliserez les tests de validation fonctionnelle.

Vous participerez par ailleurs à la définition et au développement de l’architecture d’échange permettant de garantir la bonne qualité des échanges de données en s’appuyant au maximum sur les référentiels de l’entreprise.

Dans le cadre de cette mission, vous serez amené(e) à travailler avec les différents métiers de l'entreprise et tous les métiers de l'informatique (architecture fonctionnelle, architecture technique, sécurité, opérations…).

Au sein de la communauté des Data engineers de Renault vous participerez au développement d’outils transverses, à la diffusion des pratiques autour de la data, à la montée en compétences des collaborateurs au travers de meetup, formations, veille technique.

Selon le contexte projet, vous collaborerez avec nos fournisseurs partenaires ou avec nos équipes en Inde et Roumanie.

Vous êtes diplômé(e) d'un Bac+5 avec une spécialisation dans le domaine de l'informatique.

description:
Présentation du Groupe
Air Liquide est le leader mondial des gaz, technologies et services pour l’industrie et la santé. Présent dans 80 pays avec environ 65 000 collaborateurs, le Groupe sert plus de 3,5 millions de clients et de patients. Oxygène, azote et hydrogène sont des petites molécules essentielles à la vie, la matière et l’énergie. Elles incarnent le territoire scientifique d’Air Liquide et sont au cœur du métier du Groupe depuis sa création en 1902.

Air Liquide a pour ambition d’être le leader de son industrie, d’être performant sur le long terme et de contribuer à un monde plus durable.

Air Liquide place la diversité au cœur de ses activités et s'engage notamment en favorisant l’égalité professionnelle et l’emploi des travailleurs en situation de handicap.

Descriptif de l'entité et de l'activité
L’organisation IT d’Air Liquide a été profondément transformée en 2014 avec la création d’un fournisseur de services d’infrastructure, GIO, et de plusieurs DSI métier, dites “BIS”, en charge des applications relatives à un métier. Air Liquide a ensuite créé une structure Digital, chargée de favoriser l’évolution vers le digital des métiers du Groupe et accélérer l’introduction de nouvelles technologies et méthodologies. Elle repose notamment sur des “Fabs” thématiques (New Ways of Working, Business Performance, Santé Connectée…) et sur les structures “La Factory” et “Creative Foundry” chargées d’apporter de l’expertise autour de la data science, du développement ou encore de l’expérience utilisateur. Enfin, une structure “Global Application Development” (GAD) est en cours de mise en place pour apporter l’expertise technologique pour le développement de nouvelles solutions différenciantes pour le business Air Liquide, avec un focus particulier sur les sujets autour de la data dans un premier temps.
Au sein de la cellule GAD, et rapportant fonctionnellement au Chief Data Officer du Groupe, le Data Engineer industrialise les traitements de données en vue de la valorisation de cette dernière au sein de contextes applicatifs allant de la finance à l’internet des objets, la sécurité, l’expérience client... Il ou elle travaille en étroite collaboration avec les Data Scientist, les Data Architects, les Data Manager et les experts DevOps pour définir les traitements et les mettre en place de façon fiable, sécurisée et performante sur les infrastructures cloud.

Missions & Responsabilités
Le Data Engineer aura les responsabilités suivantes :
Concevoir, développer, tester et mettre en production des traitements “Big Data” dans différents contextes applicatifs ;
Concevoir, mettre en oeuvre et optimiser, avec les data architects et devops, les pipelines de traitement de la donnée permettant l’alimentation des applications data depuis les sources de données du groupe.
Assurer le support de ces traitements data ;
Concevoir et mettre en oeuvre des outils de visualisation et d’analyse, et des automatisations, pour faciliter le travail des data scientists et autres analystes.
S’assurer de la bonne application des règles de sécurité et de confidentialité du Groupe au sein des traitements de données.

Profil et compétences
Bac + 5 ou formation équivalente en Sciences Informatiques, idéalement avec une orientation data ;
Expérience réussie de développement d’applications Big Data, idéalement dans un environnement cloud AWS ou Azure ;
Excellent niveau en technologies Data: Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Kafka, Impala, MongoDB, DynamoDB, Redshift, Elastic Search, Kibana, technologies de BI Microsoft...
Excellente maîtrise des fonctions de gestion de la donnée : collecte, analyse, distribution, etc…
Capacité de développement en Python, Java, R...
Expérience passée de la gestion de projet Agile, et des méthodologies associées (Scrum, Lean…)
Capacité à travailler dans un environnement matriciel international (BIS, GIO, Fabs Digitales, IT industriel, entités business) ;
Créativité et capacité à saisir les opportunités technologiques qui se présenteront ;
Bonne capacité de vulgarisation des sujets techniques ;
Capacité d’analyse et de synthèse des situations complexes en prenant en compte tous les éléments ;
L’anglais et le français courants à l’écrit comme à l’oral sont indispensables.

Informations complémentaires
Le poste est basé à Paris XIe sur le Campus de La Factory.
Des déplacements occasionnels pourront être nécessaires en France ou à l’étranger.

We are now 160+ employees in New York, Paris & London, supporting 1,200+ customers in 160 countries, such as Dior, Criteo, Safran, Michelin, BNP, Axa & Devialet.
Our mission is to help companies become Learning Organizations, by connecting their Leaders with their Learners. With our Learning Engagement Platform, they:- empower internal Business Experts, transforming them into active Leaders who create courses and train the others;- connect Leaders with Learners in a highly engaging, user-friendly, modern web interface where they interact and exchange knowledge (resulting in 90% participation rate vs. 45% on average);- scale fast & effective trainings to the full organization (in a few hours vs. several months), integrating 360Learning seamlessly with other tools such as HRIS and CRM;- optimize courses by leveraging user data to make Smart Recommendations.
360Learning is building a team composed of 100% top performers and a culture of well-being and collective performance.
Our goal is to become the top global provider of educational software solutions. We are funded by the ISAI fund (BlaBlaCar, Shopmium, Evaneos, Malt...) and have raised our Series B in 2018 to finance our hypergrowth.
Our workplace
Unique decentralized culture:
https://www.swipe.to/5618x*
Complete ownership of your role
Flexible hours
Holidays when you want
What we offer
Unique culture
Competitive salary
Flexible hours
Work from home
Annual leave
Transport benefits
Medical, Dental, Vision
Pension plan
Full autonomy within your scope
Many cool side activities with the team
Key moment to 360Learning and help us shape a world-class design team
Job Description
As a product designer, you’ll work within one of our experimented squads of pm’s, designers, engineers and be involved during the entire problem-solving process to improve the functionalities and design of our platform. Your role is to envision how people experience 360Learning, make sure we’ll find the best solution to the company challenges and supporting our long-term vision. We support and learn from each other, but we’re empowered to work autonomously. Our team is growing fast. You’ll have a big impact here.
*Accountabilities *
Make the user's voice heard in your squad, build and ship new features together.
Quickly translate insights from every collaborator (PMs, Sales, CST, Support) into goals, define user experience workflow, make complex information understandable and deliver design concepts that are really simple, very neat and super user-friendly to feed our product initiatives.
Provide design best practices and feedback to other squads.
Help us standardize and evangelize our design system within all the 360Learners.
Influence the way we do things day-by-day from your designer vision and create processes, best practices for all the company that help us to turn progressively into a Design organization.
Preferred Experience
Recently graduated in a great design school or past experience in shipping high digital products, not only websites.
You have an outstanding product and design sensibility.
Want to have a real impact.
You know that doing simple things is the hardest thing in the world.
Minimalist freak, and taste for clean and simple products.
Strong product design portfolio with examples of neat interactions and clear information architectures across web and/or mobile apps.
Ability to drive a project from UX to UI.
Deep users understanding and experience in applying research insights in order to design minimal things.
User research principle (user test, wireframes, etc, ...).
Conception to Prototyping softwares skills (Figma, Sketch, Principle, Invision, etc...).
No fear to change daily work processes and willingness to improve them.
Interest in new organizational methods.
Fluent english (B2 level or equivalent)
Enthusiasm for our culture explained here

Experience: > 6 months

meta1:
LEAD DATA ENGINEER (H/F)
ITNOVEM. - Saint-Denis (93)
date_publication:
il y a 4 mois
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Filiale technologique du groupe SNCF, intégrée à la Direction du Digital et des Systèmes d’information, Itnovem. se positionne comme expert de l’Internet Industriel. Porteuse de grands projets de la révolution digitale, notre société est en constante recherche de profils pour rejoindre la grande aventure de l’Internet des objets, de la data science et de l’accompagnement des projets digitaux. Qu’il s’agisse de maintenance prédictive, d’aide à la décision sur la maintenance des infrastructures, de gare 4.0, d’usine du futur, ou de sécurisation des assets, nos équipes font valoir à la fois une expérience métier et une expertise technique sans cesse renouvelée, dans le respect des valeurs du groupe : Responsabilité, Proximité, Excellence, Innovation.

Au sein du pôle Data Science et Engineering (DSE), notre lead data engineer (H/F) interviendra pour les projets de la Direction du Digital SNCF au sein de la Fab Big Data. Structure transverse qui réunit infrastructures Big Data et expertise Big Data pour l'ensemble du groupe, la Fab s'est constituée en juillet 2015 afin de traiter avec les différentes entités les projets nécessitant des moyens Big Data pour être menés à bien. Elle se compose de 5 pôles : Pilotage et valorisation projets, Data Science et Engineering, Usine IT, pôle Data (Gouvernance et Services Data), pôle transverse Data IoT.

Itnovem. recherche aujourd’hui un(e) lead data engineer (H/F) pour travailler au sein du pôle DSE de la Fab Big Data. Le pôle, en pleine croissance, comprend environ 25 personnes (40% data scientists, 60% data engineers).

Vous travaillerez sur des thématiques très variées liées aux problématiques industrielles, opérationnelles et stratégiques des métiers du groupe SNCF, comme par exemple :
La maintenance du matériel roulant et l’optimisation des process ;
La maintenance et la surveillance du réseau (voies, abords et caténaires) et des cartographies déclinées sur les problématiques prioritaires ;
L’analyse du langage naturel, notamment sur des enquêtes et rapports techniques notamment autour de la sécurité ferroviaire ;
L’optimisation des plans horaires, la prévision de perturbations, la gestion de la consommation énergétique ;
L'information voyageurs ;
L’analyse des données IoT…

Actuellement, le pôle mène une douzaine de projets de front de type et de taille variable : accompagnement data science, prototypage, industrialisation, run de projets en production. La majorité des projets où les data engineers interviennent sont des projets agiles d'industrialisation avec des équipes de 3 à 6 personnes, et d'une durée allant de 6 à 9 mois.

**MISSIONS**

Piloter et développer l'équipe data engineers, avec une passion pour les défis à grande échelle et les nouvelles technologies.
Veiller à la capitalisation et au partage de connaissances au sein du pôle DSE (documentation, production d'assets réutilisables, templatisation, etc.).
Promouvoir une culture d'ingénierie forte et la passion pour la qualité du delivery.
Participer comme expert à la démarche de conseil technologique et scientifique du pôle d’expertise DSE auprès des métiers du groupe SNCF.
Contribuer au recrutement de nouveaux talents.
Contribuer proactivement à la veille technique, aux projets R&D, et à la construction d’assets et de services techniques orientés data.
Participer à l’animation de la filière Data et à l’implémentation des pratiques Data au sein des métiers (formations, conseil et expertise).
Participer aux autres activités du pôle Data Science & Engineering (reporting d’activité, communication interne et externe, collaboration avec les universités et laboratoires associés).

**Missions projets**

En mode projet, jouer un rôle de lead data engineer pour des équipes mixtes de data engineers, data scienstists, ops et architectes.
Industrialiser des projets liés aux problématiques et enjeux DATA en développant une chaîne de traitement de données robuste et automatisée.
+ Spécifications techniques
+ Release plan des différents livrables
+ Ingestion et mise en qualité des données selon les bonnes pratiques de la FAB
+ Traitement, agrégation et sauvegarde des données
+ Intégration continue (versioning, packaging, tests et déploiement)
+ Exposition des APIs sous forme de webservices Rest
+ Configuration des briques logicielles
+ Monitoring des briques logicielles
+ Etroite collaboration avec le chef de projet, PO, OPS et architectes
+ Participation aux activités d'architecture, conception et développement
+ Veille à la bonne documentation des projets
Etre vigilant à maintenir les politiques de sécurité : Protection des données (ACL, chiffrement in motion/at rest), identification des utilisateurs, gestion des autorisations, pistes d’audit.
Rédiger du code de haute qualité et maintenable, et améliorer les performances de notre environnement de développement.
Apporter du support aux OPS dans la résolution des incidents. Troubleshooting et tuning de la plateforme sur l’ensemble de la stack technologique.

**COMPETENCES TECHNIQUES**

**Compétences techniques exigées**

Langages Scala/Java
Ecosystème Hadoop (Yarn, MR, HDFS, oozie, Spark, Hive/beeline, Hbase…)
Un ou plusieurs outils d’ingestion des données : Flume, logstash, fluentd…
Une ou plusieurs bases de données NoSql : Cassandra, mongoDB…
Un ou plusieurs SGBR : MySQL, SQL Server, Oracle…
IC/DC (Jenkins, Git, Nexus, Maven/Sbt, Ansible, Docker, Rundeck, Data factory…)
Implémenter et maintenir la stratégie de sécurité : Protection des données (ACL, chiffrement in motion / at rest), identification des utilisateurs (Kerberos), gestion des autorisations (Ranger), piste d’audit...
Elasticsearch et Kibana
Data API : REST web services, messaging (Kafka)…
Architectures microservices
Cycle de vie des données (DLC & ILC)
Agilité Scrum

**Compétences techniques appréciées**

Concepts et technologies de gestion de la sécurité : Kerberos, ACL, Sentry/ranger, CyberArk…
Composants Azure : HDInsight, Azure Databricks, Azure Function, OMS, etc.
Architectures lambda et kappa
Gouvernance des données, notamment personnelles (Traçabilité, Sécurité, Audit)
Python

**QUALITES PERSONNELLES ET COMPETENCES FONCTIONNELLES**

Autonomie
Curiosité
Rigueur et organisation
Très bon relationnel
Bonnes capacités de communication orale et écrite
Leadership et capacités à dynamiser et former l’équipe data engineers du pôle DSE
Force de conviction et capacité d’impact
Proactivité et dynamisme
Orienté satisfaction client et business

**EXPERIENCES ET FORMATIONS**

**Formation**

Bac +5 (école d’ingénieur ou master spécialisé en data engineering) ou titulaire d’un doctorat en informatique/data engineering

**Expérience requise**

Vous aimez relever des défis ? Vous aimez travailler en équipe dans la bonne humeur avec une culture de l'excellence ? Vous voulez que votre travail ait un impact fort et vous vous intéressez à des problématiques industrielles ? Ce poste est donc fait pour vous.
Vous avez acquis au moins 7 ans d’expériences dans les nouvelles technologies, dont 3 ans dans le Big data. Vous avez déjà piloté des équipes sur l'industrialisation de projets data.

Poste basé à La Plaine Saint Denis (RER D, Saint Denis Stade de France) avec des déplacements ponctuels (en moyenne 2-3 fois par mois) à prévoir, généralement en Ile-de-France.
